comment: I took the web section of this course and each week we were given a pdf slide deck, and 2-3 videos of him walking through the slide deck and the lecture code for the week. He also provides a github repo of lecture code. All the concepts are explained thoroughly and excellently. Grading is tough and you will never get a 100, but it still feels fair.

If you want to learn, take this course! I learned more in this one class about how to be a good developer and how to problem solve in this class than in any other one at my whole time at Stevens. Patrick Hill is a wonderful professor and really got me excited about web programming. Can't wait to take CS 554 in the fall!

I've been warned by others that he can be inappropriate at times and I had experienced that myself. He had falsely accused me for plagiarism and was loudly ridiculing me until he learned there was no MOSS report about me afterwards. This professor is not as friendly as others say he is and needs to control his temper towards students.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Learned a lot from the course, especially since I had practically no web development experience prior. The assignments build on each other and eventually you'll have a final project which is satisfying to complete. Only complaint I have is that the professor clowns on students sometimes - never uses names, but is still a bit personal/unprofessional
rating_tags: Group projects--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Awesome course
Do not waste your time on CS-554. The course has very unclear expectations, no rubrics, don't know whats expected until you get your grade back. Just go on YT to learn React.js and save $6K.
loves his teaching and grading style

This is one of the best courses at Stevens, might as well say the BEST. Be prepared to learn a lot of things, and do not take it if you have no intent to learn. The prof is great and is always ready to help. I would pay just to watch his lectures cuz its that good. Wish there were another one which would make it a trilogy.
Excellent lecturer with practical hands-on homework and projects. Taught me a majority of the skills I use in my career.

Great lectures and I really appreciate his no-nonsense attitude, given it comes along with very fair and reasonable expectations. He sometimes seems not as devoted to this course as he wants his students to be, however, and takes a long time to get project proposals back, stunting progress. Be prepared to start your final without approval.

if i had a choice to have professor Hill teach every class i have taken, i would've taken it immediately. although attendance is not mandatory, you never want to miss any lectures. they almost never get boring and the fast tempo of the class lets quick learners strive in such environment.

I found it v hard. I used a lot of PTO to keep up. I was concerned about my grade throughout the whole semester but I ended up doing well. I think the professor does not want to fail his students despite the tough grading. At the end, he was lenient with final grades. 10 lengthy assignments+ major group project. Helpful when needed/ have questions
rating_tags: Group projects--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Probably the toughest course I've taken. Grading is brutal. Work is tough. All in all I became a better programmer for sure. I've learned how to look for answers and troubleshoot my problems. Pretty sure that's what makes a good dev in the end so this class was worth it. Don't take during a tough semester.
If you don't give him a 5/5 after taking his class especially taking 546, then it's your problem not his. He is the funniest and most helpful professor you can meet in Stevens.
Hill is a fantastic professor and knows how to keep the class engaged. However, he assigns a lot of work and is a tough grader. He is not a professor that you want to take on a heavy semester.

Wonderful professor. One of my favorites ever. He made me love web dev. He knows his stuff super well. He makes jokes during class. He also gives some extra credit. Make sure you start the final project EARLY. He designs courses with a goal of students learning the material. The assignments are time consuming but not hard, and they teach you a lot.
Mr.Patrick is a great professor
Professor is good

He is one of the Best Professors at Stevens. You'll learn a lot during the course. Many, including me, took this course because he's the lecturer. His grading policies are very fair, and all are the same to him. Just be honest and listen to what he says in class that's all you need to do. I became soo much better in programming Thanks to him.
I would never take this course again
HE DOES NOT CARE ABOUT YOUR PERSONAL PROBLEMS AND WILL FAIL YOU EVEN WHEN DIAGNOSED WITH CANCER!

Good context, but extremely strict with grading, very easy to lose points

For example, in one lab the detail he has never told before would be the reason to deduct your points

But overall very supportive in context, lab, skills, and others,

He is Strict but Helpful

One of the best classes I took at Stevens. Professor is extremely easy to reach, and very easy to work with. Just be early and be honest and he'll help out. Lectures were easy to listen through, and usually practical to upcoming assignments. Some classmates pointed out he can have a bit of an ego, but he often went out of his way to help out

Prof. Hill is a good lecturer and his assignments are well formatted, but too often he lets his ego get ahead of his teaching. Lectures are book-ended by humble brags and any honest question about grading is viewed as a personal attack.
Dude obviously writes his own reviews.

CS 546 and CS 554 were two of the most useful courses I have taken at Stevens. Prof Hill has taught me so much. Not only about web programming but has given us a lot of invaluable advise when it came to working in the industry. I use the stuff I learned in his courses every day in my job! He is tough, but fair and cares about his student's sucesss

CS 546 was a great course as long as you put the time and effort into it. I believe a lot of negative reviews are from students who did poorly. He is one of the best professors at Stevens. You definitely get out of this class what you put into it. I really enjoyed going to his lectures every week. The TA's are great too! They are always available

Waste of time and money when I did this class. Before each class a lot of people used to complain about how useless going to class was and how they didn't understand anything and how bad grades were and also about the TA. This guy looked angry a lot of classes and two of them he was so angry he was shaking when talking to the teacher.

Professor Hill is amazing !! I was worried because of all the negative comments here. 
He is one of the best professors at Stevens.

Honestly, If I am to sum this entire experience up(CS 546 and CS 554), I would only say that I am a much better coder now. The labs are industry based and help learn a lot. These two courses have changed me as a developer for good and I am super thankful that I took them. Easily the best course at Stevens.

Best class I've taken at Stevens! I recieved and offer for an internship based just on the knowledge I got in this course. Hill is tough but fair and you get out of this course what you put into it. I feel I'm a stronger developer after taking this course for sure.

I think many students take his confidence and his directness as being arrogant. If you really get to know him, he isn't arrogant at all just very direct.  I think he is a great teacher and very likable after taking 546 and 554. Would he be an effective teacher if he was in-secure and not as confident about the material? Probably not. Plus he cares.

He is very arrogant, but his course is useful. His assignments take time but provides good knowledge. God bless you if he makes the project group because not everyone will work and you will cuss him for the group he made. but course is worth taking!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: At first I thought Hill was super arrogant, and was about to give a low score. But now, having taken both CS546 and CS554, I think that these classes prepared me more than anything for the workforce. Even if the assignments can be a heavy load at times, nothing ever felt unfair. I've also think Hill is likable now, despite my initial reaction.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria

comment: The lectures are quite easy to understand and so are the Labs. Only need to make sure that you are not careless while working on labs or else you'll lose points and that is something that the professor is always clear about. If you dedicatedly work on the labs and the project, you can easily score an A. Best professor at Stevens.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: He explains things well and explains the relevancy behind everything you learn. His class was a lot of work, but it paid off. The constant practice and homework was extremely effective. He grades harshly, but this makes you put in effort and learn. I failed some assignments and learned a lot from them. His personality can be annoying sometimes.

The professor doesn't really make students understand the material he's covering. His approach seems to be to define concepts and apply them to examples, without getting at the intuition. When people ask questions he tends to just repeat his previous explanation. Some assignments are time-consuming because they're artificially complex.

CS546 was by far the best class I have ever taken. Clear grading criteria for the assignments, exceptional professor. Prof. Hill is extremely particular about attention to detail. His course prepares you for a job in the tech industry. You learn by doing, and you learn well. Funny professor, shares anecdotes in class, fair and just. Would recommend

Professor Hill is a great professor! I just had him over the summer semester. He is always available and very approachable! I learned a lot in the course and feel this class prepared me more for the job market than any other course I have taken.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: Unclear grading criteria and bad lectures.
Great and fun professor!

One of the best professors at stevens. You'll learn a LOT in the course. I don't even know how to write Javascript code before taking the course. I can't just believe that I would build an e-commerce website as a final project. This course will help you in getting a job The Syllabus on the Graduate wiki page is outdated. He won't teach PHP at all.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: Never returns communication. Throws you into a pool even if you can't swim and walks away for you to drown!! Take his class, you will see what I mean!
Overall, he is the most unorganized professor I have encountered

All easy, busy work but so much of it (long lab and quiz weekly). The homework was graded by the TA but got a lot of points off when there was very small errors. I got an 70 on the final project and what I got as a comment were four small features that I actually included in the submission. Would not recommend this professor to anyone.

Easily the best course I've EVER taken at Stevens. Well, this and the prequel, CS 546. Anyone that complains about the prof or the difficulty is just lazy and looking to blame; you have to put in the work to do well. These courses and the Professor woke me up and taught me how to WORK. Fantastic 100/10 would take again. If you want to learn, do it.

One of the best professor at Stevens! Not only is the course really interesting, but the professor makes it a point to make the lectures interesting for everyone! Easy to reach outside the class and grades assignments fairly. If you do have the opportunity to take this course , please do!
Meh. Tough grader and arrogant.
Should not be teaching about an issue he knows nothing about.

Professor Hill is one of the best professors Ive had at Stevens, he is a bit of a tough grader however hes very caring of his students and wants them to succeed. He pretty much treats you the way youd get treated out in the field he expects you to take the course seriously which is understandable and completely respectable. He was really great!

Don't listen to these bad ratings Other students this semester gave this professor a really hard time He is great and provides a lot of industry knowledge. His stories are inspirational and motivating He really cares about his students and their success. His ta's are great too!ta's have office hours every day and the professor is always available
This class is fair, equitable and enlightening. I would love to have prof hill again.

The professor is great, cares about his students and his class & as long as you start the assignments early, you won't have a problem completing them. Only take this course if you can dedicate time to it, as it is still work. Quizzes are easy, labs are doable. Not all profs can teach over zoom, but hill can. learned tons from his class. would rec

The professor gives very tedious unnecessary assignments and not nearly enough time to complete them. He acts like you should be spending all of your time on his one class and that you dont have any other classes to focus on. Blames you for not managing your time correctly instead.

One of the best professors I've had at Stevens! Truly cares about his students and whether or not they understand the material. He's really strict with grading but it's all fair. He also relates concepts to industry practice, which really helps you improve as a developer. So glad I took this class!

The best class I enrolled at Stevens! Professor is highly knowledgeable and surely knows how to make lectures interesting. Goes over and beyond to share industry experiences to help us relate better to concepts taught and be a better developer. Professor is particular about grading, but that proved to help me write better codes and be good at it.
The course content is useful, but the professor is not a great teacher. Very often gets off topic and talks about personal matters which delays class. Overall very distracting.
The professor is way too extra. This is a grad-level class yet he treats it like a freshmen-level class. Take this if you want to have your hands held. He also has a raging ego.
One of the best course I enrolled in. I feel it makes you job ready

I would bet my life that Patrick Hill is a super condescending professor who accuses people of cheating without circumstantial evidence along with belittling students for asking for specifications on homeworks.

I enjoyed every minute of his lecture as well as his marvelous sense of humor. His lectures were very well-formatted and very easy to understand. His teaching style is amazing. Every lecture had taught me a new thing about web development. Well arranged curriculum from basic to advanced has helped me learn to the greatest capacity I could've got.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: He is the best professor at stevens and makes me the bar really high early on
Get ready to read, Inspirational, Group projects, Clear grading criteria, Extra credit
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: I took CS546 in my first semester and it was without a doubt one of the best courses I took. this course had a power pack industry relevant content which landed me an internship as well! thank you professor hill!

Prof. Patrick Hill really cares about his/her students. He makes his expectations clear at the beginning of the semester! He always demonstrates what he has taught using code or visual aids, I thoroughly enjoyed his class. His grading is extremely fair as well. I would definitely take another class by him again! :)
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: This is one of the best classes at Stevens. Professor Patrick Hill gives amazing lectures. He also gives homework every week which is a bit challenging but is a lot of fun doing . I feel everyone who takes Computer Science or is interested in Web programming should take his class.

By far one of the hardest classes, but so worth the time. Professor Hill is one of the most approachable and funny professors. He has high exceptions but he has awesome command of the material. Put in the effort and ask for help when needed, you will do well - Try to take shortcuts, you will fail. HIGHLY recommended class if you want to learn!

Patrick Hill is one of the coolest professors. I took Web programming I and got to learn a lot. Advantage of taking this class is the project that you'll implement of your choice. Professor makes sure that you implement important middleware concepts in the project. You can go up to him any time you want to clear your doubts and he's ever welcoming

Professor Hill is the very few professors left in Stevens that I can truly respect. He greatly loves and appreciates his work/teaching and doesn't want to deal with excuses from students. You either come in with the passion and willingness to learn or you will have a bad time and not gain much out of the course. He explains work in slides and code.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Great Class! Professor has a very great background in what he is teaching. Easily reachable for questions and is able to answer any questions that arise.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: Easy, but I learned a lot.

Probably the fairest professor ever. A pure New Yorker and dope rock star teaching tech is something you don't find very usual. He not only teaches the knowledge but also build up the community for students to communicate and reach an academic success that's more than a good grade. Always respecting hard-worker and has some cutest puppy ever seen!
amazing professor great guy, straightforward clear cohesive and very expressive

Due to not having any technical experience prior to taking this class, it was quite difficult for me to grasp the subject; however, the professor and all his TA's were very helpful and supportive with any questions I had about the subject at hand. The grading is very fair and clear, you will get what you put into it. Overall, great professor!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor is really great. This course is one of the best course I ever had. I would take his cs554 which is web programming 2 next semester. Good job! Professor.

Professor Hill is a really chill guy. He isn't an experienced professor (yet!) but he does his best and is really knowledgeable about the field. His policies are somewhat strict such as when it comes to late assignments, but his reasoning for it (you can't submit late work in the real world) is fair. Overall, I would recommend his class.

Prof. Hill is very knowledgeable about the subject and offers real-world examples of what is being taught. Constantly available for help and will spend time to research and respond to any questions he might not be able to answer at the exact moment. Stresses the importance of accessibility and inclusion with any web project.

The professor is really good at teaching and responsible for every students; at the same time, the professor is extremely good at programming, not only for the class he teach, but also in the other computer programming language; When I had some problems during the classes, the professor will be really patient to help me until I can handle it;

Patrick Hill is one of the best professors, he knows what is doing, he doesn't use any textbooks but uses lecture codes to explain which is very much enough to crack his assignments. The best part of this course is that the professor and the TAs are available outside the class and we cant contact them through slack.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Hill is a great guy who knows what he's talking about. The assignments evolve as the most recent web development strategies are brought to the forefront, so you're always learning something new.

Professor have great knowledge He gives good feedback Available outside the class most of the time He responses asap It will be helpful for students to learn if more in class exercise are provided More practical teaching would be helpful than theoretical lecture
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: Great professor who is always available to help. Has a sense of humor. If you have a question he won't beat around the bush until you guess the answer correctly, he will just answer the question and show you not only what to do, but HOW to do it.

Probably one of the best CS professors/classes you're going to find at Stevens. Assignments start out pretty simple but get kinda hard near the end. There's also a group project but you won't get to pick your team if you care about that.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Tough grader

comment: Some Homeworks are longer than they look.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Hill was available after every class and his TA's were available throughout the week. He is very approachable. Gives good feedback on everything. Class is challenging and hard work but learned a lot.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: The professor is very responsible.

He gives clear lecture and pay much patience to help you. Homework will take a lot of time, but it helps get hands-on experience and learn about web programming. It was, by far, the best class I took this semester.
This is a great Professor. I had him as a TA for CS 523 and he was great then as well. He is super clear about what he is testing for homework and is always available for clarification.

Can definitely tell he is super passionate about teaching the basics of web programming to his students. There is a lab every week, but following the code he went over in class is super helpful for labs and is easy to follow. He is always responding in the slack, whether it is about class or just about anything in general. It is a must take class!

He is the most amazing professor I have ever seen. I don't know why he was working before from like 20 years because he is very passionate about teaching. He is the one who has changed the entire course of the web from Php(a 20 years older era) to Javascript, Nodejs, React js and what not(completely new concepts which help student to get job).
Professor is an Inspiring person who teaches really well. Course is very well structured and makes you relate to the real world! Learned a lot of stuff! So glad I have taken this course.

He is very clear and knowledgable on the course materials. By doing his labs, you can get hands-on experience and learn practical web development a lot. He is very welcoming for questions, and when you go up to him to ask questions or to get help on solving problems of your code, he will stay as much as he can with you until solving the problem
The professor is very clear when presenting the material. He ensures to provided multiple sources and examples. Always prepare for the lectures, and very responsive in and outside of class.
Amazing class!
Has in depth knowledge about the subject. Needs to work on presentations. Overall great proffessor.
The Professor is very good at the subject and has a very good approach towards explaining how to code. Also, he is always available to students for doubts and questions.

It's a fairly easy, assignment driven course. The Professor is quite funny and the classes are often interactive and fun.. He is also very good with responding to emails (this is quire rare believe me) . All in all was a pretty fun course... 100% would recommend...
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Easy course !
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: 1. He is really an experienced web developer because our final group project is edited by one of our members and we cannot run it on our computers, he only took a few minutes to fix it for us which honestly cost us tons of time to find the bug. Really impressive. 2 Hilarious and open minded. We students can choose whatever we can learn. Cool!!

One of the best CS professors at Stevens. I've learned more from him than any professor ever and he cares a lot about how the students do. Students learning whatever has to be learned is more important to him than anything else and I really value that. I think more professors should have a similar mindset.
Great professor, very nice and knows a lot about web development. Reads off the slides during lectures, but so do most professors.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: One of the most approachable professors I've had. While people said he reads off the slides too much in the course review, I find that some of the best professors in CS do the same thing (Bonelli and Borowski). As a first-time professor, I am more than happy with his ability!

Mr. Hill was my TA for my Web programming I class, and hes AMAZING! hes so funny and hes really passionate about what he does, you can tell he enjoyed teaching us. He made lots of funny jokes and kept class interesting, definitely taking him again!
He is the best I love him

Professor Ryan was a very kind professor who is ready to help whenever asked for anything, in or out of class. He is happy to help at any time. The only thing is that he is a bit old fashioned in the way he doesn't like people being late or not paying attention the whole class in lecture, but his lectures are pretty fun so it is generally fine.

Best professor at Stevens hands down. He cares about his students, tries to make the lectures fun, has a good sense of humor, and his classes are not difficult. Always take Professor Ryan if you can. He is a Stevens legend.

Kevin Ryan is an amazing professor. He's extremely lively and energetic, makes lecture fun and easy to follow along, and is very accommodating. He does a great job preparing you well for hw and exams. Generally very kind, but will switch up and call ppl out for disrespect which I view as very reasonable. Highly recommend, one of my favorite profs.

If you can take Kevin Ryan, definitely do. He's an absolute gem. Very funny, enthusiastic, and entertaining; turns every class into a show you don't want to miss; and always there to help whenever you need.
if you told me that the prof gets infrequently possessed by Satan I would believe you.

Professor Ryan can be very inappropriate/unprofessional at times. He has trouble understanding or caring about students' situations. He is funny, but since his empathy and demeanor feel like a charade, I would not take a class with him again.
MY COLLEAGUES. Every time he says this just makes my day. Top of the top right next to my other goats GCal, Will Long, and Yi Li.
This guy is insane. He seems normal until you make him angry.

I feel like I could've done a lot better in this class if I tried harder on the first exam. I failed the first exam, and even though I did significantly better on the second exam, my grade was already tanked, and couldn't come back. Besides that, amazing lecturer, really friendly, and loves you going into extra help.
He is an amazing professor and it was really easy to understand everything he taught. Be sure to pay attention all throughout class and go to his exam reviews and you will do very well in his class.

This professor always brings a lot of energy to each lecture - he keeps everything engaging. All the homework and slides he does are beneficial to understanding the content. He does exam reviews which has always been super helpful in preparing for each quiz/exam. But I do think that at times, he can be bipolar. He's great at teaching though!

Each and every lecture Professor Ryan teaches he comes with lots of energy, happiness and humor. One of the only lectures I 100% entirely pay attention to. Great guy, just pay attention and study a few days before the exam. He does have anger issues, however. Just don't take it personally. It's not the best dealing with it, but it could be worse.

Prof. Ryan has gotten angrier and meaner this year and maybe last. He became irate at our class for not doing well on his test that had nothing to do with class material. He does not know much about how the field has evolved after 1973 and also doesn't know how to turn the projector on. To pass, attend his review sessions and you'll be good.

good, passionate professor but can get really mad which could because of anger issues or age. the class can be hard for people with no experience in python. he doesnt try to understand the students situation no matter what and will call you out in the middle of class and make you see him after class for small things. could be time to retire for him

I really like Professor Ryan as a person, he was a very funny guy that you could tell cared about his students. But I think he did a terrible job making his second semester class a more introductory course for his students that had never taken a compsi before. It was too difficult and had a tough time with the tests. Projects and homework was easy.

Kevin Ryan is by far the best professor I had at Stevens so far. He was always clear and helpful when teaching CS115, and came in every single day with the same happy attitude and smile to teach. He genuinely cares about every student and their grades, and will help you learn. The course is not hard at all if you are familiar with python.

I love Kevin Ryan! He is passionate about what he teaches and always prioritizes the students' needs. He recommends the textbook but you don't need it for the class at all. The homework and exams are easy and if you're new to coding you will survive and thrive in his class. He wants you to attend class and be present -- you will be his favorite.

Probably one of the best teachers I've ever had. You can tell he really loves what he does and he really knows the material. Not to mention he's impeccably dressed in every class and very engaging with the class. Love this guy.
literally my goat
i love this man

Professor Ryan is a great lecturer. He is engaging, funny, and clearly knows his stuff. I wish he lectured more in this class, because the later half of the semester was basically spent copying his code from the board. Basically, if he had lectured the entire time this would've been an amazing class, but it was overall average. Low work load.
hands down the most caring and sweet professor I have ever had, wish I could have him for every class.
What every teacher can and should be, the most engaging professor I have ever had!

He is one of the best professors I have ever had the pleasure of being in a class with. Every activity feels like you are working side by side with him and the classroom environment is so carefree and judgment-free that it is easy to follow and ask questions! Go to the lectures because he goes over anything you could need! The best professor!

One of the few professors at Stevens whom I would pay to teach me. He puts in a lot of effort to make sure every student understands concepts and knows how to do practice problems correctly. He is always high energy with a good attitude and his classes were very relevant. He will go out of his way to make sure you understand things. Super nice guy.

Literally the best professor hands down. Makes any hard concept so simple when he lectures. Makes you truly understand the concept in his lectures. If you play attention in class the test has no surprises. If you participate and pay attention and show you care you'll definitely get a good grade. He's so great that it'll be so easy to pay attention.
Actual nicest teacher ever. Cares so much about his students and will do anything to help them. Wish he could be my teacher for every single course

Professor Ryan is a true gem. I had him for both E245 and E231, and he always brightened my day. I am truly grateful to be one of his colleagues and I hope to be able to take another one of his classes. He is extremely nice, funny, and he knows how to help if you do not understand. He is a 10/10 human being.

I had him for both E245 and Design IV as he's the only professor for both--but I wouldn't have wanted anyone else. Kevin Ryan is a joy to have as a professor. He's dedicated to making sure all of his students understand the material: I had him during COVID and he was super accessible. His material is difficult but he makes it all worthwhile!

Professor Kevin Ryan was easily my favorite professor for my first semester. He made class enjoyable and engaging. I felt the need to participate or else I wouldn't feel the effectiveness of her class. Show up to all of his lectures because you'll regret missing them. I wish he taught more upper level courses because he is truly exceptional.

Kevin Ryan is simply the GOAT, what more can I say. His ability to have an entire hall of undergraduate sophomores engaged in lecture is second to none. He is very accessible and will never make you feel bad for asking a question. If you practice a little bit, and use Kevin Ryan as a resource, you will get an A.

The most loved man on campus, king of the nerds. He is an incredible guy and super caring, but I would much rather have him as an uncle than a professor. I am biased because I could not care less about circuits (and he does not care whether you care about circuits), so just hold your breath and get your degree, you're going to have him twice.

Hands down the best professor I've ever had. Even with covid-19 and being forced to take classes online, he's the most energetic and passionate professor I've ever seen. He really cares about circuits and it shows, he makes class very entertaining and he really gets his students involved. I don't usually rate professors but he's so great I had to.
The best prof. on campus. LOVED and RESPECTED by lots of students. Is very fair and understanding. Would take anything he teaches.

If you make the effort to work with him, Kevin Ryan will make sure you are taken care of. He will accommodate any timing issues, study with you, do homework with you, and be there if you just need to talk about problems. Completely understanding of mental health, and will make sure you have the best chance possible for the best grades.

Caused me anxiety by calling me out for poor attendance even though i'm a senior working an internship trying to secure a full time job. Not considerate of outside circumstances that good students may be going through. Otherwise is a decent professor who seems to care.

By far the best professor I've had. He is enthusiastic about teaching and knows what he's talking about. He cares about his students, so make sure to go to his office hours and ask him questions. Homework is completion based but is also good practice. Partial credit is also given on exams
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Probably the best professor I have ever had. He gets angry when people skip his class or don't pay attention, but it is only because he cares so much. Every time I saw him outside of class, he asked how the lecture was and if the homework/exams were fair.

Dr. Ryan is a true gem at Stevens. If you show an effort in his class, he will bend over backwards to make sure you completely understand the material. His lectures are entertaining, but if you have a background in circuits, the lectures will move rather slowly. Tests are very similar to past years and he runs his own reviews, which is very helpful

Decent professor. The biggest downside is that he makes his exams nearly identical to the previous years exams, so I didn't really need to show up to lecture to get high 90s. I feel like I missed out with him because his lectures are great but completely unnecessary for getting good grades.

Honestly, there aren't enough good things to say about this man. Let's just say, if Kevin Ryan taught every class at Stevens, I would have no complaints. He also rounds grades up at the end of the semester. So a B+ becomes an A- and so on.
He do want you to learn, he do want you to practice.

A blessing to the Stevens community. One of the few professors that really cares about your personal education. Always willing to work with you if you are willing to put in the effort. He is the absolute man.

Favorite professor makes the material as interesting as possible. Great for circuits and makes D4 bearable as a class, would not be the same class without him. Tries his best to learn everyones name. Is the most human professor Ive have.
Whether is Circuits or D4, this is the go-to guy

D4 with him was way harder and I do agree that I felt that having circuits with him versus D4 was a totally different experience. I don't know why he treats the two classes differently when the material is basically the same.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment: He is definitely a good circuits professor. But he needs to improve on being a better design professor.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Best professor at Stevens
One of the few professors that inspires students to succeed. He is a gift to the Stevens community.

KRyan is one of the best professors at Stevens. He is so enthusiastic and will do whatever it takes to make sure everyone understands the material. Show up to class, participate, and you will be on his good side. Exams were harder than expected but very fair. See him with test corrections for points back on exams!!

So enthusiastic and loves what he does. This guy goes out of his way to be there for students. He will remain in his office until late at night and meet with about a hundred students with no breaks just to review your test. Was there on a week night once & he bought us pizza to thank us for waiting! Such an amazing professor.
He cares about every student and will stay at school until 10 at night teaching in extra help. He knows everyone's name and is one of the most genuine human beings I've met.

Kevin Ryan is the gem of Stevens. Visiting families are taken on tours past his lectures because he is just that amazing. He is charismatic and enthusiastic about his profession. He firmly believes in an "Every question deserves an answer" policy, and takes pains to ensure everyone understands a concept before moving on. He knows everyone's name.
Kevin is one of the best prof I've met in Stevens, always be full of passion, an adorable prof when he answers  any questions after lectures.

Possibly the best lecture professor I've ever had or will have in my life. He's full of energy and keeps everyone attention in lecture. Explains everything so that you only have to hear it once to memorize it.

He is the go-to professor if you want to attend stevens's lectures. i personally dont find a lot of lecture in stevens interesting. He is an exception. Great man, great lecture. Funny and wont make you bored. Worth your tuition.
He's essentially the Bob Ross of circuits.
The absolute pinnacle of teaching. Great man, very understanding, very helpful, enthusiastic, and knows material well. Impossible to not learn from him.

One of the best professors I've had in my 5 years at the school (Masters and Bachelors). Has great lectures and goes out of his way to help students understand course material. Approachable outside of class. Very charismatic and fun. The school needs more professors like professor Ryan. Too bad he doesn't teach more engineering courses.
I can not think of a better teacher
Oh man you gonna like it. Dont trust me, listen to every student in stevens.
Awesome professor, sitting in class is like going to the movies, and he's  always around to help. Just stay off your phone in class and you'll be goldennn

Kevin Ryan is known for being one of the best and most enthusiastic professors in the whole school. Every engineer that goes through the school will have to have at least one class with him. Enjoy it!
Kevin Ryan will go out of his way to help you with anything, even if it's not related to the class. Even if you're not in his section for a class he will help you out as much as possible.

My colleagues! You don't want to miss his lectures. Kevin Ryan is one of the nicest most helpful, genuine professors I've ever met. His class is not easy, but he will help you until you understand every single thing and make you feel proud of what you've accomplished. 100% would take more classes with him.

It's all been said before.  Excellent professor and wonderful guy.  Teaches well, is enthusiastic, prepares you for his tests, grades homework leniently, and is a pleasure to speak to.  If you're a EE, you'll be sad to know he only teaches one other class in this field.

I've taken two of Professor Ryan's classes. He is one of the most interesting people you will meet. His intellect, wit, and humor make the classes very enjoyable. He is always available to help you. His tests and homework are tough but he is extremely fair! I'm glad I've gotten to know him and would easily take more classes with Doctor Ryan!

One of the most amazing professors I've ever met. He is so helpful and supportive and has such a wonderful attitude. He really knows how to teach and shows respect for students. All professors should be like Kevin Ryan!!

Prof. Ryan is the reason I became an EE. He's by far the best professor at the school. He's incredibly open to helping every student, and is one of the kindest people I've ever met. I wish I could take more of his classes!
He makes my day with his lectures and he is always more than willing to help

Excellent professor.  He really tries to help every student in any way he can.  He spends plenty of time explaining to people that don't understand.  I also love that he posts all the exams he has given in prior semesters.  These make excellent study material to prepare for the upcoming exam.  All around great teacher!!
Best Professor I've had at Stevens. Seems like the only professor that actually wants you to do well at this school God bless this man. More people should take after him.
The greatest teacher someone can ever have.  He really knows how to get students interested and tries to help everyone anyway he can!  Never forget the Paffnutty! ;)
Great teacher who puts in more time than any other professor I've ever had. I feel bad for him when I see him leaving campus around 11 some nights.

Second best professor I have had at Stevens; close contender for best. Presents the material very clearly and very enthusiastically. Almost always available if you need help outside of class. While circuits was a required class for all engineering students, his lectures certainly make it interesting for everyone.

I am a mechanical engineer. Frequently thoughout the year his enthusiasm for the subject mad me seriously consider changing to electrical engineering. Circuits is a difficult subject, but Kevin Ryan teaches you to love the challenge, and do your very best. Possibly The Best Professor at Stevens.

Dr. Ryan presents with such enthusiasm and keeps the class engaged. His knowledge is extraordinary and enthusiasm is contagious. I was fortunate to have him for three courses (TM610, TM615 & TM617). Best. Instructor. Ever.

Dr. Ryan is hands down the best professor I have ever had. He has command over the course work and he is extremely helpful. He is very fair with his grading and he is willing to work with you. I highly recommend Dr. Ryan. He is the only reason I chose the Masters of Telecommunications Management degree from Stevens Institute.

the most helpful teacher you'll ever have at Stevens, tests are hard as hell but it's only because he wants to challenge you. He also makes the difficulty of the exams according to how smart the class is. always ask for extra points on exams and go to class kuz its hard if you don't go
Best teacher at Stevens! Clear teaching

My Colleagues, Prof. Ryan is without a doubt the best professor I have ever had at Stevens as an EE student. He is so helpful and entusiatic, and one of the nicest people I have ever met. He pushes you to do well, not because he's tough, but because he believes in you. He is a rare breed, and I will always be thankful for his help.

He is not an efficient teacher when it comes to getting his point across. In lecture he did not explain concepts before he did an example which made the class to follow.  I think the class is curved alot, but he doesn't make that apparent in the semester so you end up working really hard and getting really stressed over the class.
Took this class last year, I really enjoyed his teaching. To this day I really appreciated his help and his enthusiasm for the subject. :)
BEST PROFESSOR EVER. VERY ENTHUSIASTIC. HE REALLY LOVES TO TEACH.

Absolutely the best professor I have encountered while working on a M.S. degree at Stevens. Extremely well versed in the subject matter and clearly enjoys teaching. I would recommend any of his classes, they are challenging but very enjoyable.
No Comments
outstanding
Easiest A I got all semester, but he clearly doesn't care if you show up or do anything. Just went to lab to check in and googled the rest. Waste of time.

Mukund doesn't care about this course and anyone gets an A. He is however obsessed with some Launchpad program which sounds like a scam. He claims we will own a billion dollar company with no catch, and then attempts to “recruit” into this top-secret program by announcing day one of its existence to all lecture halls full of freshmen engineers.

Mukund doesn't really care about this course and anyone gets an A. He is however obsessed with some Launchpad program which I'm pretty sure is a scam. He claims we will own a billion dollar company with no catch, and then attempts to “recruit” into this top-secret program by announcing day one of its existence to a lecture hall full of engineers.

Friendly and passionate teacher who is very good and engaging at lecturing when he does it. The class itself is very basic but taught me some new things about coding. Grading is a joke, anyone could sleepwalk their way to an A and he clearly sees the class as an afterthought and/or just a funnel into launchpad (his own thing).
Very chill professor. I enjoyed his lectures but the class was mostly run by TAs and assignments were given out during recitation. Definitely take him if you can!

I don't got much; very lenient and more effort = higher grade. Provides a great window of opportunity to skip a midterm and join a "great" Stevens program (idk I didn't join it). Teaching Assistants I had were great. It is a mandatory class so get Dr. Iyengar's lectures if you can, honestly were super nice.

Professor Iyengar is a very chill professor. He teaches the material in concise way and makes it easy to understand. His homework's are very do-able and fun to think of. He encourages you to be imaginative for your final project with the help of the TA's. A lot of people say that he doesn't teach in-depth and that is because it is an intro course.
good personality, but lectures lowkey useless. GO TO RECITATION!!!!!
Highly Recommended

Probably the easiest data structures class ever. really skewed grading scheme, most'll get an A in a heartbeat. few hws are weighted heavily but are easy. good for those with minimum programming but it's underwhelming in the material covered. def self study if u want to do more data structures. good GPA boost but at a detriment of not going deeper
No one goes to the lectures, but he's a good guy.  Makes us laugh and teaches in a easy way.  He generally stays after for questions

Excellent teaching/lecture skills. DSA course was way too easy: almost no homework, little emphasis on implementation and use, very easy grading. Theoretical explanations were very effective. The class had barely any coding. He just assumed that we know OOP even though he taught the prerequisite coding class that had a tiny bit of OOP sprinkled in.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures--Lecture heavy

comment: I went in not wanting to learn code, I came out of this absolutely loving code. Hard to explain how much this course has changed my mindset. His lectures are cool, he's very knowledgable, but it's really the way assignments and grading are set-up -- they really inspire you to go above and beyond. That made all the difference for me.

It was a pleasant class for sure. His lectures were good and his approach is a bit different since he connects the material to the industry. Seeing the actual application was great. With that being said, you will need to do a final project (analyzing data) that has very little to do with his lectures. Quizzes and midterm are totally doable.
Basically don't even show up to lecture its not mandatory. Just go to recitations and do the assignments on time and you will end with a hundred
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: He likes to explain things in the most basic way possible, sometimes to a detriment. He doe however knows his stuff, and he rewards people who go above and beyond.
Worst teacher ever. Doesn't know what he's doing. If you take one of his classes, you will learn nothing.

E115 was the only class this semester that I was actually excited to go to this semester even though attendance wasn't mandatory at all. It's basically impossible to fail the class unless you don't even try to do the work but you can get more out of the class by doing the challenge assignments. Mukund is so amazing and would love to have again!

I LOVE Professor Iyengar! He is so kind, thoughtful, and always makes himself available for his students. He also goes out of his way to really inspire students and make people want to succeed and accomplish the supposed impossible.
Inspirational professor that cares about your future. Gives you lots of opportunities to succeed in and outside of the class.
Literal waste of time. Teaches nothing and lets anyone pass. Very hands off and doesnt care if you learn anything as long as he doesnt have to deal with you.
I do not remember anything from this class. Easy A for engineering majors. Like laughably easy. Fun guy though, love him
Great professor, explained everything well.
I had a fantastic time in this class. I looked forward to the lectures and will really miss this class. Hope to take more classes with him in the future.

He is such a great teacher. Going to lectures is not necessary but it helps in recitation 100%. He runs through the homework going to be given in recitation and makes is so easy to understand, even if you do not understand coding whatsoever.

I really wish I could give a better review, but he does everything he can to appease lazy students rather than teach in-depth material. In E-115, that was okay, it's a much more general class. But teaching your material in lousy metaphors about cooking, houses, and grocery lists can only get you so far before it starts to become a hindrance.
Hilarious and easy going. But, the class can be confusing for those with no background in coding.
This class helped me change my major, and career plans for good. Awesome experience.
Really easy going professor would definitely take this class again
Funny, interactive, and informative. Love going to class!
Loved CPE360. All I had was my notes from this class before a Microsoft interview, and it was all I needed to crack it.

Mukund isn't a good value for the money. The class was Math for EE, and we didn't even learn about Fourier Series. I think Mukund is so blinded by his ideology of creating software products that he skips the topics he deems unimportant. It's evident that he doesn't actually care about the subject, and he would end class as early as possible.
rating_tags: Inspirational--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: I learned more than I bargained for. I even wrote a full fledged app, and eventually changed my major. Could not have foreseen so much at the start of the sem. Great prof!
Taught the bare minimum and the tests were super easy. Class was supposed to be an intro to programming, I came out of it not really knowing how to code.

Mukund was pretty good professor. His lectures, while sometimes lacking in depth, do their job. E-115 introduces Engineering students to programming, so detail is not always necessary. It's also worth noting that this class was the final push in helping me switch major from ECE to Computer Science.
Absolute joy to be in his lectures. Really fantastic.
Most of my peers who took with others dreaded it, but I absolutely loved the experience! Mukund is awesome!
Man is a rockstar when it comes to turning ideas to companies
Great for the self driven.

Going to be very clear cut here. If you are in any way proficient in programming this class will be a breeze. If you have little to no programming experience, you will have to put the work in and meet with him or other people for help. Very nice guy if you need help though
I love this professor, lectures are easy and very clear, always has time for questions, very understanding and always takes our feedback a and work on making the class better! Amazing guy!

A very nice guy but not the best teacher. If you aren't very good with code going into his class you will struggle. He provides very erroneous code in class and it leaves less proficient coders, like myself, left spending numerous hours trying to figure out what exactly he was trying to do. Know your stuff or prepare for a lot of work

This Guy is amazing, he is inspirational and pushes his student to love what they do. He probably changed my view of what i want to do for the rest of my life and his lectures are just a joy to be there. Plus he throws out candy and teaches with so much passion.
Clone this man! Trust me, Stevens will become the #1 institute in the country.
Phenomenal. Two weeks in and I already want to switch my major.

Awesome guy, and teaches C++ programming very well by demonstrating it in front of the class.  Go to lecture, take notes by doing what he does, use those notes to help with the homework and exams, and you're golden.  Plus, there's candy.

Excellent instructor, makes the class very interesting and conveys the material effectively.  However, the course policies are not clearly spelled out so it can become difficult to tell when what assignments and the like are due, as this varies from section to section and week to week.
Awesome professor. Highly recommended.

He really knows his stuff, and his passion for it is extremely contagious. He was so into it, we completely forgot we were learning programming or doing assignments. I learned a lot in this class and liked this experience so much that I switched my major! And it's all thanks to him!

Prof Iyengar expressed concern for his students and offered help in any way he could. It is evident that he loves to teach for his love of programming and concern for his students. He's a wonderful professor and he made this class a memorable learning experience.

Mukund was the bomb! He took a subject the is otherwise dull and was able to truly make it fascinating and easy to learn. Lectures were extremely engaging, and he kept the atmosphere positive and upbeat. I am going to miss E115. Look forward to more classes with him in the future.
I did not learn programming at all during this class but it was very entertaining. I still got an A in the class. He would bring candy and was just a very chill guy.
Mukund is a fantastic professor. He REALLY wants to help you learn the material. Would recommend any class this this man.
LITERALLY THE GREATEST TEACHER IN HISTORY
Amazing, super funny, keeps everything interesting in class. Definitely not a class I'd ever sleep in. He also brings candy to class! Best professor ever! Youngest in the history of Stevens.
Well .. this prof is so awesome I wanna marry him!

Without a doubt the best professor that I have yet to take a class under at Stevens. Despite being new to teaching, he expresses the material with extremely high levels of clarity  and will go out of his way to make sure that each of his students understands the material. Truly an outstanding professor, and very personable as well.

Described in one word: EXTRAORDINARY. I walked into this class expecting a regular, run-of-the-mill math course. Only to be blown away by the awesomeness of this professor. I may sound selfish but I want this professor to teach ALL my courses.

One of the most memorable experiences of all my school years. I not only learnt the subject, but felt that I somehow grew as a person. Amazing aura, unbelievable clarity in thought and expression, and really cool lectures!

I really enjoyed this class. We learned a lot but I feel like we understood it too. This is this Prof's first ever class he is a new graduate. And the class was really fun. I learned how to really program data structures and how to analyze algorithms. I'm studying for the final now and my study sheet is long, but it is worth it.

I would definitely avoid this professor if I could take the class again. She does not cresta a bond with her students, she's difficult to understand, and she just reads off the slideshow. I wish I had something positive to say about this professor, but I don't.

Kind of useless to be in her classes because you have to teach yourself everything anyway at the end of the week to pass the class. She's a pretty nice person, just not the greatest at teaching. Lowkey be yappin' a lot sometimes.
cant understand indian

She is a nice sweet lady but half the time most students give up onto what she is saying and we end up teach ourselves each weekly lectures. There are so many assignments for this course that honestly I get it. Its for our help but at the same time why are we doing 10-15 assignments a week.pls do your research before taking her.
Don't recommend.
bro doin too much relax its chem 1

In a world of constant change, it's notable when something remain unchanged. Unfortunately, this applies to Anju Sharma, who has been a poor lecturer & dismissive of students for 20+ years. She has discouraged students from pursuing careers in science & while I can't assess her scientific skills, I know she shouldn't teach impressionable students.

Dr. Sharma knows how to teach chemistry effectively. Take her if you are interested in a comprehensive understanding of General Chemistry 1 and 2. Strong personality, part of her class is instilling discipline in new college students.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: She's actually a really nice person and can make funny jokes in class once in a while. She does her best effort to teach, but there is a lot of homework(as all CH 115 classes have). She's always willing to help out if you are struggling too.

Was super scared going into the class considering these ratings. She was actually fairly good in the smaller section I took. Not indicative of her sections as a whole but take 115-S if you have to take her cause apparently people don't like her. Course itself is great; super generous + lenient with grading if you put effort in.
Prof Sharma is rude to students, does not say anything nice and only sometimes shows up to labs. The class requires so much work for a 1-credit lab, it is very excessive.

I took the scholars section with Sharma. If you do the pre-class notes and stay on top of everything (always do the mastering extra credit it'll take you 2 seconds and its worth it in the end). Although she says questions are welcome, they are not. She makes you feel dumb for asking something.

Overall an awful professor for a 1 credit course. She made the lab unnecessarily hard and expected the students to know everything. Also, she's very unprofessional in the lab. When experiments went wrong she wouldn't help the students but she would start freaking out herself. DO NOT RECOMMEND.

Highly test-heavy for a 1 credit lab, which was so unnecessarily tricky for no reason. She is very condescending and does not appear to want to help, instead expects you to know the answer on your own. Does not actually teach the content on the quiz/exams. You are expected to walk into the exam somehow knowing everything. Do not recommend.

Look, I know I'm supposed to study, but giving a topic review that literally just says "Study all topics" isn't helpful for the Exam. In summary, this professor outright told me with the exam review to "Study basically everything so far". Even though there are only 18 questions on an exam, practically all I studied wasn't on the exam. Sucks...

There is hardly anything good I can write about her. She is smart obviously, but the ability to convey that information was definitely not strong, even when asking for help, it felt like you were talking to Karen who is the one who is always right. It was really degrading and I don't intend to take her again, I'll just chemistry with someone else.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: The number of times my head wanted to explode, the stress and heat build-up for how annoying it was to take this class. I should've just taken another Science course and avoided this professor altogether. It's almost like you aren't welcome into the class yet I'm trying my best to study and work hard, yet she throws that effort in the trash.

Professor Sharma is hard to listen to and hard to reach out to for simply just being curious or trying to learn, I had to sign up for a tutor immediately to save my grades. Even with trying to do the work early and understanding it lectures begin, I still do not understand her. Please speak simpler English and not be so condescending. Thank you
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: In a larger setting she's not the best, but if you get the opportunity to take a smaller class with Professor Sharma I highly recommend it. I've never liked chemistry but I actually enjoy class. She's very easy to talk with an accessible both during office hours and outside of given times IF you talk with her. highly recommend.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: I really wished she would just lower her overall "Jargon Speech". A TedEd youtube video clarifies this very well that Professors are too worried about being accurate. She speaks as if she is teaching someone who already understands Chemistry. I have no doubt that if I got introduced to a nicer professor that I would love Chemistry and not hate it.
Sharma does not do well in large class settings, but if you can get her in a smaller class she is very helpful and personable.

For any unfortunate souls that are contemplating withdrawal for this class, I recommend you do. It will take too much studying to make up for the lack of information "Dr" Sharma can give you, and you will end up falling behind in your other classes. Its best to save yourself the stress and waste of time and move on, find someone else and be happier
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Ms. Sharma is not teaching students. She walks into class with a "By the Book" attitude and teaches like she is talking to colleagues at work who understand the subject already. She doesn't translate Chemistry into simple terms, all she does is show pictures as if no one can just buy and read the textbook to do the exact same. Insultive as well.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Anju Sharma does not teach, she tells you briefly what you need to know. Everyone I know in the class had to get outside tutors to pass the class because she is not good at her job.

In my opinion, Professor Sharma adopted relatively well to the remote learning format. Lectures contained material taught pretty well, albeit a bit much at times. She's accessible with her office hours and is knowledgeable, but this course also requires a lot of self studying given the vast amount of material. Class lined up with AP Chem material.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Tons of homework, many questions were not covered in the class. Class was super hard mainly because it was online. In person would be much easier. Prof answers all the questions.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lots of homework

comment: She always walks into class late and acts like it's no big deal, but if you walk into class late she comes at your throat for it. She doesn't teach anything she just reads off a powerpoint slide and when it's time for her to do an example problem not only does it take her 7 hours to do it but she does lots of mistakes. If you can avoid her.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Sharma was my worst professor during my first semester at Stevens. The worst part was that she was condescending, often interrupting students while they asked questions and sometimes laughing at them. She was clearly very good at chemistry but failed to communicate anything meaningful about the subject, teaching to the test.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: I was pleasantly surprised to see my grade. I did not think I would get such a high grade, all that due to Sharma. She showed us how much chemistry matters
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: I learned a lot
Although you need self-study a lot in this class, every test is very easy.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Avoid if you are able to
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tests are tough

comment: By far the worst professor I have ever had in my academic career. Expects you to learn everything on your own, rambles on in class, presents questions based on what you should have taught yourself rather then what she "taught" you. Always talks down on her students like she thinks she is better then us, extremely condescending. Avoid at all costs!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Poor lecturer. Appears to be intelligent, but lacks true mastery of subject. Has difficulty conveying deeper understanding of topics. Teaches to pass test, not understand chemistry.
I will never never again to take the section.
Good Teacher, tests are a bit hard, but in the end, if you listen, she explains things clearly
Very condescending, does not offer help readily. She seems to know her stuff but don't ask any questions or she gets angry.
Very condescending. Understands material very well but doesn't make you interested

Her tone sounds like she is looking down on students. She is completely unhelpful if you need it, makes you feel stupid if you have a question, and has no sympathy if circumstances arise for you that can't be helped. Does not explain, she just throws information at you. Her quizzes are relatively easy, but that's not gunna help you on tests.

She is a good professor. Extremely strict, and a no-nonsense teacher. Her chem quizzes, during the recitations, are easy. Since the recitation has a lot to cover every week, it's difficult to get some questions answered.
Great Professor. Knows her stuff! Very supportive as long as you put in a good effort.

She is very smart and knows her stuff but I personally don't appreciate how she makes fun of her students and laughs at how badly we do on tests. She needs to use more encouragement! Also, she's not someone you feel you could talk to and ask for help. Good notes, but intimidating.

No matter how hard you try, she will always find a way to screw you over if she doesn't like you. I have tried taking her class over the summer, and she loves insulting students rather than helping them. Though I've done well in her class, I know I could've done better if she actually cared to help.
She knows the material.  She's fair and if you need help then she will help you.

ANYONE who is saying Anju Sharma is a good "teacher" is just happy that they passed the class and got out.  Don't listen to those losers.  As a person she is brilliant, as a teacher she is mean, stuck-up, and she just spits info at you.  If you dont get it the first time, good luck learning on your own.  She won't help you.
never compromises.
I wish stevens had at least one chemistry professors whos first language is english.
She's pretty clear about explaining stuff. And if you don't get anything, not to worry -- the quizzes are ridiculously easy.
I loved her.  She was very concise and to the point during recitation and she was always willing to help you with something on her free time.

ehh...she's alright, but that's about it.  She'll review what you need to know, but her tone just suggests that you don't want to mess with her. She can and will make you feel stupid at times too.   Her quizzes are pretty damn easy. If she wasn't clear before, she really must have worked on that because she is pretty clear now.
Not a very good teacher, but the quizzes are do-able.  It's hard to pay attention because her teaching is a bit dry, but she'd keep me awake by bugging her eyes out like a Muppet Baby.
Unbearable!  She never explained, and actually got mad at people who she thought had stupid questions.  No help.... ever!
No Comments
think Wicked Witch of the West.....
Kill me. she's got attitude problem.

worst TA ever. rude. doesn't speak english. hates students. unclear. forgets she's a TA & tries to lecture on topics entirely ahead of what the professor of the class is teaching. on 1st hw assignment, she used material from ch 7 when the professor had only covered up to ch 2. avoid taking!
I think Dr. Sharma is great at explaining chemistry. She goes through a lot of material with clarity and coherence. Her accent is not bad. There is nothing in the course she cannot answer.
barely speaks english.....no questions allowed in class.....very bad
Good teacher.
Unbelievably smart professor, extremely talented at breaking down difficult topics. CS 135 is just a difficult course.

The definition of a weed out class. After your grades are wrecked by the midterm and final, participation grades are generated by rng and will bring your gpa down even lower. I showed up late to a few classes and despite having perfect attendance didn't raise my hand because I didn't understand content right off the bat. Sandeep likes to hurt you.

Yeah, there are easier professors and in the middle of the course you will regret not choosing them, but immediately after, you'll be glad you learned more in this class. No, you are not "too cool" to go to office hours. Nobody cares, get the help you need, and you will be just fine.

He is a good teacher but sometimes I feel like he is too intelligent to teach us. The problem sets take a unnecessary amount of time. If you do not naturally like the material then this class is a bit painful.

Bhatt is wonderful. He teaches really well and makes the content interesting. Him and the TAs care about the students. The weekly problem sets are hard but doable, and do a great job of reinforcing the material. He knows his stuff really well and explains it masterfully. 

I hate theory, and I still really enjoyed Bhatt's lectures.
Sandeep is a very nice guy, but the class is extremely hard. There is a lot of homework and the grading on tests is not generous at all.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: Bhatt is one of the best professors I've ever had. He gets a lot of hate for teaching challenging courses but he always gives a hefty curve and has plenty of extra credit opportunities to take off the edge. He makes sure office hours are readily available, and his lectures are fascinating. Material is hard though, the book helps a lot.

Professor Bhatt understands what he is teaching and communicates it well, it just sucks that what he teaches is so difficult. Weekly problem sets make up a large portion of grade and require at least 3 hours of office hours to do well. All the CAs and Bhatt are super accessible and you can do well if you put in a lot of work.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: This class is a lot. To succeed on problem sets, going to office hours is practically mandatory. The lectures are interesting, and work outside of the class is inevitable if you want to get an A. Professor Bhatt is very intelligent, but often dismisses concerns about the course too easily. Roughly 6-8 hours spent in office hours weekly for an A.

Material is very difficult but he tries his best to teach. Lectures are somewhat helpful but problem sets do most of the teaching. Labs are not that useful to exams but are not that bad. Office hours are crucial for understanding. Class is curved heavily at the end.

The only professor that teaches this class online. The lectures have bias examples and provides a lot of information at the same time with no clear logic. Assignments are due during week days, 2hrs are given for labs, and no helpful reviews prior exams. Professor's communications skills are terible! DON'T TAKE IT unless you have antidepressants.

This class is difficult only because of the material itself, not the professor. He and the course assistants are always available for office hours and he responds to emails very quickly. The work is challenging but he acknowledges that and the class itself is curved.

Discrete Math is hard so it is hard to rate him fairly. One thing to note is that he is not able to come to campus because of his health so be prepared for online classes. He lets the TA grade your homework and they are inconsistent with the grading. Ironic considering this class is supposed to be discrete.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: While he is a tough grader, the class is curved at the end which is fair for the sheer difficulty of the class and assignments. He teaches well and provides a lot of help for assignments and many resources if you need help. Tests are reasonable and he posts the slides from lectures as a resource for studying.

I came into this class expecting that it was going to be hard. I would need to put it my all to learn the subject. But no matter how much I tried to understand, going to office hours, tutoring, and listening carefully to lectures, it was just not enough. It's too hard to ask questions and he rides off the few people that actually understand.

While Prof Bhatt understands the topic and shows it. He is steadfast in his teaching methodology. There is no talking him out of changing anything. The purpose of a professor is to help the student understand the subject, and this is clearly not his goal. The assignments do show relation to the lectures, but the subject vague, therefore difficult.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Its a difficult class no doubt, but its due to the material being taught. The homework assignments do the teaching as much as the lectures.

While Prof. Sandeep is nice and knows his stuff, the wording for some questions on the problem sets can be unclear in what you are supposed to actually provide as an answer. The TAs are nice and helpful, especially in labs, but for problem sets, their roundabout way of trying to guide you without giving away the answer can be misleading.

Sandeep knows his stuff but hes unable to teach the material effectively. He gives homework that is too hard to be done even if you understand his lectures. Furthermore, the labs are also near impossible yet he claims they should take under an hour. The amount you learn is not worth the level of stress. Stay away if you can.
Absolute Legend. One of the best CS professors this school has. This class is difficult but teaches you how to think. The TA's are also some of the most helpful people I have ever met.

This is a horrible course. He has peculiar teaching style, most of the students does not understand anything in his course. The worst thing, he got the worst TAs in Stevens they are just like him don't give you constructive feedbacks or clear grading criteria.
Great prof. that teaches a difficult subject. Lots of work between the problem sets and labs which make office hours crucial if your stuck on something. Overall a very fair, but tough class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Bhatt was a really awesome professor. Super caring too -- I wasn't able to attend his student hours once and he set up a one-on-one meeting w me to go thru my questions. Weekly hw, 4 quizzes, and weekly labs, and HELLA CURVE

CS135 is definitely a challenging and demanding course. Nonetheless, Sandeep teaches you how to recursively approach a problem and solve it. He accommodates students and wants to you see succeed. There are plenty of resources available - from (two!) textbooks, to review sessions and problem sets. He is one of the best lecturers at Stevens, too.

Professor Sandeep's classes are some of the most challenging in the CS curriculum but he more than makes up for it in his teaching ability. Easily the best lecturer in the whole department, is accessible outside of class, and very willing to help students and explain topics further.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Sandeep is a great guy who gives fantastic lectures and is very responsive to student feedback. It's really tough subject matter, especially so early into the curriculum, so he gets a bad rep as a result. You do have to put in a lot of work on your own; be sure to go to office hours often.

Simply put one of the best lecturers I've encountered. The material is difficult and the assignments reflect this, but Prof. Sandeep puts his all into helping the students understand it. Any class that he teaches is an instant must take.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--Amazing lectures

comment: Rating is unreasonably low. Sandeep was one of the greatest professors I've had and I cannot imagine being able to grasp half the concepts he taught had they been taught by anyone else. The material is hard, he makes it interesting.
Absolute legend. All the low ratings blame a great professor for teaching a difficult class with difficult material, and he does so pretty well.
rating_tags: Respected--Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Sandeep's class is hard but teaches some of the most important topics in computer science and actually cares about the students, go to lectures, and read the book and you'll be fine.
Sandeep is a tough grader. He's a good professor and knows his material, but this course is not an easy A in the slightest.

Professor Sandeep is really knowledgeable person, he knows his material. Unfortunately, most students does not like his teaching methedology. His test are not easy to pass. Get ready for a roller coaster ride. I wish we had a better option.

I know that this class is notoriously difficult, but the prof and his TAs dont do much to help you out. Homeworks were difficult, would be due on the same day as exams.
