I am taking an english course with the professor at NYCCT. Her lectures and readings are interesting, if your into reading poems and short stories. Grade A professor.

Had her for intro to literary forms.  I hated it.  She is very depressing and negative.  She has a background in studying satanic literature.  She has a strange twisted view on everything we read.  If you don't like the typical writing/lit class, avoid her.

Contemporary Writing is a great class. We read two graphic novels for intersession and it was much more interesting than I anticipated. Hammerman levels with you and is not big on formalities, which is a plus for most students. She is also good at engaging the class in humorous discussions.
Really really boring and not interesting unless you are interested in boring things, which some people are.  I can't understand why.
She will make you work hard for a good grade but it is worth it.

GREAT professor! Was a great introduction to college calculus as he made me appreciate calculus even more. He explains concepts very well and goes over examples during class and encourages class participation.

Hes a great prof. The math itself isnt very hard but the exams can be pretty difficult especially the final. Get old exams and just do a bunch of practice and PLEASE do the homework. Class is an easy A if you can study 30 min a day

If you can take his class please do! He is one of the best professors i've encountered here at Stevens, he ensures that students have all the tools they need to do well. Even if you fail all the exams you can still pass the class, he is accessible outside class and a very intresting lecturer.

Jan is a great guy but not a great professor.
His lectures are less example heavy and more theory heavy aka boring and not useful.
His tests are similar to his homework. 
If you don't understand something, your best bet is to ask a good TA to help you

Professor Jan teaches some of the most useless things about just getting into calculus. Tries to make the concepts difficult for no reason when I can just watch a video on Organic Chemistry Tutor on YouTube and explains everything in less than 10 min. So the textbook that he gives us for the reading assignment barley helped us.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: W professor, basically you have to read a couple hours a week and do hard homework and work, but his office hours are cool. Do the class exercises before class and then ask questions there to know the right answers because you can finish class with half answers and be good graded but not good conceptually. His questions are on exams.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Caring

comment: Really excellent professor. His homework is definitely extremely challenging, but if you go to him or the tutoring center they will help you out. Tests are okay. You need to go to class because you need to hand in your corrected homework at the end of class. He sets you up for success. Highly recommend and wish he taught more classes at Stevens.

good teacher. homework problems were so conceptual that it was sometimes hard to do. going to the drop in tutoring center helped me personally a lot. if i did not take a calc course prior, my grade would have dropped. he uses proofs a lot which can be annoying when you're initially trying to learn a subject. very nice guy though
Jan is the only good math professor I've ever had, math has always been my worst subject but he was able to teach it good enough that it was my favorite class
This professor gives insane amount of unneccessary and unhelpful homework. He wastes time and is unforgiving about deadlines.

Most of the time lectures are spent going over homework, and then he goes over a few of the problems on the homework for the last 20 minutes. Doesn't explain concepts very well and like previously said most of class isn't even spent teaching. Homework problems are near impossible.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: This class was a pass/fail seminar class, and Professor Cannizzo made it fun. He was full of energy every day, making everyone excited for the class.

He's really nice but he sucks at teaching. I taught myself everything because he wouldn't. He assigned us readings and made us talk about them in class which was useless because it didn't help at all. He would lecture but he would lose track of what he's talking about and then class would be over. You'll leave more confused if you attend lecture.
10/10 best prof I have ever had

Took him for MA120/121. Absolutely one of the most overrated professors I've had. His manner of teaching and the way he interacts with students feels incredibly degrading, and most of what he says is garbage. I learned everything from The Organic Chemistry Tutor on YouTube, much faster and much better.
Was a nice guy, when I emailed him about a problem I had he was very understanding. Personally I wouldve done better in the class if I didnt take it virtually

Prof Cannizzo was excellent. He thoroughly explained each area of mathematics extremely well. The homework and exercises can become overwhelming at times, especially with corrections, however, the grading is very fair. Getting an A to A- is certainly doable, but you have to work for it.

Professor Cannizzo is one of the best math teachers Ive ever had. His enthusiasm for the subject really made class much more enjoyable. And although the homework can sometimes be difficult, hes not a harsh grader, plus hes always willing to hear your questions and help you out so that you can understand the topic. I highly recommend this prof.

Professor Cannizzo is, hands down, the best math teacher I have ever had! He is always available to help outside of regular office hours, receptive to feedback, and truly cares for his students. He also has an adorable dog - Laika! (Ask him to show you if youre in his class). The only negative thing is that the homework assignments are impossible!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Great professor who really helped me understand calculus

He genuinely cares about what he teaches and your feedback as to how to improve anything at all. MA 240 being a math major only course, you could sense his passion to teach to an attentive group (not like the MA 120s). Homework was hard but it was a fair challenge; never skip a lecture, you'll get decisive hints. Submission feedback was excellent.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: The best Calc professor in Stevens hands down. Cares about his students, is passionate about what he teaches, and is a fair, but also easy grader. He makes the class easy to understand and enjoy.

I Wish I could have professor Canizzo for all of my math courses, he has been hands down the best calculus teacher Ive had, and I thoroughly looked forward to and enjoyed all of his lectures. He aims for a clear conceptual understanding as oppose to forcing equations to memorize on you before a test. Wish I could rate Jan higher.
awesome dude
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tests? Not many

comment: I love Jan so much. He is truly an amazing professor. If I could take every class with him I would.

One of the most intelligent and professional people I've ever met.  Homeworks and recitation worksheets are pretty hard and require some serious thought, but if you do them honestly, they will prepare you very well for the exams, which are easier in comparison.  No surprises in this class.  Just go to lecture & do the homeworks & you should be fine
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Great teacher. He really cares about students understanding the material. If you get him, you are lucky.

Prof Canizzo is by far the best math prof at Stevens. I had him for 4 classes and I still regret not going through the whole MA series with him. He is kind helpful and his TA Funda is one of the best. He is always willing to answer questions during lecture  and will help you with the Wiley and written homework at O hours. Couldn't reccomend more.

Jan is probably the nicest and most helpful Math professor I've ever had. He really helped me get through Calculus, even with my hatred of Math. He's interesting enough to keep you engaged in lectures, and also always willing to clarify if you don't understand something. Also, great to come to during office hours if you need extra help.
Jan is a great professor. It is easy to tell that he loves teaching and is very passionate about the subject. I would love to have him again.

Mr. Cannizzo is hands down one of the best math professors I've ever had. I already loved math but his lectures made me love it even more. He gives really clear examples in his lectures and is always there for his students. You can really tell that he wants his students to do well.

This professor has a very monotone voice and exclusively reads off slides. The lectures are very boring and over 90% of the class stopped showing up. As long as you pay attention to the recitation and have ANY background in programming this class is an extremely easy A. Prof. Miles did try improving his lectures, and while I see him trying it sucks
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He is a sweet teacher but he is SO BORING. His lack of enthusiasm ruins it for the rest of the students, in the middle of the semester, more than half the class wouldn't attend lectures.
Do not take, the TAs teach more in recitation than a 2 hour lecture with Professor Miles. He's a nice guy, but a bad teacher

One of the most braindead classes I've ever taken. Prof's lectures are mega boring  and last too long for what is being taught. The recitations TAs are angels and teach everything in under 40 mins. Just go for attendance to get participation points.

Prof. Miles could improve in terms of making lectures more interactive. He exclusively reads off his slides and tends to speak monotonously. Many students stopped attending lecture midway through the semester because of this. However, he is transparent about exam content and prepares students well for them. I found his class easy but hard to enjoy

I had no programming experience going into this class and relied entirely on my TAs, who were great. The lectures were so confusing, and I was completely lost the entire time. I did not go to most of the lectures after the first few weeks. Note: he takes attendance like twice a semester, so make sure you at least go to sign in once in a while.
He is so so boring. I skipped this class every week. HATE his lecture style, very dry.

He seems like a really sweet guy, but do not take ENGR 116 with him if you don't absolutely have to. While he's caring and wants everyone to succeed, it genuinely just seemed like he himself didn't know how to program. He just copied a code on the projector without really explaining how anything works or what it did. Everybody skipped his lectures.
Took ENGR 116 (intro to programming) with him. Very sweet man, but the lectures were just not worth it. Class itself is pretty easy though, I only went to recitation and I was fine.

He's a great person, but he can't teach too well.  He probably knows the topics, but he reads off his own slides the same way we do.  In a 175 kid lecture, probably 30 kids showed up.  I learned more on canvas than from his lectures, but it is an easy class.  I've heard he made a good luck slide at the end, seems like a graceful human being.

So most sections have ~150 students and after the first few weeks, half of them at most (overestimate) attended lectures. However he does tell you what to expect for exams which makes exams very predictable. He's really sweet though, even gave us life lessons for the last lecture
He does not teach material well. He's pretty lazy with how he presents his information and he doesn't hold the attention of many students during lectures.

Miles approaches lectures much like a substitute teacher approaches a high school class. He reads off of his lecture slides word-for-word and typically has very little to add to them. I call them "his" slides loosely, as he has stated very honestly in class that he actually uses other professors' lecture slides that are over a decade old.
This class could've been so much more enjoyable with a different professor. His lectures are beyond boring, his slow amd monotone talking takes the excitement out of the class.

Professor Miles helps you out more in the beginning than other professors do. He's a pretty chill guy just to talk to before lab too. I'm not sure why he has a lot of bad reviews. Getting the robot to work was really hard so if you think you need to go to office hours then definitely do so before it gets super packed at the end of the semester

You could honestly never show up to his class. He doesn't really read anything so if you have him don't focus on sounding like a genius. TA's will teach more than anything so rely on them. Very blunt which is funny at times. If you want an easy A take him. He also lets you submit work whenever so its super chill.

Hes not a bad professor, but he truly is interesting. He doesnt really does much, meaning he tell a bit about what you have to do, goes over it a little and lets you work it out on your own. I think him more of a observer than a teacher, but if you ask a question he will try to help you without giving you all the answers. Overall hes ok

Miles gets WAY too much hate. A lot of the criticisms below are valid, but he has a lot of great characteristics too. He does everything he can to get everyone on the same page and does a great job of ensuring that the class objectives are met by every team. I honestly think Professor Miles is just misunderstood. He's genuinely a good guy.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: Social awkward. I think he might be an actual robot or alien life form trying to gather data on how humans act.

Joe Miles is one of the worst "educators" I have ever had the displeasure of working with. Passionless, irritable, and unprofessional, his only saving grace is that things aren't entirely his fault, since the course is pretty disorganized on its own. He knows this, but still chooses to make things miserable for his students anyway.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: -reads verbatim from his powerpoints, very slowly -expects students to have preexisting knowledge of everything that is covered -confusing homework system; people usually don't know what is due when -drops names daily of past students who messed up "Don't be like John Doe" -coughs with his mouth open
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Though he's no stereotypical "evil professor" that truly wants to make to make his students suffer, he certainly takes what should be an exciting class for aspiring engineers and makes it dull. (He may have some personal issues which reflect on his behavior. He has a tendency to search up morbid news headlines and leave them on the smartboard.)

The archetype of the socially stunted professor who cannot properly communicate to their students. What could have been an interesting course was instead made a chore by a general lack of enthusiasm and inability to connect with his students. Furthermore, he does not do a good job of identifying and rectifying issues involving lazy group members..

Miles is two things: experienced and relatively unhelpful. He wants you to figure answers out for yourself, which is good, but doesn't always give you the tools to do it. Make good friends with your TAs because they will be infinitely more helpful. His lectures are incredibly boring and often unhelpful. His grading is strict without much feedback.

Professor Miles gets a bad reputation because he doesn't give you the answers and instead allows you to figure it out on your own. This is the premise of engineering. Great Professor who has lots of experience.

Professor Miles expects people to figure things  out for themselves by giving you just the right amount of help. Unfortunately, most students do not appreciate this method of teaching which leads to bad readings. If you have a engineering mindset, you will do well.
Lectures are painful to sit through especially during a night class. Class is interesting, takes a lot of time but if your group is smart and works well it'll be an easy A
This professor is very boring and unclear with instructions. Avoid at all costs.

Miles is one of the most boring professors I have ever had. His monotone speech along with his lecture (reading from a PowerPoint) do not help at all. I asked for help one day and his response was "Well something is wrong, but I can't tell you what". I can't wait to finish his class.
Good professor. Lectures are pretty boring but overall he is a good professor. Talk to him person to person, he's pretty interesting.

Not only is Miles the single most boring teacher that I have ever had.  He is not helpful in explaining the tremendous amount of HW that he gives.  He takes forever to "lecture" which always ends up being him reading word for word from his slides.  One of the worst teachers that I have ever had.
Gives quizzes unlike all the other teachers.  Not very clear, mentions things maybe once.

Lectures can tend to drag, and likes to re-read information assigned for homework. Well practiced and knows what he's doing with regards to the design process. Is more than willing to help, and is a very fair grader. Sometimes advice could be more constructive, but tries to help where he can.

This guys is a really genuine person and professor. Cares about his students and is willing to help out if you seek it. His Powerpoints and endless statistics can be a bit much at times, but he wants all his students to succeed. A+ teacher - my favorite this semester and I hope to have him again!

Lectures were long, drawn out, and boring.  The structure of the course leaves a lot to be desired.  Overall, between Dr. Jones' lectures and the recitations, it's very difficult to learn and understand the course material.
AMAZING!

When it comes to Thermodynamics. Professor Jones is the best teacher ever. If you take him for Chemistry I and II and then see him in Thermodynamics, he is totally different person. By the way he teaches it is obvious that he loves Thermodynamics and show it through his excellent teaching, but his exams are hard.
He has the best Chemistry jokes, and his exams are mad easy.

The material he covers isn't the most exciting, but he does a decent job. He also assumes you've read the chapter ahead of time, so he breezes through some of the material during lecture. Doing the homework isn't necessary, but it does help (especially as the semester goes on).
I heard he worked on the Manhattan Project. (Fun Fact)

Quite a character.  He teaches Chemistry by the books, which can be a little dry for some.  Fortunately, he lightens the mood with chemistry jokes, which you are more than welcome to nervously laugh at.  If you keep up with recitation and pay attention to the quizzes, you'll do alright in his class.

Get a coffee and try to stay awake for the whole class, unless you are a chemical engineer. He tries hard to keep the class interesting with his jokes. Usually, recitations are more helpful than lectures. Lectures are straight out of textbook most of the times. Take notes as fast as you can, because he goes really fast through the powerpoint slides
Hardest class for me to get though thus far... good luck.

He's so boring! He does a good job of trying to get the material across, but the only way you'll ever understand anything is if you read beforehand. Though he is willing to help students out and even answer questions in lecture.
I went to his lectures and really tried to pay attention, but he's just so BORING. You're gonna have to become best friends with your TA and book if you hope to even pass this class.
just didn't like him one bit. not helpful at all. good luck with chem1 and 2 with him.. not easy!

I only went to chem lecture when I needed a good nap. Scary part is that I'm being honest. Horrible. Just plain old horrible teacher. Don't take him if you can, but unfortunately, if you go to Stevens, you probably need to take chem I and as of now he's the only lecturer.
Boring.

Knows what he's talking about but has the gift of being able to lull an entire lecture hall to sleep. Not a bad professor by any means, just not the best: my lecture section started with almost 100 students, by the end of the semester there where 20 of us and most slept in lecture. Going to recitation is the key to passing with Jones

I'm pretty sure this man worked on the Manhattan Project, and that is no joke. He tries to teach but the classes are just so boring.  It's funny whenever he makes chemistry jokes.  I never went to lecture and pulled out a C.  If you read the book and go to recitation you should do average.
ok, his exams are hard but if you make an effort to pay attention in lecture he goes through every thing that will be on them.  he makes funny chemistry jokes!! its sooo cute!

Alright....he can be a little boring, but at least he makes an effort to be funny, and at least he knows what he's talking about. Beware his tests though - they are extrememly hard - our class average was in the 60s for the last 2 tests.

His lectures are really really really really really boting.  I'm one of those nerdy students who always go to class, but his lectures are soo boring.  I don't think i can stres enough that his lectures are really really boring.  Also he doesn't really help with anyting.  Everything i've learned i've taught myself.  Overall the course itself is easy

My recitation teacher and the book are much more helpful than this guy. Lectures can cure insomnia. He seems like a good guy though -- probably better when he was younger. And I like the jokes -- nerd humor is great.

Bring a pillow if you go his lecture. I've only been to like 3 of his lectures. You really dont need to go, the book itself is a beautiful instrument, as well as your recitation professor. I rock his tests, just make sure you study as much as possible a day or two before.
This guy was ancient when I had him YEARS ago.  He was terrible then, and I can't imagine he's gotten better.  Pompous and arrogant.
This man should not be teaching any longer.  He is extremely old and shlould give up before he turns anyone else against chemistry.

Even though he's a pretty knowledgeable professor that knows and has experiences in Chemistry, his teaching style is not the greatest and I have definitely seen better. He teaches chemistry straight out of the book, which makes chemistry even more uninteresting to me. His jokes are also pretty terrible, but that might not be his problem entirely. If you took AP Chemistry and got AP credit for it, do yourself a favor and opt out of class.
Dry and boring, but at least attendance is not mandatory.  And the curves are nice.
No Comments
No Comments

I've had him 3x. He's a nice guy. Seems dry at first, but he grows on you. His exams are hard, but it's all from his lectures so pay attention. He's a bit boring & has corny jokes, but he tries! (more than most Stevens professors I've had!) If you're going to SIT, there's NO WAY TO AVOID HAVING HIM!
very boring, teaches straight from the book. class is better used as nap time.

To be honest, he has a pretty boring style of teaching. Unfortunately I doubt you can avoid having him if you're a freshman and taking chemistry. He tends to teach straight out of the book, and owch, his jokes are bad. He seems to know his stuff, though.

Both CS 511 and CS 496, Great professor who knows his stuff. Both classes are low level in nature so you need to be on top of studying and applying yourself because if you fall behind, the material isn't intuitive. If you pay attention though, youll be fine. For both classes he also has a ridiculous 60/0 EC hw that boosts your grade by like 8 pts
Terrible, as other reviews suggest. Don't take his classes.

Bonelli is a great professor and is always ready to help out with any questions you have about the course. Attendance technically isn't required but there was a quiz at the start of each lecture. Everything on the quizzes and the tests were variations of the optional exercise questions he gives which feels very fair.

He is a great guy and he checks all the boxes and yet I still can't say I love him. His assignments are a bit ambiguous at times, but its not that bad. I might just not like the course content which is why my review isn't glowing. No need to avoid him thats for sure.

Explained things really well and I enjoyed his course a lot. He cares for his students and understanding, I lost someone halfway through the course, and was very flexible. HW and quiz, tests were very doable.  TAs are also super useful and helpful for this class, go to OH. One thing he is not helpful for is VM issues. Go to Prof Meunier instead.
Fast paced class but explained concepts very well and provided multiple practice booklets. Attending all lectures highly recommended because they are jam packed with info.

I had him for 284, 496, 511. He is a great professor. I would give him a 5, but he goes extremely fast and does not curve. If you zone out for 5 minutes (thanks ADHD) you will be lost. But he is very fair otherwise. Lots of time for quizzes and gives plenty of exercise booklets. Pay attention and you're good. The weekly quizzes are a bit annoying.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor bone is fire. Material is abstract, but he does great work in elucidating the concepts. Grades leniently if you know what you're doing and does quizzes. Pay attention in class, and you should do well. The professor is passionate about the subject and very knowledgable.
Think twice before taking this subject.He doesn't think about student life , even if you do the small mistake in code/assignment/exam then you will be in the bad place.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Professor Bonelli is an exceptional professor who truly cares about his students and wants to see them succeed. I had him for CS 511, and it was a significant learning experience. I enjoyed learning about all the topics about concurrency; highly recommend others take the course as well!

He does not care about students at all. You will get an automatic ZERO for your coding assignment if the code does not run even if it is for something trivial. This is the worst class I have taken at Stevens. I would never ever take a class with this professor. So, Avoid this Prof., and stay away if you care about your grade!!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy

comment: Best CS professor I've had so far. Lectures are super engaging and typically spends most classes just coding by having students tell him what to write and him guiding the process. Clearly knows what he's talking about and does not waste any of your time bragging about it. Just read what he tells you to read, it's usually exactly what's on the quiz.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Amazing lectures --Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Best CS professor at Stevens, hands down. Very clear in teaching, very accommodating and all of the HW and exams are fair.

Despite the course material being hard to understand, this professor does his absolute best to explain each individual topic and absolutely knows what he's talking about. The class is also graded quite leniently, and the 'textbook' (a pdf he wrote) is phenomenal for studying. Unequivocally one of the best professors here.
Good professor and knows what he talking about but kind of leaves you to learn certain hw and makes it unnecessarily harder.
Awesome prof who teaches the material very well. Not much hw and quizzes are usually easy (make sure to do the optional exercises tho).

This class would have been so easy if I paid attention. Bonelli is REALLY awesome, a great teacher (when I was listening), and the work is well dispersed thru the semester. Remember it's a FOUR credit course, not 3, so don't act surprised when you actually have a lot of work. Just don't procrastinate and go to student hours. ALSO NO CURVE
Good at lecturing and clearly an intelligent guy. I would give a 5 but Prof. Bonelli has a habit of getting lost in the sauce and losing me in lecture.

Professor Bonelli's 496 is probably the worst class I have ever taken. The assignments are not even remotely close to what is done in class. Be prepared to fight to ask a question during office hours which will just frustrate you even more. Oh try emailing him directly, he doesn't care enough to respond. Halfway through semester, one quiz graded
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Very caring professor who obviously knows the subject very well. He can go a bit fast, but if you ask him to re-explain things he will and it's generally worth it. You should definitely pay attention in class, because while the work is tough if you pay attention and participate you'll be fine. You should also attend class because of weekly quizzes.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: Pop squeezes every Friday, he makes students write 2 functions program in 30 minutes under pressure in class. It is very frustrating not just for me but for most of the students I happen to meet with. Professor Bernoulli does not care at all whether students understand or if they following his lecture or not. Avoid this class at all costs!!!!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: One of the best Prof. I have ever seen in Stevens. The teaching style is very understanding The only thing is that the course may seem difficult but actually it is not if you just pay attention in his lectures :)

Challenging, but always completely fair. He really cares about the subject and his students, which occasionally leads to leads to him getting frustrated by lack of participation or misunderstanding of the material. Definitely take his courses if you get the chance. They are tough, but you get your money's worth with him.

Bonelli is very passionate about computer science and spends most lectures either live coding on the projector or doing examples relating to trees on the whiteboards. The exams are a little tough but they are graded very generously. He also gives extra credit on the homework and exams.
Very caring professor.
passionate

Bonelli is very passionate about the topics he teaches and cares a lot about every one of his students. His lectures are informative and he does a good job at explaining the content. Do not get into the habit of skipping this class, you will miss important content and eventually miss a quiz or two.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Really cares for his students, brilliant professor. Wish he took more subjects.
If you are a QF, you're going to be roasted by him, so beware. Otherwise he's a fairly good lecturer and explains things clearly, so long you pay attention.  Weekly quizzes and extra credit.
Very enthusiastic about what he teaches, but goes really fast.
Really nice guy who cares about his students' performance more than his paycheck.
Bonelli is fantastic. His lectures are clear and encourages everyone to ask questions when unsure. (Do that. It'll help.) Make sure to show up for class, as there are often quizzes.

Pastore is a fairly good professor. His lectures compose of reading from slides (which are posted beforehand btw), solving problems, and occasionally answering questions. Tests and quizzes are lenient, extra credit is available. My recommendation is to prioritize recitations and the weekly-ish homework (and get used to his god-awful handwriting)

Pastore is a good person and is comical with some things he says, but he is not the best professor. He doesn't really care so getting an A isn't too difficult, but his teaching is very rushed and often assumes we understand everything things already when that is why we are there. And yes his handwriting is awful.
His handwriting is horrible but he's a nice guy and knows what he's talking about. Lectures are kind of useless you could teach yourself most of the material.

There's no point in going to his lectures. He moves too fast and doesn't go over any practice problems. He reads off slideshows that are hundreds of pages long and just has sheets of equations on them. As long as you go to the recitations, you should be fine. Seemed like a cool guy, at least, but made the class a lot harder than it had to be.

He's honestly one of the coolest and funniest professors at the school. A chill dude who's willing to help out when necessary. The hardest part of the course is doing the wiley hw, but it's doable. Tests aren't bad if you study a little for them. Definitely recommend taking him.
you will never understand this mans handwriting

The course itself was not difficult, and Dr. Pastore makes no effort to make it harder than it needs to be. He often goes too fast during lectures, and his handwriting can be difficult to read. Although the Canvas page had helpful resources, it was very unorganized. These might be issues for more difficult courses, but do not matter for PEP112
Only went to one lecture because he goes to fast and I didn't retain any information. I learned everything I needed to know from recitation. DON'T FALL BEHIND ON THE WILEYS. just don't.

Great professor and very willing to help you out if you aren't doing well. The lectures were good, but I felt the recitations were more useful. However, I highly recommend him. If you just study do decently well on the tests you can end with a good grade, just make sure to keep up with the Wiley HWs. Definitely recommend.

Literally just do the homework and its copy paste of exams. Pastore is a nice guy, but the way the curriculum is designed (not by him) lecture vs recitation is a losing battle for lecture. Just go to recitation and you will learn everything. But even if you do get bad grades, Pastore is chill and will give you points back. 1/4 exams are dropped too
Talks too fast in lectures and is too laid back to help you understand the material

Did not enjoy how the lectures were often few topics behind the assignments that were provided during the week. Doing the homework will basically teach you all the stuff you need to get through the course and the exams were often repeat questions of previous assignments. Prof. Pastore has a great personality, but I did not feel like I learned much.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Pastore is super chill. No one goes to lectures though. Class is an easy A. Just do a couple of homework assignments since they're so long
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: He's funny and is always willing to answer homework questions in class. The lectures can be a bit fast sometimes but he'll go back through the slides if asked. There is definitely a lot of homework but as long as you pace yourself you'll be able to get it all done since it's all due at the very end of the semester.
So much stuff in this class and only 20% of the class actually goes to lectures.  I left a month in and his lectures are a little rushed but comprehensible.

He is the best professor I have had so far in my experience at Stevens (currently a sophomore). He is so entertaining and has so much experience in the field. His job background makes him so fascinating. I would take any class he teaches.

Prof. Pastore has maybe the least amount of teaching prowess out of any professor that I have had. He confuses himself constantly and his handwriting is often unreadable. The lecture after the 2020 election he confidently said "I knew COVID was gonna be how they stole the election". That's all.
Pastore is awesome! Very funny, and lectures were entertaining.
Understanding and fair professor. Pleasure to take his class

Lots of people love this guy because he's ha-ha funny but most of his jokes are leveling with us that the material sucks and he gives off a big aloof not caring vibe. He's an industry guy, so not sure why he's teaching since he doesn't seem to love it. He answers emails and takes feedback. Meh overall. Catch him with a cig outside of Red & Gray.

His lectures consisted of only reading off of slides, and those slide were really confusing. All you really needed were the formulas he highlighted, since his exams were literally just plug and chug formulas. I didn't learn any concepts from him at all, and I barely remember anything from the class

Knowledgable about the subject matter for every class I've had with him (PEP112 and EE471) and understanding of the difficulty of the material. Lectures are long but he is able to clarify questions I've had.

Pastore is the MAN!!! For those that gave him poor reviews in E&M they just didn't study enough. Took him for Phys III as well as Transport (CpE version) and I can assure you he is good for those two classes. Definitely would have not done so well if it wasn't for him.

Pastore is a blessing in disguise. If you are EE or CpE you need to adore him in E&M as he is the new professor for Transport. He want to make sure ALL the students pass his class with high marks. His predessor was SUPER TOUGH!!! Thus Pastore is better in my opinion. He needs to teach more EE courses. :)

The due dates for homework assignments were not posted on Canvas and they are not given to you in even incrimants, but even so, he will not let you make up homework. His lectures are just him reading off of slides. He tends to brush over many details. He clearly doesn't want to be there.

Not an effective professor at all. All he does is read off powerpoint slides. I skipped most of his lectures and still got above average on almost all of my exams. I learned everything from recitation and individual studying, which was easy because the exams were plug-and-chug. Not available outside class because wants to go home early. Immature.

He is a good guy, he makes e&m easy to understand. He answers questions and is open to feedback. Sometimes makes typos or messes things up when he writes stuff on the board. Tries his best to make complicated material easy.

A cool laid back guy, but lectures way too quickly and sometimes it's unclear. He is very open to feedback and is always looking for ways to improve the course. Lectures got a little useless towards the end of the semester but go for the pop quizzes!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Hilarious

comment: Prof. Pastore tries his best, but he still needs more practice. Make sure to give him feedback because he will listen and take it into account. His lectures were ok, but improved as the semester went on. As long as you write down all of the equations presented during lecture, you should have no trouble doing well in this class.
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Clear grading criteria--Tests are tough

comment: Very cool and fun guy, but very disorganized. Easy with grading and will always answer your questions. He made the class very easy, but I don't feel like I really learned anything.
Cool guy
He's inspirational and the reason I strive to be successful everyday. I am going to name my kids after him whether its a boy or girl.

He feels like an example of what every professor should be. Instead of scolding you for being wrong - which you rarely are, considering how well he teaches - he works with you to help you understand the material. He's a great guy and a great professor to have.
Great class, go to class so you know what you're talking about and so you're able to take the quizzes, which are 25% of your grade. Do exercises online, and study up, and you'll be good.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Hilarious

comment: Too easy for a graduate level. Gives everyone As who needs it.
He's a gangsta, all of his quizzes are good practice and he wont let you leave unless you get a 100 on it.
Gives a quiz at the end of each class. If you don't get 100% on the quiz he will tell you to go back and answer it until you get it correct. I love this guy.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: You're basically guaranteed an A if you show up to class; after each class there's a quiz that he won't let you submit until you get the right answer. I paid attention for a few minutes each class just to know how to do the quiz, and did other work the rest of the time. He "refuses" to give us below a B on exams, and there are only two per semester
He doesn't work at Stevens full time anymore but he taught one section of stats this year, class is a breeze.

He is the best Professor anyone can ever have. He teaches us with passion and clear concepts. His agenda is to make stats easier NOT difficult for students. I respect Professor Robert and salute him for his achievements!
Prof. Stinerock is the best.  He reviews the material in the order that you need it to get to the next thing.  Plus, he has good jokes.  I don't think I would like stats were it not for him.
Wish Stevens can keep him longer
Great at teaching, smart, knowledgeable, funny, and helpful. Uses real world examples to apply lessons. He should teach other professors how to teach.
Great proffesor, knowleadgeable, funny and helpful.
Very understanding!  Communicates clearly and very smart!!!
awesome teacher
No Comments
hands down best teacher at stevens.

Amazing Professor. Knows so much about what he teaches (marketing). Makes all the material relatable with references to real life situations that show the material you are learning as applied in the real world. Very personable and is more than willing to help his students.  Makes class interesting by cracking jokes and being lively while lecturing.
He's just the man. Period!
Best Professor at Stevens IMHO

Everything is take-home. He's extremely helpful. He will actually look over your exams once and let you know if any answers are wrong before your final submission. All his lecture material(even the off track examples) are provided in his lecture notes, pretty much verbatim.
One of the best professors at Stevens!
Just like everybody else said, he's a great professor.  He will explain everything and he is funny.  Class is hard, but he makes it interesting.  Really liked him alot.
Great Professor! Makes classes fun. He actually gives you all of his teaching notes, PowerPoint slides, etc. - unbelievable!! Would take him again any time.
Best prof at Stevens.
Made math fun and interesting, if you can believe it!  Amazing instructor!
Amazing Teacher!
this guy is amazing! my fave at Stevens hands down
Expectations are clear, just do what he asks and you will be fine. Provides real time feedback during class. Class format is fun.

Unequitable, Have to prove yourself in the course and work up to his expectations without remorse. Outlines are nonsense. Does not care about your life or that your in class to better your life. Very hard and cold to core.
This man is a horrible unequitable professor
it is a tough experience to do research with him. TRUST ME DO NOT DO RESEARCH WITH HIM.

the grading requirements are very complicated and demanding, and there is no clear description of those rules in the syllabus. tough, rough assessment. Even you tried to contact him very respectfully, he just replied one word.

Gray Lynn is the worst prof at Stevens! He is very unclean about assessment and due dates. His syllabus dates are wrong and he refuses to change them, also writes back one word email. Did not enjoy his class or learn anything at all.

I graduated with the MTM class of 1998 and I have fond memories of Prof Gary Lynn. I was perusing his book INNOPRENEURSHIP and that's what brought me to this site. What I remember most about his pedagogy is that it was fun. We had to make presentations and defend our theses. I don't think I've made more presentations in any other course.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: He is definitely one of the best professors. If you take his class, you are definitely going to enhance and improve your marketing skills.

Every professor could learn from Dr. Gary Lynn.  He has created a formula that works for higher education - especially at the graduate level.  He brings an excellent mixture of both industry and academia to the class room giving students a great learning experience.   I highly recommend this course - or any course Dr. Lynn teaches for that matter.
Professor Lynn was by far the most attentive and considerate professor I have had. He would go out of his way without hesitation to help students with any matter, related or not with the course.
Interesting class and good teacher. highly recommend!
I very much enjoyed the marketing management class I took. The simulation is close to the real time markets. I learned much and I think taking up his course was a good choice I made.

I leaned more than I expected! I learned the importance of good marketing strategies through cases and simulation experiences. It's complex, but at the same time it all makes sense. Also, Professor Lynn helped me improve my presentation skills a lot! I improved my ability to be create  intelligent presentations: concise, logic and meaningful.

He is a  very passionate professor and truly cares about getting a students involved in the coursework as well as how do I apply it to real life experiences. He also follows up with the students post graduation and loves to hear about how they're doing. He brings the course to life.

Professor Lynn is a passionate person. His classes focus on teamwork and person involvement. He managed to draw students' attention and interest in his class, marketing management. That's one of the few classes I enjoyed.

This is one of the best courses and professors at Stevens. His energy level is inspiring and his discussions thought provoking. He is not difficult if you pay close attention to what he is looking for. I had a great time in his class and learned a lot.

This is one of the best courses professors at Stevens. His energy level is inspiring and his discussions thought provoking. He is not difficult if you pay close attention to what he is looking for. I had a great time in his class and learned a lot.

Professor could be a little over-board with some of his jokes but he definitely knows how to keep the attention of his students. The sabre simulation can be frustrating but other than that this is the most enjoyable course I have taken at Stevens.
His explication is clear and he can always keep students' attention. The simulation is really helpful for understanding marketing. And his passion is also transmitted to everybody.

Just like any normal person, he needs to know you well to be able to judge you fairly. To make yourself known, you need to do the work, do it the best way you can, do what he states he likes to see in the syllabus, and participate in class. It is as easy as just taking the initiative. I have never understood and enjoyed marketing before in my life.
This is the most interesting class I had have! Prof. Lynn uses various types of tools let the marking real world vivid back into class. Easy understand, qiute useful, and very impressive!

Professor Lynn is quite passionate and patient. In his class, he will cooperate with usrather than imbue us with his lecture. He is considerate enough to remember every detail during the course and remind us of them in the end.
I like this professor and also his interesting classes as well. Especially through the simulation participation, we run a company and grow at a rapid speed by learning lessons. It is owesome!

The  classes are captivating and fun. What was unique about the course was that it both taught about the fundamentals of entrepreneurship  and let us experience it through simulation games at the same time.

Very helpful and informative texts, wonderful design of the course. Very clear in class explanation of concepts. Great inspiration to students who do not have a management background. The only thing I feel sorry about this course is we do not have enough time to finish everything because of Hurricane Sandy.
The class is really helpful for understanding the marketing concepts. We used SABRE as a tool to apply the concepts. The class was really good and challenging.
Professor Lynn is an excellent prof because he provides real world examples to support the content he teaches.
Interesting and engaging professor. Was clear on the goals and objective of course and those were obtained. One of the better professors I have had at Stevens
The exam will be slightly difficult and the scores will be relatively low, but a lot of extra points will be given to allow everyone to pass.

Professor did not seem to have a good understanding of lecture material, everything was copied from the Stanford AI class, including the homework. Homework did not reflect what was on quizzes and exams. Study material was not properly given. Coding homework was not properly explained. Lectures were very boring. Definitely avoid this class!
IDK WHAT PEOPLE ARE TALKING ABOUT SHE IS AMAZING!!!
Difficult!

She is the worst professor I have had so far. So unprepared and unorganized. Copied the entire course from Stanford (YouTube) and would use the exact same slides and even repeat them verbatim. No grip on the material. Changes HW/Quiz/Exam questions on the fly. Makes it harder than it needs to be. Avoid at all costs.

This course is too hard, I think there should be pre courses.
I am freshman in computer science, and this is my first semester, so i think it's hard.
Not good at conveying the material to students and the course is poorly organized
you'll be learning from your peers
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: not exactly as bad as everyone else is saying bc i remember relatively few people showing up to class. But I never got the impression that she had thorough knowledge of the subject and perhaps this is rooted in her not being the most engaging public speaker. There were definitely poorly thought out assignments.

The professor often seemed like they were figuring out the topic as they were giving the lecture. You definitely need to teach yourself everything. Coding assignments were often simple until the professor would change them right before the due date. Class was scattered between five different websites which made studying rough. Grading was fair.

She is not very accessible outside of class for questions about data structure, and when she does respond, she just points you to YouTube videos on a topic. Her lectures are not useful either, very shallow. Might be better off reading textbooks on Algorithms & Data Structures instead

She was unable to effectively communicate the course content and would change questions on the exams as we were taking them. Moreover, she would announce quizzes with very little notice and would not post the assigned readings until the day before the quiz, with these readings being up to 100 pages long.
Lectures are close to incomprehensible. Professor does absolutely nothing to help students, and she is inaccessible aswell.

Extremely unprofessional professor, avoid taking class with her at any cost, it will only give you depression. I would list other reasons but the other reviews have covered most of my other complaints.

You will never not be stressing about this class. Prof Liu sets overly-high standards for a Freshman class. Cannot explain her own codes used in the course. She is incapable of giving a coherent lecture.  Highly unapproachable and hardly ever answers the question. Ridiculously complex assignments which are constantly updated as we work on them.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I personally did not think that any one professor could be so incompetent to teach and so unbearable to try to learn from, but I was wildly wrong. It is a clear consensus among all of the students that she is both unprepared and unfair, and gives unbelievably hard assignments / quizzes to us as freshman (Google interview q's, LeetCode hards, etc.)
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy

comment: Regardless of whether or not you know basic Java, Prof. Liu is no help. Frequently disorganized, cannot read the room, and assumes that students know everything from the get-go. You constantly get the impression that she doesn't know this material herself, and often struggle to decode her own lectures. Expect to teach yourself absolutely EVERYTHING

If you are student who is looking for a challenge, this is your professor. She teaches in a way that if you do not already know comprehensive Java, it will be confusing as she is not good at lectures. However, if you are like me and knew only basic Java before this class, please avoid this professor for your sake / grade. She will not teach you.
rating_tags: Tough grader--EXTRA CREDIT--Graded by few things

comment: She is not fit to teach others about Java when she appears to know nothing about it herself. Her lectures are incoherent ramblings and watching her struggle to debug her own code which should have been done before class. Her grading is harsh and unfair, and even though many have complained about her nothing has been done.

She is not helpful outside of class and when it comes to technical problems with the IDE she told us to use. Her lectures are alright but she goes through some things too fast. People criticize her for the homework, but the amount of homework she gives is the same as the other cs284 professors. Plus, these homework are helpful for interviews.
Professor Liu just can't teach well. The code is confusing and she doesn't do a good job explaining the concepts. You will have to self-learn everything.

This professor gets some unwarranted criticism tbh. Yes the class is hard, and the lectures can be a little hard to stay engaged in. However she has the right mindset, and her goal is to prepare you for interviews. The quizzes are designed like interviews, which can be challenging, but overall the class is very fair. Also lots of extra credit.

Professor Liu was one of the worst professors I've ever had. It's obvious by lectures that she is unprepared, and it makes you question if she actually knows what she's doing. Her online material is scattered everywhere and she does not outline clear grading criteria. She is also very hard to reach, and you will have to teach yourself everything.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Ive never had a professor give a quiz, have the average for it be a 0.1/10 and not give a second thought. Terrible useless lectures. Doesnt answer questions in a remotely helpful way. There are also 3 different course websites to be enrolled in, had to watch a lecture recording to copy the url from her search, because they arent listed anywhere.

Never take a class with this professor. She is terrible at lecturing, often edits the slides in the middle of lecture. The slides are dense with notation, derivatives, and very little explanation. The hw was bloated and redundant, it took my desktop 45 mins to run. The class went from 13 to 6 by the midterm It's the only class I ever withdrew from

She was unprepared for class at least half the time. Due dates were changed randomly, the homework quizzes and exams were usually heavily modified while we did them, lectures were hard to follow and her presentation skills made it difficult to even listen in class. Next to no communication, resources given difficult to find. Avoid this prof.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: Professor Liu (susan) is the worst professor I have ever had. To be fair this was her first time teaching a course and the course was interrupted due to COVID-19, however it was clear from the start that she was unprepared and was not good at communicating anything about the class. Be prepared to learn everything on your own, 100% of the class.

His lectures were at a high level of understanding but he explained everything thoroughly if you asked a question. If you talk to him after class, he'll make sure you understand the most abstract content. Homework was pretty hard so your best bet is to work on it with your friends. Exams required a good amount of studying.

Taam is a good professor, explains material well, and is caring/understanding, but no matter how else you put it, the material is hard unless you're naturally good at Calculus. Get ready to study a lot on your own if you want to do well, but he does allow corrections on quizzes and tests for up to a 50% gain on your score. So, don't fret too much.

the people's professor. MY goat. bro actually loves what he's teaching! his passion for the subject and willing to help students made him my favorite prof in a grueling semester. as an adhd-er i can tell he prob has it bc of how fast he talks, he sometimes writes bad + is slow on emails. but otherwise 10/10. just PLEASE show up to lecture i beg you

Professor Taam was very good at getting what we needed to know across and responded to every question without fail. He did ramble sometimes during class which is pretty funny but did take up time. The test for the class aren't too hard and the previous test are easy to find to practice.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class--Online Savvy

comment: he's really chill and the workload isn't too much, but his lectures were a little hard to follow. I really don't know what it was, I understood the words he was saying, but I didn't understand the topics he was going over. apparently it's a 50-50 split, you either get his lectures or you don't. I didn't, so I was just self-studying for this class.
Great lectures, amazing handwriting for a math professor, and the homework and labs were super useful. There's nothing to complain about.

Great at teaching the concepts for multivariable and vectors specifically, doesn't go through computation well tho. always open to make meetings and loves answering questions either about tests or material. good respectful personality as well.
thats why hes the GOAT!!!!

Taam is a solid to great lecturer but has limited power outside of that, given several professors run 125/126. He's nice with a hint of leeway but expect to study. It's true that 125/126 is more rigorous in the fall, not impossible, but definitely more stressful if you lack mathematical rigor. Resources from past sems can help a ton throughout.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Taam is great for 125 & 126! The course material can be challenging but his lectures are engaging and he cares about his students. The assignments in the course are the same for all professors so take Taam if you want to understand and enjoy your lectures.

Everything is good and is an amazing professor however, his hand-writing is terrible. Like I have never seen a professor with handwriting this terrible which makes the lecture very hard than they already are.

Taam is the way to go for 125-126. Sometimes he gets a bit ramble-ish in his lectures and you need to filter out what's useful, but he's overall easy to understand and covers all the needed material. Sometimes it'll feel frustrating because workshops are often really hard, but his lessons will adequately prepare you for exams. Don't skip lecture.

He went pretty fast in lecture so it was hard to keep up. If you study and ask your TA for help you will be fine. Apparently the class is harder in the fall than it is in the spring and they decide how hard to make 126 based of the grades people got in 125.

Thorough and easy-to-follow lectures, although slightly fast-paced. Taam covers the theory extensively as well as practice problems, but attend recitations to get more practice. Take Taam for 125-126 if you have the chance to.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: I always heard people say Alessandrini was the best MA 125 teacher but I had Taam and he explained everything perfectly for me. I'd definitely recommend him to someone passionate about math. I do think he goes fast in his lectures and over-explains the theory behind everything, but it was always interesting to me.

Taam understands the topics very well and cares about his students but spends much of the lecture doing a proof for math and then cramming the procedure in at the end of class. Very good if you attend office hours but not very effective lecture times.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Test heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Took him online for MA 121 during winter intersection. Class was two weeks long and the hours were insane, but he still managed to teach a good amount despite the horrible schedule. His lectures were pretty good and informative. Just study and go to recitations.

Freshman fall, I was assigned to Monika's and didnt understand anything so I just started coming to Taam's lectures and it was a breath of fresh air. Incredible drawerer of multivariable graphs, and an incredible topic coverer. Highly Recommended over other choices. (he also writes the tests)

Taam is fine. Unremarkable. Perfectly average. That's okay because he still teaches well. His biggest issue is that he goes pretty fast. I'll be writing stuff down and sometimes struggling to keep up with what he's writing. Easy to understand. Nikolaev is better but Taam is good too. No other complaints besides going kinda fast.

He is a nice professor, but he moves so fast in lectures it is hard to keep up. He explains stuff as if his students already understand the topics he is teaching, but even if you do the preclass work, it is hard to keep up. He is very kind and understanding, but I found myself using Youtube to learn everything.
Very stubborn and does not round up, even if you are .05% from the cutoff. Other math professors will bump you up.
He's pretty decent, does a good job at explaining the material.

For 125, vectors were easy, but matrices were harder to understand cuz I had no prior experience.  126 was easy overall, his lectures made it easier.  Only class in which everyone came to the lecture (which is pretty impressive).  Only bad part is his handwriting is terrible and is hard to read from the other side of the room.

I took Professor Taam for MA-125 and MA-126 and he was really great at teaching both. The biggest issue I have with him is that he will occasionally go on long "speeches" during lecture which may be a little hard to keep up with but besides those instances his lectures are great. Textbook is free for both classes and the recitations are helpful.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Caring

comment: Every class, Professor Taam would walk in and start lecturing, and wouldn't stop until after class was over. He explained things in a way that helped me understand, but deciphering his handwriting was a whole other challenge. Do not skip lecture, and if you put in the work you should be fine.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Really great lectures and does give great feedback on quizzes. Tests arent that bad but study the practice multiple choice he puts out because sometimes the exact questions are on them.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures--Skip class? You won't pass.--Accessible outside class

comment: Must attend lectures to complete the clicker questions. Homework is challenging but manageable. Sometimes the lectures go a few minutes overtime, but they're usually worth staying for. Instead of a textbook, he posts his own lecture notes.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Challenging class but his flexible office hours make it tolerable. The workload is manageable. The textbook is free and online. No textbook work is assigned but reading it before the lecture is very helpful.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Prof. Taam is very dedicated and super nice. Easy to arrange student hours. The material is going to be easy or hard depending on past experience and how much you pay attention in lecture. The recitations are useful, although a LOT of group work.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: Great professor, examples in class can be kind of confusing at times, but overall a very friendly and helpful professor.
It was always a fun time trying to figure out what he wrote on the board
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: His handwriting is godlike
Make sure you really listen attentively during his class for some great Machine Learning tips. The way he uses Excel to explain ML algorithms makes them really easy to understand. Good Experience!

Please do not take his class ever again, he is not a good professor and he does not grade you based on your performance , he grades on partiality basis, favours only a few students, very arrogant ,very manipulative , does not deserve to be a professor at all, worst possible man who could teach this subject
rating_tags: Hilarious--So many papers--Graded by few things

comment: Good Professor
Very good professor

The final grade is only depend on your final project. Don't need to worry the hw and exam, both are easy to finished. The hw and exam i believe is grade by TA. just pay attention for you final project.
Pathetic professor! Does not give fair grades and no uniformity. Poor teaching and high expectations. Wont recommend him to anyone.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Unfair grader and okay lecture

Most overrated professor. Most of the people like him just because he use to gives easy homeworks and exams. But trust me he just teach very basic stuff which can be just taught in 2 lectures. He would never be on time! never. And CS593 is completely useless as most of the courses. Never gives hw on time and then will give all hw during your break
That's it.

You grades depend only on your final presentation. Even If you score 100 in all assignments, midterm and finals, if you or your team mate is not able to answer his question, you might get a B+/ B straight. All your semesters hardworking will be useless.

Very nice professor. He explains the topic very clearly and we can ask questions without any hesitation. The most important thing to care is the group project. Your grade solely depends on how you performed your group project. So be careful while choosing your teammates and project topic. Exams and assignments are easy can be finished in short

Course is smwat overrated! Covers only classifications and some clustering. You will know about all these algos & techniques but not which to use when. The professor is inaccessible largely via mail and has no office hrs. TAs are mostly an unhelpful bunch. Grades are posted extremely late with little to no feedback. Everything rides on the project.

He is very respectful, nice, helpful, and explain everything very clear. but you can't reach him. he doesn't reply on any email not even canvas and he has no office at Stevens. the assignment will be graded in the final period (very late). everything depends on the final project(if you did poorly on that, you wont survive)
Lot of importance is given to the final group project. Doesn't mind students collaborating on assignments
Nice Professor........!
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Really bad professor. Don't know why the comments are so good out here. Signed up for CS593 - Adv. algos in data mining for big data. And the professor didn't even teach that.  Only linear, logistic, and multivariate and PCA analysis is taught in SAS which is not at all helpful. CS513 was much better than CS593. Please don't take this course.

He is very passionate about his work and gives you great knowledge that is very useful. Has a good sense of humor too. Always tries to engage the class and encourages to ask questions. You will learn a lot in this course. The grading is fair and the project is interesting as well. You will leave the course with practical knowledge.

He is a very enthusiastic professor and very engaging with the class. Always willing to answer questions and helps you through out the whole course. Follow his lectures and take notes and you will do good in his course. The grading is fair and reasonable. He is very passionate about his field and teaches practical knowledge that is useful.
Great class!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--Amazing lectures

comment: Awesome teacher! You cannot go wrong with taking his classes. He is a very good lecturer and he tries to make sure the class understands the material.

The finest professor for Data Science & Analytics subject. Not only teaches but gives a real life application of every concept used in market. He makes you work hard by giving wonderful application oriented assignments. Highly knowledgeable, down to earth and humorous in nature , you wont feel like missing his class.  #Respect#Knowledge# Hilarious

He is one of the best teachers I have studied under and his lectures are so engaging and interactive that you will get to learn whatever he is teaching and you will love it. Homeworks would be there but they are for our best.
Teaches you all that you need in the workplace.
He is a great teacher who is very passionate about course. Willing to help if you ask for it. knowledgeable and have many idea about professional work
Great professor for Data  Mining

Great professor. He genuinely cares about your education and wants you to learn, understand and know that material. I highly recommend. He also puts a focus on practical knowledge, not just theoritical which is super interesting.

Great professor, and one of the highest-quality courses I've taken. The class was hard and assignment-heavy, but always helped in preparation for material down the line. He has a good balance of brutalism and optimism while teaching, but I do wish he would consider students who are trying hard in his course but don't think as a robot. "Happiness?"
In lectures, he reads straight from a txt file, which is better than it sounds, but not great. Tests are hard but not too hard if you prepare. 'Happiness?'

His lectures are hard to engage with, he just reads off of his .txt file notes. He also has been very rude to myself and other students in many circumstances. Sassiest man alive. He tries to honor board everyone without probable cause.

Great professor overall. Just be careful submitting programming assignments since half of your grade is "Programming Assignments." Also, be warn he does give quite a few exams throughout the semester (in my case 4 -> 3x50min midterms and 1x3hr final exam)

He is a great professor for this course! His lectures never left me confused, and all you had to do was pay attention to learn the algorithm. The work was graded promptly, and while he could be harsh for some of the written homework or quizzes, he never makes them impossible. If there was one tip for his class, it would be pay attention. That's it.

Meunier gives great lectures that are engaging and fun despite being about perhaps some of the most tedious topics in computer science. The homework assignments are incredibly difficult but the TAs are super helpful and there is ample time to get everything done. The tests were tough but not unmanageable, all the information was in the slides.

Homeworks are long and progressively get harder, but I absolutely love him. This is one of those classes that reveal things you didn't know you didn't know. Really pumped I took the class and prof made it that much better. He is unbelievably knowledgeable and super accessible in and out of class. Easy recommendation.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Hes good, he is friendly and reachable outside class. Basically if he have no class, you can meet him in his office hour anytime. But BEWARE, the class is hard and he is a harsh grader. Some time he don't curve and you might f up you grade.

As boring as some lectures may be, he more than makes up for it for being THE most accessible professor I have ever had. Both 385 and 492 I would struggle on programming assignments or just have questions and he was always there to have office hours, and is quick in email response time. Very knowledgeable, very fair, no surprises in either class.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: shocked to see he has so many 5 star ratings, they're probably all from dudes. incredibly disrespectful towards his female students. he makes me feel really unsafe on campus.
No surprises, everything is clear. very good
Good

385 and 492. He is awesome. I love him. Extremely smart, hilarious, and helpful outside of class. Engages the class regularly. Makes the content super interesting and is clearly very passionate about the subject. I look forward to the class every day. Super strict with deadlines though. Try it during deener.

Amazing professor. He taught the class in a very clear and concise manner. Even if you do not enjoy his lectures, he has a bunch of recordings of the previous professor's lectures which are great additions to Philippe's lectures. This course has a lot of assignments, and can be pretty overwhelming when taken in conjunction with CS 382.
Great professor just show up to class and pay attention. Programming assignments take a long time but there is tons of help available. Tests are easy if you study the correct material.

Philippe is super funny and definitely super knowledgeable. His material is pretty hard but that isn't his fault. HWs and Labs weren't too hard, but the programming assignments are challenging. Tests are also hard but you can definitely use your 1 page notes sheet to get a bunch of points just by writing the right stuff down.
Very good professor; Open office hours policy, good sense of humor, easy to understand complicated things, and course was not overbearing.

Philippe is one of best professor ever! He has a really good dry, but fun humor which definitely makes classes more exciting and interesting. The course is very interesting, and adequate resources are provided to help you understand the material. He is a tough grader and does not budge much, but everything is laid out fair to you in advance.

Pretty rude and not accepting of a lot of circumstances. He will ask for PROOF anytime you need some sort of extension (even if it's a very valid excuse for an extension). His lectures are insightful, but not very engaging. The homework is fine if you pay attention, but if not it'll take you some time.

One of the best CS professors I've ever had. He's funny and knowledgeable about the topic of algorithms. His lectures are always used up to their full potential and the homework is always doable. As long as you don't skip class, you won't fail.

Very theory heavy class, but I thought the content was always well explained and interesting. Meunier pretty much is always available and has office hours anytime he isn't teaching. Only work outside class is 3 hw assignments and a final project. Midterm and final aren't to difficult as long as you pay attention in class.
Hands down, one of if not THE MOST amazing Professors here at Stevens
Excellent lectures and very knowledge. Answered every single question asked in class in detail.

Professor Meunier was an absolutely wonderful professor to work with. The pacing of his class is great and his lectures were simple and easy to understand. Some programming assignments were difficult, but they were all graded fairly and everything from labs to reviews were very well organized. He also gave a us a ton of resources to study from.

Inspirational, friendly, and easygoing, his lectures are worth listening to, and he leaves plenty of notes online to study at your own time. His tests and quizzes are something to be wary, however, as regardless of how much you study, there's always something there out of left field.
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Professor Meunier is great at making difficult concepts seem simple. Even though some of the algorithms he teaches can seem abstract and confusing, I've never had a problem understanding them in his lectures. He clearly cares about his students and goes out of his way to make sure they clearly understand the material.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Great professor! If I had the chance to grace his presence once more I would not hesitate. He is an angel sent from heaven. From his clear and in depth explanations to his beautifully explained lecture notes he doesn't skip a beat. Mans is perfect. He explains everything you need to know and even lets you make a cheat sheet for the tests. 10/10.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Really amazing professor -- he's done really well for a last minute replacement. He has an open door policy, and is always willing to help. His humor is very dry, and he doesn't really smile, but he cares a lot about his students. Highly recommend! There is a lot of homework, but it will prepare you well.
Diana is a very knowledgable professor. I loved writing essays about the history of art, she often gave us extensive freedom to choose our topics so I could write about what I like. Very intelligent.

Best professor but class is not easy. Professor Bush cares about the students and she will work with you. 
The trip was fun.
Absolutely terrible.

The readings are insanely long. For the midterm, you must memorize 100+ art pieces and identify 10 of them, including name, date, creator, what it's made of, and how it is historically significant. Terrible way of testing. You are also REQUIRED to go to the MET twice for two 5-page essays. Choose a different humanities course and if you need one.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Test heavy

comment:
This class has a ridiculous amount of reading.... for one week we had to read over 100 pages. Instructions for essays and tests are very unclear. 
You are expected to memorize over 150 pieces of art (Name, Year created, and location ) and you will MAYBE be tested on 12. She moves too fast in the lectures so you cant even take notes.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Bush is one of the best professors at Stevens for humanities. The material is hard, but Bush teaches it in a way that is easy to understand. Even if you know little about art, her humanities electives are easy, HAR 384 is great! She grades easy on papers and gives GREAT feedback, but Quizzes are a little tough. She is CARRYING the VA&T program.
She's probably fine for CAL but don't take her art history class
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Be prepared to memorize 150+ art pieces
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy
