comment: Great professor but NOT an easy class. If you have taken HAR180, HAR 280 was easier and she seemed to enjoy it more. She obviously cares for her students but if you don't make the effort to participate it will reflect on your grade. Great course if you are interested in modern art history. Would not recommend if you're looking for something easy.

Incredibly bright professor. Knows her art and is socially aware. If you read and then participate in class, you'll be golden. Grading wise, she's biased. Picks favorites and outright tells some students their opinions are wrong on days she's upset. Some attended every class, talked a lot, did subject pool, and 95+% on essays: they range B- to A-.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Let me preface this by saying I disliked her class while I took it. However, as I look back, I'm glad I took it. The readings are mainly from critical theorists (Adorno, McLuhan, Manovich, etc). The topics of discussion related to the events unfolding before us. I appreciate being able to challenge my beliefs and understand why I agree/disagree.

Professor Bush genuinely cares about her students, and tries to accommodate for busy schedules by pushing back due dates, or being available outside of the classroom. You definitely will not do well in her CAL 105 class if you do not read what was assigned. She is a lenient essay grader, but may sometimes go off on tangents during lectures.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: To smart to be a college professor and gets off topic a lot! A relatively easy grader when it comes to essays but to get a good grade participation is a must in this course!
rating_tags: Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Where to start. Talks fast and fires so much info at you (half of which is inaccurate or her opinion) that it is impossible to retain much of anything. Grading criteria is anything but clear, and favors suck-ups. Asks for responses from students but cuts them off and doesn't actually listen. Knowledgeable but terrible teacher. Drop this one Stevens
Her class is hard
One of my favourite classes in Stevens

She motivates her students to get out of their comfort zone and learn about more fields besides engineering which is very important considering how limited people are at Stevens. Also she was willing to talk about pretty much anything and it was a pleasure to be in her class. You will have to do the readings though
She's really boring if you don't like philosophy or art. You'll really like her if you do like philosophy and art. Shes not terrible, but there are much better options.
Definitely has a lot of knowledge, easy to get lost if you're not an art person. Interesting perspective and very interesting woman. I would definitely take another class with her.

Dreadful woman to deal with.  Had no idea what she was saying half the time, and constantly changed what she wanted in her papers.  Terribly inconsistent, and just rude to deal with.  Fire this one Stevens.

This professor has a lot of knowledge, but references paintings, texts, sculptures that I have never heard of nor seen that seem completely unrelated to the text we ARE supposed to be reading and therefore confusing. Her midterm was based off of memorization of the ten texts/facts about them. Given the choice I would not have taken her class.

A lot of knowledge coming out of this woman.  Also blurts out a lot of false statements and propaganda that Stevens students don't catch because they don't know much about history.  LOTS OF READING ASSIGNED - much of it unnecessary.  Just skim and know the background of each selection, if you know about history you will do well.

Very easy to talk to and will give extra credit if needed.  Midterm and final is hard as hell and each week has an in class quiz which my grades ranged from a 17 to a 100.  If you like to read, which I dont, then take it.
No Comments

Professor gives lots of readings. too much readings. Exams ans tests ask for very specific details. prepare to have to read from a lot of different sources.  don't take her class if you aren't a history person.

Professor Shupenko is a very great and caring person. He made sure you understood the task and really made you think outside of the box. However, sometimes it did feel like he was a little out of the loop. Overall, amazing professor though and very accessible.
Professor Shupenko is a goated professor; he's a fair grader and is willing to help with any questions about material or assignments.
The goat; super chill, always clear with his grading criteria, and gives great feedback.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Hes the goat
Maybe it was just for me, but he genuinely doesn't have a good grasp over the software he is teaching and seems very unprofessional when reviewing assignments.
Professor Shupenko was a great professor and truly cared about the success of his students
I had Shupenko for ENGR 122 and he was extremely understanding about issues that came up throughout the semester. He's knowledgeable and very straightforward. Would recommend!

I had Shupenko for both ENGR 111 and 122 and he is an excellent professor. Very much cut to the chase and get things done. He's also very helpful and approachable. I'd say he's pretty lenient so as long as you submit your assignments on time you'll get an A!

This class is based on a semester long group project with lecture in between lab periods. I enjoyed taking this class because he was a great professor and very helpful when we needed help with the code or circuits we were making.
He is so nice and always helps you if you have a problem, also doesnt care if you are late.  I had him at 8 am for 111 and 121 and every single person was always at least 10 min late

Professor Shupenko was amazing and made a class I thought would be hard a lot easier than I had expected. He is also extremely understanding when it comes to group participation and was a fair grader. He was also helpful if you had any questions with the work. Would 100% recommend and take again.
Professor Shupenko was amazing. Even though Design I was challenging at times, he is very understanding and also has a great sense of humor. Would 100% recommend.
Great professor. He was really helpful to my group since we had 1 less person than everyone else, and was very understanding with deadlines and guidelines. Highly recommend.
Amazing teacher, always willing to give feedback and help any way he can. Highly recommend.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Mainly project based class, so he explains his thoughts and helps us effectively.  You can see he cares about what he does.

Professor Shupenko was such a pleasure to have coming back to in person classes. He's passionate, knowledgeable and very approachable about the course material. He granted my group an extension on our final written report since other classes piled up assignments, and provided excellent feedback. Not an easy grader, but you gain a lot from his help!
Was fun going but still strict as a professor. He should have a better setup in terms of grading for the robot competition.

Great instruction. Not easy or harsh in terms of grading I would say just about the middle. He knows which members put in work than other members in a group. Its weird that I did better than a previous design course I taken him with. Not a bad choice. DONT go in thinking he'll be an easy A. I think your guarenteed a B if you have him.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: The entire purpose of Design 3 is to further Mechanics of Solids and inspire teamwork. Dr. Shupenko does both. I intentionally chose his section of the course, having had him in D2. He is always willing to lend a hand, ear, or tip to those in need. His humor is corny and dad-ish. You don't pass if you don't show up and/or have a functional group.

This entire class is basically based off group projects, so having a poor group will definitely make it difficult. In my case, I had to work my butt off to get good grades with him in order to make up for my group members. He was always extremely helpful with questions I had, especially since he could tell I was doing the bulk of the project.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: I have a great deal of respect for Shupenko. He cares deeply for this course and the students in it. Not only that, he is receptive to hearing the gripes about group strife from various members. His listening saved my sanity this semester.  You want Shupenko for this class. No doubt about it.
He clearly cares about his students and is passionate about what he does! Loved his Design II class.
He's great and very helpful
Great Professor, I had him for both design I and II and I am really hoping I get him next semester as well. Lectures are interesting and to the point. Very passionate and knowledgeable!

Very interesting class. Is very clear and to the point unlike some other prof at Stevens. Hopefully you have a good group in the projects (I did) because if you have lazy teamates it will be hard to get a good grade or even get the projects done properly
Fair, not the best
Had him for Design I and II. Lectures are to the point and succinct so the class gets more time on their projects. Good professor!

Good lectures and a funny professor. Recitations felt more helpful. Goes over very relevant information taht makes you extremely prepared for the 3 quizzes, however the final is challenging and you should be prepared. I would take him again for PEP 111, I learned a lot and did well even though I'm not great at Physics.

Attendance to recitation was graded but not lectures. I still went to his lectures because he's a huge troll and is so funny with how he incorporates topics to be funny such as describing projectile motion with airdropping "stuff"  out of a plane to avoid the "Dough Enforcement Agency". Huge Breaking bad fan too. Chill, funny, and easy class.

Honestly a really easy class, easier than AP Physics in high school. Lectures are alright, but recitations were very helpful. I didn't really do much in lectures, but did all the problems in recitations and I was fine. They tend to give you some of the exam questions in reviews. Not a very time consuming class. The professor is also really funny.
Exams are exactly like the review lectures.

Always engaging to listen to, and a very approachable first physics class, aside from raw dimensional analysis. Uses funny word problems, which is pretty necessary for any physics prof, in my opinion.

Amazing teacher, he always goes over what is relevant on the tests and as long as you pay attention in lecture and recitation it should be an easy class. Also extremely hilarious and his lectures are fun to attend.

Favorite prof. right now. Lectures are really well done, interactive, and builds a great base. Lectures are combo of lecture for concepts, then doing a lot of examples. Pay attention to all examples because tests are just a combination of a few of them. Really good guy and helps a lot when you ask. Examples don't go from easy to impossible. Amazing
Goes over material relevant to quizzes and hw. Is extremely funny and makes problems interesting and doable.
Easy class, he goes over questions like the exam right before the exam so we know what to expect.  Said a lot of funny things during class, and he teaches more than what is on the test as well.
You do not have to attend class because all slides are posted.

Entertaining professor, most of what is going onto be on the test are often reviewed during the lectures (If not, the same exact questions are being taught before the exam). Chatterjee sets you up for success and bases his grades off of how people do in the class so the class is also heavily curved. Should not be a class to really worry about.
Professor Chatterjee was amazing. I had never taken a physics class before, and I understood everything he was teaching. His lectures are interesting, and he gives a lot of example problems.

Chatterjee is the best. I always looked forward to going to his class. He made Physics, a normally mundane and boring class interesting and I found myself wanting to go each time. Always joked around with the class and kept things light while focusing on the material. Review sessions for exams were always informative. Do the homework!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Chatterjee is a great guy. He explains stuff clearly but overall Mechanics is a straightforward class with not so much studying. Just do the homeworks and you will pass easily.

You can tell Chatterjee knows what he is talking about. But unless you love mechanics, it's not very interesting. He is not a great explainer; I've found self-teaching and studying with peers is a much better way to learn.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: He is good at his teaching and throwing in a joke, but he is not very accessible outside of class. My conversation with the professor through email felt unpleasant. PEP111 is a class with a lot of freshman student so you will be relying on your TA more. Your TA is the one who assigns homework and grade your test. Hope you get a good TA

The actual professor was very nice and funny, however the TA was definitely a tough grader and he graded all the assignments. Sometimes hell let you redo them if you totally bomb it though. Overall the material is pretty hard and youre going to have to put in a lot of work to do good. Probably not the professors fault though

Professor Chatterjee is a good professor. He really helped me understand the basic principles of mechanics. Pay attention in class. As much as his exams are easy, you'll be very lost if you choose to ignore his lectures.
rating_tags: Respected--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: I've started calling him professor CHADerjee because he's the goat. Absolutely love this class. Just watch the lectures, attend recitations, do all the practice problems, and you'll do fine.

His lectures mainly consist of example problems with a little bit of teaching at the start. Cool guy but you need to know what you're doing before you get to his class or you won't do well. Good news is the exams were plug and chug, I just memorized the formulas and wrote them down on the test and I aced them. Final is hard though beware
Chatterjee is a really fun Prof. and clearly loves what he does.

He went out of his way to teach us concepts that we thought would be interesting as a class. He designed his own exams rather than pulling questions from online and made the problems creative to make the material more interesting, including Harry Potter references. He offered a challenge if you wanted it, but gave you the knowledge that you needed.

He talks about the dumbest things during lecture but he isn't strict at all. My recommendation would be skip his class and learn from the textbook or hit up you TA for help. Seriously thank god he was chill because I never learned anything from him.
He overteaches, but not in a bad way. He makes his lectures so that he gives you more information than necessary so you can retain the important information. His quizzes were very easy.
Fun Guy

Professor Richard Anderson is a great guy and very passionate and informative about the subjects he teaches. Although I wish he had more in the grade book other than extra credit and the 3 tests he gives out. Overall lecture is heavy and sometimes the tests aren't a fair representation of what we learned. But fun class and a good professor.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I liked Professor Anderson's lectures, but I definitely think there were questions on some of the tests that weren't in our notes and weren't discussed enough in class. I wish there was additional assignments given out to make the weight of the 3 tests less. Your grade will be split between the 3 tests plus any extra credit, so you have to do well.

The class is very heavy on lectures and note-taking as the professor does not post notes/slides, and just writes everything on the board. If you take notes and study a decent amount, you'll get an A. The whole class is graded on 3 multiple-choice tests, but they are difficult if you don't study a good amount. Attendance counts as extra credit
Discredits textbook when it could've been helpful. Bad grader. Unhelpful at office hours.

Professor Anderson is wonderful. He is great at teaching and conveys the material super well. He gives you everything you need to do well on the tests. As long as you study, you will have no trouble getting an A. He only grades by the test and attendance though, so if you do bad on one, it will affect your grade. Some extra credit is given.
awesome sauce. his tests are not though. very funny, good idea to participate in class. his lectures are super interesting so its easy to pay attention and raise your hand.

His class was a lot of fun, he is so funny. Had online tests which made things INCREDIBLY easy. Group project throughout year was straight forward- when you choose groups on the first day, choose wisely... Prof gives great feedback and is very understanding, sad I dont have him for microecon rn.

Professor Anderson is great. He raises your grade up by a lot and makes everything clear at the start of the semester. If you have him, attend class and participate. Showing up to class and taking notes will help a lot for exams. Exams aren't too hard but if you don't prepare, you won't get the grade you want.
Great professor who truly cares for his students
Really good professor. He is by far the best economics professor.
Great class and professor, grades only by 3 tests (no final or midterm) which are all relatively easy. No HW but extra credit is available.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures

comment: yeah hes good
hes lovely

Anderson is one of the best professors I've ever had. His lectures are engaging and easy to understand -- he uses a lot of helpful real-life examples. The final grade is based on just 3 multiple-choice exams. No homework, no attendance, no projects. Just show up and you will learn a lot while getting a good grade. I highly recommend.
Awesome teacher, makes a boring class interesting and interactive.
Awesome professor. Awesome lectures.
Knows how to teach to college students better than any other teacher

Took micro with him this year. He's a great professor who makes a somewhat boring class very interesting. only had 3 tests and if you go to class there's no excuse not to get an A. Not only is he easy, but he makes the class worthwhile. I'll definitely be taking as many classes as possible with him.
Great Professor. Really knows his stuff. As long as you go to class and pay attention, you'll get an A
Awesome guy and great professor. Very easy to talk to and is more than willing to help. Also relates stuff to the real world which helps understanding a lot.
Best professor at Stevens

BEST PROFESSOR. Curves everything and gives a half a grade curve at the end of the semester. The class was fun and useful. Only thing is that he has no office hours. As long as you pay attention in class, you should be able to get an easy A.

An excellent instructor who is passionate about the subject and makes learning enjoyable. Always approachable and patient when addressing questions or doubts. I would gladly enroll in their class again in the future.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Provides clear and concise explanations for proofs and formulas, making complex concepts easier to grasp. He uses the allotted time efficiently to cover a wide range of material. His style keeps concepts accessible, and his MATLAB approach encourages critical thinking and independent skill development, fostering a deeper understanding.

Pedro truly stands out. MA576 is very challenging, but his dedication to teaching and helping students made a difference. If it weren't for him, I probably wouldn't have made it through. He's approachable, friendly, and always willing to support his students. An amazing professor who truly cares!

One of the worst professors I've come across in my entire life. Doesn't know what he is teaching and not to mention the course was extremely hard. He doesn't respond to any mail nor is willing to help out. He takes the 3 credit course spread across 2 days a week( he travels a lot and is extremely busy). So, he teaches carelessly and gets out.
Poor students do poorly. Strong students take great advantage of his courses. As easy as that.
If you can, avoid this professor at all costs. Does not communicate any sort of coherent topic at any point.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: A knowledgeable guy that cannot teach. He basically reads off of his slides all lecture and never gives example problems. Believes his lectures are more 'enrichment' since he wants you to read from the textbook first. Your grade depends entirely on 2 tests and lectures give nothing substantial. Avoid if possible, and a tutor is a must have.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Cannot communicate topics well in class and is very hard to follow. Homeworks do not line up with tests well. You are going to have to teach yourself.

He's a knowledgeable guy, but can't communicate the topics effectively. If you don't understand his initial explanation he's unable to reword his explanations and regularly does not understand students' questions. His lectures are not fluid and hard to follow. He regularly gets lost in his own train of thought and feels rushed.

Pedro teaches a high-quality course as if he were teaching at MIT or Princeton. You need to have a minimal level of maturity and aptitude for doing math. As the previous rants show, an average student here will struggle with it. Before registering, think first if you qualify to succeed in this course.
worst professor ever. The professor made no sense at all. He is a nice person but can not teach. Stevens needs to get their act together.

Overall okay professor, pretty fair grader and the class isn't too difficult. However the exams were graded strictly and the lectures were hard to follow. I ended up not going to lectures and self studying this course instead. One positive thing I will say is that he gives a very nice extra credit assignment that is actually pretty fun.
Nice guy but tests sucked hard. Two were worth 35% and the final was worth 40%. Extra credit was worth an extra 8% which was nice at least. HW was usually simple and straight from the textbook.
Great professor. Plenty of partial credit. Extra credit projects to catch up. Reasonable midterm and final. Thanks professor for this rewarding semester!
Guerra was super confusing, and ruthless in his grading -- no partial credit on the final and the average was a 68 (no curve!). Avoid if possible...

Pedro is a very kind person. He helped me all along the whole course, even though I was not sufficiently prepared for it. Not only that, but I had the bad idea to "ask for help" on the midterm. He realized this unfortunate mistake but he was very easy on me. Only con is that tests are not easy but he offers plenty of extra credit to catch up.

Prof. Guerra provided detailed feedback for every homework and also complete solutions. Every code he provided was explained and programmed live in class, so there are several recordings showing the code works. He is very considerate and gave us every possible opportunity to improve our grade. I really do not understand the previous reviews.

His lectures are well organized and understandable. He uses Mathematica, Desmos and Octave to illustrate every topic presented in the course. Tests are not easy but perfectly doable. I will probably get an A but you need to work for it. What is really required in this course is a minimal aptitude for math.

Reaching out to him often leads to more confusion. The homework is busy work that takes 10+ pages while the exams are far more difficult. He doesn't indicate why or how many points he's taking off on the exams. His MATLAB code never works and he doesn't provide solutions to HW which makes studying difficult. Avoid this class if you can.

Professor Guerra's lectures are long, convoluted, and difficult to follow. Most of this class is self-teaching from the textbook because the professor is unhelpful. The weekly homework assignments take well over 10 pages of work to complete. The difficulty of the tests is significantly harder than the homework or anything that is done in class.

His lectures are very dense and agonizing; he essentially reads from the textbook verbatim. He often gets lost when trying to work through examples. The weekly homeworks he assigns average 14 pages, and the difficulty from homework to the test do not scale. His Matlab code is absolutely wretched and difficult to work with. Take if you have P/F opt.

Gives little or none explanation for any of the proofs & formulas and basically tries to go over everything he possibly can in the alotted time. Very hard to focus on what he's even talking about half the time because he gives BASIC explanations and mumbles, never does examples and gets lost in his own thought process and codes horribly in matlab.

He is one of the worst and meanest professors I've ever had. He does not know how to teach the material and makes fun of students who ask questions or get stuff wrong. Is very inconsiderate of his students.
Rude

If you are not one of her favorites, you will fail. I took her twice; once where I was with good standings and the other where I was getting ready to transfer out. The difference in her teaching! If you are stuck with her, you have to flatter her in order to come out with a decent grade. A good professor if she's a in good mood.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Blatant favoritism, rubric is set up so that about 40% of the grade is decided by whether or not she likes you. The worse your essay is, the better grade you will get. She marks your paper with her unintelligible scribbles that offer absolutely nothing and uses chat GPT to provide feedback on your paper. Genuinely a mean person, 0/10
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: One of the worst professors I've ever had in my life. She loves to act all nice and friendly, but spouts the most horrible things with no regard for your feelings. She loves to tear you down and will grade based on how much flattery you give her. Take this class if you want depression. Puzzling how such a terrible human became a professor.

Majority of grade is composed of multiple choice exams with obscure questions from one of the many many readings. Rude in class when students don't share her love for French Medievalism. If your looking for an easy grade in a humanity look somewhere else as she expects this to be your most important class. Plays favorites and grades harshly.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Do yourself a favor and do NOT take a class with Professor Sinnreich-Levi. The work she assigns often has nothing to do with the actual subject material of the course, and she grades quite harshly. And this isn't even mentioning how rude she tends to be in terms of politics and other sensitive subjects during lectures.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: The short version is she seems to think this is the only class we take and we care way more about it then we do.  She gives piles of reading before each class and her main writing assignments have literally nothing to do with the class itself.  And when you bring up something to do with class like modern king arthur representations? not allowed.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: I have to say that in all of my 4 years at this school, this professor is one of the WORST. She's extremely rude, gave an unmanageable amount of reading for homework (70-150 pages), brings politics into the classroom, has completely unfair exams, and weekly curations are graded the morning of class with unreadable chicken scratch handwriting. AVOID
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Do the readings!!! Shes very kind, and I know she cares about me as a person. Got a really great class, and it made talking about the texts so much better. You will have to do timed essays, but other than that, as long as you know the material, youll be fine.

An alright class - not hard to get an A if you do the reading and extra credit. She seems like she knows what she's talking about, but often it feels like lectures are a series of "gotcha" moments. We didn't really talk about themes as much as I'd have liked, there was more of a focus on just going through what happened in the reading.

Felt like I was back in high school regurgitating useless information that she forced us to read. The more basic the essay the better you'll do. HARSH essay grader but easy tests. Not an easy person to talk to - you have to be super specific about any question you have and she can't give clear answers. Participation matters and has favorites.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: Not a great class. Acts like a know it all and focuses on the little details on the reading rather than the big picture themes. Do not take if you do not like to read! If you have to take either metaphysics or images of science and literature a class don't take this one.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: In all honesty she keep her class interesting and I would have given her a 5 except I had to argue multiple times to get my grade changed and her rubric doesn't really make much sense and if you ask her about your grade she will not give you a straight answer about anything. My advice is to talk to her in person her emails make no sense.

Not the most interesting class but if you do the readings and pay attention in class the tests are not that bad and she is pretty easy when it comes to grading. You'll probably get a B if you show up to class at listen and show up to class and A if you read. Do NOT take this class if you don't like to read - we read 5 (300-600 page) books
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Definitely the worst professor I had this semester. She thinks she knows everything, but she's been wrong multiple times in class while acting 100% confident about every word she says. She also likes to tell you that she knows all the translators of the stuff you read personally, which gets annoying fast. The tests are rough
She shares fantastic stories every class, really interesting! Also a tough grader, you should work REALLY REALLY REALLY hard to get a acceptable grade from her course.

The ever worst couse I have taken. She is demanding and pedantic, rambling in every class. If you just want to learn some funny stories and  limited grammars without considering your GPA, just choose her! Also remember, the school's WCC cannot help you out, 'cause she will find out every single mistake in your essay and give you a disgusting grade!
learned a lot of material in this class, i wish she taught more classes because they never fit into my schedule, can't wait to take another class with her
An excellent professor with an excellent lecture style. Grades papers very harshly, but allows for rewrites. Easily the best professor I have had so far.
Great teacher.  Do the readings and study from her slides that she goes over in class and you'll be fine for her exams.  What a pleasant teacher.
She was awesome, so helpful!  I learned so much!
No Comments
If you get a chance, take a course with Dr. S.  It will be worth every minute both in and out of class.  She is great!
Terrible professor. Barely shows up and is rude to students.
Class changed this year and all sections were sloppy. He made it less painful
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Avoid at all costs. He is an adjunct and cares little about students. Cancelled class constantly because of work. Grading is terrible. If he doesn't like you he will give bad grades. Actually said to the class that if you complain about a grade he will hold it against you. Rude, arrogant, and one of the worst professors at Stevens.
He move up assignments in start of class but we had last 2 weeks off which was worth it.  I did see him help out one of my friends but he is not easily approachable.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: One of the least helpful design professors.  Doesn't provide clear or meaningful feedback when grading assignments or even when you ask him a question.  His grading is terrible; he gave my group a 60% on the ROUGH DRAFT of the report of a project that wasn't even half-way complete yet.

Has been hard on some individuals in my section.  I had one of those kids as lab partner before and he was useless so maybe it is deserved.  Talks fast but moves class along.  Will report Honor Board violations which is not typical at stevens for these labs where a lot of reports are copied from earlier years since they never change.

He is a fair teacher who knows what he is doing and the work is reasonable. As a person he's sarcastic, condescending, sexist, and makes you so angry. He sometimes contradicts himself and does not make sense so hopefully you have a TA with experience since they help more. He works so hes not in class sometimes and goes at at accelerated pace.
He is harsh but he did change mu group partners who were not working with me

Doesn't give helpful feedback on reports.  When you email him for help he sends you back something that confuses you more.  Hates groups of people for no mentioned reason so be careful if you identify with the wrong group.  Generally doesn't care about students and is one of the least helpful professors at Stevens.

Perhaps the most condescending professor at Stevens. Overly sarcastic, not really that funny, and absolutely awful with grading. He'll take points off major reports for the weirdest reasons. Smart and knows his material, but gets really annoying.
A bit off some days, but keeps it moving
Had no qualms with him in the beginning of the class, but later found out he suffers from collective narcissism and almost screwed me and my group near finals.
Helpful
Talks fast but is motivated
not too bad, keeps things moving
Good but lacks some patience with some other groups, not my group

He loves one group in the class and screws everybody else over. Do not ask why you got the grade you did because he will lower it, never raise it, actually he will make you beg for a better grade afterwards. If you become his fave, then it's smooth sailing for you.
He is OK
Good dude
Good with presentations
Horrible. Never in class. I dont know how he is still a teacher. Doesnt TEACH anything, so how is he labeled as a teacher?!?
He is unwilling to meet with you outside of class. No grading rubric. Grades not based on merit
Helpful, willing to listen

The class was easy, but Xiaohu did not do a good job at conveying the topics at all. I didn't learn anything in this class. He seems like a passionate teacher, but he just ended up reading off slideshows that were walls of text, and I still don't understand the purpose of what we were learning.

Extremely passionate and funny. The first few HWs (all are with a partner) and the first quiz are somewhat tough, but the class is quite easy thereafter. He is also helpful outside of class. Lectures can be a bit hard to understand, but you can learn a lot if you pay attention.

Overall, professor Xiaohu has good mastery over the topic, but his accent can pose a bit of a problem. However, the class is a very easy A because the exams and quizzes are all open book and professor Xiaohu posts all the slides that he goes over in class. Homework can be done in pairs as well.
Exams are open notes and is like what is gone over in class. Homeworks are perfect guide for the exams.
Overall a very easy class. The tests are all open book and as long as you do homework you should easily get an A.
Great professor, super passionate, very funny. Exams are very easy.

While it can be hard to understand what Professor Li said at times, he still communicates the material very clearly, and wants to make sure everyone understands. Sometimes he says things that are unintentionally hysterical, especially when he calls things "stupid". Great professor who I'd love to take again
Despite being very difficult to understand, this man is extremely passionate and makes sure everyone in the class is following what he says.

Dr. Li definitely knows a lot about the field of statistics and wants his students to succeed, however, sometimes it feels like his expectations are unrealistic. This class seriously lacks a recitation section, because there is not enough practice. The homework could be done just by reading the textbook. The final was unnecessarily difficult.

Lectures are hard to follow but the homework and quizzes are in the textbook and can be completed by reading it. The class can be very confusing but not to a point where it feels impossible. Quizzes and midterm were incredibly easy, but the final was insanely difficult and felt out of place compared to the rest of the semester.
Lectures are a little hard to follow but he cares a lot for his students. Just make sure you do the homework and go to office hours if needed.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: He's very passionate about what he teaches and cares a lot for his students. He's always available outside of class to answer any questions but the lectures themselves are hard to follow. The textbook and his lecture notes do make up for this.
You can feel the passion from this professor, but he is not that good at teaching and has a thick accent.

His lectures were clear and I thought the homework was generally a fair extension to the material. Had the class final been cumulative, it would have been significantly worse for me. Homework lacks full solutions; you will live by the textbook and Youtube videos to affirm your understanding for topics. Sometimes I could simply not do this.
Heavy accent. Blurry or even inaccurate conception explaining. Absolutely misery in his class.
I wish we have a better option, please Stevens help us, we are lost in this class, heavy accent could not understand anything, 6 chapters to cover in one lecture (400 pages) come on please!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: This prob course is measure-based, not calculus based. If your research direction is applied math, operations research or statistics, this course can lay you a firm theorectical foundation and train you a logic thinking. Must take real analysis before taking this course.

The homework is quite complicated and is not really touched upon in class. The exams are also bizarrely complicated and there is no real way to study for them. He does not post homework solutions either, so you cannot learn from your mistakes. Very time consuming and frustrating class. Start HW early and eat sleep and breathe those office hours.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Tough grader

comment: Lecture is useless. He does not allow you to ask questions. Tests are always before the relevant homework. There are exactly zero positives about this professor and I hope I never have to take a class with him ever again.
If you want to train yourself to have logical thinking, you can take this course. Very challenging.

I have never worked harder for a class and I have never left a class knowing less.  He is a nice guy and willing to help, but is very unclear.  The weekly assignments are incredibly difficult and each took 12+ hours to do as are the open book take home tests which took me 30+ hours. Lectures barely touch on the topics assigned as hw problems. Avoid

I don't care that his grading system is very forgiving, I learned almost NOTHING from Dr. Li. Gave a midterm (open book and open notes) and final project which were easily the hardest things I've ever had to do in my life. Takes a lot of points off because your proof is "unconvincing," yet, he doesn't tell you what's wrong with it. AVOID!!!!

Dr. Li's passion for Probability can't be mistaken. However, since his lectures come mostly from the textbook (which, in itself, I found WAY too difficult for this class), I found his lectures useless. The assignments we've had so far have been very challenging because of this. Thankfully, he grades very leniently. Not great, but not terrible.
This professor never shows up to class. His lectures are very hard to follow as it's simply boring and repetitive.

Triandopoulos never showed up for class and the first time we had an in person lecture (after 4 weeks) he made a comment about how many people weren't there and that we needed to show up. No one learns anything which I think is only partly his fault, but the class was an easy A in the end due to his super lenient grading and curving.

Prof commutes from Boston so class was often pushed online. Not too many assignments, lots of extra credit. The midterm was in-person but the final was online. Overall not difficult, just show up/join lectures and labs, and you should be fine.

A useless class with a boring and hard to understand professor that no one pays attention to. Plus the weekly quizzes are completely unrelated to the content. I don't know why the whole class is a cybersecurity class when it is supposed to be CS 101? Overall an unnecessary waste of time and would never take again.
I never recommend taking a course with him. He really wants to get rid of things and never prepare to answer your questions or your emails.

CS101 is a  basic class for Computer Science majors at Stevens, but for some reason, it's taught entirely with a cybersecurity curriculum. Nikos would just invite some random speaker onto a call every week who would talk for fifty minutes about something not at all related to your curriculum, and then a few days later tale the most unrelated quiz.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Tricky to understand.

Triandopoulos needs to improve on his lectures and keeping students engaged. Almost no one showed up for any of his classes and a good portion of the class time was taken up by him complaining about how no one participated. There was no need to ever show up for class as everything would be better self-taught.
Never take any course with him. He is not a good professor at all and in no sense

Prof. Triandopoulos knows that you don't want to be there and makes it clear he doesn't want to be there either. Lecture consists of reading from slides and the tests are regurgitating from the slides as well. The TAs are helpful, but it doesn't change the fact that his courses consist of slides and little else.

Very strange class that was about a third taught by Nikos, the other two thirds taught by other professors in the CS department. It was an online class that basically just talked about complicated topics that we couldn't really get a grasp on. Highlight of the class was everyone messing around in the Zoom chat. Nikos might be good but idk.

Very strange class with online lectures and different professors teaching each class. Total grade was based on like 5 quizzes which contained only very weirdly worded questions, however two attempts were given so they were no problem.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Accessible outside class--Online Savvy

comment: CS101 was a weird required seminar for freshman CS students that didn't make much sense. He relied heavily on guest speakers to talk on complex topics that either went over our head or weren't explained well enough. The Zoom chat was the only redeeming quality. The quizzes are posted way after the seminars but are doable, there are multiple tries.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: never posted grades. midterm arrived 2 hours late to the exam period. was only given 1 homework assignment when several were mentioned. past the deadline for final grades and it is still not posted

Triandopoulos gives some really fun lectures. Outside of that, however, this dude is a MESS. As of this review, the final is in 9 days and no one in the class has a grade yet because nothing has been graded. Also don't bother emailing him; for all I know, every email he receives just gets sent to a black hole.

Absolute catastrophe of a class, and an awful teacher. Grading criteria is very unclear, and he continuously posted quizzes on seminars six to eight weeks after the lecture. He would cancel class with little warning, and on top of that could not explain a topic for his life. He completely relied on guest speakers. AVOID AT ALL COSTS!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: It is a new required seminar for computer science freshman. I have no idea what the school expected from these seminar... The quality of the seminar depended on the individual speakers. Most of them explained complex topics to new cs students terribly. The quizzes made by the prof were the hardest. Prof never responded to any of my email.

This is one of the most dysfunctional courses I've taken at Stevens. Professor promises to post homework for weeks and takes about a month to do so. Midterm was delayed over an hour because TAs were printing the exam at the start time. We do not have a single grade for the course at this time (weekend before Thanksgiving). Would not recommend.
Nikos is the most unorganized professor Ive ever had. He has no idea how to meet a deadline.

Professor Nikos is really a respected person, he lectures mostly from the slides, not easy to follow or understand his lectures. The book he provides has nothing related to his slides, he tends to be not organized, make sure to follow him in the lecture and ask questions. His tests are really tricky and confusing.
Interesting class and a good experience overall. Not too much homework and the exams are fair. The professor is enthusiastic about the topic and encourages participation without making it mandatory.

he is very nice and helpful. gives few HW. no midterm or final. he always try his best in class. very nice in grading and gives extra credit. attend the class, do your HW on time, participate in class if possible, and you will get an A

A great physics professor and clearly has a lot of passion for his topics. His quizzes (exams) are pretty difficult, being both conceptual and calculative (a lot of the times both), but he allows you to make your formula sheet for it. Great class, if you can take him in S-section then go for it; he really makes a hard course in E&M more enjoyable.

Search is a really hard professor, but his alternate grade scale makes it much easier to get a good grade. His lectures are amazing, and he is really knowledgeable. Exams are... rough. Overall an amazing professor though would love to have him again.

Professor Search is very knowledgeable of the subject and wants his students to succeed. Although the course content is difficult, Search provides a bunch of different resources to help you learn and practice in and out of the classroom.
Don't confuse the difficulty of the course with a lack of teaching ability. Prof. Search has genuine passion and is rooting for each and every student to succeed.

Professor Search was very knowledgeable about the subject, he wants to help you learn, his class is difficult but worth taking. The homework and class examples prepare you well for the quizzes which make up a bulk of your grade there is an abundance of extra credit. He is also very quick to answer emails.

Genuinely amazing professor. I don't hate going to class and he teaches content insanely well. Homework questions are chosen to help you learn more even if you don't fully understand content. 
I don't know how he is for gen ed, but he's amazing for other classes.

Search is very passionate and knowledgeable about physics and it shows. His lectures are entertaining and the homework is not too much. The class is challenging but not insanely hard pay attention and do your work and you'll be fine.

One of the smartest professors that can explain a complicated topic with ease, IF you ask, meaning you NEED to pay attention or you'll be so lost. For physics majors he's a fountain of knowledge. But I also TA with him for freshman courses. If you're in PEP 112, turn off your phone and pay attention while he talks. You really will learn something.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Anyone who thinks Search can't teach isn't trying to understand him. This guy is a physics god. The knowledge he possesses out-shadows any professor I've met to date. His tests are murder, but if you study hard enough they'll be (somewhat) less painful. Lectures are heavy but interesting, homework is tough but doable, office hours save your life.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tests are tough--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Dr. Search is a fountain of knowledge who gets a bad rap from uninterested students who have to take his gen ed course to pass. He begins each lecture with a diatribe on the latest politics gossip or physics invention, but eventually becomes a powerhouse of formulae. While his explanations can be a it lacking at times, the book is there for that.

Prof. Search is a wealth of knowledge, for one of the most difficult classes I've taken to date he managed to make the lectures clear and concise, even if there was just too much to cover at times. You definitely need to put in the effort to get the most out of his class but if you value the education you're paying for it's definitely worth it.

Professor Search gets a bad wrap because a lot of people have the wrong idea about his class. Engineers believe that if they memorize the formulas they're entitled to a good grade because they're so smart. He actually does teach, and quite well especially in higher level classes, but people say he's "boring". He provides all of the tools needed.
Very underrated professor who is often looked at as boring and gives long lectures.  He is very smart, provides a lot of information, and teaches you what you need to succeed in the class
He's not as passionate about the gen ed classes as he is for the specialized topics. But then again, isn't that the case for everyone? He's smart, well-read, and a good teacher.

He covered all of the material in depth in class on the board (even some interesting extra stuff) and did some of the more difficult HW problems. The midterm and final were take home and were just like the HW's. Definitely beats taking engineering turdmo with Professor Gallois. An introduction to statistical mechanics is a must for physics majors.

Not too bad really. Most of my friends who think negatively of him are the ones who just sit at the back of class and play with their phone the whole time. If you listen attentively to this guy, you can actually learn a lot. It just takes a bit more effort though.
Smart, but can't teach for his life.

Such a joke. He's very smart and knows his physics but he cannot communicate well... think Sheldon cooper from big bang theory, only not as funny. There was no point going to lecture, too many students, couldn't hear him and he just read slides. You'll do alright if you read the book and do the practice quizzes he gives.

Complete and utterly useless. Ive gone to him to see if there were other alternatives to boost my grade and he just laughed. He has the attention span of a rat; if someone talks as he lectures he snaps his neck and goes "what" retardedly. He also says "um" a lot. He may know his physics but he cant teach for squat

Search has a bad teaching voice, says "um" over 3000 times per semester, and constantly references quantum physics in order to make things more interesting(for him). My TA for him was incapable and incomprehensible.  If you want to learn at all, bring headphones/earplugs to lecture and read the textbook.
This guy is a complete retard. He may know physics, but cant teach even if his life depended on it. If you want to pass physics, take someone else!
This guy is a real jerk. Doesnt make us understand any material and to add to that he confuses us with his material. Teached phy with only slides....He is a complete useless person
A teacher or professor is supposed to teach his or her students. This man does not understand the meaning of the word "teach".
Professor is super patient!!!! I love him!!!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: Good professor, kind at heart and wants the best for students.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Too many homework for one subject, but he is not strict grader and flexible with timelines

The Prof. has tons of knowledge, and his ability to explain topics is also good. But beware, not everything will be taught in class and especially, he wont teach every little detail. If you select any subject taught by him, start self studying from day one, will help a lot in future, classes and assignments. He provides good study material. Goodluk
Absolutely useless. NO learning!!!!!!!!!!!!!
His voice is very low and he is old. Because of which, we cant understand what he is saying. Also, he is not teaching any spreadsheet models in the class.
You literally learn nothing. You might sleep off in the lectures. The grades are randomly given with no real focus on what you write.

No doubt that he's got an amazing amount of knowledge but now his age is catching up and is unable to convey things clearly and because of that, the whole class made the same mistake in a project and still, we had to pay for it and got fewer marks which ruined our grade. Ask anyone who took his class and you'll get the same review!
Attendance is not mandatory but participation in his classes will go a long way
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: He is a good professor but makes you work a lot for an "A". That said it is not at all difficult to get an A. Just do his homework assignments on time and check every detail while doing it and participate in class. His classes will make you fall asleep since his voice is very low and you may not understand even if you're a front bencher.
Really makes you work for the grade. Very particular about plagiarism. Attend class follow lectures and submit all the assignments in time.  Not tough to get an A.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Good Professor. Too many weekly assignments. Sometimes he conveys so many things in the class which we could not understand easily.
He's a great professor
Great Professor!
Good professor
A great professor who is clear with his lectures and assignments.  He is always happy to help you out if you just take the time to ask.  Follow the class syllabus and it is hard to not get an A.
Certainly knows his subject, but tries to convey too much to the class, with list absorption. Gives too many weekly HW assignments.
AWESOME
Awesome prof
The nicest professor in the world!
No Comments
Nice guy, very understanding.
Great guy especially for a required class, he will try his best to help everyone in the class and is also very generous especially with some of the issues that you can run into with projects.
Russo is an amazing professor while some of the material covered in Engr 111 and 122 is challenging for incoming freshman the way Russo teaches makes the transition much easier
Amazing

While the class has many assignments, he's very understanding and flexible with deadlines if you need it. He's such a sweet guy and accessible in the lab at all times to help you. He's the type of professor who really wants his students to do well. His grading is not harsh and if you lose points he'll tell you why. Definitely recommend.
The first ENGR (121) is a tough transition from high school to college learning. Russo made the transition so much better and understands how tough it is. Really cares about his students.
very nice prof. sometimes projects were difficult, but he was so sweet in answering questions and giving out grades :)
While the class lectures were typically boring, Professor Russo did a great job answering any questions regarding what we were working on in the lab.

By far the best professor I've had at Stevens. He is incredibly caring and will always support his students no matter what. I am very grateful to have had him and I learned a lot from him whenever I had questions. If you're taking D2, try to get Russo because he's the absolute best.

The lectures are useless, but it's not his fault, I feel like every lecture no matter the professor for that class is useless.  He let us do our own thing for the project and he gave help when we needed it.
ENGR111 is a very project-heavy class, but if you follow the guidelines they provide to stay on track, it's manageable. He is a fairly lenient grader and deadlines are incredibly flexible.

Great DII professor. Was understanding of the covid situation at the time. The course was challenging hybrid, but he was very caring and unless u didn't put in the work, you'd most definitely get an A. Get em for DI and DII

During the COVID-19 outbreak and being sent home Russo has done his best to make surer that the Engineering Design 2 Course was taught well and to not cause further stress to his students. Because of the rush, my group was not given the right cable for our project and he went out of his way to mail us one. He is extremely caring and understanding.
Good professor. Cares about students
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: One of the best teachers I've had so far. Is very passionate and understanding. He is very knowledgeable yet is down to earth and helpful. Show up to class and put in some effort and you will do well and finish this course with some new knowledge. 10/10 would recommend.
Really great design professor. Makes it pretty easy to get an A, but still cares about conveying the information and helping with the project. Best design professor I've had so far.
He randomly changed some of my group's grades so I got an A- in the class. Awesome guy
Wish I had him for D1 and am very grateful for having him for D2. Cant ask for a better design professor.
Compared to what my friends had to deal with other lab professors. Prof. Russo is definitely the top 3 design professors. Is very understanding. Really hope I have him for Design III next semester.
The best design professor I had without a doubt. Wants all his students to succeed, relates labwork to real-life engineering problems.
Great Instructor. Provides students with in-depth understanding of what to expect and how to succeed in Industry
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Just do the work and contribute to the group project. Easy to talk to and will provide help and assistance.

Had to redo a paper 3 times just to fix workcited even after seeing the writing clinic & meeting with her. For the midterm, I forgot to use a pen & write double-spaced so she made me rewrite it having said nothing when she saw me writing. The final was unrelated to the course and after asking for clarification I was left more fustrated & in tears.

Probably my least favorite professor this semester. She is extremely nit-picky over every little thing. She did not help me with the first essay we had to do for her class; her only advice was to go the writing center. She takes herself way to seriously over a class thats not even towards my major. I would highly recommend staying away.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: the WORST Professor I have ever had. Does not care about you at all and is utterly selfish. Was rude and hypocritical the whole semester but when the time came for students to evaluate her class she sucked up to us so the school would not fire her.

Professor Whitney is a harsh grader and at times does not communicate clearly what work needs to get done. However, she is very prompt in replying to her emails and will make you a better reader and writer. At first, she may seem tough and will keep badgering you with all the issues in your writing, but you will learn and improve from it in time.

I took this class because after studying French for 8 years and passing my AP French exam, and scoring a 94 on the french placement exam at Stevens, I thought this class would be a good way to brush up on the parts of my French that were rustier, and to take my mind off my engineering courses. Instead, she made me cry in class, and hate French.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Her optimistic response to asking questions made me open up more. I feel that she has prepared me better for future presentations when it comes to overall performance as well as having a positive outlook on the whole idea. Whitney was also always available and was understanding when we were confused about any subject during the course.

I was scared of taking this professor because of the reputation that she has. Honestly, don't feed into the hype. Yes, she's a tough grader. But if you spend time with her during her office hours and put effort into your work you WILL get an A. If you don't, you won't get a great grade. She's only mean to those who disrespect her. I enjoyed class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Whitney isn't a bad person and is pretty easy to talk to. She has VERY strong opinions, assigning 4 papers a term and a lot of work. If you have Whitney you will have to really work for a good grade, but if you have any problems you can approach her and she will try to help.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: She gives so much work its crazy. Its a 3 credit course and I have more homework for it than my 4 credit course. Avoid at all costs. It also is just not fun to learn what she is teaching.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Tough grader, does not teach, she edits. Learned more about MLA format than how to improve my writing.  Does not care about content at all. Just a nuisance to deal with, avoid at all costs.

She's not a professor, she's an editor. When you hand her your paper she will edit it and then give you a grade based on how many grammar mistakes you made. And even then it's not clear how she grades because she wrote "amazing!" on one of my papers with no apparant markings and gave me an 89. Just avoid this professor.

Once you get to know her she is not all that bad :). She might be scary at the beginning of the semester, and she is moody sometimes. However, at the end she will give good grades is you show that you put some effort.
You will learn a decent amount from this professor, however there are better ones out there.
When asking for help if you question why you are wrong she gets personally insulted and raises her voice at you. She should never be a teacher.
She gives the most work out of any 103 prof and when i comes to grading expect low marks

This teacher was horrible. She would frequently come in to class late and even cancel them because she could not wake up. When that happened, she would usually give a pop quiz on something she posted on Elearn. She also had a habit of torturing the foreign students who couldn't write. Also, she took the elevator for 1 floor. Just saying....
she does have mood swings, which are entertaining. never really explains what she wants on paper, but shes nice. loves it when people ask her for help!

She has insane mood swings and only cares about marketing even though the class has nothing to do with marketing. She will spend most of the class talking about one thing and then give an assignment completely unrelated with no explanation of what she really wants. I highly suggest any other professor.

She is very entertaining and keeps the class at a manageable level while still requiring certain amount of effort if you want to get your goal grade. Less load than other professors, grades in a neutral-semihard manner, and is always there available to give help. I took HUM104 afterwards with her as well. Loved the experience!

Probably the easiest HUM 103 professor. Has weird mood swings  which her easiness depends a lot on. If you do what she asks and get on her good side, this class is a breeze. Just hand in the work on time and follow her directions. Not a difficult class to get a good grade in.

Her grading completely depends on her mood. It's like she randomly picks a number from 60-100 in her head. She has once commented amazing at the top of my paper, the only mistake noted was the misuse of a comma and I received, an 80. I honestly believe she teaches at an 8th grade level, yet tries very hard to appear intelligible.

The professor is not very difficult as many say, difficult to understand his classes a bit, but the course is well structured and would help to understand AWS concepts well. Assignments and final project are good

I took this course in 2018, and despite receiving an A+, I have to say that the professor is not great. The course isn't challenging, but I stopped attending lectures because they were incredibly boring. It's clear the professor struggles with teaching and doesn't address students' concerns about discrepancies.

It is an easy course, all you need to do is pay attention in class and participate a bit. The professor is quite helpful, in your homework and project too. All you need to obtain an A is participation and understanding. He always arrives half an hour early to clear your doubts.

CS570 - This is the worst professor I have ever had. This guy can't teach at all. His lectures are boring as hell and it was very hard to understand him. He reads directly from the PowerPoints. When he speaks, he mixes Russian and English, its like he's speaking another language. He scribbles on the board.
Dude doesnt know how to teach and needs to get a grip with reality.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Great
Great content in the course. try to use the aws credits and get hands on aws experience
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Group projects

comment: Professor Igor is really helpful and is always accessible outside the class. If you work on the given assignments and ask him questions it is an easy A. He just does not like people who do not want to learn. If you show him that you've worked hard then he does not care about the percentage.
Excellent Professor!!

Don't give him bad feedback in review forms, he bashed everyone, can't take criticism. Homeworks are confusing, and he doesn't give a fudge about student's project. Doesn't teach Cloud tech, teaches CN and OS combination instead. Best of luck if you're already in, run away if you aren't.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: The most underrated professor at Stevens. I would highly recommend taking his courses. They are very helpful if you want a job in Amazon or any cloud provider company.

He is a good professor and explains you each topic clearly. The only problem is his communication. You have to concentrate on his class properly and have to read chapters after going home. Assignments are easy and midterm is open book. You have to buy his book else you won't pass. Overall a nice professor.

if you wanna pass this course: attend all the classes, sit in the first seats exactly facing the professor, do all HW on time (they are tough), participate in class, and he gonna help you to get an A even if you did poorly in final. programming assignments are challenging, his ascent is difficult ,he is very restrict in class . Nice TA.
rating_tags: Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: The most exciting course ever!  I cannot imagine you can learn so much in one semester.  His links to history, literature, and music in the context of computer science are awsome.  ALWAYS ready to help, answer email, no late penalty if you are sick.  Funny and HOT.  Should not waste his time on lazies and cheaters.

He is a very experienced senior professor from industry who has worked on stuff and exactly knows what he is doing. Will clear all your doubts in a simple and clear explanation. Proud to be his student.
Absolutely the specialist of specialist in telecommunication. Full stack professor but only give lectures of cloud computing and operation system.

Who ever rated Professor Faynberg bad is just wrong.  If you show up to class, do the work and he knows who you are, you will do well and exam grades wont matter.  I did bad on both the midterm and final but still got an A.  If you do not do the assignments, do not show up for class then your grade will be strictly based on numbers.

A lot of the negative views on prof Faynberg are a result of those students not doing to work assigned. Not only was he fair, if you needed help, he was there. Many in the class decided to be lazy and they had to deal with the consequences. Instead of improving their work ethic, they complained about prof Faynberg instead.  Funny and friendly too.
His homeworks tests a student's coding capabilities rather than Operating Systems knowledge

He comes off as strict but is very reasonable and has a sense of humor. His accent isn't too thick . His homework takes time to complete if you want to do good. Had open book exams in class and chances for extra credit to help boost your grade. Just come to all his classes and pay attention.  Very experienced and fun professor with a lot to share.

HE IS SO NICE! He is actively learning to keep students engaged. He really cares about his students and lecturers. The class MIS is pretty easy. Please go to all the classes and participate. I liked him so much I am taking him again for BT 416. protect at all costs

Really nice guy. The first half of the semester was lecture-heavy and boring, and attendance started to drop. But after we indicated this problem in the mid-semester survey, he got a lot more engaging. A lot of his examples were funny (at least to me) and kept my attention. I'm taking him again for BT 416.

This whole class is one group project to make a website outside of class with multiple deadlines for different things. The lectures are 2 hours, but he makes it pretty interesting considering how long it is. He was really nice and understanding

Professor Muehlen was very passionate about the subject of info systems. His tests, of which there were only 2, were essentially collaborative and were taken outside of class. The website project was very time-consuming but was kind of cool to work on. It was also nice to learn a bit about excel and Tableau but the TA's could've been a bit better.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Super nice & interactive. But not always responsive to emails. Don't think he read our peer reviews either. 1 of my group members didn't contribute at all, and even though we said so in the PR, they still received full credit. midterm was graded arbitrarily w/ no explanation. good prof/class but there are some issues that need to be worked thru

Clear expert of his craft. One class a week and one recitation for MIS 201. He wants to see his students succeed, and clearly knows what he is talking about. He is very accessible during and after class and is always willing to help his students. The website project was awesome, without any website building experience, I learned a lot

Professor zur Muehlen is a very nice professor. He is always available and willing to help you with the project or any other work he assigns. He does call out on random people during the lecture so try to pay attention in class.
Group project heavy class but the professor is great and really helpful
Very nice teacher. Very helpful if you need help and lenient with grading, if you need more time because you need to ask him questions he allows it.
Good man!
german folk, good lecture, good looking
Very funny and entertaining. We have one group project throughout the course of creating and coding a business and website for the business. He guides you through every step.
Very helpful when you get stuck. Useful topics taught in the class and he explains them very well. Group projects are creative and fun.
He was clear during the lectures and he is willing to help if you have any trouble with an assignment or the group project.
Very helpful and always willing to answer questions and help with homework.
He is excellent professor. Veru organized and very good hold of the classes he teaches. I found it very helpfull and learning experience..
Tough but fair and a great lecturer
Professor Zur Muehlen is very good!

I love this guy! His lectures are very clear. He seems very in touch with industry. He's easy to get along with as long as you do your work. He did his academic coursework in Germany, so he brings a unique European perspective.

Professor Zur Muehlen is a very good professor.  Very clear in lectures and speaks from real world knowledge. However, by no stretch of the Imagination is his class Easy.  Homework for every class & Papers to do. He is a very Fair professor in grading.
He lectures a lot and assigns a lot of text-based writings. He's very willing to discuss anything that you need to, but can make contradicting claims.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: Went into the fall semester not knowing that I should have checked my professors before signing up for classes, hindsight is 20/20. I received top 5 grades on both his harshly graded essays, never missed a class, and participated, but in the end, my grade fell from an A because of his over-expecting final paper. Impossible to succeed in his class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Gives good feedback on the analytical essays until official surveys are done. The final essay is graded on how well he likes you rather than how well you wrote your essay, both another student and I reviewed each other's papers but received wildly different scores even when quality of writing was the same. Not recommended and rude in emails.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Ogden does not use Canvas effectively, never posting important details of assignments or any rubrics. His command of the subject is poor and does not effectively inspire or teach students in any way. He does not propose interesting discussions and is overall an awful teacher.
Grades essays harshly and is very boring. Not too hard to get an A, but not easy.

He is a good professor, just not great with feedback on papers. There are 3 big papers with the last being a group project/presentation. He is nice but the content was a bit boring with lots of reading in the CAL 103 book. Definitely have to write and manage time on your own with due dates
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback

comment: His class is very reading heavy, everything is from the textbook and you have to read, he will talk about it for the next 3 weeks. The readings itself were long and boring and graded very harshly compared to other English teachers. My advise, don't take this class and find the guy who got his PhD at Brown University.

Really good prof all around. Chill, caring, fair, & knowledgeable. He does his best to pull interest and enthusiasm out of philosophical topics that are otherwise insipid. Gives helpful feedback and is very approachable. Would definitely take a class with him again.

Prof Ogden is a great guy and a great professor. His class is not difficult as long as you put in effort and follow his directions when writing papers. He is very accessible and willing to give feedback on your writing if you ask. Really wants his students to do well. He's progressive, chill, and caring. Would definitely take him again.
great prof overall. his lectures are very laid back and he gives ample opportunity for relevant conversation and interaction. fair grader and very caring towards students.

Ogden was a good professor, although there were times that he took off points due to not agreeing with my viewpoint which was a bit frustrating. Aside from that, the discussions he leads are interesting and easy to participate in. Overall, great professor and would recommend if deciding between a few others.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes--Accessible outside class

comment: He's clearly very passionate about what he teaches and makes every student feel welcome in class discussion. However, he tends to take points off if he doesn't agree with a student's viewpoint. Also, he does not always provide feedback regarding his grading. However, he is a very caring professor and is willing to grant extensions if needed.
Hes an good professor, I found his class pretty easy to pass as long as you do his work and hes willing to help

Pretty decent professor. Focused on a central topic of courage/philosophy which was a bit boring, but made assignments easy & information retainable. Not a lot of work/essays & was mostly focused on in class activities. Havent had other cal105 professors to compare but the class was easy enough & hes nice. Easy A if u put in a little effort.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: Pretty standard professor, good communication skills always available after class. Didn't like the random group assignments, felt like a waste of time. Topics and readings were pretty lackluster and boring. A lot of busy work and didn't feel like I actually learned much in class. Not bad wouldn't be first choice.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: He doesn't give much feedback on essays but is clear about what is expected on them and you can rewrite one of them for a better grade. Lectures are focused on ethics which was boring to me but they weren't unbearable. He was a chill teacher to me and I would take him again.

Very helpful professor, incredibly easygoing. Lectures weren't overly interesting and focused heavily on ethics. Really helped me learn how to write better and was overall a great person to work with. Highly reccomend

He definitely makes you work hard to get a good grade. Most of the topics and readings are based on philosophy and ethics... not the hardest thing in the world, but still tough. Although the ideas are difficult, he does a great job at guiding the class to write a decent paper.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Writing assignments are extremely vague but not too long. Required readings are incredibly boring and won't make much sense unless you happen to be a philosophy buff. Just do yourself a favor and avoid this guy.
