If you have to take BT 200, take it with Biagi.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Absolutely incredible professor and extremely knowledgable in her field. Great mentor outside of class and always accessible for questions. Makes a rather dull subject (accounting) rather interesting and very straightforward. Wish she taught other classes!
Just go to class. She's lovely and very smart. If you study for the tests and actually pay attention in class it is an easy A.

FIND ANY OTHER PROFESSOR.  Gives extremely long homework's that average around 4-5 hrs, provides no help and her lectures are dry and boring. This is her second semester teaching at stevens and it shows. Try's to be nice but comes off as extremely condescending and is not very understanding, does not empathize with missing hw under any circumstance

I wouldn't say that I learned a great deal about SWE since her lectures were mostly reading off slides. Plus, the stuff you learn aren't really enforced in group projects, so you don't really internalize SWE concepts like unit testing. On the other hand, it's an easy A course, from which you get a fullstack project to showcase on your resume.

If you don't like group homework, don't take anything with her. Very fair, really understands what she's teaching. If I could have taken her class in person I would have since she's very sweet and understanding. Her lecture material easy to understand, and assignments can be difficult but aren't ridiculous.
rating_tags: Group projects--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Raz took over from a previous professor. Lectures were ok, but students were not alerted about any important announcements unless they watched the recording. Assignments can sometimes be unclear, and we only programmed once during the semester. Ok course, but it's not the best introduction to software engineering as knowledge doesn't build with 540
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Prof. Saremi is the best professor. She guides the students and help them achieve the goals. Her lectures are well organized and interesting.

She is one of the best professors for Software Engineering. The lectures were interesting and learning Python becomes easy if you would listen carefully, get your doubts clarified, and complete the assignments. She was accessible post-class during office hours.

The professor covered all the details that I needed to know to start a new programming language. I believe the professor was giving more attention than needed to a graduate-level course. If anyone needed to be taken care of like a baby and do not put any effort I suggest you drop graduate school and join a kindergarten.
So fluent. amazing ��
The slides was so useful
An insprational lecture Thanks professor Saremi
It was hilarious and helps me in my project Thanks
This is amazing amazing �� thank you professor

She teaches very well. All of her slides were complete and understandable. She knows what she is teaching and always helps in my project by giving insights and comments even now in my other projects. She always challenged us in how to code which I believe helps me to learn a lot. I will take any other course if she offers it.
Just read slides without any understanding, not prepared for class.
Read slides without understanding

She is one of the nice professors from Software Engineering. The lectures were pretty good and learning Python was a piece of cake if you would listen carefully, get your doubts clarified, and complete the assignments. She was accessible post-class during office hours. TA Michale was quite late in grading but asking for regrading wasn't an issue.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Does'nt know P of python. Just read slides without any understanding, not prepared for class. Very confusing assignment's grading criteria. Never grades on time, graded all assignments and quizzes at the very end. Can't call her a teacher. What a waste!
i love him hes so great and nice and cares about you and your grades

The classes were amazing and interactive. Getting to class on-time is mandatory, else get ready to do the Steven's Duck Dance. The content for this class is apt if you want to go into strategy planning. The final presentation is interesting and very informative.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: Great prof, funny, caring, accessible outside of class.Very knowledgable & wants us to succeed. Takes the time to get to know every student. His class is laid back but very informational. He grades super fairly. Read the weekly articles, participate in class, follow instructions for each assignment, & submit group projects on time- you'll be golden

Great prof; very funny, engaging, & informative. Fair grader. Comes w/ lots of valuable real-world experience. Grade's based on 3 group presentations, 1 hw, & attendance/participation. Presentations: put in effort & you'll do well. Participation: reading a few articles weekly & making comments on them in class. Definitely take his class if you can.
tough grader and cuts marks on mere nitty gritty. get ready to read.

He has a very unfair grading policy. This subject is not technical at all and during the job hunt no one will even look up to this subject and still you will see your grades falling unnecessarily over minor issue. He cuts marks over petty things. Unfortunately he is the only prof for this subject at Stevens.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Weekly we have to read a lot of papers. Course is very basic not technical and has nothing much to learn as it basically talks about very normal management topics which we learn in undergrad but this is a core course so we can't skip it. it is very time-consuming and the score depends on group projects just imagine if u don't have a good group!

Best teacher. He is so nice and makes the class fun with lots of memes. He just asks that everyone participate and do their part. Homework is just reading and like 3 group presentations. Overall would definitely take it again

Is a great professor but isn't a breeze. Time consuming and is VERY group project based. Strongest thing I could recommend for that is finishing your papers/presentations (you will have 2-3 over the course of the semester) early with a few days to go and submitting it to him, will suggest edits that let you get a perfect grade. Also weekly readings
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: He is an amazing professor, share lots of personal experiences, bit tough in starting because of so many articles to read but by the end, I really enjoyed knowledge I got from the professor.

Parfett is the man. He is very funny, engaging, and an easy grader. The final grade is based on a paper, 3 presentations, and participation. He will give you above a 95 on every presentation as long as you follow the guidelines. Read his articles, make a few comments about them in class, and you'll finish with an easy A. He loves memes.

Keeps the entire class engaged till the end of the lectures. He expects you to read all the articles before you come to his class and he makes that sure by asking every student questions relevant to the articles every lecture. Fair grader. You will get to learn a lot from him and your presentation skills will improve as well
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Amazing Lectures, a lot of reading but all good articles. Most of the times you'll be working on presentations. Teamwork matters and he is all chilled out.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: He is really good professor with profound knowledge of the subject and comes up with different examples to explain. This is more oriented to presentations and by the time you will complete this course you will be pretty good in them. Take him and you will enjoy.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Attend class, Do assignments as per templates/ lec slidedecks then an A is not difficult to get.
Attend class and you will get an A. All assignments are group assignments except 1.

Impossible to understand the lecture due to heavy accent. Better off reading the slides, but those aren't the best either. No tests except the final which I suspect he did not grade because no one was prepared, the Canvas shell was deleted so no one saw their grade for it, and everyone ended with an A that I knew. Only go to class to copy class act
Right.
Literally did the in class activity for everyone in two different classes. And did it wrong in each class two different ways.
A blind man trying to speak. I don't think he is a real person.

Other reviews do a good job, it's very hard to understand him. He's smart but not a good educator. I can say I have learned absolutely nothing about this class. It sucks because this class is pretty cool and closely related to ME but sucks it had to be with him. Would not recommend it to anyone. Avoid if possible.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Consistently goes 5-7 minutes over time EVERY class which is extremely disrespectful to the students. Spends too long on problems and assigns “class” activities that he rarely has time in class for, so it just ends up being homework every class. nothing learned in class, youre better off w the textbook or going through the slides yourself.

Just reads off of slides but in worse English. The online quizzes he gives are written in broken English to the point where you wouldn't be able to answer the question. If you try to ask for a further explanation, you'll just end up more confused. Takes off significant grade points without reason for projects and assignments. Avoid if possible
Heavy accent, reads off slides, nothing learned, cant use a computer
Very nice guy and a very lenient grader. He is really not an effective educator so he relies on flipped classroom, which makes it very hard to learn the material. Mmm
He was consistently available for feedback and help with coursework outside of class, even within the hour before an assignment was due.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Reads right off slides without any insight into the simulation tools. Good luck if you've never used the tools before - it's impossible to learn for the first time here. Boring classes that teach you nothing, and homework problems way more complex than the ones he glazes over. No textbook to assist you either.

This guy is really not a great teacher. Reads directly off slides, doesn't relay the material across to the students effectively at all. I'd gain more useful info from reading the slides at home in 10 minutes than sit in his class for 50 minutes. Nice guy, but just needs to learn how to teach effectively. Try to avoid if possible
Follow his instructions to a T in class to complete in class activities. Ask for help from friends on homework or search forums online in you have no prior CAD experience.
Useless introductory class with piles of stupid busy work. Utter waste of my time and money
He's really not an effective educator. He teaches and reads right off of powerpoint slides, which is pointless and prevents learning.

He has a pretty heavy accent, which can be entertaining at times (he says doubly-click) but is pretty hard to understand in general. He'll give you help if you need it, but it might not be the most helpful feedback.
Grading is not too tough but the HW's are not related to the lectures and need to implement algorithm from scratch instead of using sklearn. Finally she helped in midterm with a sample paper.

For the hws you need to start early so you have time to ask ta's/her questions if they come up. Prof responds well to emails and at least this semester changed lectures based on feedback. Don't get salty, she will help you learn what's a very new field. Deep learning isn't a prereq though, but there's no way to do recent nlp w/o it.

Teaches an intro class like she's speaking to other experienced academics. Homeworks are unreasonable and demand skills not listed as prerequisite to the class. Of the countless hours I poured into this class, the majority were spent teaching myself what the professor almost certainly should have taught us herself in the classroom. Do not take.

Awful Professor. zero flexibility for in-class attendance (funerals? too bad, losing credit). No clear explanation for answers to quizzes beyond "You should know this, I taught you this in my lecture." 

Clearly an ineffective professor, yet an accomplished academic. Be prepared to devote significant time to coursework.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes--Graded by few things

comment: Typical slide reader while wasting 40 minutes on taking attendance and a quiz. Homework's are doable but full of mistakes and typos. It consists a lot of implementing your own algorithms from scratch which is not useful at all at real use cases where we can call Sklearn or Tensorflow.

She is a good professor, and even though the homework assignments are extremely long and quite challenging,  they are doable with effort. However, do be prepared to do a lot of studying outside of class time. She does a great job of giving intuition behind a lot of the methods used in class, and responds very quickly to any questions.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: No help at all when you don't understand her teaching. She basically reads from the slides and there's no engagement. No effort is taken to engage with the students during the class only engagement is to test the students from her lectures which she reads from the slides. She doesn't know how to teach just reads from slides.
Never ever take her courses. Very tough course, tough grader and doesnt give partial credits
never ever take her

Not a terrible professor, but the assignments are hard. Very little feedback on programming work and always graded late. Offers an extra credit assignment at the end of the semester. Decent lecturer, but I wouldn't take another course with her.
just don't take her class. don't consider if students can follow. too hard for people just get started with ML or DL

comment: The material and class quality is comparable to some of the ivy leagues . That said the homework's are pretty tough for someone new to NLP . With some prior knowledge of ML as well a little work you can get through with good grades.

comment: She has taken the complete coursework from Stanford's NLP with Deep Learning course. This course was first introduced this semester and she didn't care about how many of us are really following her class. The coding standards were never taught and yet even the slightest referring on Google got our marks deducted. No appreciation for project/paper

She cannot explain most of the concept very well. Most of her class is reading her slides. The only way of her teaching is hard quiz, hard homework and hard exams. I don't think her class content quality and depth could match with the hardness of the exam and homework.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Not teaching well.

The professor is hard working and expects you to work hard as well. An intermediate Machine Learning class. You need to have a little background in ML (take an Andrew NG's class in coursera will be highly recommended), and have fluent python programming skills for this class. After you did that, you will find this class very helpful.

Assignments are challenging and hard. You get 2 weeks for each assignment. Start early ! Total 4 assignments mostly coding with python. Only midterm no final exams the midterm was hard. Lectures r heavy and can easily get losf. The way she teaches is not easy for everyone to understand. You need prior knowledge of probability, linear algebra.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Good teacher.

If you have the opportunity to be taught by Enrique I highly recommend him -- absolutely amazing. Don't get me wrong, CS532 is a very tough class. But he teaches so well and I learned a lot. He is also flexible with remote education.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Relaxed personality, but his lectures drone on. The content is taught through slides, not through actual coding practice.

This class is an easy A, but not much of a learning experience. The slides are online, and the "in-class" quizzes are mostly done by everyone at home. Heavy emphasis on the group projects but they aren't hard to get by. The lectures are bad. We learn HTML etc. through slides, not through coding! Professor Dunn's teaching style is slow and boring.

Overall just friendly and chill dude. Majority of grade is a semester long group project which he gives you plenty of preparation and freedom on. He responds to emails and gave our group additional points when we disputed a grade from a TA. Lectures weren't super engaging but would definitely recommend if you're wanting an easy-ish A.

The class is mainly based on one group project in which you build your own website. He gives quizzes, but they're only worth 5% of your total grade which is nothing. As long as you put some time into the assignments and the class in general, you'll get an A.
No help at all.

Professor Dunn is friendly, but his lectures are incredibly dull, and I feel like I learned nothing new this semester. Also, the CAS or TAS are highly annoying, like really bad. There are no clear grading criteria, and they grade you well or poorly depending on their own "fair" standards. Finally, the class was mandatory, a horrible experience.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: He's only good at explaining theory, all the assignments will be coding assignments and you'll struggle if you didn't take a similar course in your undergrad. Exams are open book but they are tough. He'll check the exam papers, he's too slow to grade (took 45 days to grade our mid sem paper) but will expect you to submit your assignment in 15 days.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Very Solid professor. The concepts covered were interesting, but it can be hard to pay attention over zoom. The course was structured very well, and features a group project where you work over the course of the semester to make a website, which can be a great addition to a resume, especially if you take this course freshman year.
Great at teaching high-level concepts. The lower-level more math-oriented stuff, not so much. Luckily his classes are mostly high-level

Course went online after the pandemic. He was basically just reading off from slides for three hours and it was hard to keep focused. The course would be better if he presents an outline of everything we are learning, and revisits it every week for a few minutes. I felt the topics skipped unrelatedly each week.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Enrique is a legend. His hair is kinda sick too. The class itself is fine. It basically revolves around you and your group creating a webpage and presenting it at the end of the year. A few tests. Not hard stuff. I left computer science and even I pulled off a good grade and think the class wasn't bad at all. He is super nice too. I wouldn't worry.

Great and actually best Professor I ever met. Yes, you are not required to attend the class but then you definitely will miss something. The lecture is clear and well organized, you can ask any questions related to the class. Professor Dunn is also very friendly and welcome student to ask questions during the office hours.
Knowledgeable prof with great bedside manner and a good sense of humor. Dr. Dunn is great!

Dunn does not care if you show up to class at all and he just lectures from a bunch of power points. His quizzes aren't worth a lot but they are all memorization, so be prepared for that. I wouldn't say that he's a great teacher but he's not terrible.
One of the most engaging professors I've had and class was entirely on Zoom. Very easy grader for the most part, just cares that you try to understand the material. 100% would take again.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr.Ferrara is one of my favorite professors ever!They are so understanding and caring, loves what they teach and you can tell through the passion they have, gives extensions for most assignments, has about 1-2 extra credit,and the assignments are not difficult at all you just can't lack through the semester you have to keep up.Definitely recommend!

Dr. Ferrara genuinely cares a lot about their subject and it shows. They are extremely understanding regarding deadlines and outside issues and are always available to meet. The one time I went to their office hours, they gave me a lot of valuable feedback on my final paper. I would only say that you'll have to do a lot of writing.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: One of the best humanities teachers ever. PERIOD.

Amazing professor, who knows how to give the best insights on papers you will need to draft and finalize throughout the course. They also provide the best perspectives when it comes to class discussions and they know how to engage the class and make them feel as if the class is not just a normal English class, but a safe space to discuss anything.
Most amazing CAL professor. Took their 103 and 105 class. Very easy as long as you attend class and do your work. Overall, a great professor and person.

I took this professor for both CAL classes, and I don't regret it one bit. Participation matters, but the discussion is so engaging sometimes that it's not that bad. There is a lot of reading, but it's manageable. Put in the effort and it's an easy A. They give lots of good feedback on essays and tons of opportunities for extra credit. amazing prof

Mel Ferrara is the best CAL professor to take. Their class is very easy to get an A in as long as you put in the effort. Yes it can be a lot of reading but it really isn't that bad and the discussions are really interesting sometimes. They give lots of good feedback on essays and tons of opportunities for extra credit. 10/10. I highly recommend!!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Very good Professor. Class is engaging and readings are interesting. I have had them for both CAL 103 and 105 and would take a class with them again. Feedback is constructive and the professor is very reachable outside of class hours.
Prof Ferrara was amazing. Easy class, cared about your grade and well-being, only wanted student success. Made transition to college writing easy as well.

Prof Ferrara is one of the best professors I've had over my 4 years at Stevens. Grades very fairly and gives a lot of opportunity to succeed in her class. Her classes are very interactive and not just lecture based. I would 100% recommend to take her classes for her teaching style is great!

Professor Ferrara is meant to teach. I was fortunate enough to be in their course for my first two semesters in college, and their class is always a pleasure to be in. They are clearly passionate about our course topic (Sports), which makes lectures interesting and engaging. Do your best and you will succeed. I highly recommend taking their course.
Very kind, knowledgeable and helpful

Dr. Ferrara is one of the best writing professors I have had. They are always accessible outside of class and willing to read your essays offering feedback. She is a lenient grader and is open to everyone's ideas and opinions. Probably the best English professor at Stevens.

Professor Ferrara has to be one of my favorite professors/teachers I've had. They are clearly passionate about both the subject matter and helping students succeed in it. Each assignment, whether its just a worksheet or an essay is sent back with an abundance of helpful feedback. They are an amazing professor and an amazing person!
Great communication. Very accessible. Genuinely cares about students and is flexible if you are having difficulties. Gives great feedback and also accepts feedback.

This is easily the least stressful class I've ever taken. The professor very organized, very straightforward with expectations, grades incredibly quickly, and leaves amazing feedback on writing assignments. I genuinely feel like a better writer after taking this class. Also, they're a super kind person! They baked us cookies for our last class :)
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Ferrara is a great professor who is understanding of your other responsibilities. There is a clear rubric with every assignment, and they are happy to answer any questions in class or over email. The workload is very manageable.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: I suck at language arts but I still have an A PLUS. Easy grader!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: His lectures are very engaging and easy to pay attention to. He is very passionate about the material and makes linear algebra so easy to understand.The homework are also pretty light and the exams are similar to material discussed in class.His final was a little bit rough,but I still got a B+ on the final and an A in the course. Highly recommend.

The best math professor I had so far! Dr. Sohrabi is funny and at the same time makes lectures very entertaining. The class is not hard at all if you just attend the lectures and do the homework. You could always go to his office during hours to ask a question and he will be there for you. This class is a breeze.
Had him for a summer session of calculus of two variables. Good-humored and provides clear explanations; would recommend to anyone.

He is pretty funny, making frequent jokes to engage the class. Teaches in an excellent manner with a projecting (no pun intended) voice and is very easy to understand. Clearly knows the material well. Asks engaging questions. Makes the course easy to understand and practice the material. Homework and tests are very fair. Highly recommend Sohrabi.

You can really tell Sohrabi is passionate about teaching linear algebra and just math in general. He's a very nice guy and is able to explain the concepts well. Weekly homework for this class, but it is usually pretty short.

Differential Geometry is one of the hardest courses I've taken at Stevens. Having a small class size helped Professor Sohrabi convey more topics to a class centered around math enthusiasts. Overall, Professor Sohrabi is amazing at lecturing and always helps out whenever he can. I highly recommend him and was easily one of the best professors I had
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Great guy, you can tell he cares. A little intense with urging people to participate. Class was hard as hell though. He will make time to answer questions and meet with you outside of class time. Did my best not to let his explanations go over my head since he understands calculus a lot better than me. Would have liked to have him in person too.

Multivariable calc is not an easy class, but Prof. Sohrabi made it understandable. He can seem a little intimidating at first, but he genuinely cares about his students, and if you show you care, he'll reward that investment. He does a good job of presenting the material, and if you ask a question, he'll be sure to answer it. Take him if you can!

Best professor I have had at Stevens. Lecture is very clear and makes difficult subject matter easier to understand. He really cares about the students and always willing to help students. Took the class in McLean with no a/c and a white board the size of a post it note, but he made me love the class regardless!
If you don't understand something, go to his office hours. He genuinely cares about the students, and he wants to see them succeed.
He can be hard to understand at times, but he cares about the students and will work with anyone in order to help you bring your grade up.
Him and Serbin are the best math teachers in the department. A little difficult to understand sometimes but is always will to put the time in to make sure you do well.
Loved him! Best math teacher here
He was a great professor and I liked him so much i am trying to find a way to be in his Calc II class. I really liked the way he explained things

great professor. he is foreign (obviously) but he speaks loudly and clearly and his lectures are informative and well structured. had i gone to all of them and not sucked at calc i would have gotten an A but i guess that goes for most things.
He's very nice and a great professor at Stevens. One of the few good math professors here.
He is an amazing teacher and makes the material easy to digest. He is very clear about what is going to be on the tests.
Best Professor at Stevens
Great teacher. He was my ta and I switched into his class. He makes class interesting and he is a great professor.
hot nice and very helpful i love him !
Great teacher!

The only reason why I got a B+ is because in the beginning of the semester, I did not know what a cosine was. He is so helpful, I don't know what I would've done if I had another professor. Dr. Kaz rocks!
Extremely helpful
hes really nice and really helpful
good teacher
I got a D in calc I. I registered for Kaz for calc II now I have an A. He's a really great teacher

Kaz is one of the best, if not the best, prof at stevens.  he is helpful, kind, and extremely smart.  i've never had a teacher that would sit for hours helping me through material...take calc 1 and 2 with him, rearrange your schedule, do wahtever you can b/c you will do well in his class if you put the time in.
kaz is awesome!  take calc 1 and 2 with him!!! he's a great prof and super nice guy! go to office hours if you ever have a hard time, he's very helpful...
Takes a relatively interesting subject and makes it insufferable. Not coherent at all. Needs to work on his verbal skills.

Enjoyed the class and the professor is great
Professor Gaurav Sabnis can make marketing such a boring subject.

A complete waste of time. Dont tell me I didn't warn you.

Professor Gaurav Sabnis made an interesting subject very complicated. He gave pop culture examples which were not relevant to the topics. Overall, an avoidable course by Professor Gaurav Sabnis.

Zumrut is a very nice professor and knows a lot about Python. She always encourages her students to ask questions and gives out candy to people who participate. However, she covered topics very quickly, this class was difficult for me because of how fast-paced it was.

She is such a great person who truly cares about her the success of her students. She is more than willing to help you out. CS 115 was a generally easy class if you have prior coding experience, however, you could catch me at office hours a lot because there was usually a challenge function or two per hw that some guidance was useful for.

Didn't know much Python, but Akcam's lectures made learning easy. Classes are very engaging and often interactive, and she makes sure to slow down/re-iterate if students are confused. Generous late work policy and the tests are easy if you really study. The posted slideshows and notes are sometimes not great, so be sure to take notes during class.

omg if you can make sure you take Dr. Akcam's class. she keeps her lectures simple so they're really easy to follow and she doesn't overcomplicate any topics like a lot of profs tend to do. she's also very understanding and you can just tell she cares about her students. the course is a bit fast-paced but that's more the school curriculum than her.
She is hands down the best professor.

Dr. Akcam is easily the best teacher to introduce coding. Her amazing personality always cheers her students up, and she provides a good challenge while guiding them to success. I recommend her all the way!
Engaging professor, made each class interesting. Not an easy A, but if you put the work in and pay attention it isn't bad

Akcam Kibis is the GOAT. Lectures are engaging and funny, she explains the material well. Make sure to do the homeworks and labs because those are the best for actually understanding the topics. She will give out chocolates if you are the first to have a complete solution to practice problems. It's easy to participate -- don't skip this class!

Dr. Akcam is great, her personality is so genuine and lights up the whole room. The class can get difficult, but it's not as artificial as 115's insane curriculum. The final exam had a 90% average, so just stay consistent and thorough, and you'll be more than fine. The few CAs I've interacted with are also effective and caring of the student body.

She is a very nice person and teaches well. She makes funny jokes and tests aren't unfair. The one bad thing I would say is I think she doesn't have good control over a large class, especially ones where a few kids can be disruptive almost every single class.

Literally an amazing professor. I didn't know how to code at all coming into her class and she was able to teach everything in a way that got me to end her class with an A. Definitely a difficult class but I think that she was very helpful and a very good professor that I am choosing to take again next semester

PHENOMENAL professor - and that is an understatement! Professor Akcam cares about her students and is extremely kind, funny, and relatable. Although this course is not beginner-friendly, it is not her doing. Her lectures are very well done and she takes the time to make sure her students understand the material. Take her class, you won't regret it!

Professor Zumrut is one of the best lecturers I have had. She makes sure you understand what she is teaching, she is funny, and makes class interactive. She teaches through drawings, code, examples, etc. She is very open to questions. 10/10 professor.
She keeps class entertaining and helps make the information very understandable.

She is an okay professor but the way the class is structured is horrible, especially for people who have never coded. She focuses way too much on recursion. It is supposed to be an "intro" class yet the class simply another weed out class with a professor who is not willing to help those with less programming experience.

She is a real sweetheart. The homework for CS 284 can be difficult, but is assigned weeks in advance so using your time wisely is a must. Midterm and final were challenging but fair on the topics she covered. At the end of the day she wants you to succeed. If you have the chance definitely take Zumrut as your professor!

Professor Akcam's lectures are fantastic, as she not only manages to simplify complex material into easily digestible slides, but her sense of humor makes the class really fun. The only issue that I had with the class was that there was a group project for the final project,but other than that everything was amazing and I would highly recommend it.

Hard intro class, but it's not Ackam's fault as she has implied her distaste for the "weed out" curriculum. Go to Office hours for help she and her TA's are very generous, and while the final was optional, I took it anyway, and unless I got a 104.5, I'm certain anyone who took the final just got a grade bump without actually caring how they did.

Professor Akcam has been one of my favorite professors in college. The lectures are very informative and cover everything needed to succeed in future classes. If you have the option, I seriously recommend Professor Akcam.
Excellent professor moves a bit quickly but ultimately has to keep the class at an appropriate pace. She really does want you to do well and is great during recitation.
Lecture moves very fast, and exams were hard to prepare for. But she's solid.
Too casual when teaching materials, does a horrible job overall

She is a confusing teacher who is overly strict regarding attendance and rarely accepts any reason as to why you missed a class She is also effectively useless when you have an issue as the TAs do more work than the professors in the Chem department She is basically a worse version of an already boring $600 textbook that you sell your soul to buy

The professor would literally just read off the slides and wasn't very helpful at all. Sometimes students, including myself, have asked her a question and she would say "maybe it's this" or "I don't know." Doesn't really teach well so I'm purposely avoiding her for Gen Chem II.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Don't make the huge mistake of taking her.

The lecture moves very quickly, and you have to put in a ton of work on your own if you want to do well. Even if you work really hard you still might not do as well as you would like, but she is more receptive and likely to help you if you show you care about the material. Just don't be a distraction in class.

Although some people complain about this class, it really comes down to how bad YOU want an A. Prof. Alluri is really kind and approachable. If you have any questions at all, she is willing to meet with you. (Just send her an email.)If you take ownership of your learning and ask questions, Alluri will help you achieve your goals for the class.

Read previous reviews and decided to take her but ultimately regretted it. Flat and boring, chooses to talk in circles with no depth rather than explain things clearly. Obsessed with calling on students who aren't paying attention in a lecture hall of 50+ students like it's a middle school class. Stick with Muisener

Dr. Alluri was an excellent professor for Instrumental Analysis II. I learned so much from this class, her lectures were exceptionally clear, and all of the examples from class really helped with studying for the exams (of which there are a lot). The tests were fair and very well-written.
Ineffective at lecturing, glosses over most topics. Be prepared to use Khanacademy

The tests are much harder than the material taught in class and recitation. The averages are low, and do not at all reflect the amount of work put in by the students. . comment: She was a tough grader, but as long as you showed the effort (i.e. going to the Writing and Communications Center), she would help you and definitely give you the benefit of the doubt. Dr. Minsloff is definitely a rough grader and expects a lot of her students, but if you can shrug off that pressure she will turn you into an excellent writer She's very fair with accommodating students and also cares to see you succeed. Literally the worst The only good reviews of her are her, I agree with the other comment right below this one. comment: Attending lectures is extremely important as the notation used in class can be very confusing and tough to understand. comment: Subjects are difficult but she makes it more difficult. I can't really understand what she teaches. Tough on grades. Be ready to work damn hard!!!

Very bad hand writing, and never explain questions clearly. The test is too difficult, even 2/3 people on the lecture got fail in the test, she still wont curve on change the scale. If a lecture have more than half students get an F in an exam, the professor should curve the grade or find his problems.

i'm very surprised about the other review of her teaching in ma 222.  the tests were easy, bonus points on each exam and she offered an optional make-up exam.  i never got below 100.  she fell far behind on the syllabus and i wish we covered more material.

I am concidering filing a complaint with the administration about this professor. Very unhelpful, extremely unclear explanation of the material.Did not conduct a test review or provided a formula sheet as she promised. Beware of this professor, do not take this class with her.
she is a good teacher, very knowledgeable.

Not too difficult in linear algebra.  Not a good instructor, but her tests were very straightforward.  Very smart lady, and very kind if you get to know her.  Just not that great at teaching...or at least teaching in english.
Makes easiest class, very difficult/impossible.
Richard is a great guy who teaches very well, people rate him hard because the don't like the course and take it out on him. he's really pretty good
very nice and respected teacher with a passion for his work. you will have to listen to a few rambles but they are very rich in knowledge when you pay attention.

good old rich get way to much hate! all you people saying he makes you do to much or doesn't round up are just coping. if you pay attention and go to all the lectures and study correctly you will do just fine 5/5
He didn't get to evil with the grades this year, so that's a big plus for me! Good old "No Round Up Richie" never rounds up my grade, and God do I love him for it!
wow so cool!
Good old Richie "Don't Round Up" Eitel couldn't find it in his heart to give me the 0.06% more I needed for an A.  Also, most boring lecturer I know

While not a personal favorite professor, he definitely deserves more credit than people give him. He tries to make the class interactive, and the class is pretty easy if you put some effort in. He does his best in a large lecture class, and is willing to help and wants you to pass.
awful

I understand his intention of making this course better. However, for a course that most of engineering students don't need and will forget one week after the final, he is literally asking too much. Most of students have more important things to do, like improving professional skills for each one's major. Apparently no one in this school cares.

He's really a great professor. A lot of people bicker and moan about his assignments but most of those people don't go to lecture. His class is really easy if you go to lecture and do the homework. He's also a really nice person if you go to after class. He does deserve to be treated better since he has to deal with two of the largest classes.

Professor Eitel was a solid professor that made the class very very. He was upfront about what he expects and as long as students attend lecture and do the homework, the texts are not hard. Overall, one of Stevens better professors.

Professor Eitel broke down the material for students and spent time making sure that it was understood. He was a very good and professional teacher and what I learned from his class still is with me today. Exams were only difficult if you did not take the time and do the HW. HW was challenging but allowed students to get a firmer grasp of material.

Class is easy. Grading is lenient on HW, reading quizzes, etc. Lectures are not always particularly useful or interesting, but test questions are pretty much exactly from lectures. I missed more than a couple lectures and did OK. I would suggest getting a pdf of the textbook (don't bother buying one)

class is mandatory but stupid. Didn't learn ANYTHING from lectures, just from old tests and old homeworks and what I taught myself from the book. Which wasn't much because the book is not very relevant. Too bad this class is mandatory and he's the only professor.

It has only been a few weeks and this is misery. He assigns 100 pages of reading for a 10 minute open book quiz. I'm not sure of his difficulty yet because the first test is tomorrow. But i'm terrified for my grade.

Professor Naumann is a good teacher, but he sort of expects you to know the course before coming in. Several times I have asked him questions and his answers haven't been helpful. I often had to figure out stuff myself. However, he teaches well and is very knowledgeable. He is also funny. He taught the course well enough that I currently TA for it.

Highly recommended you take up a bit of Python as you can drown from the workload! Functional programming is the core of how the textbook teaches so beware! Honestly he's a down to earth guy. TAs are super helpful. As long as you dedicate time to understand topics and go office hours when needed you'll do great. The weekly HW will improve skills.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy

comment: Very good at teaching cs115. The way he repeats himself reminds me of Khan Academy. You will definitely have an edge if you know programming before, but you should be fine after 2 months into the course without any knowledge beforehand. New programmers will definitely struggle initially. He is accessible through the Piazza website

Teaches effectively in the lecture, need to listen in class to get a good grade as he even says himself that the slides aren't meant to be the only thing you learn from. A couple especially difficult homework assignments that you need to do outside research to be able to complete, but not unmanageable. Good professor.

David's CS115 class is not beginner friendly. If you have to take this class as part of your major, I highly suggest learning a bit of Python beforehand. He expects you to practice daily out of class, as if students don't have lives, and is very arrogant. The homework and pop quizzes are incredibly difficult and time consuming. Good luck.

Naumann seems like a cool dude at first.  In reality, he is one of the most rude people I have ever had an interaction with.  He is very conceited and when asked questions he responds with a condescending tone.  Not very helpful when I asked him questions.  A few times I asked him simple questions and he told me to figure it out myself.  Avoid.

He's a great person and wants everyone to learn/do well/be interested in interesting things. The only downside is that he is a little disorganized and you might have to seek him out. Grade real tough too.

Not a very helpful professor and his lectures were very boring and hard to pay attention in. Clearly a smart guy but doesn't explain concepts very well or communicate politely. Often was late in giving the TA's lab solutions and had MANY typos or errors in Labs/Homeworks code that made them impossible to complete without TA assistance.

He is very smart but doesn't do a good job simplifying difficult material. I found him next to useless as a discrete structures teacher. I myself am not a CS guy so I didn't understand some of the stuff he kept rambling on about all the time

i found it pretty tough to pay attention in his lectures, and that reflected in my test scores a bit. i did decently but if i managed to actually take notes and be thoughtful during class, i would have aced everything. he knows what he's doing
Great professor. Better hats.

Generally a good teacher. You will have some very difficult programming assignments, and they will take some time. He's clear enough when he speaks, but most of your learning will come from the assignments.

Decent professor. Assignments will be challenging at times and expect to dedicate a lot of time to it. But if you do the assignments, the tests will be pretty easy. If you pay attention in class at least slightly you'll do fine.
Great, caring, thoughtful professor.
One of the worst professors I ever had.
hard to understand, extremely fast paced and difficult topics covered

Terrible teacher. She can barely speak english which is not a complete problem, but she cant explain her slides at all which leaves students dumbfounded. I think maybe 3 students in my class of 20 knew what was going on. She just sucks.

The professor tried so very hard to make this class work out, but there was a rift between the students and teacher that we couldn't cross. She just could not connect with us, and no one was learning. When the majority of the class failed the first test, she seemed to accept her plans wouldn't work, and the class effectively became 'A for effort'.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: She's awful. She doesn't seem to know what she's talking about in an introductory class and whenever someone asks a question, we end up more confused after she answers. I honestly believe that just reading the book and looking at the slides would be more beneficial than actually taking this class because that's all we learn from anyway.

This class was terrible. She's confusing, doesn't explain things well, and recites the textbook if you ask a question or are confused. It is a difficult topic, but she doesn't do much to assist with approaching it. She also can be mean to students at times.

Also had for 496. Her lectures are right from the slides. I wouldn't say I learned much, but it is definitely not hard to do well in the class you just need to go. Half the points are from quizzes u don't even need to do that well on and she gives so much extra credit I don't know how any one can do too bad

Difficult to understand her accent. Reads Power Point slides which are out of the book verbatim for the entire lecture. Encourages struggling students to drop the course instead of offering help. Avoid at all costs.
Mean. Literally most of the class is failing. Not good at helping.
Worst Prof ever at Stevens. We spent as much time heraring her complain abut her husband as we did (supposedly) learning about CS. Skip her at all costs!

I will never, ever, ever take a class from Adriana again. She talks way too much about her husband(ex?) and personal life and she makes me totally uncomfortable. She will never help a student. I'm actually confused about the contributor that describes her as "helpful". I just do not believe she's capable of that.

Worst prof I've ever had. I accidentally asked her about a test ques. that she phrased wrong. She was actually yelling and screaming at the class about how intelligent she was, and how we were just "peasants" (her words) compared to her "wealth of knowledge". I guess she didn't realize that she's human - lacking integrity and character.
The courses may be boring but don't take these courses with another Prof.  She is real nice and offers a LOT of help. If you do the weekly quizzes you get a decent grade.
No Comments
Avoid classes offered by this prof.
No Comments

No Homeworks, 1 test, 1 presentation, both super easy if you just put in a fair amount of time and effort. If you just pay attention to the lectures, the test will be super easy and the presentation has alot of bonus. Not for beginners because its alot of research and theory, but niether is 559, so you may as well start here where grading is easier

He is an excellent instructor, and I highly recommend taking his courses, especially in AI and Machine Learning. He is fair and rewards hard work, offering good grades to students who perform well on exams. To succeed in his class, staying engaged is important, asking questions during lectures to ensure he knows you.
Research oriented course. Not for beginners. Most of the lectures will give you deep understanding of machine learning algorithms.

He is not fit to be a professor. Terrible teaching quality and perfunctory notes in the classroom. You won't learn anything except to watch him show off his math skills, so don't be fooled by previous good reviews.
A midterm and a final thats all you have to show your understanding. Good luck trying to understand his notes, hes a nice professor but he is not curving grades. No office hours or TA office hours!
If you choose his class, you must have a strong math background. Fortunately, he typically offers a curve.
This course is 100% Math class. No any code assignment. It has quiz, exam and notes. The lecture is very hard. You cannot understand unless you have stronger math and machine learning background.
No coding assignments, only homework is latex notes for a few of the lectures with a partner. Offers extra credit. Easiest grader I've had and laid back atmosphere.
easygoing
Amazing knowledge about Statistical Machine Learning and AI. Must take class if you want to get into Machine Learning research!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes--Caring

comment: Nice professor and I would like to strongly recommend you to take his course like AI and ML. You will learn much in his class.

Best Professor i have ever met. His course is quite tough but if you pay attention it's really useful class. He will teach you very well during office hours and will definitely give yo good time after class also if you have any doubts.
Really good professor. Concern about this is his first year of teaching, I believe he will become perfect!
Great course!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: He's a really good professor, his course is quite tough and even his voice is quite low but he's very helpful. If you don't understand a topic in his class then you can meet him during his office hours and he is always ready to teach you. And even he's grading is good.

Everyone complains about ME thermo but honestly it's probably because they don't go to lecture. GO TO LECTURE! prof. choi is an awesome lecturer and is VERY knowledgeable in the subject and is very willing to help students grasp the material, but being present to learn/ask questions is a must for this class. Do the work yourself and you'll be fine.
His class is very hard but he taught it well. The class is very test heavy so if you dont show up to leactures your kind of screwed.

The material for Thermo is boring, but Professor Choi did a good job of keeping the class engaging. He goes over examples almost every class, which are helpful when studying for the tests. He also told some fun random stories. If you attend lecture, take notes, and do the homework you should have everything you need to succeed in this class.

He has changed!!!! He is such an amazing professor and really takes take to go over practice problems that will be on the exam. IF YOU ARE MECH E YOU NEED TO KNOW THIS STUFF. Don't skip lecture, actually try to understand the Wiley's, and you'll be fine. If there's one class you should pay attention to, its this one. #ChoiBoys4Life.
He is a king. He gives good lectures and will go over important topics a lot to make sure everyone understands. Homework is 40% of the grade so that was great. Quiz's are pretty easy.
Having Choi for 235 was a pleasure.

Professor Choi is one of the best professors I've had at Stevens. His lectures are super informational, and he goes over everything thoroughly. He makes the concepts easy to visualize in real life scenarios. He is super relatable through sharing his own engineering experience which is very humanizing.  Show up to class and you'll do just fine.

First semester teaching the class and he did well.  He gave us good examples, albeit the ones Zahra uses, but still great for us to comprehend.  The recitation and homework are useful in this class.  I don't think many people were too focused in the lecture, but it's a gen ed for most people.  Probably 30% of the class showed up on a good day.

It was his first time teaching the material and it showed. He had also admitted that thermo was his worst class when he was in school. The material is difficult and you don't learn much from his lectures anyways.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Choi's class is my favorite class so far, his lectures are interesting and he is very knowledgeable. He makes sure to repeat things to make them stick. He is great at connecting concepts and he proves the equations that we use in a digestible way. His lectures keep me entertained the whole time, his mannerisms remind me of a movie character.

I had a 4.0 coming into this class and tried hard but his lectures are unhelpful and the PowerPoints are cluttered. His handwriting is atrocious, he lectures at us, and has a very thick accent - so overall hard to follow. He'll say all semester no curve, but it's a lie since the class is so hard and everyone fails the exams.

The teaching itself was great, he is very knowledgeable in Thermodynamics and taught the material well, but the grading scheme was tough. 95+ is an A, 90-95 is A-, and so on. DO THE HOMEWORK WITH A GROUP. We use WileyPLUS wwhich makes getting points on the hw difficult even if you understand the content. HW was 40% of the grade too

Choi is a really nice guy. He's actually pretty easy to understand, but he does have an accent. Thermo was pretty boring, and while his lectures could have easily been compressed into 15 minutes, he does share plenty of useful information and hints about the tests. I wouldn't hesitate to take his class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Very knowledgeable and is good at explaining. Sometimes class can be a bit boring because he moves slowly through lectures; but he does so to reiterate important points. Even though attendance is not taken during class, it's important to go because he gives relevant information before quizzes that will prepare you.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--TEST HEAVY

comment: Not a good teacher at all. Very nice person, but can't understand what he says in class, and the people who do well in the class are those that cheat and bring the solutions manual to tests with them. Working hard in this class is useless.

Clearly knowledgable, however cannot teach that knowledge. He spent a lot of time repeating inapplicable information. Lectures and in-class examples dragged on and had nothing to do with homework and exams. He was equally unhelpful for 1-on-1 extra help. Thermo is an important course, take with a different professor or find a very good tutor.
Lecture time is not used effectively.  Homework problems involve very different concepts than those presented in lecture.  Textbook is not particularly helpful.

Ting Lu was a great professor, she's really passionate about astronomy and you can tell she knows a lot about it. She also cares a lot about her students (especially ones that participate), she learns names quick and will remember you.

Professor Lu is the best, I have had her for 3 classes now and she is by far the professor that cares the most about her students. Attendance isn't required, but if you don't go to class you will miss important info. Class is straightforward.

Her voice is very soft and I honestly think she would be better at narrating meditation podcasts than teaching lectures, being in there makes me want to fall asleep. She is knowledgeable in her subject, but teaches too much information for an introduction course. Her slides are useless for studying and "study guides" are just topics lists

This professor is kind and puts in good effort in making her lectures engaging. I can tell she is genuinely knowledgeable about the content she is teaching. However, the lectures cover an excessive amount of information for it being an intro class. Her slides are useless and the study topics she posts barely appear on the actual quizzes/exams.

Professor Lu is awesome. Super nice and the class is very fair, no surprises and she really tries to cover content in an engaging way by getting the class to participate. Plus her slides are fun, you never get fun slides in college anymore
made me love astronomy

Super nice, I know a lot of people say her lectures are boring, but if you just sit down and listen/participate they're actually fun. She doesn't care if you get the answer wrong. I feel bad for the lack of participation people give her, I think it makes it more difficult to lecture to kids who obviously don't want to be there
Super passionate and nice professor. If you just show up to lecture, do the hw the class is fine. She's open to talking more about whatever you're interested in if you ask her a question. :)
Straightforward professor, no surprises

She is one of the most boring teachers I have had in my whole life. You will learn nothing in lecture all year. We are two weeks in and 80% of the kids and lecture don't even show up because it is pointless. Every time i go to lecture I regret it.

Professor Lu was very technical and informative when it came to the actual material. She explains things at a higher level than I think most non-physics majors are ready for/appreciate. I think the better professor for getting an A in the course is Chatterjee, but she actually goes much more in depth and is probably better suited for physics majors

Professor Lu is genuinely interested in her subject. Her lectures are often a bit slow, but she's more than willing to talk to you about any concepts you're interested in/confused about and is very approachable. Homeworks and labs are very easy, but you need to know your stuff for her exams; she does give extra credit and grace periods though.

My experience with her has been great, as while her lectures may be a tad bit "boring" in the end she has done a very good job at teaching the material. She's a very fair professor and will reasonably accommodate It's a physics class, so you WILL need to work towards your grade The methods she's taught me have worked, but if they don't, go to a TA

I'm gonna be honest, the class kinda sucks. I don't like speaking bad on anyone, but Ting Lu is definitely not the greatest professor. Very lecture heavy. You'll want to fall asleep every time. She does not explain things very well. After a while, some of the equations will just get lost in your head. It's not that terrible, but it's pretty sucky.

Ting does not know how to get information clear to her students. There needs to be a standard for professors and she falls well below. She basically sabotaged my grade by claiming I would be able to take a test that I was ill for and then refusing to agree to that later on. In the end she refused to give me the extra .02% that would put me at an A

This class is as easy as you make it for yourself. He is very willing to help students and is very thorough in teaching. How assignments/labs/HWs are weighted can really benefit students who may struggle in this subject. He is very good with the course structure. What is being reached also lines up very well with lab content.

Professor Mahmoud is great; very engaging professor and teaches the material in an understandable way, but some concepts are skimmed over so the textbook is great to supplement. Attendance for lectures is not mandatory, but exams are taken during the lecture times on specific days so be careful. He was truly one of the colleagues of all time.

Dr. Mahmood teaches and is engaging but should never be able to decide the content. His time management makes this course more difficult then necessary, because he spends 2 months teaching V=IR and all its variations then a fraction of the time through all AC circuit concepts when that material is much more challenging and everyone is lost.
WHERE ARE YOU?
He's a really good professor, the material in the lectures are boring but he makes up for it with his humor.

Pros 
- Teaches and explains the material well
- Calls us his colleagues
- Approachable and offers help 

Cons
- Sometimes hard to understand and has moments of stuttering
- Homework is due at 8 PM on Saturdays which is IMO, dumb

Absolutely abysmal, I wouldn't take another class with him if you paid me to. Homework assignments are due at 8pm on Saturdays and they lock immediately after. Difficult to understand, over-proctoring exams, lack of study material, I can list 100 reasons to avoid this guy.
My colleagues, place yourself into the node and you will have great success in this class.

This is to date the only professor I had that where I attended the lecture not becuase I needed to but becuase of how well he taught. This was by all regards a skippable class in which I went to every lecture because of how fun, engaging, intuitive and thorough his classes were.

Mahmoud is the most enthusiastic professor I've had at Stevens. He clearly wants everyone to actually learn from his course, and puts in effort to make lectures engaging and entertaining. He does a lot of example problems in class, and does a lot to help review for the tests. It's a difficult class, but he puts in a lot of effort to help everyone.

Class starts off easy so I stopped paying attention and now its most likely going to be my lowest grade this semester.  Don't skip lecture, he is really entertaining and caring and just wants to help you succeed.
He is an amazing professor overall, much respect for him

My colleagues, he is a great professor that deeply cares about us.  He always stops to ask us if we have any questions.  By using his "take a walk" principle and repeating cdvdt constantly, I understood most of the class.  Class is fairly full for a class that isn't needed by many majors.

He's one of the good ones. Does his absolute best to make sure everyone understands the material. He's very understanding, funny, and an overall cool dude. Make sure you go to the pre exam reviews especially for 232, and take thorough notes during lectures.
Really just a great dude all around. You can tell how much he cares about teaching and he gives off dad energy. He's always ready to help!

He is so passionate about what he is teaching it makes it enjoyable to listen and learn. He also has such a great grip on the concepts that he is able to explain things in different ways so everyone can learn

My favorite lecture to go to. He is so devoted to making sure everyone does well . He constantly posts surveys to see how he can improve his class. His final was boarder line impossible, but he added 5 whole points to everyone's final grade. Tests are challenging but he gave make up quizzes and sometimes made tests take home/ dropped one quiz.

Professor Al-Quzwini is absolutely amazing! He's such a sweetheart and will do anything to help you understand/pass the class. He makes his lectures interesting and easy to follow. Do the homework and pay attention to what he tells you and you will do fine. Also watch the reviews for the quizzes, he usually does almost exact questions different #s.

Professor Al-Quzwini poured his heart into this course. The tests were sometimes hard, even though the review covers them very well. However, he works with his class to any ends to make sure he does right by them. His care and effort he put into the class is absolutely amazing, and although the course can be hard, he made it worthwhile. Great guy!

Do not take her class. Take my advice! She try her best to deduct your points. She satisfied for deduct points. You can't get an A. You can't argue with her. She would say that is not her problem. It is you deserve this points. I got all A in other classes. I work very hard but no use for this class. You can't change her style.

Very boring lecturer. Basically repeats the textbook. Minimal classroom interaction, just stands there and babbles on for a few hours without enthusiasm. Tests require you to memorize and recite the textbook, instead of applying your knowledge on applicable problems and test questions.

I have had her for CS 105, 115, 146, and 347. Honestly I really like the woman. Many students don't understand that you need to read the book (146 and 347) to do well in the class. She elaborates in lectures and actually tells you what to read in the book so its not hard if you put in the effort. Her method get annoying at time but get the point ac

Professor Schwartz was wonderful.  She was always able to help after class.  She would even do some of the homework with me when I was having trouble.  Most of the homework problems can be found in the textbook.  Always see her or the TA for help.  Lab quizzes were a lot harder than the tests.

Such an easy class--her tests and assignments are never really difficult. However, her lectures are almost never of help. Your TA is the key to understanding concepts, so make sure to attend LABS, NOT lectures.

Extremely boring professor. She'll often take a simple concept that can be covered in 30 seconds and drag it out over 30 minutes (just like the textbook you will need). Many times she starts talking about when she used to work as an Assembly programmer. While it's easy to get a good grade in the class, her grading scales are rather sporadic.
Boreing an sucks ass as a teacher shes uses her text book as a crutch cuz she cannot teach for the life of her.
If you have this professor without a recitation, without a lab, or without prior knowledge, expect to fail this class

Terrible teacher. Useless. Boring lectures. Either you can learn the material on your own or you will fail. I don't know who wrote that she is "helpful" here. Even if you completely understand the material, her tests are graded stupidly strictly. Tests are based on memorizing syntax of MATLAB and are done on paper. AVOID TAKING THIS PROFESSOR.

This woman cannot teach computer science for her life. Her lectures and examples come straight out of the book. She is useless without her notes. She deferred to the TA for any questions regarding programming assignments.
Not good at teaching an introduction to scientific computing.  Tests are all written in this course...not fun and not similar to how a lot of programming will be done at Stevens.

She is probably not the best teacher in the world however if you get to know her she will help you out.  She knows her stuff and is willing to help students if you put in the effort.   The above statment is from someone who is clearly not a CS major and therefore went into the class with a bad attitude.
She is the root of all evil. In the words of Iron Maiden, "Run to the hills. Run for your lives."
No Comments
I had no idea what I was doing nor cared about the subject, and got an A- by putting in a normal level of effort, so pretty good class considering it was required.

You probably don't have a choice in taking his class but be happy that you are taking it. Dr. De Rosa is the best professor I have had so far, he clearly cares a lot about the students and thinks deeply about how he teaches. He grades the exams and is very forgiving. I clearly messed up 2 things on an exam and still got a 100.

Made this class a breeze. Definitely need to pay attention in lecture, as conceptual questions sometimes appear on tests. Workshops are super helpful, I did about 90% of the learning there, and they are accurately reflected on the tests. Abundant online resources too; you could pass without ever attending if it weren't required.

Probably best professor I’ve had at Stevens. Really cares about teaching, is in every single workshop along with the TAs. Even knows people’s names when he has over 100 students. He always seems open to helping and makes the seemingly hard material easy to understand.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: This charming lad is able to dispel Thermo to us normie engies. the brit is able to make thermo understandable! review sessions are basically what will be on exams. DO study for exams as doing bad on them will drop u a letter grade or two. the grading scheme tho is totally fair for a sophomore class. imo De Rosa is the ideal professor!

This man is a perfect example of a great professor. His lectures are to the point and cover examples while the recitations are practice problems that accurately portray what to expect on the test. If you attend lectures, there is really no reason not to pass. He will help with whatever you need, whenever you need it as well. All-round great guy!

He is amazing and absolutely deserves all the hype! He cares so much about his students and gets to know you as an individual. He's eager to help you really learn the subject and will go out of his way to help you. His passion is infectious. I hate thermo, but I loved his class (and his accent) and I have the utmost respect for him. 100% recommend!

Prof. De Rosa is a great guy. He makes the material clear and genuinely cares that I understand the methodology to solve problems. Recitations are worth it if you stick with problems, and the homeworks are worth doing. The exams are generously graded if you know what you're doing but don't have every number right. The final was a fair challenge.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Caring

comment: I'm convinced that De Rosa is the only person that can make a four hour lecture on Thermodynamics on a Friday in the middle of the summer the highlight of my week. I wish I could submit more tags for this gem of a professor; 3 just don't do him justice. Anyway, 10/10. Fantastic professor, very chill. Experience him at least once if you can.
Great professor. I hurts his soul when he has to fail a student. VERY TOUGH exams especially final. Be prepared to visit him in offices hours a lot. NO CURVE!!! But still kind in grading.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: Great guy. Love the way he runs his lectures, and he also does recitations as well which is really helpful. And he goes out of his way to learn the name of every one of his students names.

He's a good lecturer. His notes are written down by him in class so you can always get everything, and he does example problems are actually valuable. He also teaches recitation, where he explains everything perfectly and is willing to stay after. Not intimidating to talk to at all. Very understanding about missed time.

Alex is an amazing professor. He truly cares about his students. He makes an effort to learn every name and takes time after class to talk about his students' interests and hobbies. If you show even a remote interest in your work, Alex will do everything he can to help out when you need it. 10/10 would SolidWorks again.
Incredible teacher. Explains the work really well. He really knows what he's doing. I'd go out of my way to take him again.

Dont take this class if you're not the best writer. There are 3 essays and she is very picky about how she wants you to write them. If you dont meet her expectations then this class isn't going to be easy. If you are having trouble with your writing, she'll just send you to the writing center and they dont help. I struggled to keep my B.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment:
Getting an A starts at 94 (idk if this is true for other teachers as well). It is very hard to get an A overall but she does two things that will improve your grade

1. She lets you rewrite 1 of the first 2 essays (you choose)

2. She lets you have a 1 week extension on 1 of the 2 (you choose) 

In total there are 3 essays, first 2 + final essay

Awful teacher. Grades completely subjectively. Started rambling about GMOs in class.

She expects a bunch of kids going to a STEM school to act like humanities is their primary concern. I withdrew from the class because I couldn't handle her rants in class about her personal opinions and how it leaked into her grading, I'm surprised they hired her.

Dr. Sims is an incredible professor, and the topic of the course is very interesting and applicable to today's world. However, if you are not a great writer, I would advise you to take a different class. If you are a good writer, you should have no issue in this class, and sims is very understanding and will work with you to improve your writing.
Very good CAL teacher. Engage with the course and material and you will get a lot out of the clsss.
Awful person all around and grades incredibly strictly. Very hard to determine what she wants. Would not recommend ever taking one of her classes... hands down the worst professor i have ever had
Sims is a very tough grader but not a bad teacher. Recommend to glaze and hyper her up to get better grades!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: She wasn't the worst at all, but a very tough and particular grader. She was very specific from what she wanted out of her papers, but it was very tough to meet all her criteria. Otherwise the homework wasn't terrible.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Had her for CAL 105 a bit ago and really enjoyed her. The grading was somewhat harsh admittedly-- particularly the final paper had a weird rubric-- but the lectures were great. Several nonstandard lessons throughout the semester and a topic deeply relevant to today's world, with interesting philosophies and sources behind it.

probably the hardest and strictest cal103 prof by far, but sims' grading criteria is no way unfair or not clear. show up everyday, do the work everyday, and take advantage of the 1 free revision and extra credit opportunities that pop up if you need it. not a class to slack off in.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Heavily encourages students to go to the Writing and Communications Center, then fails you off of the Writing and Communications Center's feedback. Had her two years ago but had to come back to let the new students know !!
Ridiculous grading system for her papers. Highly recommend not taking her classes, I believe she grades completely based on her opinions and not objectively. (DONT TAKE HER CLASS)

Do NOT take her class. My entire high school experience was learning how to write correct essays with correct citations, and I received under a 50 on my essay. All she had to say for it was to meet with the writing center. Awful feedback. The grading is completely opinion-based. If you meet the requirements you will still get 0's on the rubric.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: I had Sims for CAL 105 and do yourself a favor, don't take any of her classes. She is extremely particular about her essays yet gives students confusing feedback. The only way to succeed in this class is if you write exactly what Sims wants to read. Save your GPA and pick any other professor!

She is a very tough grader and doesn't give you very helpful feedback to work with. Most of the time just tells you to go to the writing center even if you already have. Attendance and participation is a MUST in the class. She does make you feel dumb if you don't know something.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: If you see this professor's name in your schedule, switch off that section. This professor gives terrible feedback if given any. Her lessons were mid af. She gives an absurd amount of homework every single class, she doesn't even look at half of those assignments. I do not recommend taking this course with her. (respectfully, she should transfer)
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: A dedicated professor who ensures students have a solid grasp of concepts by thoroughly working through example problems. He takes the time to build a strong foundation before advancing to new material, promoting understanding. His unique approach challenges students to think critically about statistics, making it a valuable learning experience.

Professor Pedro Villanova is by far the best instructor I've ever had. MA231 is a challenging course, but Pedro's guidance made all the difference. Without his support, I might have dropped out early on. He genuinely cares about helping students succeed and goes out of his way to make the material more approachable.
