I like the guy but he not a good teacher. If you excel at learning on your own time you will probably like the course. I found myself watching the clock. His slides are long and dense. Honestly I'm unhappy with Stevens that this is a required course and both the professors are bad.
pretty chill, but very dense lecture material
Thanks for this rewarding semester!
I have never been interested in optimization before, but this course has changed my perspective. The instructor's expertise and enthusiasm has made me a believer. Thank you!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback--So many papers

comment: This course was demanding but the instructor's approach made it manageable. I am grateful for their clear explanations and real-world examples. I feel much more equipped to tackle optimization problems in my future endeavors.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: The instructor was fantastic. The material was challenging, but the instructor's approachable and engaging teaching style made it manageable. I feel much more equipped to handle real-world optimization problems in my future endeavors.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--So many papers--Graded by few things

comment: I am so grateful to have taken this course. The instructor's expertise in optimization and data science truly shines through. This course was demanding, but so worth it. I feel confident in my ability to tackle complex optimization problems in my future career.
very tough grading
Genius.

Genuinely an awful professor. In lecture, he spends entire classes going over example problems he's done before, taking weeks to ever advance to new material. When he does, even the most concrete, real-world concepts in statistics are seemingly abstract and confusing when he teaches them. Avoid taking this class with him if you can.

Not a great teacher. Monotone voice makes it hard to pay attention. Doesn't seem to care if anyone is paying attention. Repeats the same examples multiple times and falls behind. Heavily dependent on the slides (though this isn't a bad thing). Doesn't motivate students to participate. Okay at teaching.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Dec 31th is the day when Canvas grades were released.

All information given is cluttered into barely-comprehensible slides, with no other forms of organized notes notes whatsoever; his Canvas is nowhere near the level of other professors, lacking tabs such as the grade, and half of the test material does not seem to be in the slides.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment:
The professor is great, and if you pay a lick of attention during class you'll pass. It's fast-paced but with the amount of homework given, you should have more than enough chances to process any new material. 

Bonus: She gives you three excused absences no questions asked.

I think she explains concepts well and she's very kind and caring. I think she's definitely the best instructor for CH 115. The only main drawback is that the lectures were quite boring. This may be just a fault of the material and not her, but sometimes I found it super hard to focus in lecture. If you do focus though, her explanations make sense.
lectures are often boring, she is extremely enthusiastic and cares about the students. class is difficult but she wants to make it easy for everyone.
Super hard, math heavy course. Muisener is the best prof for the course because she cares and explains it well, its just extremely hard and dense content so get ready to grind.

I love Professor Muisener so much! She is an amazing, caring, funny professor who really goes above and beyond to help her students and teach them. Her class is by no means easy, but I really feel that I learned a lot and am taking her again next semester. Totally recommend taking her if you can!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Patty is great. Her lectures aren't always the most interesting, but if you want to learn the material, Muisener is the way to go. She understands which concepts cause the most confusion and spends class time accordingly. If you don't understand a problem, she will do everything to make sure you get it. Never took AP Chem, but CH115 was a breeze.

Patty is the most disorganized professor I've ever had. I have had her in 4 classes now, and every single test has had an error, it is never clear what our homework exactly is, and she is late to her own classes almost every day. I have even heard of her sending in recommendation letters late, so people are disqualified from research opportunities.

Dr. Muisener is one of the kindest people you'll ever meet. She will do anything she can to help you understand chemistry. That being said, her lectures aren't always the best, but it's really not for lack of trying on her part... people often don't give her the respect she deserves. She knows a lot and it shows. Read the book and go to her office.

Dr. Muisener's love for chemistry and (more importantly) teaching, is obvious. She is always happy to meet with you for extra help and guidance. Her tests are definitely not easy, but as long as you are putting the proper amount of work into the class, you will do well.

Patty: easiest teacher I have had. Extra Credit Galore. Ended the semester with over 100% having never taken AP Chem. Just do the homework and read the book. Lectures are completely unnecessary, but there are clicker questions ever so often.

Patty.... definitely could have been worse. But, she also could have been better. Her lectures tend to be hard to follow. If you never took AP Chem in high school, you have a lot of work to do. Recitations will be your friend, and not lectures.

Patricia is nothing if not predictable.  This is my second course with her. She doesn't miss class, though I can not say she was always... all there. Sure, her literal person might be with us, but... not so much her brain. Things you're supposed to learn from her get instead learned in recitation. Would not have passed without AP Chemistry.
All you gotta do is ask for help when you need it and she foes over the moon and back to make sure you know what you're doing
I love chemistry. Like, you would be hard-pressed to comprehend the level at which I like doing chemistry.  Patricia Muisener makes me loath chemistry.

This professor was my absolute favorite! She really cares how well you do and is always available to help. There are 2 midterms and a final, but they are very fair with what is taught in class. Definitely take her if you can!

Her class is very interesting and she is alwasy full of energy. She use new and updated examples to explain what she teaches in the class. Everything in the test is coverd during the class. I can't believe she is only 3.6 on this website lol

Professor Saad-Lessler is honestly one of my favorites I have had this semester. The coursework isn't too bad and the exams are not that hard either. As long as you pay attention and study off of her practice exams you should be entirely fine.
Amazing economics professor. Clearly understandable lectures that are recorded for future reference. Homework assignments to reinforce concepts. Exams are similar to homework.

Had her for Macro and Micro. She uses Sapling for the homework assignments. Weekly homework assignment, manageable, nothing crazy. All the info is on the slides. Gives opportunity for extra credit. Tests were multiple choice online. Overall, a good experience and would recommend if you want to be partially challenged and not go crazy.

Took this class online in a hybrid format. The professor did a great job of making sure the online students felt included in the discussion. She did require us to purchase a Sapling subscription. She uses this for online homework and testing. Make good use of the Sapling resources since similar questions are asked on exams.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I had to teach myself. I've never read a textbook so closely in my life and watch so many Khan Academy videos. She doesn't bother to make her own curriculum - she relies on all the material from the textbook software. She goes through everything quickly like we've all be doing this for 20 years like she has. And her internet connection is terrible.
Avoid if possible.
In beginning you may tell yourself "ok she's not that bad" but wait till the midterm comes around. She ruined my chances into getting into a good business school.
Short tough exams. You need to dedicate A LOT of time for this course if you want to do well in it. I would not recommend as there are other fair professors at Stevens for microeconomics.
Avoid it.

This professor is very test heavy and very picky about the responses you give. Her exams are all open-ended and you have to study very hard for them. She also makes so many grading mistakes on exams so you have to sit and review to make sure she gave you credit correctly. Her teaching method is okay however, I could have had a better experience.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: NO CURVE!!! Make grades by the decimal point. Definitely great when it comes to teaching. But the exams are extremely tough. You have to know ALL the topics inside and out. Good luck with her.

Took it the first semester they offered the course and her first semester teaching here, so the class was only a handful of people, which made attendance very encouraged. Overall, she did a good job teaching the material and I learned a lot. Online hw is easy, but you will have to put in time studying for the exams.
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He's an extremely nice guy who's open to anyone's opinions in class. He makes you read his articles and the excerpts in the textbooks, and is just open to whatever you think about them. He also gives more papers than other professors I believe, but they are much shorter than what other professors ask for.

John Horgan is a great Professor! I enjoy his teaching style and class structure. It is also nice that he gives so much freedom on essays and he gives such great feedback! Professor Horgan is also great when it comes to extra credit and fair grading. Would definitely recommend John Horgan's humanities classes to 1st year students.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: John Horgan is the best CAL105 professor at Stevens. The only homework assignments for this class are papers and outside readings. He always gives amazing feedback on all papers. Finally, his in class discussions are always very interesting and really make you think.

John Horgan is a fantastic teacher. Although his lectures can be very boring, prepare yourself, he gives a lot of freedom when it comes to writing prompts, and gives great feedback! As long as you do well on the essays by having a very creative writing style that he takes a liking to, you will receive a good grade. Beware of weekly readings.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy

comment: His class was very interesting. There are a couple of readings each week, 1-3 articles, some of them being his own articles. Do the readings because he goes down the attendance list for who to call on. 2 small papers and 1 large research paper. He likes a specific style of writing, so cater to it and you'll be able to get an A on the papers.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Horgan is SO MUCH FUN - class is all discussion, and he has lots of interesting opinions. He's super open to hear lots of different perspectives, and I've had a few fun debates with him in class. 2 3-page essays, midterm and final were just our thoughts on class readings, and one "research" paper w a presentation <3

One of the most amazing professors at Stevens. He is very vocal about personal opinions during class discussions on material, but is always willing to engage in discourse with a positive and amiable attitude. He manages to teach about language and writing skills all while being a very interesting and personable professor. Definitely recommend!!!

Horgan is by far the best humanities teacher at Stevens. He assigns a few essays throughout the semester which are on interesting topics, unlike most other professors. The final project is fun and much easier than it seems. Try your best and take some notes during lecture and you will get an easy A!

Fun Class. Most of the class is debates and discussion, which he makes interesting. You'll have to write a few papers, but they're on broad, interesting topics. He doesn't care at all about MLA or any of that nonsense. Overall, he gives much less work than other CAL teachers and he's a great guy.

Professor Horgan is very knowledgeable and opinionated and loves to spark great debates in is class. He runs a very laid-back, casual class. If you take interest in the subject matter, the class will be easy and enjoyable.
The class is very discussion based, but he's super opinionated and isn't afraid to hide his opinions. Extremely easy to get an A if you show up to class and agree with him.

i really enjoyed the way he structured his class to provoke discussions. made readings, which could easily be painfully boring, really interesting by getting students to debate controversial topics. would take class with him again. he does grade papers a bit tough though.

One of the better humanities professors. As long as you read the passages and contribute in class, you'll do well. Takes readings and connects them to modern people and cultural concepts; makes class much more engaging. Paper topics are interesting and somewhat fun to write. Great professor, fun (in a college sense) course.
best hum class hands down. Everyone should take it!

After graduating, I found that his classes are the most useful in the real corporate world. He is very clear and interactive in his teaching methods (with classroom discussions and on-hands experience). His textbooks were actually used, compared to other professors who assign books and never review/test the material. Hes also nice and encouraging.
Very boring, liked to hear himself talk, took attendance, but assignments were easy and he was well organized.
Talks more than teaches
meh
Boring. Can't Teach. Hasn't mastered material.
some one should teach him the material before they let him teach it. also some one needs to teach him HOW to teach it.

Again it's ashame to see so many disgruntled students. In fact this is a good professor, misunderstood at times yes. If you take the class properly and open your mind up you'll learn a lot. He's rusty on the details of program usage, but that's what your textbook is for. Go to him with macro-environment (computer) questions and he'll teach a lot.

omg.  what can i say?  horrible teacher.  its bad enough that he doesn't know how to teach, but when he does teach... he's WRONG.  also, what he calls "cutting edge", "new", and "revolutionary" has been around for um.. years.  good job jkeating!  keep wasting our precious money.  *sigh* I was looking forward to an e-commerce class.
Does not teach/explain things well. terrible.
complete idiot, but an easy A
No Comments
No clue how to teach. Stay away. If you are in BT you are screwed.
omg, this guy has no clue what he is talking about, and is boring as hell.
Take the course, the professor is very nice, except for his python knowledge. Hires tough TA to help him do that. Go for project class that's nice.
Awesome Prof. Hughly recommended if you want to learn and have fun while learning. Caring and listens to students

Highly recommend professor. 
He really understands his stuff and make it easy for students to comprehend. 
Very engaging lectures which makes you learn project management hands-on. 
He was always available outside class time to answer any questions and concerns relating to weekly homework or to final project.
This professor is amazing. Prepare to learn a lot and work a lot, but you will get an A without a problem.

This course was challenging; however, Dr. Ali's lectures made it a bit tolerable. This course is heavy in regard to material, so do not underestimate the course's material. STUDY, STUDY, and STUDY (that's my only advice). Dr. Ali's teachings were amazingly helpful, and without him, I would've most probably barely passed.

Dr. Ali's teaching was excellent and easy to understand. However, do not expect to do well in this course if you don't work on yourself. Students must study and apply the knowledge outside of class to do well in this course. Finally, participating in classes would only increase the chances of getting a high grade (so don't be a ghost in class).

Great professor with great understanding for material taught. His lectures are engaging and well-organized, making complex topics accessible and interesting. Highly recommended for any student looking to be inspired and challenged
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: If you want to learn PM, I would definitely recommend him. But be prepared for lots of work. Always available for questions outside class.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: The professor knows his stuff. He explains the concepts very well and he keeps repeating it until we understand. The homework and exams are difficult but you only have to try and will get an A. If you are planning on taking PMI certification exam, you don't need to study extra.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: One of the best professors I took courses with.
The professor was answering my questions on weekends and even inspired me sign up for the PMP exam.
He is an amazing professsor

Project management course is very interesting and there are lot of things to learn, but professor ali yassine made it too difficult with his difficult grading and setting up difficult exam. sometimes I felt like he is a racist. So I prefer don't make a mistake choosing him.

I won't recommend this professor. He is very harsh at homework. The midterm and final exam is too much difficult. And if you miss the deadline because of switching courses within the first two weeks, he doesn't accept your late homework. Such an awful teacher.

He's a real old world genius and academic.  A great professor, and I'm so glad to hear he's still teaching seminars in emeritus.  He can be kind of a hard ass, but only because he has high expectations of what we can do.

I loved this class.  I learned a lot.  He was my best teacher of that semester.  And you guys just don't appreciate his tangents - they're sometimes fascinating, and even when they're not, they're adorable!
I wasn't expecting much, but Mr. Rothberg's class was the high point of my time at Stevens.
Thermodynamics has got to be more interesting than this. I fell asleep nearly ever lecture. Guy can't teach.

He has a good heart and he is very knowledgeable. In lecture he wanders off onto these bizzare topics. Just keep reading the book and go to his lectures because they will help as long as you tune out the times when he wanders off. He helps all those that want it.
Worst professor ever, I repeat EVER!!!  He was hot though.
No Comments
Boring man who only went over equations instead of theories and how to apply them.  Better get a tutor since Thermo is FOUR credits.
No Comments
...very hard test. no clue what to answer. but he goes to answer every interesting part of physics. very good teacher, but nothing you learning about test ,unfortunately.
rising senior warning worst professor ever had
No Comments
No Comments
Great professor to learn from!
Best professor at Stevens. Teaches you in a friendly way and answers all questions. Homework's aren't difficult but you do need a good group. Quizzes are online and are a good practice for the final.

Prof Rowland is one of the best. He's willing to help. Even if you don't have coding experience, he encourages us to keep learning and give us a guide. From my personal experience, I really learned a lot from him.

Excellent professor, really good knowledge, great speaker, motivator but his TA for CS 555 is a disaster. Total Sadist and ignorant TA. Lots of people have issues and it is a total mess of his grading style. Not sure if I could
Absolutely the best professor in this college, I took 3 courses from him. Giving amazing lectures and good feedback. Though some courses have lots of homework, he is willing to give high grades.
One of the best courses I have taken. Professor was helpfully and taught very well. I would recommend anyone to take this course if you want to learn python programming.

Prof JR is one of the best! A must take course irrespective of your coding exposure. There is a lot to learn for newbies and proficient programmers alike. Not only teaches Python but also teaches you to think like an architect while writing good software. Be prepared to work with weekly quizzes and assignments. Prof is always available though.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Really interactive lectures, took a dry and theoretical subject and made it fun.

Definitely take one of his classes if you get the chance. A lot of work, but he's always available for help/questions/anything you need, and he gives you a chance to correct your work and make it better. Clearly cares about his students and wants them to learn and get the most out of the course.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: My favorite professor of all time! He spends a lot of time giving helpful feedback to his students and really cares about them. I've been in his office countless times since I am new to programming. A+ teacher and person.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Very friendly and takes excellent lectures
Gives great feedback to everything and helps you patiently with whatever you ask. But be prepared to put in the work; Gives lots of assignments and homework
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Would take again

comment: Amazing professor, good coursework, nice project work, interesting lectures, always available for all the problems but get ready to work as he gives so many assignments each week but worth it. Must take course
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: You could read the textbook faster than it takes Jacek to explain what a DFA is. His lectures make easy concepts hard, and hard concepts are "waiting for you in the textbook" because he doesn't teach them in class. Easy problem sets and exams, but because they are all pulled from the textbook. Just read and practice the book problems and its easy A

Prof. Jacek is honestly a great professor. He cares about what he teaches and tries to explain as much as possible in every lecture.

However, for CS334 I highly recommend just taking the other professor. Students who took this class learned the same but had worse grades, no curve, and harder homework. No reason to hurt your GPA with Jacek CS334.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Pretty boring class, professor was fine. He seemed a bit rude at times, but he wasn't too unforgiving. The assignments were long, but they helped to understand the material.

My poor grade is due to a lot of burnout and outside circumstances surrounding my midterm exam, but overall the class is really well made and very interesting, and the professor is very knowledgeable and passionate about helping students understand the material. The only downsides of this course is a 0 tolerance late policy, and the boring lectures
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: He is a really passionate guy who loves what he teaches. Discrete math is a hard class, no matter who the professor is. Homeworks were very hard as it was almost impossible to complete them without some sort of help. They were graded pretty strictly too which brought down a lot of grades. Tests weren't too bad.

You'll like him based of the type of learner you are. He grades most of the work pretty strictly and there aren't any extra credit opportunities given. His final and midterm aren't too hard, but he doesn't let you have a formula sheet, whereas other professors gave one, so he expects you to memorize all the concepts he gives you in class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Excellent lecturer and records all of them. The homeworks are hard, but the TAs are helpful doing well is very possible if you start them early and go to office hours. Scheme labs can be annoying but aren't bad. The ZyBooks are helpful too.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Other reviews are exaggerating the whole homework situation. Do work diligently and you will do well. His lectures get into detail with proofs, but are easy to follow. Zybooks helped, and so do his TA's on discord. Sometimes the TAs grade weird, but it can always be discussed with other TAs or Jacek himself. HW are hard, but we get ample time.

Professor is good and he is understanding however his TA's are extremely cruel when it comes to grading. In homeworks, you are not supposed to be 100% correct but even a spelling mistake will have them take off points. It's like they have no life except being a loser. Also, some students received 0 for lab because of plagiarism when its just coding

He just gave students 0 for a coding lab due to students having similar answers. Programming is a logical science, many problems in the field can be handled in similar or identical ways. Therefore, punishing similarity unfairly affects students who could have independently found the same workable solution. Someone teach him that.

Professor Ossowski is a phenomenal lecturer and he does a great job explaining very difficult concepts. The class is brutal but that's not his fault and he makes it as painless as possible. Super accessible if you have questions. Always tries to engage the class and he breaks up lectures that make you consider dropping with some great jokes.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: This class is hard and that really isn't his fault. He is such a nice professor and cares for his students, but this is a weed-out course. His tests are closed notes but I think on avg pretty doable. There's HW due every two weeks and he drops lowest 2 grades. Would not take this class again, but would like to have him for something else

Great prof, especially for 135. Lectures are easy to follow along, but the weekly problem sets can be extremely difficult, but they are important for the exams. Final exam was difficult, but our class didn't do great so he curved it, plus he drops some low grades. Overall I definitely recommend for CS135.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Prof. Ossowski is a really good lecturer and the material he covers in class is on the tests, so just pay attention in class. The assigned homework is really hard but manageable if you work with friends and the TAs. The ZyBooks are a hassle in all honesty, as they often just reiterate what was said in class and don't clarify the material.

amazing professor for cs 135!!! highly recommend + he drops problem sets and he is very accessible through discord! there around 10 problem sets + labs and so you are able to do well in this class if you rewatch his lectures + read notes!

At least for HPL 369, Professor Steinmann tends to talk a lot about the topics. It can get kind of word-salady and confusing sometimes, but I feel that that is more because of what we were discussing. Very fair, lenient, and overall kind professor in my opinion. He was willing to write me a recommendation letter despite not knowing me at all prior.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Accessible outside class

comment: Classes are lecture/discussion based and I found all the readings we discussed very interesting. Homework is weekly readings and a few short papers (graded with good feedback) plus a presentation. Class is a nice low stress environment and Professor Steinmann is very understanding if you need an extension on a paper. Had a great time in this class!

Wasn't a bad professor. He just talks a lot in a monotone voice that makes you fall asleep but as long as you engage in the conversation you wouldn't fall asleep. He also wasn't a hard grader at least to me. Very lenient with deadlines gave extra time if you notify that you need time.

I've had him for two classes. Both had: 2.5 hour lectures (with a 10 minute break) once a week with 2-3 students presenting on that week's reading during the class. 5 2 page papers and then a final paper (4-5 pages). Not very difficult with lenient deadlines, my only complaint is that the lectures can be monotonous at times. Definitely a safe bet

The lectures can get a little boring if you don't care for the material, but if you're a real philosophy/religion nerd you'll probably like him (I sure did). The only grades he entered were one midterm paper, a presentation, a final paper, and participation. However he is really great to talk to about anything, very accessible
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: hard grader, boring, lectures non-stop. for a cal major that understands books, maybe for you, put for an engineering major just trying to fill the credit, dont bother!! can be funny at sometimes but lectures on and on about nothing. also expects your papers to be perfect.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: He is harder than almost all CAL 105 professors.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Steinmann definitely wasnt the worst. If you end up with him youll be fine. His lectures are just very boring, but he doesnt take attendance. Hell just talk for 2 hours. If you even just skim the readings youll be able to write a decent paper, and if you actually read them theres no reason why you shouldnt get an A on all your papers.

The class was pretty boring and the lectures are very monotonous. It wouldn't be so bad if the class wasn't 2.5 hours long without a break. The class is not difficult though, and you are probably required to take this class anyway.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Very monotonous and boring classes. After 2 hours with no break lost concentration.
Very monotone and gets very off topic sometimes but is pretty lenient with being a little late on homeworks. Also no tests, just presentations.
Great teacher. Although her grades rather hard, I loved him as a person
No Comments

Tbh I was really surprised when I saw Dr.C didn't have good reviews. I thought she was great! I liked how she taught, she answered questions well, and clearly knowledgeable. Genuinely cares about the students, both academically and personally. Fair grader, reasonable person, and has a sense of humor. Would love to take a class with her again.

Her lectures are fairly long, and she just rambled code on OMNET for the whole second half of the semester.  She taught the prob stats section good enough, and the test was easy.  Wish she took more time to explain the project.  Also, she says this is "fun" but I haven't seen kids smile because of her in that class.

Comaniciu is very disorganized; she will not respond to emails. Most everyone is lost. Everyone I know either had issues or didn't know how to interpret the results with our software. Lectures will make you confused. Project grading is fair tho and she does curve and gives second chances so do take advantage of all extra credit opportunities.

This professor is the possibly the worst professor/teacher I have ever had. She is completely oblivious to reality and doesn't even realize she's such an awful teacher. She doesn't understand basic technology (even though she's a CPE professor), her lectures are incoherent and a complete waste of time, and her assignments are poorly constructed.
would show up late, assignments unclear. probably better off just reading out of a text book

Lectures were bad, but homework and the final project were pretty good. CPE345 was super confusing and everyone was lost because she does not explain concepts very well. The coursework was relevant and she makes sure you know what you are doing on the final project.
Very sweet, caring, intelligent women. She really tried hard for class to get the concepts. Yes, she curves a bit on grades.

Cons: 100% you'll be lost in lectures and clueless how to do some of the classwork, 35% Midterm exam on statistical math topics which is unfair when the class is 80% omnet++ programming, TA is a super tough grader. Pros: Class is curved, No final exam only final group projects, very kind in grading the final project.

Even though everyone is so clueless in lecture she very kind and sweet. She curved the class, no final exam just final project. She'll roast you hard on the final presentation but she does it so that she challenges you and you are able to show that you learned the material well. Very hard to get below a B in her class. You'll be happy in the end.

Doesn't understand what she is even talking about. She does not care about her students, and dismissed me when I showed up to her office for help. Students constantly have to tell her how to teach. She never actually explains problems or teaches how to problem solve. I had no idea what was going on the entire semester. Prob the worst class so far.

I have had this professor for a couple classes for my graduate courses and I found that she is a very good teacher.  She takes the time to ensure you understand the material and explains the information very well.  Even with an online course, I felt I learned a lot from her courses and felt that she cared for my education.

Awful professor. Cares very little and does not go out of way to help students. Have had her for two classes now, and she is incapable of teaching even the most enthusiastic students. Does not grade anything in a timely manner, so you don't know where you stand in class. Has an attitude and dismisses students questions.

Professor Comaniciu is a good teacher and legitimately cares about each of her students. She is always willing to work out problems with students that are having trouble in class, and readily responds to any concern regarding the class that you may have.

Dr. Swindall is a very caring, kind, & effective professor. Lectures are helpful and important and she's always willing to answer questions. The final paper will work out to be a long process that will take a lot of work, but she guides you throughout the way and makes herself accessible outside of class. Gives great feedback & is a fair grader.
Professor Swindall is very enthusiastic about what she teaches and knows her material. Her lectures are engaging and she is overall a great professor.

Professor Swindall is a great professor that is readily available to help. You will have to spend time on reading assignments and writing papers but she will give optimal feedback for you to improve. Would definitely take her as a professor again.
Amazing professor! You have to read a chapter weekly for class and write 3 papers total, but overall you learn a lot and its great material.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Swindall's a good professor. Classes consisted of a discussion of the assigned readings or time to work on the papers. There weren't too many stressful assignments and missed points can be made up through a lot of extra credit. The professor gives very thorough feedback for the two papers we write. Solid choice

Dr. Swindall is so nice and a great teacher. Usually english is my least favorite class, but I really enjoyed her class. She is a very fair grader and if you put in the effort to go to office hours or email her with questions, she is extremely helpful. I definitely recommend taking her class you will learn a lot! Also she doesnt give too much work

Definitely makes you work for an A, but it's a decent class. She is very caring and takes on a positive outlook on life which is refreshing. You definitely have to put in the work, but once you do, you will be glad that you did. Grading is on the tougher side, but that is because she cares and really wants you to be your best.

Really great professor but the class is not easy. Lots of reading and memorization and she is not an easy essay grader. If you talk to her she is super understanding and her lectures are relatively interesting. Glad I took this class but would never take it again. I raised my grade from a 72 to a 86 with final and extra credit in the last week.

Swindall is a great professor and overall very nice. I love her enthusiasm when she talks about the topic of the discussion. While she does give out essays, she's very helpful if you ask questions on what she thinks about them before you have to turn it in. Definitely talk to her during office hours for a good grade.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: She's a very nice lady but don't let that fool you. The course is based on a book that she wrote and it's pretty boring. The work is assigned lazily. The two essays you write are the same exact prompt. The research project requires a 5-7 minute speech without media. Reading is unnecessary until you write your essays. Tough grader. Extra credit opp.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Lindsay is awesome. Engaging class lectures on interesting topics. A lot of group discussion. Assigns readings every night, but it is extremely manageable. She is very passionate about her profession and is always there to help her students. She pushes her students, but only because she wants them to succeed. Great class. I highly recommend.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: NO GROUP FINAL ESSAY
Absolutely awesome teacher. Looked forward to her class every day.
Good teacher.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Respected

comment: For an introductory english class, Prof Vredenburg's pacing was extremely fair. Not only was he lenient with assignment deadlines, but he also allowed for a revision of one essay with a chance to earn back 2/3rds of lost points. He also kept classes engaging and entertaining, even showing us an episode of the Sopranos. Recommend taking this class.

Decent professor and didn't assign too much work for my class. Gives good feedback on essays but the class is very group-project heavy. My writing definitely improved, and he didn't seem to grade my papers insanely hard. Overall a nice guy and would take again for CAL 103.
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--So many papers

comment: Do not take this class if you're expecting an easy A, although you really shouldn't be for a 300-level humanity. Vredenburg has an obvious passion for the subject, which makes lectures and recitation very enjoyable. Quite a tough grader on essays, but very lenient on exam grading. Overall, I enjoyed his class, but definitely had to work for an A-.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Gives good feedback

comment: Professor Vredenburg was an okay professor, but compared to other CAL 103 professors he gave a lot of work. Read what he assigns, because he will often have pop quizzes on them where you have to write.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: Definitely makes you work for the grade. As long as you show up to class and do everything you are supposed to, you'll get a good grade. Seemed more time-consuming compared to other CAL103 teachers, however, he is very a nice and flexible guy.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Amazing lectures

comment: Jason is a nice guy, but not always the most interesting. I actually found the class to be a lot more interesting once starting the group research project, which was quite fun, but there's a lot of listening to him talk about a topic that for most isn't exciting. If you have him you'll be fine, but I personally wouldn't choose to take him again.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--So many papers

comment: I loved Prof. Vredenburg! I took him for Intro to Cinema and he made the recitations a blast--he's a huge film nerd and his passion comes through clearly. He also gives great feedback on your writing, and doesn't grade too harshly. If you reach out about having him read over your essay before submission, he'll do it with you. Take him if you can!

Vredenburg is great. He is definitely a fair grader. If you hand in mediocre work, you will probably get a B. However, he is always willing to offer awesome feedback and as long as you put in some effort, it is not difficult to get an A. He is very down to earth and kind! But he is strict about attendance and his class is a technology free zone.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: He is great at leading class discussion and in my experience not a tough grader. Exams are long and thorough but not hard if you study.

He was overall a decent professor. He is a VERY tough grader and is pretty subjective with grading in my opinion. If you ask for help, he will give it but definitely doesn't go out of his way to help you out. All said, I ended up with a B in his class which I was very happy with

In class, he does a very good job talking about the text we had to read. He gives good detail and discussions. He is also a tough grader when it comes to essays, but not so much of his exams. The exams he gives are long and detailer though so it requires you to put effort into studying.

Can't say I learned anything... takes forever to grade and doesn't make much of an attempt to help if you're struggling. Best part of the class was the final project because we didn't have to show up to class and listen to lectures
The class is very easy and he is very good at explaining everything about accounting. He has a very dry sense of humor but tries to keep the class engaged the best he can.
He's sooooo nice!!!!!!

Took him online, poor organization. Unhelpful. Added all my grades and it figured to be a “A-“ or “B+’. I got a “B” and when I asked him about it he brushed me off and said "That’s what you deserve" with no explanation.

Lecture notes were a direct copy from the text book. Rarely responded in a timely manner, was rude on several occasions. The grade he gave me, when I calculated it per his method, should have been one level higher then he gave me. (regular vs. +). When I asked him about it he just blew me off. Guy shouldn't be teaching.
Lecture notes were a direct copy from text book, I mean exact. Did not explain material well, grading was somewhat unfair.

He really knows his stuff. His tests are tricky and he words them so that you'll think twice about your answer but he really makes sure you know how to perform accounting calculations but also the concepts behind them.

This guy is the worst. All we did was read the book and do homework which he did not correct. He was non-existent and did not deserve to get paid. All grades came from exams which he graded horribly. Hopefully Stevens wakes up and cans this loser.
awesome!
Great teacher.  Makes very hard material seem easy after just a few classes.

This guy is a dumba$$.  His lectures were verabatim from the text book.  He's big on attendance, even for those that have responsibilities at work.  I missed two classes due to work and I dropped a letter grade.
Awesome prof. Try to take any of his courses!
This guys is awesome.  One of the few good BT teachers.  Made accounting easy and fun.  He tells bad stories but they're still funny.

Extremely intimidating and challenging professor. Incredibly arrogant but is a subject matter expert and guides students who want to learn. Be aware that he will not spoon feed you this material. He puts the burden on the students to review the subjects and challenge themselves to learn. He makes sure that all TRUE ChE's learn and understand thermo

Completely terrible as a person and as a professor. Uses profanity and has frequent temper tantrums in front of the class. Don't be fooled if he seems friendly at first. I will never forget the time he tore a student's homework assignment in two in front of everyone. Be prepared to work hard for low grades. He is unforgiving. Avoid at all costs.
Rude and not clear during lecture. Gives minimal partial credit but has no issue taking points off for small errors.
Strict professor. Arrogant, but very intelligent. Knowledgeable in field of study. Challenging exams. _HLF

Knows his stuff. Class comes off as difficult because he berades those that don't come to class prepared and gives pop quizes regularly that are bombed by all who didn't study the night before. But by the end of your semester you come to realize the class was actually super easy and if you put in a decent effort you will get something out of it.

Very Hard professor. Would pick on students who came to class unprepared. Worked on the policy of 3  credits = 9 hours of work outside of class. As long as students work on hard and study he is a fair teacher. Sometimes he has errors in ppt slides.

Very arrogant.  Didn't teach very well and always made assumptions that we knew things from previous courses.  Not helpful at all, and makes jokes of students when questions are asked.  I highly recommend the book, as it will be your best bet for passing the class.

An excellent teacher with a bad arrogant/know-it-all attitude. Makes fun of two types of students: Uninterested sluggards, and women. Definitely hit on some of the more "endowed" women in our class. However, the material is not that hard. If you do the homework and study for tests, you will get an A easily. Relies on textbook heavily, so buy it!

One of the few teachers who can actually TEACH. Gallois is fun and keeps the subject interesting by mocking uninterested students. He tries to make the material harder than it really is. In reality, most of the work is simply pluging-and-chugging. (whether his students realize it) He's probably my favorite teacher at Stevens so far.
A fun, smart jerk.

A knowledgeable, demented man.  Very cruel to students, especially to those that seem more vulnerable to him.  He picks on young women, making inappropriate jokes about what they might have been doing over the weekend and calling them idiots for asking questions.  He should be fired.
One time Prof. Rubenfeld cancelled class, but most of the class still showed up anyways. Because he's THAT boring and nobody listens at all. Plus you have to read a lot!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: I love Professor Rubenfeld. He's in love with what he teaches, and although it can get a little intimidating to participate in class you know he loves what he's doing, and it shows. Go buy his book. Go take his class. This man is the sweetest professor I've ever had at Stevens.

Rubenfeld was great. If you are willing to attend class and pay attention, you will have no trouble passing and doing well. Although he may say that a lot of the reading is required, I only read part of the material and still managed to get mostly A's on his "pop-quizzes". If you have the time read the books, it will help your participation grade.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Seemed kind of scary at first but ended up being a really great guy. He really wants all of his students to succeed and is willing to help however he can. Papers are short, super easy, and graded leniently. Readings are a little boring but it's worth it.
Participation matters, easy to do well if you put in minimal required effort.

He is kind of awkward and makes little jokes in class that are not funny. Not a very personal guy but he grades pretty easy on papers which there aren't a lot of! But the midterm and final are very hard and a lot of writing. Good thing each paper, the midterm and final all had the same weight towards grading.

I took 117 during fall and 118 during Summer. Summer was very easy with no papers or mid-term.  Very good.  During the fall/spring on the other hand is much more material, very hard paper grader. Midterm and final are very long with continuous writing.  Only thing i regret is his Writing assignments cuz I suck at writing
good teacher, knows his stuff.  easy to understand, humorous, and altogether enjoyable class
No Comments
Very good and intersting. Funny guy, pretty cool.
No Comments

A M A Z I N G!  

I have no idea where any of these negative reviews are coming from. Did we take the same class??? Professor is the most knowledgeable one in Stevens. I wish the other professors were like her. Tough class but with the professor's explanations everything was streamlined and manageable. She rocks!
Even if someone offered me millions of dollars, I wouldn't take her class. Sometimes I wonder if she understands what she's teaching.

In 16 years of education, I have never come across a course of such caliber. Insightful lectures, amazing homework where you learn tons of things specifically for the NLP part of deep learning, and inspiring teacher. I have no idea what has happened with the previous comments but man can't be about the same professor!
Professor always tries to make the concepts clear and is easy to reach out to. The subject itself demands a lot of self-learning and a strong understanding of the basics.

Subject Deep Learning and yet every single lecture after the basics focuses on her research domain - NLP. Assignments are too few and last minute. Grading criteria changes based on how many assignments the professor & the TAs are able to put together. Grading is slow, and the last assignment is the day after the final. 1 is too much. Save yourself.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy

comment: She does not teach, nothing is clear in the class. Slides are non informative. This course is one of the mandatory courses I needed to take. I regret taking it..

She's the most terrible professor I've ever met in my student life. Her teaching is so boring / unclear and makes me sleepy. Quiz is more like final exam, 2 Hours quiz? Are you kidding me? In-class quiz don't have pre-notice, missed the class, missed the quiz. Oh, never available after class, sent email? No response or takes one week for response.

She's not good at articulating anything. Boring delivery, not accessible after class, and if she is, she acts as if you weren't in class. Barely any assignments and quizzes, midterm was not ANYTHING like she described. I don't know how she's a professor here. Does not care about the students or the class. DO NOT TAKE!

Avoid her if you have no prior knowledge on Java and Data Structures. She is an awful lecturer, can not explain concepts well, and has unreliable slides that are just pieces of code (which was sometimes in a different language completely) and diagrams. She often showed a lack of preparedness and would not communicate with us and even the TA. AVOID

I have no words. I don't understand why she was even given the title of Professor. Sure she understands the subject but she can hardly convey it to the student body. Even worse is that if you ask for help she basically makes it seem like you're not worth her time. I'm devastated that this is where my tuition money is going. Wasted.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: What in the world is this? I wanted to learn Computer Science, but this Professor I can hardly figure out what she is saying. Yes CS is a hard subject, but at this point, she sounds Alien, I'm not the only one. Everyone with me is completely lost and hated the Professor and not the class. We enjoy coding, but the professor made that very difficult.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: It is unfortunate that Ms. Xu is a professor at such a prestigious institute. Her speech is unclear and it is hard to latch onto her lectures. About 10% of her student body understands, and everyone is unable to translate what she is saying. If you try to get help, she does not make an effort to blame her teachings and offer a helping hand. Avoid!

This class is lecture-intensive, which can make it easy to lose focus. However, his tests are relatively straightforward since they are all multiple choice and usually about 40% similar to the practice exams he provides. He doesn't assign much homework—just complete it carefully and avoid simple mistakes, and you should do well.

Very generous professor with a very fair grading scale. Clearly has the knowledge for the subject. One bad grade in the class will not destroy your grade. Objectively a low amount of homework. Great guy who cares about the students. Would absolutely recommend.

One of the best teachers at Stevens. Took computational finance, and his teaching style is very engaging. Although lacking some visual intuition, the course material is very practical and thoroughly explained. The notes are amazing! Make sure to do the HWs because they are valuable hands-on work; can integrate all of them into a resume project too!
Very smart and nice guy but the subject matter is dry. Attend class because he gives hints about what to expect on exams.

Honestly, he isn't a bad professor he's just really boring. If you pay attention to the lecture and do the homework assignments (hws are graded on correctness btw), you will pass the class easily. Also, usually one or two of the homework problems end up on the exams, so make sure you take the time to study. Positive: textbook is free.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: He is a nice guy. Lecture is boring but if you pay attention the concepts are easy to understand, basically he does explain things well but he's just so boring. Makes test a lot of ur grade but takes questions from lectures and puts of extra credit on test. like he put 72 points on test and a 100% was only 65 points. grades hw hard but drops lowest

Can tell how smart he is and tries his best. Lectures can be so boring. Grades all the homeworks weeks after they are due. If you pay attention in lecture the test is easy which is nice... just like the questions in class. At the end drops the worst homework and makes the test you did best on out of the 3 the most weight. He's very Nice.
The lectures can sometimes be boring but if you pay attention, the concepts will make sense. Curves tests for better grades.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: One of the worst professors I ever took for Mathematics. Makes Statistics very boring to learn and very hard to learn. I do not recommend taking this professor and I pray for the future students of his.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Lacks energy, the shape of his course is super test-heavy, with tests making 80% of the entire course grade, and there arent many opportunities to raise your grade.
Very bad professor doesn't explain STATS very well. Very hard to understand and doesn't grade homeworks. His tests can be very hard and he is trash teacher.
Graded 3 homeworks during the whole semester. Doesn't explain well.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Dool is a very influential person at Stevens with lots of real-world experience that he gladly shared with the class. He only gave out a couple of assignments for the entire year and was a very easy grader. His lectures were laid back too, and they weren't very boring either. This is one of the better professors at Stevens.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: awesome guy, awesome prof. very lenient with due dates and his lectures are super chill but informative. former CEO of multiple companies so he comes w/ a ton of real world experience. very accessible outside of class and he grades fairly. take him any chance you get, you won't regret it. one of my fav profs.

Dool is a great human being who cares about his students. He is flexible with due dates and is understanding about personal situations. The assignments he gives are relatively lengthy, but if you don't fall behind, you will be good. His grading system seems arbitrary, but if you do what is required of you, you will end up with at least a b+.
Dr. Dool is a great professor. He keeps lectures interesting and accepts late work on assignments. Just don't fall too behind on your work and you will be fine.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Tough grader and gives a lot of busy work that piles up by the time it hits November and December. He never gives anyone the highest grade. It is always one point below.

Dr. Dool is one of the most chill professors I have ever had. He allows late assignments and attendance is graded but class is enjoyable so it is not a hassle. He takes questions and criticism well, and his assignments make sense. If you needed to ask questions, you can text him or email for help and he quickly responds.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: His lectures were great and he was able to connect his relevant industry experience to whatever he was teaching. The group project allows you to get a feel for what it's like to really manage a semester-long project, and as long as you show that you care about it you'll get an A.

Dool is a good lecturer and qualified to speak. However, he only grades assignments between an 88 and 93 which is completely arbitrary. Even if you got the highest score on all 5 assignments, you still would not get an A. Dool pretty much gives everyone an A- or B+. He also cancels class every Thursday to use for "group time".
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Dool is a great lecturer and is really knowledgeable about the subject matter. However, I took issue with the arbitrary grading system, where the lowest grade on most assignments was around an 85 and the highest grade was around 92, meaning poor efforts were rewarded with a decent grade, while even the best efforts ended up with an A-.
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Rick is the man. His lectures are very interesting and easy to follow. Good class discussions. He likes to skip class at least once a week, and makes you post online journal entries. You will get mad and think this is dumb, but it actually forces you to internalize the material. Easy and understanding grader. 13.9/15.
very good class share his experience with the class and very respectful toward the students
good experience in the field share real example
I appreciate how this class let us explore ideas that were wide ranging.
A nice professor who is interested in active discussions
Great
Prof. Kizershot is a solid CAL professor. I would say that she can be a tough grader sometimes, but overall if you pay attention and do the work, you should have no problem getting a good grade.
Required class but useful and a good way to engage with one's peers. Caring prof.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: Professor Kizershot gave me a lot of good advice about being a student and other things I was interested in. She was kind enough to write me a letter of reference when I chose to transfer to a college that allowed me to study more things in addition to engineering.
understanding during the pandemic about how many things are happening
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: Thoughtprovoking material. A lot of writing.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: Good
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: Interesting class got me outside my usual.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: Favorite class.
would not reccomend
Extremely intelligent and fair. Fast paced but you will learn a bunch of practical application.
Extremely interesting and practical class. In my opinion it should be a must in the Financial Engineering program.

One of the best classes I have taken at Stevens. Professor Eroles really cares about his students and makes extraordinary efforts to make himself available outside class, amidst his full-time job. He covered a wide array of topics that are relevant in the industry and taught us through both theory and practice (in-class trading competition).

This class is a chance to learn a little about industry instead of just learning something that may or not be useful. The class is interesting but what makes it great is Juan. If you want to gain some insight into what the real world is like you can talk to him.

Prof Eroles really cares about you learning. He is an industry professional and teaches 1 class on the side. Incorporates real application feel via trading simulation (way diff than other classes) No exams but 7 Homeworks. He'll keep on asking you to redo them if they are incorrect. Very Fair. Don't really need programming exp but VBA is a plus
great professor

Great Professor, can bring industry knowledge to the classroom and motivates people to do their best. His homework are hard and heavy but if you do it, you definitely learn a lot. Always available to take questions and to talk outside class. Great example of a industry professor who understand the needs of the market and try to teach it in class.

One of the best class in Fin Eng program at Stevens. This class is certainly a bridge between academics and the industry. The professor not only made use of real-life techniques in the assignments where we managed a real FX trading book, he also made sure that we understood the different career options available in a sell side firm.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Amazing lectures--Would take again

comment: Good course
rating_tags: Tests? Not many--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Really love him. Taught us a lot about the basic things and also trading skills. He is really patient in helping us on the hw.

One of the best courses (a not to miss) in the Financial Engineering division of Stevens Institute. Prof. Eroles are very committed, uses the class time effectively, brings a lot of insight into the class, constantly motivates & encourages towards the right approach of learning, has no boundaries in sharing knowledge, very humble person & friendly.

He is an industry professor from Barclays and still currently works there on an emerging markets/derivatives desk. He can sometimes be unclear especially when it comes to assignments but if you ask him questions he is very helpful. His industry knowledge is invaluable and reason enough to take his course. He will bring in outside speakers.
Kang is alright at teaching the material, but she can be hard to understand at times. Wouldn't take again if I had the option.
Love her, shes a bit difficult to understand but she displays passion for the course, and gives loud, interesting lectures.

Super hard to understand, does not know how to work the stupid clicker questions. It is evident she is not efficient with catching attention of the room. I got an A last semester in CH 115 and I find myself reading every chapter of the text to learn this on my own and not listening in class because she confuses my readings. I miss Sharma.
Kang is a good professor. I reschedule my class just to get to her recitation
If you read the chapter before the class, you can easily  take notes and understand what she is saying during the class!
Very good
She is the most helpful recitation teacher. I was actually able to learn from them.
Kang is a very easy grader, and is willing to go over the material with the class interactively.
Oh lord. This woman can get very frustrated very easily. She's not exactly approachable.
VERY helpful. Easy to understand.

Very nice professor.  She is very helpful and extremely approachable.  If you keep up with the book, and pay attention when she gives you hints during the class about the tests, you'll do well.  Be sure to look at the quizzes when studying for the tests.

She is awesome! her quizes are fill in, but she always reviews b4 the quiz and usually helps you out during. She gives out review sheets with questions that almost always show up on exams! she has a cute accent and likes to make jokes. doesnt have toooo much patience.

Notice how all of the low rating are the School of Business MA117 students who don't want to learn what sin(x) is. Great professor for Data Science applications, and a really good prerequisite to all of the CS Machine and AI courses because those classes are not beginner friendly. Very accessible outside of class, very knowledgeable is in teachings

I sat in this professor's office hours longer than lecture hours. Exteremly hard class, but the professor has plenty of example problems and is VERY accessible and responsive to students wanting help. Current rating is harsh because its full of business students who don't like being pushed in baby math. Very Knowledgeable and good at higher levels.

This professor is really nice as a person, but is not very good at explaining the concepts. As someone who has taken calculus during high school, I was lucky to have some experience or else I would've been teaching myself everything. Even having taken calculus before, the way he explains concepts is very confusing.

Do not take this professor for MA117. The grading system is very confusing. 3 midterms 13 quizzes(1 every week), and a Final. Spent probably 80% of my time reteaching myself the material or getting retaught everything from my TA. Professor Prasad is great as a person but not as a professor. Would not recommend especially if math is not a strength.
Good Prof.The current rating is harsh for him imo. Teaches well, Keeps encouraging you to follow and you can always ask questions. Pretty gentle demeanour.

His grading policy does not make sense. He tends to get off-topic. Does not know how to teach criteria. It causes problems more complicated than they are. He expects you to know already the standards he is supposed to be teaching.  Average on exams is extremely below average. You do not want this professor.

His lectures are very hard to follow and he does a bad job at explaining concepts. He assumes everyone understands it after the firs time he explains it, while in reality most of the class is left confused. Makes the tests extremely hard and has said he prides himself on being a tough grader and he "doesn't believe in curves".

Prasad is a very good human being and cares about his students. He always does his best to help whenever he can. Honestly, he is an alright math teacher but is also a very fair grader. I would take his class again, definitely a solid option.

Overall is a great guy, he's so nice, and if you go to extra help he really tries to help the best he can. Overall, not a knock on him but I feel like he could never get in everything he wanted to say as class was short. He also would do problems wrong a lot or mark correct answers on quizzes incorrect so was always a hassle to get them fixed.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Overall such a hard class because the lectures are just so short (50 mins each) and he doesn't have time to go over too many examples in class which I would have rathered. He definitely needs to make the class time longer and go over more examples that are of equal difficulty to the homework because otherwise you will struggle on the homeworkalot
He is a great professor. Very passionate about math and wants everyone to do well. The math department at Stevens is pretty tough but he is a fair and nice guy. Would recommend.

Good guy. Sort of a legend ngl. He definitely cares about his students. The material is definitely challenging, but he's there to help you. The homework across the entire math department is a bit steep but manageable. Tests are fair.
He's very helpful and accessible all the time. Good professor indeed!
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Horrible Professor. Forces students to code in a very specific way; coding in this class is inefficient and tedious. Ruined the fun of taking a computer science course, complete waste of time, would rather teach myself using online resources. Professor Iraklis wants his students to code like robots, no creativity and diversity of thought.

Bi-weekly Programming assignments given are very hard. Need good Java skills and programming background to do them. Quizzes are not a breeze, and unfair grading on Final Exam. He's okay not that great. Wish he would tell foreign exchange students to stop talking during lecture and during Final exam cheaters in Hindi/Guju. Would not recommend him.

I took the algorithms course under the professor. I must say he is a brilliant professor and a knowledgeable person. The teaching material was perfectly organized and he was always prepared for the class. Each topic was very well covered from scratch. If you are planning to take algorithms, I would suggest you take under Prof. Iraklis.
Tough paper
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: My mom told life would give you difficulties, she was wrong. GOD GAVE ME ALGORITHMS and from that day onwards I have cried blood tears. The existence of Logic is not in proximity. The guy is practically meth head who wants to feed upon my fear. DO DRINK AND DRIVE BUT NEVER EVER TAKE THE CLASSSSSSSSSSSSSSS!

Iraklis is a great teacher. He encourages class participation and never makes you feel stupid if your answer is way off. He presents the content very straight forward. Both him and the TAs are super helpful at office hours. He doesn't take any nonsense with cheating or excuses and his grading is very fair.
rating_tags: Respected--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: He's a really nice, and fair, guy. Available for help. However, the programming assignments given bi-weekly (most of your grade) are incredibly challenging. If you have no experience with Java, get a tutor or try and learn before taking this, because it is a good prereq, but difficult. Also, must study the lecture notes for the quizzes!!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: I'm not sure if it's Dr. Tsekourakis' teaching style or just the class curriculum but this guy lectures a lot, in a subject that really shouldn't be lectured on. I learned way more from Google and hands-on coding than I did from any lecture or slide show. Other than that, he's a hilarious and helpful teacher.
He is probably the best teacher I ever came across, oh man he is such a nice and humble human I can't even express. You should definitely take CS590.

Hercules is an awesome professor. While his lectures may seem like stuff you've seen, especially when you get to HTML, CSS, and Javascript, they are informative and helpful. The class also has a lot of group projects. Just watch out for his "Short Quizzes" which are randomly assigned. But other than that, awesome class, and awesome professor.
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--GROUP PROJECTS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Big Herc is a great teacher. He teaches his subject pretty effectively, and his class is fun to go to. The only two concerns with him are his admittedly thick Greek accent and the short quizzes that come up without warning. Despite these shortcomings, Big Herc is my absolute favorite professor at Stevens.

Big Herc is a great instructor and is really good at helping students during projects. He will give some pop "short quizzes" throughout the semester, but are easy to pass if you review lecture notes before each class.

The best teacher I have encountered during my time at Stevens. I've taken 2 of his classes now. Explains everything clearly, makes the course difficult and pushes you to learn, and is always there to help you no matter what. Top tier teacher that deserves every bit of appreciation, if you have him you're a lucky student.

Good professor but 106 is a very tedious course in general, especially for an incoming college freshman. Lots of content, lots of formulas, lots and lots of homework, the tests are also very difficult. The course you take after that (qf 112) is a lot easier content wise.

Beware the QF106, or the QF in general trap. Unless you are ready to apply yourself to this major the same way you would for CS or an engineering major, QF is not for you. QF106 is no exception. Lonon is a great teacher and an even better guy, but the class is no joke. Very difficult, and if you can't keep up its basically on you.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Lonon was easily my favorite professor, he taught extremely well in a way that was clearer and more in depth than a surface level description.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Easily one of my favorite QF professors. His class is definitely difficult, but he has very good and concise lectures, and is always willing to help you outside of class. He truly wants all of his students to succeed and pushes you to do well in the process.

Professor Lonon is fantastic. He is clear when describing complicated concepts, provides encouragement, is willing to meet with you to help, and is generally interested in your success. His tests are difficult but he prepares you well and grades you fairly. One of my favorite professors I've had at Stevens, overall a great guy.

Professor Lonon is a great professor that cares about his students and wants them to succeed. He has clear grading criteria and makes you work for the grade you want. Be prepared to attend lectures, study the content before exams, and understand all of your homework. The content he has to teach is very difficult but he does a great job at teaching.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Pretty difficult class. The subject matter is very niche so it is hard to find sources online to compare to or learn from another point of view. Lonon is a great professor and wants us all to do well, but the class is definitely more difficult than others.

Really good to have as a professor. His lectures didn't always click with the majority of the students, but he tries a few different ways to help everyone learn, does his best not to leave anyone behind, as is more than willing to help outside of class. He won't change your grade, but he's a very good professor if you put in the effort.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: Overall a pretty solid class. It was a lot harder than the other classes in the curriculum but I managed. Definitely have to study and do the homework or this will be a difficult class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Lonon is an amazing instructor, however, he is difficult, especially for a freshman course. Be ready to work really hard for this class and take notes on everything he says in class. You need to understand EVERYTHING from the lectures to do well on the exams. Be sure to complete all homework as well and thoroughly understand it.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: His lectures are very informative and they are full of important information and practice examples to ensure that we understand the concepts. They are meant to make sure that we understand the concept behind something, but sometimes they're a bit hard to follow (not necessarily his fault though). His exams only have four questions though.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Alrumayh is seriously awesome! She really cares about her students. Taking CS284 with her, She's so into the subject and makes everyone feel included. Always there when you send her an email, quick response. Plus, she's all ears when it comes to what students need. And grading?  super generous.

Amazing professor and very caring about each and every student. She even considers late works, excuses and such which most professors don't. Her lectures are extremely helpful and they are really helpful towards the exams and quizzes. There is no attendance mandatory but you should not miss her class.
Professor Alrumayh is an amazing instructor and teaches well. She is a very lenient grader. She cares a lot about her students.

Professor Alrumayh cares a lot about her students. She is respected and kind.
Definitely, I recommend taking her as your professor!
She is a sweetheart who listens to the students and adopts their needs.

I must say it was an absolute delight to take CS284 with Professor Alrumayh, she demonstrated a passion for the subject matter. She creates an inclusive and welcoming environment for all students. Their willingness to engage in discussions, answer questions, and provide additional support outside of class. 
I would highly recommend her to anyone.

Great professor!
Tests are average,  you need to show up to class and pay attention.

The course is just generally flawed, not necessarily due to Prof Alrumayh. Programming homeworks don't line up very well with the lectures as code is rarely covered. Midterm exam was very conceptual in comparison to the detail-focused slides. Difference in experience depending on professor for this course is extreme. Participation grade unclear
Abrar is sweet, she obviously has a lot to take care of at home and she's trying her best to teach us, but her lectures are engaging.

Great professor, lenient grader, offered extra credit, was helpful and accessible all semester. Attendance isn't mandatory but there were pop quizzes instead. Lectures did get monotonous at times but overall Dr. Abrar was amazing and definitely one of my better professors this semester. Just make sure to start the homework labs early.

While I do believe sometimes lectures can be very monotonous, she and her TA's are very generous graders. Especially as someone who wasn't a java wizard, I had no idea how to do the Homeworks, so I would go to my Recitation Ta's office hour every week and it was always just me and him and it was EXTEREMELY helpful. So much EC as well

She tries her best that her students understand the concepts taught in the class, and very generous grader.
 Cares about the students!

Good guy, but don't take him if you don't want a B. Many other professors grade much easier than him and it's way easier to get an A under another prof. 3 essay assignments are pretty much your only grades so there's no room for mistakes or learning how to adjust to college writing.
