A great prof all around. He was very helpful when he explained the texts and was very thought-provoking in his questions about the reading. He also was very generous and realistic with readings often including quotes and places where questions were answered in the daily questions.

Really kind professor. I'm a pretty bad reader but I always felt like I walked out of the class with a really deep understanding of the text. Class discussion heavy. Light on homework, and not a very harsh grader.

Really engaging professor and provides detailed feedback on assignments. It's really helpful how he scaffolds the assignments so the work is evenly distributed throughout the course and you can implement his suggestions before submitting your final project.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback

comment: I chose Jurlando because the topic was super interesting, Immortality and the Soul or something like that. Death and afterlife. Opened up some really interesting discussions and made me think about things differently. Really fun class. He's really sweet and understanding. Definitely participate in class and do the readings.

Professor Jurlando is an amazing professor. He gives good advice when it comes to papers and gives worksheets that help when it comes to writing your research paper. He cares for his students and wants to help in any way possible. He asks many thought-provoking questions and relies on your participation to improve the class.

Great professor for CAL 105. Although you need to attend every lecture for credit, they are engaging and the works/topic we look over are interesting. Also, he does not give a lot of work at all, and gives assignments that greatly help the final research paper.

would definitely reccomend for 103. lectures were engaging and even if you didn't feel like you completely understood the reading assigned, when its gone over in class, you feel like you have a significantly better understanding

Professor Jurlando was extremely helpful throughout the semester. Very sweet and gave amazing advice on most of the assignments I worked on. I enjoyed the theme of the class as well (death and mortality of the soul). Overall, really good class but it is heavily based on participation so be ready to discuss your own thoughts to the class.
I have Prof. Jurlando for CAL 103. He was super supportive and overall pretty entertaining. Class is heavy on discussion, so participate!!! Go to hours or writing center if you need.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: I took Professor Jurlando two years ago in my Fall 2018 semester as a freshman. I have to say, he is one of my favorite professors to this day. He genuinely cares about his students. His teaching style is just really unique. He gets people to think, and I like that. I highly respect him to this day. Some essays, a presentation, but it's not bad.

Jurlando is a great professor who really cares about the material he teaches. His teaching style allows for a lot of class discussion which makes the reading topics approachable and memorable. His class theme is Death and Immortality, which is an interesting concept compared to other professors. He is skilled at lecturing and leading discussion.

Great Teacher. He really cares about the material as well as his students. You need to go to class and at least make an attempt to participate, but if you do so and do your assignments you will do well.
Really great professor, who really wants to help you, easiest class you will take.

amazing professor who made physics a lot more understandable. however, there were times when he overcomplicated things in ways that we didn't need to know for exams/quizzes. he went through notes really quickly tho, so be prepared to annotate notes rather than trying to write it all down.
if you do poorly on pep 111 that is not this man's fault lmao

Great person and professor. Makes a tough subject much easier to understand, and evens knows all the places the textbook doesn't explain enough or is just wrong. His enthusiasm for the topic is contagious.

OK IM NGL I HATED THIS GUY FOR THE WHOLE SEMESTER BUT HE JUST DROPPED A BONUS EXAM WHERE YOU GET BACK UP TO 80% OF ALL THE POINTS LOST ON EXAM ONE AND TWO, MEANING IF YOU GOT A 0 ON BOTH IT BECOMES AN 80 ON BOTH. SAMUEL HEDEMANN THE GOAT. honestly tho this is the Stockholm syndrome talking rn pls dont take the class weekly quizes have ended me ngl.

He is a very good professor.  He gives amazing lectures, he gives us the best tips for success in the classroom, and is very funny.   He made me enjoy physics even though I am not a physics major. I am definitely taking his class again for modern physics.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: Honestly, hes a very caring man who I can genuinely respect as an educator and individual (seemed pretty cool outside minus his teaching style). As a newcomer I didn't understand anything, and his notes were not understandable at all. Chill guy tho ig just a bad teacher.

He was a very good lecturer, got boring at sometimes but he knows the material. Many people I know never went to lectures and still got an A in the class. The homework is optional and with the recitation and TAs to help, there is a lot of resources when having trouble. The quizzes are easy and are based off the homework problems. Great professor!
If u wanna hear about his love story for quantum mechanics then take him other than that DO NOT TAKE HIM
DO NOT TAKE HIM I REPEAT DO NOT TAKE HIM
Terrible. Don't recommend. Only talk about quantum physics during lectures
do NOT take this class!!!

Unless you have to do not put yourself through this class. I have a good background in physics and when i tell you what this man says in lecture makes little to no sense isnt an exaggeration. its as if every class is a review session and he just assumes you understand a lot of the topics. I teach myself everything and have an A but i study alot
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Hedemann talks very fast and it's hard to keep up. Just listen and fill in the notes afterwards. He does pretty much read off the notes anyways, but it's clearer during lecture so definitely attend lectures. Sometimes he will give hints for the quizzes. Quiz + exam are not bad make sure you do a ton of practice problems
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Hedemann is simply not a good teacher. He just reads off the notes in class & provides little to no clarification on topics discussed in class. He's not a relaxed person and makes simple topics more confusing than they have to be, & you'll have to self teach. There have been classes where multiple people have fallen asleep in a 50 min lecture.

He is the golden standard for professors: fair, organized, personable, and friendly. HWs are straightforward enough for you to succeed during quizzes and exams (given you practice). Hardly any negatives, maybe lectures can sometimes feel bland since the format of most material is in handwritten black and white PDFs. Just know he won't do you wrong!

Tough. No powerpoints/notes just him talking the entire lecture. Will call on you randomly to answer questions. Expects you to know a lot of material and be keeping up with finance news. Stock pitch project is a really big part of the course. When you present he interrupts a lot and asks very specific questions so be prepared. Exams are long.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: If you want an easy pass, don't take his class. But if you want to learn, keep an open mind, and you will learn a lot from him. However, if you don't want to read, answer questions, or take hard exams, forget I said anything. You need to spend effort if you want a good grade in this class, some of us think it's a downside, but is it really?

Portfolio Mgt class. He literally turned his camera off, and didn't have slides. We didn't learn anything in his class. Lectures are spent talking about nothing; we paid 7k for a class where we just read the textbook. The quizzes are unrelated and we leave having learned nothing. He talks to us like we're in grade school. He shouldn't teach here

It is a pretty hard class if you have no background knowledge. Is a very understanding prof. You will have to learn a lot and fast if you want an A. Long hw assignments and the exams and quizzes are very hard so read your articles and textbook and LISTEN in class!
rating_tags: Respected--Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Big Jon and I became tight last semester. He has an unconventional way of teaching, but if you go to class and listen to him, you will learn a lot. He has great industry and life experiences that he shares in class. His projects are meaningful but his quizzes are not. He's hilarious and willing to help any student who wants to learn!

Professor Kaufman was super nice and very fair. His voice is very monotone which to me can make lectures boring and hard to pay attention. Overall, as long and you pay attenion to his explanations, you will pass. Hes more than fair with grading and one of the most understanding professors ive had.

I have had nightmares about this guy. What a horrible professor. By far the worst I have ever had in my life. Doesn't teach anything yet the tests are filled with topics that we should have learned. The textbook he requires is utterly useless as well.

He seems very knowledgeable but for whatever reason he treats his students like a bunch of children. I learned next to nothing in his class because it was so easy and he actually does not cover much. He is very unorganized. He did not follow any structure in any of the classes I had with him.

No lesson plan. Comes into class and "teaches" whatever he can come up with. I feel like I do not deserve the 3 cr. I am receiving. He is a very intelligent man but should not be a college professor because he has no structure in his teaching.
Very comprehensive lesson plans.  Taught material in a way that was easy to understand.  Would love to have Professor Kaufman again.
Teaches nothing, expects us to know everything. We never get grades back. Teacher I will not want to have again
Kaufman is a horrible professor. He teaches as if he was talking to middle school students, and has absolutely no structure or organization with his class and lecture material.

The amount of assignments in the class is crazy. She is the class's main course instructor and professor, so she is critical. She will also answer students' genuine questions with a lot of sass as if we know the content as well as her. The labs were a disaster too. I knew people with other 211 profs and was graded a lot more fairer than my section.

Professor Fontaine is good herself and teaches the content in a way that students actually learn with examples and discusses each step. She's the course coordinator so knows the topic very well and will always help. However, there is an insane amount of HW for this course and the exams certainly will have a more challenging question.

although a very kind person, Prof. Fontaine often expects too much from first semester students. The class is also an insane amount of thought and work, I honestly went in expecting a free grade but was gravely mistaken.
Really harsh grader.

Her class is not great but not horrible, she seems like a nice lady, but she grades way too harshly and she is very unhelpful and expects you to know everything off the bat. As a result, the TAs were much more helpful, and even seemed more informed than her when it came to the project.

feedback is minimal usually. her lectures arent engaging and repetitive. design labs are met with TA's helping you which doesn't matter for a professor review, but when you ask for help from her, she goes with whichever option is equivalent to restarting your project/assignment rather than working through the problem.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Hard to understand and too harsh of a grader. Do not recommend taking.

The material for statics is basic and the pace of is very slow, but Professor Fontaine taught the subject well. Honestly you don't need to go to the lectures, but the examples we went over were helpful. She's really nice, and an understanding grader. The tests are easy, so if you're with a bad group for the project it shouldn't tank your grade.

The ENGR111 course is pretty annoying in my opinion, but Professor Fontaine was good enough and was never really a hindrance to the education/project aspect of the course. She provided extensions to a few big assignments in our class and also understands that sometimes circumstances are rough. Greatest attribute of this course is the TAs, goats tbh
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Fontaine is very knowledgeable and cares about students success. She as well as all professors in this class assign a lot of homework but helps her students succeed. Main downside is amount of material she expects her students to do in such a short time frame but gives you enough notice if you check in advance. She is a solid choice for this class.

For E126 and ME322. She is unclear, rude, and unhelpful. She does not post assignments or notify us about assignments until the day before. It is entirely unacceptable. Her way of grading is completely ambiguous. I find her rude, unfunny, unhelpful, and just a bad professor. Class would run much more smoothly if she was simply not the professor.

One of the better professors Ive had this semester. If you just pay attention to the lectures and do the homework youll be fine. Shes pretty nice and will take time to help you with any questions you have.

Not the greatest professor on earth but she is kind and is certainly the "easy" option for mech solids. Sometimes out of the loop because Billah rules the E126 curriculum with an iron fist. Would take again for a course I don't care about.
Great lecturer. Probably the best physics-related professor I've ever had. Clear and concise and knows exactly how to get the material across.

As long as you attend class and get the homework in, this class is a breeze. Fontaine very clearly explains how to do the assignments so it isn't difficult to do the homework/quizzes perfectly. Sometimes feels like she is moving too slow with the instructions, but you'll appreciate her steady speed as they get more difficult.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Professor Fontaine goes over the-week-before's homework every class period in-class. You still must submit the homework before class starts, though. Don't think you can get the homework done in-class while she's doing it.

He is a nice guy but does not teach you. The lectures are prerecorded and you have to watch or read them yourselves. They are very heavy on material. During class time he will answer any questions you have. Some HW and example problems are ridiculously hard, but the exam problems are nowhere near as bad. HW not graded and textbook not needed.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Material for this class was mathematically intensive. Professor lists problems on poorly formatted PowerPoint slides, then gives lectures by reading over them. Little effort is spent showing the process behind solving the problems - teaching style is more of a review, assuming you already know the info. HW & Exams are far more complex than notes.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Tests are tough

comment: Truly inspirational. Das beste oder nicht.

The lectures are very dry and consist of the textbook in PowerPoint form, Sven reading off the slides, and most people falling asleep. Each slide is content heavy and don't provide much different information than the book itself. Examples are basic in the slides but HW is complex. He does care and is helpful when asked questions to an extent.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I learned a lot in this class that was not covered in undergrad math courses. He taught me absolutely nothing. He reads off the slides and had no good worked through examples.  The textbook is garbage with worse examples than his. I would never take another class with him. I go to class to be taught not to be read to which all he does is the later.
If you want above a B, expect to work really hard.
Very confusing class
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
The worst professor. He over lectures and doesn't give you time to finish the labs. Also he is super arrogant. Avoid this prof at all costs
Professor over-lectures in a lab based class, ran out of time to do lab work due to long lectures. Very harsh and blunt with critiques; not approachable.

I just had professor snell for ENGR122 and he was a great professor. The project was very tough and I had to work for hours on hours a day for weeks straight, but professor snell really helped out wherever he could. He really cared about the students and wanted them to succeed. He was also available outside of class whenever help was needed.
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Snell is a pretty good professor, but his class is not an easy A. He expects you to show up and work. He genuinely wants his students to succeed and will always be available to help, but not give you answers. If he asks you a question in class, answer him (or expect a lecture lol). Speaking of lectures, Snell can talk for hours and sometimes will.

Professor Snelle clearly knows what he's talking about as an architect. However, he is teaching engineering classes and he does not do a good job at bridging the gaps between the two different mindsets. He has been very rude when he can't get a topic across and has threatened to quit multiple times throughout the semester I had him.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: Snell will not sugar-coat anything and he will treat you like an equal whether you want him to or not. He expects a lot but it's not unreasonable and he's always willing to help you out.

If you suck up to him and nitpick over the details of your work, he will love you and you will do fine; you just have to actually care. He can be stubborn (he got into a whole argument with me, claiming that mass didn't exist), but he actually teaches the material and you will learn from him. If you want to get something out of his class, you will.

Professor Snell is so funny, thoughtful, and intelligent. He always makes himself available to us, and really pushes us to do what we never thought we could. I would totally take him again if he teaches a class I need in the future. The one thing is... dont be late to class. He hates that. And if he asks something to the class, answer him!

Professor Snell gives you everything you need in order to succeed in his class. He is also one of the most caring professors I have ever had at Stevens. If you don't understand something, he is not condescending and instead does everything in his knowledge to help you. His class was very tough, but coming out of it, I realized I learn a lot.

Snell begins by explaining the very basics, but will soon launch into a huge multi-stage project that's never entirely clear. However, he is always around to help, and is easily reachable outside of class. He genuinely wants all of his students to succeed, though it doesn't always seem so as he can be sometimes be arrogant and aloof. Decent choice.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: If Professor Snell is not the definition of a caring professor than I don't know what is. Very carings, wants ALL his students to succeed, will explain things over until you get it. Literally tells you how to get an A in this class. Thank you Prof. Snell for everything seeing you again for D2.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Definitely take Dr. Conn. She helps you become a better writer and lets you know what you can improve on specifically. You can tell she actually cares about her students. Her classes fill up quickly, so you have to be fast.

Conn really sets you up for success! No busy work; you learn something useful every class, so be sure to attend all of them. Textbook readings were tough, but her notes made them easy to understand and apply for future essays. Instructions and rubrics were always clear and she gave great essay feedback. Fair grading with some flexible deadlines.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Amazing Professor, extremely understanding and kind. Would 100% take again
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Conn is the best! No one is doing it like she is! My friends told me to take her and I could tell something was up because her classes fill up so fast, like whos even taking these they're for freshmen, but now I see why! Prof Conn is so fashionable and funny and smart and so so so caring, take her if u can get in!

She's really tough but it became clearer and clearer over the course of the semester that it's because she's holding us to a high standard. She actually believes in us! She requires a lot but if you pay attention in class and take the initiative to come to her office hours she'll give you so much feedback and the tools to actually do it right.

I would recommend taking Professor Conn's class she is very flexible with extensions and attadance you will do more work compared to other cal classes but its worth it she gives a lot of feedback on writing. A lot of professors will make you do a lot of presentations be she isn't like that which i appreciate.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr Conn is an excellent professor who cares and helps your writing grow throughout the semester! I enjoyed having her for CAL 103 and I signed up to take her class again in the spring. Her grading style takes time to adjust to but as long as you go to class and complete assignments you'll succeed.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: Professor Conn is actually a great teacher, her lectures are very informative. Very professional and provides good feedback on assignments and is easy to talk to. She made us dress professionally during group presentations, something that other teachers don't require. Not much homework but a decent amount of classwork.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: Amazing professor! I took her class for CAL 105 this semester and the topic, the body in our society, was incredibly interesting. You need to read and annotate two articles before each class, but you can just skim them as class discussions go into more detail. She is extremely understanding, gives great lectures, and there's not too much work.
Conn is a wonderful professor. She's really helpful with feedback and availability! She also provides extensions if you ask in advance! And, her class was really interesting this semester.

I had professor Conn for CAL 103 and chose to have her again for CAL 105. She is super nice, easy to talk to, and gives pretty interesting lectures. CAL sucks unless you really like writing, but professor Conn makes it at least bearable. She is also super lenient with deadlines and gives very comprehensive feedback on essays so getting an A is easy
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: I love Virginia Conn! She is a great professor and is a lenient grader. As long as you try in her class, she is very accepting of all writing levels. I definitely grew as a writer in her class and I'm taking her for cal 105 now.

okay to be honest I disagreed with almost everything Dr. Conn said but she heard me out and didn't make me feel stupid. I respect that she didn't try to change my opinion but still made me back it up because that helped me understand my own positions better
She was an amazing, caring, forgiving, and motivational professor. Her outlook on education is incredible and I wish I could have had her for every class.

I love professor Conn! I had her last year for CAL103 and am taking her again this semester for CAL105. She really knows a lot about everything, and on the rare occasions she doesn't, she'll find out. She's really good about getting everyone involved, even when they normally wouldn't be. Smart, funny, engaging, and all around great. Take her!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures--So many papers

comment: Professor Conn was the only teacher who learned my name all semester. She took a personal interest in her students and treated us like real people instead of numbers. Besides that, her classes were interesting and made me consider things I never had before. Even though it has nothing to do with my major, hers was the only class I looked forward to

Lectures are very important since he goes over examples in class. Not many homework assignments, but they are difficult and doing them is really helpful for understanding material. Occasionally takes attendance
He has a big ego. Gets mad at people for showing up 5 minutes late because they were taking a test beforehand. He's the type of Profesor that's not understanding at all so just keep that in mind.

Avoid this professor at all costs, even if it means you will have to take the course during the Summer or a later semester. Homework solutions sometimes have incorrect solutions, along with quiz reviews; rendering useless for studying. Does not help in office hours, and tells you to "refer to the slides". Super-inflated ego, avoid at all costs.

I've learned more by watching lectures on YouTube from other professors than paying attention in class. He's not prepared for classes, and makes you practice with materials that you aren't allowed to use on the test. Thinks he knows everything, and more often than not does not want to do his job. Would not recommend.

Amazing professor who knows his stuff. Very insightful and will not hesitate to answer questions to the fullest potential. I faltered in his class early, but with his help I was able to pull it together in the end. Do not hesitate to visit him in office hours with any questions whatsoever.
Very good professor, learned a lot, graded fairly.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: Very lecture heavy and way too cocky about himself. Makes it very hard to listen to him. Accessible outside of class but I wouldnt recommend going to him unless you want to hear him talk about himself for another hour.
Prof. Williams is a smart dude, but can be cocky at times. Likes to call you out during lectures if you're not paying attention. But open to meeting up outside of class to help.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Pretty smart guy, although he needs some work on his jager and wiener schnitzel. Great bread baker (almost as good as wonder bread) and has fairly good smelling shampoos. Mr. Williams does pretty good at Buzzword, but has never beat me at Catan. Overall though, good guy to grab a soda pop with.

Professor Williams was one of my low-kew favorite professors. This class was not the easiest but how well he knows the material really helps you out as a student. If you put in the time you will have great success with him.

Very helpful and friendly; definitely willing to be there for students.  Knows his stuff for the most part, and is pretty good at teaching, though he makes mistakes from time to time.  Tests often put students through a time-crunch, but generally aren't too difficult, and if you studied well, they shouldn't destroy your grade.
I graduated in 2005 and still remember Traugott Fischer as one of my favorite professors.  Class is not too challenging but very thorough.  You will learn something from him, if you go to class.
No Comments
No Comments
Best class I've ever had at Stevens.  He made Materials fun.
Awesome teacher!
No Comments
He is the worth professor I have ever seen. He should not teach at good school like Stevens.
Best prof at stevens.  Actually cares about the students and loves what he is teaching.  Made summer classes bearable and yes, sometimes fun. (not very typical at stevens)
Fischer is a great teacher.  Very animated little guy.  Lots of experience.
hard to understand sometimes. dont like too much
One of the most entertaining, personable, and INFORMATIVE professors I've had.

Took Koeller for Microeconomics, learned a lot. Always made the lectures interesting. 85% of the grade was 3 tests but if you pay attention in class, or even just in the review before the test, you will do well. He is helpful when you need him and understanding of other circumstances. Explains the concepts very well.

Love having him, I would recomend him to anyone his class is an absolute joy. His lectures are not mandatory, however when you go it is always fun because he adds real life stories into the lecture which are really interesting. I strongly recommend.
3 HW assignments, 4 exams. Attendance is not mandatory. Moves very quickly. Review sessions are very good. Fairly accessible outside of class, usually in his office. Solid guy.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: He does make the material much harder than it has to be, but he does very good reviews before the tests and it is usually the same problems that will be on the test.  Honestly only went to the review sessions and got As on everything
He is a great teacher, and makes the material very easy to understand. Glad to have him as my first econ professor.
Excellent professor. Really knows his stuff. Does not use textbook. If you pay attention class is easy.
Excellent prof. who is very knowledgeable but explains concepts clearly.  Attendance is not mandatory but is highly recommended as he teaches his own material rather than that of the textbook.

Good professor. Agree with other comment mentioned for class. Is fairly simple. His tests are NOT multiple choice, and be warned - he cuts a lot of points if he's looking for something specific in your answer and it isn't there. Felt that the tests tested more of what was in class than textbook, fairly good at lectures.
BEST PROFESSOR EVER! If you get the chance, take him. He is a great guy and you'll learn alot. Interesting course material is a bonus.

Very nice guy, gives very short tests.  Has an alright curve, and is pretty competent at explaining his own material.  Tests are pretty easy, try not to make dumb math mistakes, and study to an extent, and you'll get an A.  Be warned, his tests are roughly 10 questions long, so one dumb math mistake, and goodbye 10 pts.
Made the material very complicated (much more so than needed to be). Is not very good at explaining the material well.
One of the greatest professors I have ever had. I just wished that he continued teaching. Open-minded, encourages creativity, and gives helpful feedback.

He is one of the best professors that the Humanities school had. He brought a fresh perspective to the school and taught the importance of the subject. Hopefully, he decides to teach again at Stevens - Ha

The main methods of teaching were slide presentations and working through r scripts with students. He is very approachable with questions and clarifications whether in person or online. Start work ahead of time and take advantage of feedback opportunities, especially for the final project, as he gives very useful comments for improvement.

He values that students are learning and will take the time to make sure they understand the material. Willingness to help students. He recognizes and rewards effort, and would not give an A for the bare minimum. Provides good feedback to improve on future assignments. At times he might overcomplicate an explanation.

I was a bit harsh on my 3/5 rating, given that the exams were still curved anyway and he asked for feedback from us on the midterm. In 317, he maintained the same redeeming qualities and gave out more opportunities for extra credit. 317's data project was my favorite project so far at Stevens due to the freedom and creativity involved in QSS.

One of the greatest profs in the humanities department. As an aspired machine learning engineer, this course gave me a valuable perspective about analysing social data and coming up with a useful summary/results using complex statistical methods.

2/10 professor. Literally reads off of slides and gives extremely hard exams to test memory rather than knowledge. Also teaching a psychology of prejudice course but doesn't want people to reflect on their own prejudices just on science?? Isn't engaging whatsoever. Worst course and professor of my college experience.

Nonchalant demeanor. Lectures being recorded is a huge plus. Mostly straightforward, practical assignments too. The syllabus is clear and displays a good outline. I will agree with others that he needs to work on making memorization less significant on his exams.

Psychology of Prejudice talked more about social science and data than actual psychology. Two extremely difficult tests that tested memorization and specific details more than overall class concepts. Tedious assignments that are only 10 points. The majority of the final grade relied on a project(not discussed in class) and two (low average) tests.
rating_tags: Group projects--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: The exams did not test our conceptual knowledge on the subject, but rather memorization of random statistics from the of studies we had to read. Averages in this class were lower than my STEM classes (50s-70s). Put it so much effort just to get a bad grade. You can study all you want but it doesn't even matter. Don't take this class.

The Prof remained neutral and open minded. The lectures are insightful and he encourages diverse thinking.HWs are mainly discussions.The questions on exam does need some work, as I believe they don't really test student's understanding, but more of a memory test.TBF the prof did provide a curve in the mid and final exam and is open to improvement

Gives students insanely hard tests. A unnecessarily difficult class that wouldn't be if he tested you on the conceptual concepts, rather than your memorization of random statistics. There is no reason class averages for a psych class should be in the 50-70s% range. Such low class averages reflect poorly on the professor, not on the students.

You won't learn the knowledge and related lecture subject but will hear some real professional experiences. Multiple team projects and facilitators don't give you fair grades at all. Avoid it if you can.
Very knowledgable, you will learn a lot but be ready to work hard. Don't take if you don't like to participate. Gives group projects.
Professor is not serious about teaching this subject. Just time pass assignment and syllabus is very boring. Need to update lot.
Great lectures , approachable and will always help u ... its either full grade or no grade .
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Gives a lot of homework assignments right from the class1. Makes you work on multiple team projects and individual projects. But doesn't gives you grades at all. No idea on what basis he gives grades(Very rude grading). I would suggest not to take his course.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Predefined grades - Not sure if the submitted papers are evaluated for the grades. Definitely gauges the effort you put in - More effort  less marks. Very smart - ensures the course feedback is completed before giving the grades.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Not at all transparent in grading. Grade doesn't reflect your effort. Very hectic course. No constructive feedback which helps you improve. Equivalent to taking two courses in one semester.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Very knowledgeable professor. The only thing that really bothers me is that he doesn't give constructive feedback on your work. You will need to hunt him down for every assignment to understand why you got the numerical grade you got. That does not help students learn if they do not learn from their mistakes. He definitely has favorites.
Roymeher was very knowledgeable, very helpful and very approachable.
Easiest A of my life. Great professor, doesn't care about grades. Lets you out early every time. Knows what he's talking about. You can't NOT get an A.
Easiest class ever, barely did work and go a free A

The lectures were very information-heavy. Attendance is mandatory and participation is tracked and worth a decent amount of the grade. Tests are usually all MC as well as the homework. She's tough with students, but it is because she wants them to succeed.
Prof Taddeo was often rude to students. Made herself available outside of class. Exams were difficult but cheat sheet allowed.

Professor Taddeo was amazing. You can tell that she truly is understanding and caring for her students. The lectures are very organized but it is easy to get lost mainly because biology is all content. Attendance and participation matters! She is strict about the final grade but there is a lot of extra credit with every assignment.

Lectures felt useless in comparison to the textbook given by Prof. Taddeo; Even then, the course was still difficult despite the given resources. The homework provided no help and the reviews felt like it only helped answering few questions on the very packed exams. It also did not help that majority of our grade were dependent on the exams.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Very little review done in class so you're going into the exam blind. Taddeo tells you to read the textbook but the questions in there are so much easier than the exam questions. She does a mini review the day of exams but those questions are also a lot easier than exams and don't really help. Exams questions are extremely specific

Every test in this class is absolutely packed with usually 6-7 chapters of information. It becomes difficult to understand Taddeo because of the mask and accent, and she is no joke about wearing masks. I've witnessed kids get kicked out of class for not having one and she will constantly interrupt lectures because of this. could find better,

Absolutely horrible teacher. There is no redeemable factor to her teaching. 
Her tests over 7-8 weeks of content at a time across 8-10 different methods of learning (Class notes, homework, textbook, etc) After all of those methods she writes her own questions which are sometimes in broken english. 

Never take a Taddeo class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Taddeo is barely audible in lectures and her test questions cover an impossible amount of material at once. She makes the material hard for no reason and gives you no example material for exams so you have no idea what's coming. She also does not proofread her exam questions so there are many errors that make them hard to read.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Lectures are just talking through slide presentations in a quiet voice so I was always bored and rarely able to focus. The exams are based on informations from massive slide presentations so the only way to really do well is to memorize random information that you will end up forgetting after the class (you have a note sheet to help).

Taddeo is a very straight-forward professor with a clear grading schema. The material is difficult and specific, but she does her best to passionately and deeply explain it. Online class made it a bit hard, but as long as you attend each lecture and answer questions, you will probably pass and learn at least something. Good professor!
Gets material across very well and cares about the students.
Prof Taddeo was very nice and got the material across well.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: This professor is what every professor thinks they are. He is clear, gets straight to work, and slides a joke or two in the lectures. You did not have to go to class and the HW is on gradarius. He is willing to work through any problem as long as you try. There is no need for extra credit, it's impossible to fail the class. Lectures are long:)
Professor is really helpful, the exams are easy to score, and teaches brilliantly

Professor Paul is amazing! His lectures are not boring and easy to understand because he talks pretty slowly, writes out all the work and explains it. His exams are super easy, LIKE if you been to at least half of his lecture before each exam, you'll pass his test. He really is amazing; he makes the exams as easy as possible.

He talks very slowly but he is an amazing lecturer. Everything he does makes sense even if it is slowed. He does very helpful practice problems in class which helped me understand the homework we had later.
bro is mean asf but really funny at times
Easy class, he requires your attention if you attend lectures but he is a very funny and sarcastic professor. Entertaining and informational lectures, would take again.

This is an amazing professor. The lectures are very clear and he genuinely cares about the Student's learning. Although the homework can be annoying it is not too much and it really helps to prepare for exams.
Easy course and the tests/HW are the same no matter what prof you get but he is decent at explaining the concepts and is a nice guy. Bumps up your letter grade if you are within a pt of the cut off.

Professor Schwartz was great! His lectures were long but he did a good job pacing and didn't make the information and content too difficult to understand. His tests were manageable and a fair representation of what we learned in class. Professor Paul Schwartz makes learning calculus manageable, and I applaud him for that.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: The lectures can definitely be a little boring but overall the professor is good at teaching the subject, especially if you ask questions for clarification. Homework never took that long, and the tests were all easy as well. If you studied at all to prepare for the tests, there's no reason you shouldn't get a good grade.

Take this class w/ Paul Schwartz!! Almost impossible not to get an A. Lecture notes & recordings w/ all the work were posted.  Homework was straightforward, only 5 or so questions, and recitation was also easy.  Only two tests that were simple and no one should have had a problem with them. Plus, the final was take-home. Highly recommend!
I could have finished this course in a week if he could talk faster. Sometimes he skips material in the lecture but it was all simple enough.
Good teacher.

Easy A, but this class is super troll. He wants to simulate a real-world software project, but then why is there also so many slides and quizzes? Should be a seminar and discard the trivial quizzes that we spend all class studying for. No class time for developing and teamwork. And every day he reminds you, "I worked at bell labs you know"

Avoid this class like the plague. Homework is incredibly time consuming and dull. The textbook is essentially useless unless the homework asks a question from it. Questions are either step by step right in the lecture notes, or have no help anywhere in the lecture notes or textbook. Lectures are just from the notes and boring,this class was useless
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Professor is good in teaching and grading criteria is good as well. only drawback is we need to purchase zybook ( $58), other than that it is light course , we can make it with ease.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: It's a wonder how Prof. Peyrovian has been teaching this long. The lecture are fundamentally nothing, he references chapters that appear in no version of the textbook out there, and his criticisms during the semester-long project are RNG, often times directly contradicting his previous criticisms.
Force students to purchase zybooks ($88/term). And over 2000 questions in first week and you need to type all of them on zybooks to get credit.

Professor Peyrovian seems like a great person who wants to be a good professor but unfortunately is not. Lectures are quite literally read word for word off of slides that are not even made by him or the department. He does not answer questions in any way that is useful and seems to think that CS 383 is the hardest and most difficult class here lol
You will be graded by few projects, but be ready to not learn a single thing from this professor and be left even more confused after every lecture.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: He's very lecture based, basically reads off the power point. He acts like you only take his class. so if you're lost he'll be like read the book and try 20-50 problems. Classes as you can imagine are very boring and no one listens to him since its in through one ear and out the other. Grading isnt good, not hard but its not structured well.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Do not take this course unless you can find mistakes in the professor's lectures. This professor knows a lot but is not familiar with some details in algorithms. It happened several times that students asked questions in class and he gave wrong answers. He can't explain details but he pretends that he knows.

He is awesome. explains everything very good, knows a lot, very nice and respectful. I really enjoyed the class he made everything as easy as possible. very fair in grading, very clear ascent, very intelligent. nice TA's. he appreciate your work and gonna help you in final project. always available and reply on emails immediately. he is the best.

PROs: # Mid and Final term will seem easy if you paid attention in class and did the HWs on your own. # The assignments are based on lecture examples. CONs: # Lectures are quite dry. # The solution to some of the assignment problems are counter-intuitive. # TA sticks to the answer key and will not accept any alternate solution/logic.
good

Inaccessible in person or by email.  Received the midterm exam late.  Grading scheme for the exam wasn't provided and discussion about the exam with the professor not possible.  Basically - the instructor posts notes (already made and containing errors) on the web and THAT'S it.
online class, subject was difficult for me but was presented logically.  Learned a great deal.  Professor communicated via email only but was usually helpful.
Very boring and unhelpful

Good professor but overall hard to understand because of his accent and requires you to do stuff not entirely related with the material. Does not follow the book and has his own study structure. Expect to be spending a lot of time coding and reading 15 pages of useful comments about a 1-2 page assignment.
Most awesome professor ever.
Great Professor for OS. Good source of knowledge.
As someone with no prior experience in programming, i couldnt cut it and had to withdraw from the class
Very good teacher.  He explain things very well so that everyone understands.

basically, i couldn't understand him. my few indian friends that could understand his accent said he was a great teacher, but i didnt learn much from him.  our school needs some new teachers that speak english
Excellent teacher. The best I've had, ever. He's funny, clearly explains difficult material, and is fair with grading; always willing to work with you to help get grades up.

Great slides, refuses to use mic and doesn't speak loud enough so hes hard to hear. Doesn't write his own homeworks so he won't help you, so go to TA's. The lectures match up with the exams pretty well, but both him and his Ta's have less than helpful office hours so expect to have little resources. Pray you get a CA that speaks english well.(pray)
The final exam score is ridiculously low. The homework is ok, but the question in the exam in tricky.

Lectures are good and recorded. HW's are not too long but dont really prepare for exams almost at all and not always clear. Some written questions before the exam would actually help a lot. Not as supportive as TA's outside of class, so hopefully you have at least one good ta. Despite good lectures, extrapolating from them can be a challenge.

An amazing and very passionate lecturer. Enjoys participation in the class and explains concepts very well. If you like machine learning, he is a great prof to take. The homeworks are difficult but not unreasonable - start them early and go to office hours. This course is very heavy on statistics.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: insightful instruction on machine learning foundation

The best CS prof @ Stevens. If you want to get your base if ML strong, you first take CS556 by Prof Erisa and then CS 559/CS583 by Prof Tian. His lectures are amazing. He goes into detail behind the math of the concept plus HW's are set in a way that helps you understand what you learn in class. I would take his class again anytime!

Do not take. There were 4 assignments for CS559. Homework 1 was so hard and the midterm was impossible. It is difficult to follow the lectures. His class is also very theory based and not practical at all if you want to learn how to code. He also doesn't provide example problems so you have really nothing to study for the TWO exams you get.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: The class is challenging but Professor Han lectures well enough that it doesn't matter. The class is split between math and CS but somehow he's better than most of my math professors and CS professors.

All of the ML profs at Stevens know what they're talking about, but Tian Han is actually able to communicate the concepts clearly, which is huge. The HWs are hard but fair, but the midterm and final are both especially scary.

Prof. Han is one of best instructors I've ever met. His lecturing style is passionate and inspirational. The lectures are heavy but he managed to cover all the intuitions and implementation details. So you should be able get a good grade if you take the lectures and finish the hws.
Hard working professor, willing to help. Clear lecture structure.
Did he leave Stevens? I still see his pic on our web, but dont see the name in course list. My friend says he is the coolest professor.
I wanna register his section. Where is he? Cannot see his name on the course schedule. They say he is one of the best, if not THE BEST.

His class was one of the best experience for me at Stevens. He is funny but determined; easy going but serious about the topics; too many homeworks but generous in grading, etc. He several times spared extra time for me and encouraged me to study more. I want to take more classes from him but ufortunately, he teaches only microeconomics :(
This is my first semester and I started liking economics beacuse of him. Extra credit, too many homeworks though
Learn economics not for a better grade, but for a better life :) lol

what a G. Gives 20-point curves for both Mid Terms. He is so good at teaching and cares about his students understanding what he is teaching rather than just learning for a good grade. So funny and kind to his students. One of my favs fo sho.

Class: I dont like.
Professor: I like very much.
No tricky questions in the exams. Knows name of all students and asks so many questions during class. Thus, it is impossible to sleep in his class.

Friendly and caring. A little tough sometimes. Homework every week.
Will learn a lot from him.
"Learn economics for a better life, not for a better grade" You will hear this 1000 times. Lots of homework, time consuming but useful. Student engagement oriented. Will learn a lot.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Great lecturer. Teaches every details and focuses all expects of the topic. Always on time.
Not the best professor out there. He reads the powerpoint word for word, doesn't do too many examples, and then pop quizzes you to make sure you go to class.
Talks about theory from powerpoints. Ensures class attendance by having pop quizzes. Lets people do whatever they want in class
Pretty subpar. Got a decent grade and recall the material well, however.
Totally unprofessional and unable to teach the material clearly.
No Comments
No Comments
This teacher SUCKS!!!!  Boring class and didnt learn anything!!!
No Comments
No Comments
NOt a great teacher, but what a hot bod!
He is the best ever!
Dr. Wharton is engaging and inspiring. He is helpful and approachable. Would recommend any of his courses to my fellow classmates. I heart Dr. Dubs.

He is a hilarious amazing person, just go to his office and talk to him one day if you have the chance.  His classes mostly consist of class disscussions and typical wharton antics (in a good way).  Definitely  a class I never wanted to miss.

Very good professor, explains topics in depth. Class consists mostly of discussions about the text, with occasional digressions to current events. Has the uncanny ability to turn the boring topics into fun (and sometimes, hilarious) ones. Definitely recommend, that is, if you can make it before it fills up.

Anyone who has had Wharton can tell you that he is amazing. It is a privilege to get into one of his classes (there is a reason they fill up quickly) He is engaging, always encouraging debate and discussion, and makes sitting through a HUM actually entertaining.
Wharton somehow just finds a way to engage students!

The greatest hum professor (or possibly even in any department) at Stevens. He's fun, and if you've ever had trouble staying awake in a class, his classes are nothing like that. Alot of talking, but alot of it is more about current events relevant to the class (as opposed to discussing strictly the text, which can be boring). All in all, a great gu
Everyone at Stevens knows that Wharton is one of the best professors here.  He can turn any subject into a lot of fun.  Not too often can u say that class was fun. Awesome guy.
great guy
No Comments

Class has very light workload but is also very interesting and one of the few classes I pay attention to. Weekly reflections based on a text he provides in the assignment and essays are usually 600-750 words based on a documentary he assigns. As long as you do it with some effort on time you'll do fine

While the material isn't the most interesting in the world, Professor Teke has an obvious passion for it. I believe he understands that most students aren't well versed in Islam, and because of that he grades very leniently. The only assignments I or anyone else received less than a 100 on were exams, and even those were in the high 80s.
Easy class overall. Short essays due weekly/bi-weekly. Open book midterm where everything is covered in the course. Generous curve.

There is a lot of writing in the class (2x 300w reflections a week + 700w essay sometimes) but the professor will give you a 100 if you submit on time. I never got below a 100 on any assignment except the exams. The exams were tough and had questions that were never discussed in class, but it is still possible to do well. Somewhat easy A.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Lecture heavy

comment: Taking the midterm for example, maybe 20% of what was on it was learned in class or through the insane amount of reflection assignments. For further clarity, this professor (FOR A 100 LEVEL HUMANITY) requires at least 600 words of writing based on 2+ hour long videos or 6 page essays TWICE A WEEK. Not only that, but they're only 10% of your grade!!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--So many papers

comment: Great class, easy A. Gives 100 on papers as long as you put some effort. Will be hard for anyone to fail his class. Missed a reflection or paper due date, that's okay he just lets you hand it in next class. Just don't take advantage of his good nature. Would definitely take another class with him.
Great Professor!  Very nice guy!  Easy class.
Teke is an awesome teacher, and I plan to take his other history classes as well.

Teke is the man, I'm sorry that his other classes won't fit into my schedule next semester.  Seems like a pretty cool guy its a shame the material was pretty boring. Class was extremely easy, 6 papers and everyone gets 100's. The easy A is worth sitting through the class twice a week.
No Comments

Took the class as someone who already knows quiet a bit of programming, so it was an easy A. You have daily quizzes and you wanna listen to lectures if you want to pass. Very accessible and easygoing guy. Gives bonus point everywhere. Homework is done with partners, sometimes a lot of work, but usually pretty easy.

Professor Engling is the best professor I have ever been a student of. He is witty, charming, doesn't take himself too seriously, makes the coursework interesting, and always goes above and beyond both in and out of the classroom to help his students. His lectures have given me goosebumps and shown me the beauty of math.
Mike Engling is the best professor at Stevens, hands down. A god among men.
Engling takes some of the most dry material out there and makes it tolerable. The course work can be confusing at times, but that's just the material. He's clearly eager to help as well.

Professor Engling is able to make a highly theoretical course like Automata not sound dull. He is very passionate about it and his in between jokes eases the difficulty of understanding the rigors of decidability and undecidability....

A truly great professor. The lectures are always very enjoyable, and his way of teaching really can inspire an enthusiasm for the material. Converted me from thinking "programming is the only important  part of CS" to "theory is awesome too!". I also highly suggest taking up his recommendation of "Gödel, Escher, Bach" if you come to share interest!
Best.
Probably the best professor left in the CS department. Knows what he's doing, cares about his students.
Great guy and genuinely a nice person , very understanding and clear during his lectures.
You can tell he really cares about what he's teaching.
Great professor. Really eye opening for someone who previously had no interest in English. If you have the option take CAL 105 with him.
Great professor, definitely going to try to take more of his classes

One of the best professors at Stevens. He takes what seems to be a boring subject to some, and breathes passion into it.  The class itself isn't too hard, just a couple quick papers and a quiz or two.  The experience you get from taking the class makes it all worth it.  Long live McClellan!

Phenomenally intelligent, someone you can actually talk to on a person-to-person level, instead of simply a Professor-to-student level.  He's absolutely enthused with history and it shows.  Although he failed to instill this enthusiasm in us at 9am, he never let up the forcefulness of his lectures.  Long live McClellan!
Awesome teacher.  The best of the year.

I took all of prof, McClellan's classes and must say that he was one of my favorite and I got all A's.  I took him in late '80s when he was still young and handsome. loved talking to him and watching his cowboy boots. hope he still wears them, loved his French accent, even went to Paris to compare.  miss you prof McClellan, you are one in a million

Endearing as a person. Somewhat difficult to pin down as a professor. At times very enthusiastic, other times seems to be going through the motions. I enjoyed reading the texts he wrote, and I imagine so did he.
No Comments
He's just a very enthusiastic and enjoyable teacher.
McClellan is the best!  He's fun, interesting, awesome... I just love him!  I'd marry him, but I'm already married!

Touikan is awesome. Very intelligent and funny guy. He made the material really easy to understand. He's also available often for office hours and would literally spend hours answering your questions. My only complaint is he writes his 9s like Gs.

Very friendly professor who loves clearly math but this class was extremely proof heavy. Can be a bit all over the place at times and it's hard to tell what point he's trying to make and how things connect occasionally, so studying your textbook and notes is essential. Assignments are fairly hard, but quizzes are easier.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Touikan was really laid back and helpful. His lectures were clear, and if you have questions he's almost always available at his office or via email.

Professor Touikan is an awesome professor and I'm glad to have him for MA 121 all the way to MA 124. He is absolutely hilarious and his class is engaging. If you need clarification, it is easy to find him during his office hours and he is helpful in clarifying parts you don't quite get.

Touikan: The only reason to get up for 9am math classes. I made the mistake of waiving my AP credit for calculus, but his lectures made retaking calculus worth it. He despises the lecture format but makes them interactive enough to keep his class' attention. His jokes are hit or miss, but his sense of humor is unique. One of my favorite professors.
Prof. Touikan is an amazing professor. Lots of material to cover (especially MA 123/124) but he made me want to go to lecture every morning.

Professor Touikan is a super sweet and smart guy. Any issues I had with MA-121 and MA-122 were not because of him - I promise. He tries his best to shove a lot of material into the short amount of time he is allotted, and does a fairly good job at it. Always open for office hours.

Very enthusiastic during lectures and manages to keep them fun and entertaining. The class itself can be grueling, but he was very helpful with questions and always responded to emails from students. Would definitely recommend if you bore easily during math lectures.

Very young teacher but that just shows itself in his enthusiasm. He might mess up on the board a couple times but he's fine with having students tell him when he writes something wrong. Just a very nice guy

He is very excited about his work, he puts a lot of effort and is very funny during lectures. If you have any questions you can always go to office hours and ask.  He might make a lot of "silly" mistakes on the board but then you pay attention and the class becomes more engaged. I would really recommend him.

A good professor for a bad class. I had a massive amount of homework, but I'm not sure if that's from the prof or the class. He's pretty nice and is a decent but somewhat boring lecturer. He will definitely help you if you don't understand and grading was very easy. As far as a required chem course goes, Khade is pretty good so I'd recommend him.
Thoughtful, fast email responder, good overall teacher that is well-rounded in the field of chemistry.

Rahul Khade was my favorite professor as a freshman hands down. He was a really chill guy and always taught the material well. He was always able to answer any questions people asked in multiple ways. The class itself was kind of a repeat of high school chem, but that's not really on him.
Dr. Khade was the best professor I ever had because of how approachable and nice he was.
Dr Khade is excellent teacher with subject knowledge. He is easy to approach and supports well when you need better understanding of the topic.

Professor Khade is an incredible professor who is always open to helping his students. He clearly is very caring and will do everything he can to help you succeed if you reach out and go to office hours. Ever general chemistry class has the same curriculum and grading policies.
great professor, explains things very well if you have questions, lecture notes are very wordy and can be confusing so make sure to ask questions as he will clarify it really well

His lectures are extremely boring and useless for almost anyone who took chemistry in high school He is also next to useless when grading issues arise No matter how blatant an issue there is regarding grading he deflects and ignores any comments He also gives effectively meaningless feedback when asked for help and often gives you wrong information

There is a decent bit of homework but none of it is too difficult. There are plenty of extra credit opportunities and the chemistry department does whatever they can to help everyone's grades at the end of the semester. He explains things well during the lecture and answers questions well.

One time I got a different grade from my groupmates on an exam for the same work, and he told me that grades are based on the graders opinion and I cannot expect the process to be fair. He also gives all material the same amount of classtime, so harder topics are not given enough time to go over. You have to self-teach if you want to pass.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Compared to all the CHEM teachers at Stevens. Dr. Khade is one of my favorites. He answers questions during lectures and wears super funny t shirts. Though everyone complains about chemistry, those are the typically people that don't ask for help or invest any time. Chemistry will never be an easy A. You have to push yourself, and actually study.

Definitely the most confusing professor I've taken at MSU. He speaks in a heavy German accent and speaks in a low voice which makes it hard to understand and hear him. The group project will leave with a giant question mark for a while even after the class is over. Easy A by the way. However I'd strongly suggest taking someone else for Statisitcs.

He is somewhat hard to understand, I feel like I did not learn anything from the class but I still received an A. He gave 3 test, you were allowed to use your computer for all of them. Make sure you keep up with giving in powerpoint slides for the group presentation. You will not learn anything but you will get an A if you try. You need the book.

This is not a class to take if you want to learn Business Statistics because you wont learn anything. Took him at MSU and you will wonder how this guy is even a professor. Hard to understand and you kind of just have to work your way through it. Its pretty easy and the tests were all open book which is how everyone passes.

it was impossible to understand him. attendance is not mandatory. homework assignments are easy. exams are easy.. (he curves)--  i went from a 75 to a 100. do everything you need to and you will get an A.
He is incomprehensible and completely useless. If you do the basic stuff, you will at least get an A if not anything else.
Competent
Easy but he can be a pain.  Don't bother attempting to talk to him. He won't understand you, nor will you with him. He's a pushover too. Just keep resubmitting the work until u get the grade u want.
No Comments

Bazil, is very easy to get an A, he lets u make up homework and do extra credit.  He is not a hard grader, and lets you hand in work late so long as you hand it in.  he is also easy to contact and available to help you any time..he wants everyone 2 get As

Prof Bazil is an extremely inteligent person.  He knows more than most people about systems operations  but the language barrier makes him hard to understand.  All homeworks can be resubmitted.  Easy to get an A or B with little or no effort.
this was a very difficult class, only 2 exams. however it makes you think a lot. he's a great teacher and if he sees vast improvement from exam 1 to exam 2 he will weight exam 2 heavily.

Insanely amazing professor, his tests are hard, but what really matters to him is simply demonstrating an understanding of the material by the end of the semester.  His passion for mathematics is incredibly inspiring and it is a privilege to be in his classes.
Not good

Pinkham is an absolutely brilliant man. However, he does a lot of magic hand-waving while at the board. You can tell how much he genuinely loves the subject; every motion projects a zeal for mathematics. However, this doesn't mean you can follow along with him. Though I loved having him, I wouldn't like to have him again.

Had him for Calc II honors.  A good percentage of the things he wrote on the board were wrong (he knew what he was talking about but wrote things down wrong hence confusing you more).  He does not dwell on the foundation of what you should be learning before skipping to more advanced math.. thus you build a house without a foundation...  And eventu
First you must learn the material; then you can afford the luxury of understanding it.
Pinkham ruleS.
OK, so I had Prof Pinkham 5 years ago. He was brilliant, clear, and fair.

He's a great guy, very nice.  When I had him, we all took Maz's test, regardless of the teacher.  It made the tests impossible, because he didn't go nearly into enough detail as Maz, or was nearly as strict.
Nice guy. Very helpful. A bit unclear at times, but on a whole, he's a good professor.

Honestly whoever takes this course I wish you the best of luck. Midterm average was a 56.3 and the final was a 32.8 with a 20 point curve. The professor reads straight off the textbook and randomly humiliates students who even slightly look confused. Homework's are graded out of completion.
Unempathetic, often degrades students publically, extremely harsh grader and 95% of your grade is determined by exams

HW was 5%, midterm was 35%, and final was 60%. Most of the other stuff we learned wasn't on either exam; only brief concepts were on it. The 3 questions on the final were little things we learned but on steroids. Minimal partial credit on exams. The mean for the midterm and final were 61.9 (w/ 20 pt curve) and 26.2 (no curve). Course curved 28 pts.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: She knows what she is doing, but I know many people who didn't understand what was happening.  The tests are 95 percent of our grade and the averages were 27 and 39 respectively before the curve.  She gives no partial credit.  She was approachable at first, but she was more hostile later and could not answer questions. People were afraid to speak.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment:
The class itself was difficult enough, and she makes it even harder. The questions on the exams are not something you would see in your homework. And speaking of homework, there's barely any homework for you to get exercised, which means you would have no clue what's on the exam. No partial Credits.
Not being fair on grading presentations.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Elnaz Sadeghian is quite possibly the rudest, most uncooperative, excruciatingly pedantic individual I have ever come across. Your existence as a student is an inconvenience to her personally. Elnaz did not take our class seriously and failed to fulfill her duties as an instructor, while allowing her snobbish and repulsive personality to run free.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Graded by few things

comment: Assistant Professor Sadeghian is not fit to teach. There is little to no effort put into the preparation and curriculum of her class. The lecture is little more than a page-by-page summary of the textbook. Does not provide any partial credit or extra resources for studying. When asked to explain, often gives pedantic and patronizing explanations.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Graded by few things

comment: EE348 is a rough class, and she makes it super difficult. 60 final, 35 midterm, with no formula sheets, and the class is an absurd amount of material you must memorize exams have 3-5 questions, so rip if you study the wrong thing. But LOTS of extra credit, and she is funny and approachable. I hated this *course*, but I did learn quite a bit lol
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: She didnt give us homework till 1 month in. Told us she wasnt going to give solutions for the homework and we should just talk and figure it out. Also said might not give us exam solutions after. Hw is only 5% of your grade and tests are 35% and the final is 60%. One kid out of 20 got above a 70 on the homework and she wouldnt curve it at all
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: The class is not hard, she makes it hard by unusual teaching methods and rules. There was nothing on canvas like materials or notes. When we suggested things like notes or hw solutions to help us better understand the subject she would reply with a rude and condescending no, as well as argue with the student who asked. She is not fit to teach.

The textbook is the only resource you have for this class. The notes she gives during lectures are practically straight out of the book and every time I asked for more work / resources / explanations and I was ALWAYS just pointed to the textbook. Barely gave any hw, or tests, so no way of knowing how you are doing until it is too late.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: I don't understand what the bad rating are about. She great lol

I want other students to know that she is cognitively synced with the molecules. Sometimes in class I see her mumble, but its not directed towards anyone. At first, I thought this was quite weird, but later I realized she was conversing with Methane to get permission for a methyl shift.

I would be meaner, but I still need her help. Will update rating when I don't need her help. Weird obsessions with mongooses and east african crowned cranes. Seems like she would eat batteries as a kid.

Just a small town girl
Livin' in a lonely world
She took the midnight train going anywhere
Just a city boy
Born and raised in South Detroit
He took the midnight train going anywhere
A singer in a smokey room
A smell of wine and cheap perfume
For a smile they can share the night
It goes on and on and on and on
Strangers waitin'
Up and down the boule
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: they have comitment issues, hates saccharides, and has red hair!!! thye hate bio too!!!!
Shes a good teacher but too short to see when in class
Rehab was supposed to be a fresh start, and it was with Rhea!!
I asked for help on a question, and she literally farted in my face. I recommend staying away from her.
She is great but cant teach for the life of her... No Experience
She is a great teacher, but she seems a little too young to be a distinguished professor. I think she's a Young Sheldon type case.
Nice course, even nicer professor!! Wish he offered more classes.

Liked everything about this course except the finals. Team projects can be terrible when you are the only one working on it! Professor is one of the nicest at Stevens! He knows his stuff and knows how to make it interesting. Enjoyed the course until finals! Plenty of bonus points for completing data engineering certifications.

Learned a lot and so much more to learn. Professor's passion for the subject jumps out. The stories he shared about tech and applications made it more enjoyable. Gave me a lot to keep busy over winter.

Engaging in class helped me a lot. Found myself reading more in anticipation of questions professor may ask during lectures =) XD I like professor Guntupalli's teaching style, particularly recaps and quiz Q&A reviews. Somehow those complex topics seemed much easier when everything came together during recaps. Highly recommend!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: This man rocks! Love his teaching style and how nice he is. Quiz every week kept me on my toes. "Forcing mechanism to keep up" as Prof. Guntupalli puts it for weekly quizzes and milestone presentations for finals helped me a lot. Almost like gamification. Plenty of bonus points with certifications and AWS Academy courses.

BIA/EMT 678 is great if you can handle the course load. I'm in the AMP, so it gets overwhelming sometimes, but Prof. Guntupalli has been very helpful from the get go and helped me get better every week. He is super nice and wants you to succeed. Just finished AWS course for bonus points, Databricks Spark cert next. Hoping for an A.

Not the easiest also not the toughest. I am a decent programmer so I was fine not my teammates. +ves: covered a bunch of real-world data eng. & ML use cases, Spark deep dive, LOT OF GOOD LEARNING MATERIAL. Negatives: team project for finals. Should be individual. Take prof Venu's class, my friends told me the other sections were mostly theory.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: Prof. Venu Guntupalli is hands down one of the best at Stevens! His classes are engaging and his teaching style very easy to follow. You can see how he really wants his students to succeed. BIA 678 introduced me to a new area of distributed ETL and ML. Just put in the effort and the prof. will help you ace the course. I wish he taught more courses.
Almost a quiz every class. Attendance mandatory. Topics are distributed computing, data engineering & ML. Spark topics and coding in almost every class. Professor is nice and chill.
This is the best class so far!! He motivated me to learn more content outside of the syllabus and even gave extra credit for completing Databricks certification. I wish he teaches more classes.

In the first lecture the professor gave reasons why one should take this class and why one should consider dropping. He said he would make it worthwhile if we put in the effort and I am so glad I decided to continue. It was heavy on Spark assignments and readings but I learned so much. I want to become a Data Engineer now thanks to the professor.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Awesome course. Prof is great and so are his lectures. He focuses so much on making students industry-ready. It was a little tough but learned a ton!

Every week 2 papers and their summary to be written- this is the only thing that makes the course a bit intense! you will have manage your time! For midterm its a take home paper and final exam is a pyspark project!! the professor is knowledgeable just that at times the class gets very monotonous but i think it is because it has so much content!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Caring

comment: Took two courses online concurrent with this guy.  He finally started posting material 2/3 weeks into the semester.  Does not return emails.  Does not grade anything till the last week of class.  This is a problem because his assignment build on the previous assignment.  So if you mess something up all the assignments are messed up. Goodluck!!!
Never met this professor, but I'm in his class..... The registrar says he's still teaching, but experience says he is DEFINITELY retired/gone!
