Tewks is one of the nicest teachers I've ever met. He is so down to earth and tries to crack some jokes during class. Although he is not the greatest teacher and you don't learn much in class (somewhat because it's just a hard subject), he really tries and is just a sweet old guy!
Definitely an awesome prof. when people stopped attending he gave us a test, and asked us to write the letter I backwards.
He is a fun guy...But E 115 is totally a joke I learned nothing from him
Smart guy. Nice guy, even. I just don't think he can teach at all. Kind of smug and eccentric. Wants to help but something about him also makes him inaccessible.
Easier then making a cake
Tewks is the man. There's really nothing else that needs to be said.
No Comments

Tewks is the man. When people stopped going to lecture, he gave a quiz with one question: what color is the WHITE board? Those not there, get a zero. =) Fun times. He's pretty clear in lectures, and his website is even better. Makes cool jokes in class. Doesn't believe in exams. Will hit you if you call him "Doctor" (just "Tewks"). Cool guy.

He covers a lot in a short amount of time. The quizzes focus on the most important class concepts and generally aren't hard. Each homework feels necessary, but the labs don't. I really like the feedback we get for our project (and that we present them). I also really like his flexibility and that we stop getting homework once we have our project.

382/392. Excellent lecturer and extremely knowledgeable. Paying attention during class is critical. Exams are fair and highly conceptual (as opposed to memorization-heavy) but studying for them can be tough since practice problems / past exams are not posted. Neither 382 nor 392 is bad if you practice and you will learn a lot.

He is a bit difficult to understand, and his lectures are very vague. He doesn't really explain things in depth in the lecture. He gives almost no review material for tests, just the slides he went over in class. Also, he asked us not to give him a bad review after he got mad at the class for collectively getting an answer wrong on a test.
Pay attention in class and practice ARM coding. The class is not bad if you put effort in

Prof. Mordohai is a good professor and he is accessible during office hours, but he gets serious points off for his vagueness. In a course where his lecture notes and the textbook are often in direct conflict, "You need to learn to make these decisions yourself" is not acceptable when asking for clarification.

CS800 is a good course for an introduction into research. It is basically an independent study of a specific topic, so the course content changes by student. Overall great experience. Very self-driven course though.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Graded by few things

comment: Great professor. He does a good job of helping you to understand the material. He does expect a lot of prior knowledge though so this is probably why a lot of people think he is a tough professor. Come prepared to learn the course material + any material that you should have already known.
horrible class, horrible professor. If you're taking cs 382 take it with reza if you don't want to hate yourself.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Extremely rude and not helpful professor when you ask for help.

He cares about student, and he grade all the homework, really take it seriously. He explains thing clearly during lecture, review through quiz almost every lecture. You will learn a lot if you follow, and he will help if you struggle. Nice guy, only minor stuff is his accent.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Clear grading criteria

comment: I missed a ton of labs but she let me make them up every time without a problem. she can be a bit blunt with the way she speaks to her students but I think she has good intentions and is caring underneath.
Unstructured, make rude gestures when 1 MINUTE late to the lab. Overall, TAs teach the class, but the professor who runs it herself is not swell in personality.

Extremely condescending teacher. I missed a lab because of a family issue, and because of this, she replied to an email regarding all of her students needing to retake a specific lab to move on which made no sense. She provided no accommodation and ultimately gave a 0 for the lab (NO makeup). Being 1-2 minutes late means you can't take the lab.

Faith Kim doesnt really teach at all whats happening during the lab. You will be getting taught by your TA. Its a fun class when the experiments go well. I rather have taken this course than the actual lecture class.
extremely rude and unhelpful

The labs were pretty good, TAs were willing to help. Faith Kim herself, if you get her talking to you for the lab that week, talks for like 4x the amount of time as other sections, but it's all in ensuring your safety so I'm like split on that. For a required course though chem lab is fun, don't be scared about it (unless you get a bad partner).
TAs mostly ran the lab but when Faith Kim showed up she was helpful as long as you showed up on time and followed lab procedures.
Easy lab class, wanted every student to learn and succeed. Prof Kim was not often in the lab as it was mostly TA-run but she was helpful when available.

Always has everything prepared for class. Explains lab procedures very well. Punctuality matters, so don't be late. If you miss her instructions at the beginning of the lab then she won't let you participate. She takes safety very seriously so make sure you wear long sleeves, goggles, etc.

I really enjoyed having Professor Kim run my lab section! She is very knowledgeable, helpful, and makes herself available outside of class for any questions. I am happy to have her again next semester.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Nice lady, though a lot will complain about her accent and clarity. It could've been worse, but depends on whether you ask someone who took AP Chem in high school or not.

Cancels class half the time because of migraines. Some assignments were submitted on Canvas, some in person, and some over email. The hws were unclear/hard to find in the slides. She tells funny stories, but is very condescending and not helpful if you have questions academically. I honestly think she just reads off of the very outdated slides.

She knows her stuff, but you'll have to apply a lot of individual effort as the in-class feedback she gives is rarely clear. She can also be rather condescending and abrasive. However, she is generous with extra credit if you show you've worked for it, and you can get a lot out of this class if you choose to. You'll get the grade you've earned.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: so unclear, don't know what grade I'm gonna get, doesn't use Canvas at all
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Note: COVID-affected semester; Executed this on-campus class well in an online-only environment. Regular lectures. Next to no HW -- Pro: more time to study topics for better understanding / Con: Makes tests have higher stakes for grade. Topic  hard if w/out background in stats/regression, but free online reference info/videos will help with that
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things

comment: This online class was poorly executed. No recorded lectures only PDF slides. Her HW instructions were vague and too open-ended. System dynamics can be difficult and time-intensive but her implementation just exacerbated it unnecessarily. She makes herself available to answer questions if necessary.

I love her, she's a no bs kind of teacher and expects you to put in the work. She does not really assign homework, but there is a tradeoff because your grade is all based off the final and midterm. Her classes have very interesting material and she teaches it well through personal and textbook examples
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: A great teacher, just need to put in work in her classes. Have to attend, else the tests will seem out of reach. Trying is more important than getting it right.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Professor Zigh is really amazing The course itself is tough as is the material. But she's willing to stay after class or set up meetings with you if you don't understand. However, PUT IN THE WORK, It's only easy if you put in work. If you sleep, text,go on FB etc she'll notice and frankly, I wouldn't waste my time either if the student doesn't care
Very tough class, but she offers a lot of help whenever it is needed.
GREAT Teacher, always helpful, if you have the motivation she is willing to help you the whole way. Show her respect, you get it in return. Great Person, too!
Great classes with equally good assignments that will make you engaged in the classes.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: The Professors who are able to break down complex topics into smaller, more manageable pieces and provide examples and real-world applications can be particularly effective in helping their students learn.

I found Prof. Schwed very passionate for teaching since the 1st class. He not only focus on academics but also practical knowledge which can assist us in our future.
He always encourages students. If I ever get a chance to work with him or again to learn from him in future, I would love to. I just want to thank him for precious lectures and words.

Prof Schwed is super passionate about his field and even more passionate about imparting that knowledge on others. His lectures are very informative ability to keep us engaged during virtual learning was greatly appreciated. Very flexible and works with students. A definite recommend!

Professor Schwed was an excellent professor and industry professional to learn from. He's approachable and teaches from experience. His passion for the material is truly inspiring. He encourages questions and always provides informative answers. His class was the most beneficial to my career. I would highly recommend taking a class taught by him.

Professor Schwed was an excellent professor and industry professional to learn from. He's approachable and teaches from experience. His passion for the material is truly inspiring. He encourages questions and always provides informative answers. His class was the most beneficial to my career. I would highly recommend taking a class taught by him.
One of the best professors you will ever meet. He changed my perspective on construction safety from being a boring subject into a seriously interesting subject that I want to know more about.
Great professor a lof knowledge in the class.

It was a great experience studying in Prof. Schwed's class. He is passionate about his work and brings with him an immense amount of industry experience. He uses detailed presentations for instruction and invites industry leaders as guest lecturers. To sum up his teaching is- experiential, collaborative, presentational, and participatory. (5 stars)
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures--Would take again

comment: It was a great experience studying in Prof. Schwed's class. He is passionate about his work and brings with him an immense amount of industry experience. He uses detailed presentation for instruction and invites industry leaders as guest lecturers. To sum up his teaching is- experiential, collaborative, presentational, and participatory. (5 stars)

Online course EN 250 Quant bio. Best course you'll ever take. Not much work, and easily secured an A in the class. Records all the lectures so I never had to attend. Highly recommend for science elective.
Yo, Strigul the bomb. He cares so much about what he's teaching and will help you go above and beyond if you express interest. Protect this man at all costs.
The best!!!

If you got below an A- or below in this class, you my friend need intellectual help. 4 assignments. 1 Midterm Presentation, 1 Midterm Report, 1 Final Presentation, 1 Final Report. Use Mathematica for final if you really want to secure your A for the class. He's very flexible for the project which is why he doesn't set grading rubrics. TAKE HIM!!!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: Ignore all these 1 star reviews. Strigul is truly a 5.0. Yes his lectures are confusing but the midterm project and final project can be ANYTHING as long as its 1% related to biology. He recognized hard work and complements students who deserve it. Most students choose his class rather than NANO since he's 1000 times better. Prof Strigul is the man

Overall a decent teacher. Had him for Calc 3 over the summer session. His tests were easy and homework was assigned right from the textbook so solutions were available. He can be hard to understand at times, but once you get used to his accent, it's not bad. He's helpful and responds quickly to emails. I would take another class with him.

He wasn't the director of the class Levine was, so his lectures were always at least a week behind the homework. Very frustrating and annoying to go to class when you learning what you did on the homework you had to figure out yourself 2 weeks ago. Loves math, but doesn't do a good job of explaining to the class.

Teaches but there is no point to listening. No tests. No quizzes. Attendance is not taken. Choice of a final test or final project. Everyone will choose final project because no one knows whats going on in the class because of previous reasons. Final project is not clearly defined, totally ambiguous. He expects us to magically know what he wants.
Great guy. Very nice and very helpful.

He is seems like a nice guy, but he can't teach very well. He has a thick Russian accent. He knows what he is talking about, but can't teach it. He loves math; to him it's "beautiful".  He basically teaches right from the book. You will learn best by doing examples from the book.

You need a study partner or two and a lot of time for this class which includes regular hw, Matlab hw, weekly quizzes and very detailed exams with a harsh grading. This class feels like taking at least 2 classes. The teaching is extremely limited like in most of the eng courses and it provides maybe 20% of what you need. Level of difficulty: 4.5

This is my second course with him. In his online course, he only provides his bare-bones slide decks, with no extra notes. The difficulty of his classes would be greatly reduced if he would actually define what the variables in his equations meant and if he would actually show examples using real numbers. He does not do either of those.

Reads directly off PowerPoints, which is word for word from the textbook and the textbook sucks. Gives a quiz after every class. Gives EXTREMELY long (50+ page) MATLAB assignments even though he doesn't teach MATLAB in class. He gave more homework than my other three classes combined. Wouldn't take again, too much work for one class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: The guy is a very solid teacher and does a pretty decent job at conveying the course material to his students. He gives pop quizzes almost every class so make sure you pay attention but the pop quizzes are open notes and are very fair and easy. He's very accessible after class and will try to help you the best he knows how. Very quick on emails too
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: If I had 2.5 hours to live I would spend them in one of Professor Li's lectures because you feel like it's been an eternity. While he is knowledgeable he does not translate his knowledge to the students well and you'll be googling the homework and project questions to solve them.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Just think clearly before select his class, he is just a stubborn teacher, no much skills
A significant portion of the grade was based on Matlab projects. Exactly 0% of the lectures and 0% of the textbook included any material on Matlab.

Took 2 classes online with Dr. Li.  Instruction was boarder line nonexistent.  There were no lectures. The entire course was a bare text website listing what book chapters to read. Notes and labs appear to come directly from the book publisher.  "Notes" quote the book verbatim and provide no additional instruction outside the book.
dude needs to stop mumbling.
Difficult material, but he does his best to get it across.
I would take this class with any one but this prof.
pathetic professor.  Never take it.  Teaches all out of scope things.
Not well prepared for each lecture, missed a lot of classes yet no make up, graded rigidly and hard to communicate with, comments for homework are not persuasive.

Took an online course with him, he is very helpful and answers questions thoroughly through email. I enjoyed his live sessions but wish there was more practice material between sessions as the class works may not have been enough and I felt my knowledge of statistics was lacking for what we needed to do. I liked the class though and learned a lot
Excellent
Does not give any marks for attendance. Did not tell that there are no marks for attendance. Not helpful at all. Gave marks to discussions that are not at all helpful
Loved him!
A good professor who grades fairly and provides quality feedback.  His online live sessions and their recordings could be of better quality.
A good professor who is clear with his assignments.  Online lectures and live sessions could be a little better quality, but all in all he gets the material across.
he actually cares about students and for once i felt like I mattered.  project was awesome which helped me in my interviews.  took far too long to grade, but he did not have a ta
Great class by merging data management and R scripts together in mostly a learn by doing setting.  Class should be 3 credits.
group project was awesome but beware of who your team mates are teacher is very knowledgeable only negative was took professor long to grade hws

Houlihan has a firm understanding of the subject matter and teaches in a fun manner.  I was able to secure an internship at a hedge fund based on the practical knowledge I learned from this class.  I recommend taking his classes.

Overall, a really good professor.  He uses a very practical approach to investing anyone can understand and start investing.  His teachings made me realize it does not take an Ivy League MBA to make money in the market, much is common sense invest by observation approach.
Professor Houlihan is horrible and the entire QF class is glad its his last semester.
professor no good he not clear and no experience and not fair grader gives girl better grade

Professor Houlihan explains material in a clear and concise manner, he also ties programming to practical applications within finance and does not bore students with too much theory.  I was not very interested in programming at the beginning of the semester, but by the end I really enjoyed programming!
not a great teacher, not respected by students. all he talks about is how much money he could have made if he made different life decisions.

Dr. Lee is absolutely amazing. He is so thorough in his explanations of every detail. I look forward to his lectures every day. Definitely take his class if you are brand new to biology, you will learn so much. There is a textbook, but it is free to access. Be ready to read before going to class! He will make himself available if you need help.

His one positive is that he made the tests open book/note, but this is offset by the fact that they were designed to make students fail. Lectures were largely useless and what material they did cover was poorly explained--then we were tested on stuff never covered. He was disengaged, unhelpful, and made the TA do almost all of the "instruction".

The most unhelpful and condescending professor I have ever had. He manages to make every single question on his exams a trick question, and then accuses his students of cheating and insinuates they are dumb. A direct quote from an email he sent out "the results also suggest that I continue to overestimate students." Avoid at all costs.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment: Woo Lee is undoubtedly the worst professor I have ever had. He has unbearable handwriting, unhelpful lectures/slides, and the worst attitude I've ever seen. He always rushes through examples and information and then spends 30 minutes talking about his travels and his hobbies and basically anything that does NOT have to do with Materials.

Woo lee isnt a bad guy, hes just a bad professor. He is self absorbed, mostly comparing the class to himself, such as saying that our bad test grade is an embarrassment because he would have done better. He does indeed use obscure examples to relate materials to the real world which can be useful, but they usually end up being about himself.

I learned more about how to make pasta and immigration than Materials during lecture. Was told to buy the online textbook as it was going to be used heavily and turns out he tells us when the semester is almost done that the test material is not from the textbook at all. bruh

Illegible handwriting, contradictory notes he doesn't bother to correct, told us to purchase book then told us that the stuff on the test is not in the book, test is entirely trick questions, more paper writing than actual materials science, spends class time bragging about his research accolades and topics, all tests taken online, homework  test
rating_tags: SO MANY PAPERS--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Here is a guy who knows what he is talking about, its just a shame that he cant teach. Lectures are dry at best, be prepared to learn more about him making pasta than material science. His tests are brutal and exact, no partial credit anywhere to be found so good luck. Its a shame this is a required class

Hes my favorite professor at stevens. Hes funny, and is great at explaining materials science through real world examples, and he requires students to solve modern day problems with what we learn. A real gem. Also, he doesnt give a final exam, and tests are only worth 45 percent of the grade.

Took him in 2013. His Australian sense of humor involves crassly poking fun at students, yet he also gets frustrated when a class Engineering students is not eager to participate in this environment. I was struggling so I went to his office hours, and he was a completely different person: very warm and helpful. I would avoid taking his class.

Professor Dobbins is a very wise professor. Most definitely not for everyone though; he is quick to call students out on poorly made decisions/thoughts. He is a tough grader, but if you put in the work, you'll pass. Participate, and definitely talk to him during office hours! He is much less intimidating in casual conversation, I promise.

Suuper smart guy, but he's usually too preoccupied being offensive to really teach anything that profound. He also uses a ton of examples instead of just saying whatever is on his mind, so that comes off as patronizing. If you sit down with him you can definitely learn from him, but he doesn't use class time as effectively as he could.
He insults his students regularly. You don't have to actually read the passages until you have to write your essay. The essay's hold the most weight in grading, he values them more than tests.
He's the kind of professor that'll take off points if your opinion doesn't match his which is very annoying. He's also pretty daunting.

Professor Dobbins is my favorite professor at Stevens.  He's a tough grader so if you're looking to coast, go to Rutgers.  Overall, Dobbins is greatly inspiring. Just don't expect to be lazy in his class and not get called out... in front of everyone.

I don't know how other students found him nice, he insults the entire class on a daily basis saying "That was the most unintelligible answer I ever heard."  His arrogance and sarcasm comes off as cruel, not funny.  Avoid his class if you can, not an enjoyable experience.

He is one of the nicest professors I have met in the CAL department.  We always had intriguing and philosophically stimulating class discussions.  He is a tough grader when it comes to papers, but usually if you talk out your ideas with him it will help you know what he is looking for in the papers.  I would definitely take a class with him again.

Professor Dobbins has a way of seeing more in his students than they see in themselves. He pushes your level of understanding of any excerpt read, and inspires you to think deeper. You won't get away with papers that restate discussions you had in class - you have to push yourself. He is one of the most interesting people I met at Stevens!

Took him last spring, and the absolute best professor I have ever had. I never left one lecture confused. The class is a bit tough and theory-heavy but Professor Brady never failed to explain in a way that just makes sense, plus he added humor to the class. I wish I can take him again.
I'm convinced Prof. Brady works as a hypnotist. His lectures would consistently put me to sleep, but I'd always wake up knowing the material inside and out.

Prof is a legend. He's been teaching the course for ages and knows his stuff. Lectures are like any math lecture, but his jokes break the dryness and inspire students to write some stuff down. Course can be done completely by textbook and recitations, but he makes lectures interesting enough to go to. Definitely take if your can.

Class is crazy hard. Brady is okay. He makes jokes here, so I'll give him that. Definitely lecture / note heavy. I feel like every lecture I would look down at my notebook to write notes and I would look up again and the entire board was covered in the span of ten seconds. Class is definitely garbage. If you're aiming for an A, lower expectations.

Brady's amazing. He gets a ton of hate for being boring and ancient, but I honestly think he's the exact opposite. His quotes are pure gold and he oozes wisdom. His humor is incredibly dry, and 90% of the time it goes over the heads of everyone in class, but that makes him infinitely funnier in my book because he still knows he's funny. Smart dude.

worst teacher i ever had dose not know how to word questions at all asks things that are not in the text book and gets angry when you ask about it or if you ask about the way he dose his homework he snaps and goes off saying "i have been teaching forever don't give me opinions on how to run my class" he in very unfriendly also very not lenient.

He might be a little dry during lecture, but if you pay attention, he's actually extremely clear cut. Has been teaching forever and so he has his lessons down to a T.  He's also kind and pretty laid back.

Also had for 221, but Levine ran class. By far one of my favorite teacher. Genuinely want to help students. We went over the homework on the day we handed it in and were able to correct the ones we got wrong. Also able to suggest test problems. Funny, talks about going to the bars, and even brought in candy for us after Easter. Great teacher!
No Comments

60% of your grade is dependent on Exams (15% Midterm 1, 20% Midterm 2, 25% Final). Meaning you can score 100% on every assignment (there is a ton of work) but be a bad test taker and your grade will suffer. If you don't have at least two A- on the exams, he will bump you down to a B+ automatically because of the finance department's silly policy.
He would like to skip teaching and had us meet him in his office from time to time instead.
Prof. Ghoddusi is nice and very helpful, but sometimes he does not keep up with plans and is not organized teaching.
Professor Ghodussi is a very good teacher.  He explains things in a clear and concise  manner.  I highly recommend taking his class.
He is a good lecturer, some times not prepared enough.
Very knowledgeable and presents the material in a clear and organized way Participate and class and you'll do fine
Very good professor, explains concepts well and is a likable guy who truly cares how much his students learn.

Professor Ghoddusi really attempts to teach the reasons underlying the concepts he teaches in his classes. He really cares about how much the students in his classes learn and is willing to adjust the pace of the class accordingly. It is rare to find a professor who cares about the his students' experience so much.
boring and dry lectures

The best class at stevens if you are interested in leveling up your low-level skills, focused mainly on C and the shell. Not easy but very useful if you plan to pursue a future at a low-level coding job.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: One of the best professors at Stevens. If you're looking for an easy TechE, this is not for you. If you want to learn and double your brain size, take him.

Jan is a little quirky but really likable. He's funny and very passionate. He clearly has a lot of experience and cares about his students learning the material. The course is a wonderful balance of concepts and application. But he expects you to watch videos outside of class and doesn't use canvas. The homeworks and CTF are hard but doable.
This is a really good course, but it is very programming intensive. Get ready to make your hands dirty with UNIX and C language. Professor is really good (teaching + knowledge).
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: 1. Only 60 minutes per class 2. No curve for grades 3. Lots of homework and projects 4. Don't take it if you are not proficient with C programming, including concepts about pipe, thread, linux file system, HTTP

-> Don't take this course if you are not proficient with C or you don't like coding or you can't spare enough time for assignments. -> Professor does not use Canvas (Learning management system) so it is hard to keep track of the deadlines. -> There is no scaling/curve for this course. -> Found professor to be somewhat prudent.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: The professor Schaumann is one of the best professors in Stevens. Expert in Unix/Linx. Working as a principal engineer in Yahoo. The lecture is interesting and homework is median difficulty but needs you read the document of Linux if you are new to Linux. The homework feedback is really specific and helpful.
A realm of Stevens Computer Science Department. Very informative and knowledgeable.
That's all.

He means to engage the class by cracking a few jokes here and there but it doesn't stick most of the time. If you're ok with a prof who talks at you, gives take-home exams, never calls on you, and doesn't take attendance, take him.
Easy grade, very basic SQL concepts. He points out SQL interview questions sometimes

He's a nice guy, but not a great teacher. I have him here at Boston College & everyone I know is confused when he speaks during lecture. We have a ton of homework, his office hours are only 15 mins long so ur not able to get anything done during that time, & the tests are insanely hard- like test avg of 30, with some of the smartest ppl I know...
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Overall great teacher. Gives plenty of time to do homework. Never gives a lot of homework.

He is a very old professor and he will give you A grade for sure in the end. Attendance is not mandatory so you don't need to go for classes. Assignments are super easy and can submit older ones too. The only issue is you don't learn much about the subject unless you do self-study with his slides. So for boosting the GPA, you can choose his course.

Somewhat easy grader, not many assignments in this class. People unfortunately stopped attending class midway through, which was sad to see. He's well-versed in the subject. Have to do assignments of course to do well (2 group presentations, 2 individual essays).
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: assignments are straight forward. anything you need is in the textbook, but the lecture notes are very dense and in-depth, so you will probably not need the textbook. Easy and forgiving grader (Seems to grade more on effort than correctness)

An easy professor who is clear with assignments.  Do not go to him for assistance or clarification because he is not very receptive.  As long as you follow the instructions for the assignments he is not a difficult grader.
The best professor for Knowledge management and data warehouseing... give practical examples for KM .. fav toyota model :) ...
Top notch professor,  a wizard of ME!
phenomenal professor. was extremely thorough and helpful.
Thermodynamics has never been so clear.
Best Professor.
Simply one of the best. Took 2 classes ME 335 and ME 354. Very clear and helpful. makes class interesting. Tricky exams.
Probably one of, if not the most helpful teachers I've had at Stevens.
I wish he taught me thermodynamics too. i wouldve had a better grade for sure. He also teaches heat transfer.
good
This is the best teacher the school has! He is a good guy and cares about his students. I wish he taught all of the ME classes.

Dr. Abel is great in some ways, but can be difficult to reach at times. I wish she did weekly office hours. I feel that if a course is asynchronous, there should at least be more regular office hours than 3 times in the semester. She will meet with you, but sometimes she is very busy. Tough class.

Posted entire course of recorded lectures day 1. Does not post hw solutions and does not allow you to ask questions about past hw errors on Q&A sessions. Ignored my requests for a call before exam. Knowledgeable on content but lazy. Grad class but treats students like children. Tough exam does not allow you to go back to a question once answered.
Any graded assignment I have has no feedback or explanation. Never received 100 on any homework's only 99.8. Also no late homeworks at all. 10/10 would take any other professor.

Quirky professor who's in charge of an entire department. Not sure why everyone hates her but I haven't taken her upper level classes yet. Loves to chat and joke around, definitely has command of the material. If you're EM or ISE and you don't like her, best to just suck it up and learn to because you want her on your side.

Homework and lab assignments take way too long to complete because she teaches the class very poorly. Nearly the entire class failed the second exam and then she refused to curve it. Speeds through recitations and expects you to print out all the questions because she refuses to post the work online. Just a bad professor overall.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: She strives to make econ significantly harder than it should be. She does not communicate material well and the problems in recitation, homework, and exams all feel worlds apart from each other. She also refuses to curve exams that well over half the class failed because she won't admit she made a bad test. Prepare to study A TON if you want the A
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: I'm sure she means well, but Dr. Abel can be a little rough. She won't hesitate to kick someone out of lecture for using their phone or to blatantly tell you you're incorrect. She also throws a lot of curveballs--study hard for the final.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Tough grader

comment: I don't understand how someone can be teaching the same thing for so long and not understand that when people do bad in her class it may not be their fault. She is super stale and boring and will not help you when you ask a question. She thinks everything she says is the 100% truth and will completely ignore anyone who may think otherwise.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--EXTRA CREDIT--Tough grader

comment: Course is mandatory to graduate... The "Fun-Fact" every lecture consumes class-time better spent on example problems. For recitation: you are expected to do the problems first, so she can QUICKLY breeze through the answers, never to post the solutions, and makes sure no one has out any electronics, or else. NO materials available for exam studying.
Group project class, Professor Reinisch is great and helps out every group with feedback. He is incredibly caring and if you put in the effort, you will get a good grade.

Probably the most committed, enthusiastic, and enjoyable professor I have had yet. All other sections complain about how bad their profs are and how the class sucks, but this professor made the class so enjoyable and showed us why it was essential. He is there for you to learn something and not cause he needs a job. Take him and save yourself.
Hes a great guy, really made MGT enjoyable even though I took the class remote. The lectures can be bit of a drag at times but overall I highly recommend

Such an amazing and accomplished teacher! A lot of engineering students are always confused about why it is mandatory to take this class but this professor is the reason why. He truly explains the necessity of business skills in engineering and provides a brand new perspective. Overall, one of the best professors/teachers I have ever had.

More technical-minded engineers will complain about the course content, but Prof Bill is a great guy who does everything he can to keep it engaging and fun, even if he is cringey sometimes. Don't worry about getting a good grade in the class
One of the most entertaining professors at Stevens. Best MGT professor there is. The class itself is a drag but he tries his hardest to make it NOT suck.
would have been nice if he boosted are A minuses to full 4.0 As but im not gonna be too salty of it. Bill was awesome throughout the semester. P.S. he likes Bill rather than William.
Solid choice for mgt103.

Professor Bill is by far the funniest and goofiest professor I have ever met. Learned a lot from him. Also is the ONLY Mgt103 professor with an engineering background and has a bachelors in engineering. If you achieve below a B+ in his class you really need to evaluate your major because Prof Bill is that good!!!
Bad professor teaching a bad class. Don't recommend.

Class can be difficult depending on how much you like mechanics and is one of the harder required engineering courses with a lab + general lecture & exam schedule. Professor Shi is not a bad professor and his lectures/lecture notes are good, but he is really quiet and I sit at the front in lectures. English is not his first language. Nice guy tho
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: He can be very quiet but tries to utilize a speaker to project his voice more. Lectures are usually pretty empty since most of everything covered in class is on canvas

This class is rough, I don't know who made the curriculum for this.  But, this is mainly the lab component itself.  For the lecture, Shi's a great guy.  He's quiet, but he explains the topics pretty easily.  The class is empty mainly, but most of the topics he showed to us made sense.  Labs are horrible, but that's for every professor.

Yong Shi responds to emails quickly and gives good advice on approaching an assignment/project. Although his grading was easy, his lecture videos on cloud computing are outdated and he cares little to update them. I would take this course so that I can focus more on self-learning and other courses of that semester.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor shi is very nice if you were to talk to him 1 on 1. But as a teacher he lacks significantly and will put you at a disadvantage compared to students with other professors. 0/10 on him as a professor. He stares at the board confused most of the time and is very hard to understand. His lectures are abysmal especially in a harder course.

Yong Shi is a very respectable man, however a poor teacher. His accent is extremely difficult to understand, and the material he teaches you is almost nothing like what is on the test, and his work is fairly inconsistent with the correct answer. He mainly reads off slides, which can be found on canvas.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: He has issues with clarity sometimes, but he tries very hard to explain himself clearly. He also loves teaching very much. He came and reviewed with us for the final at 6 pm on a friday. We went to his office and he went through a bunch of problems with us.

I'm sure this teacher is brilliant in his own language, but he is absolutely impossible to understand.  No one could understand him.  People would walk out during class.  I had to get a tutor to pass this class.  Fortunately I got one of the best tutors ever and passed with flying colors.
Very difficult to understand. He graduated from MIT but it seems that he just doesn't have the ability to teach. As I said it is terribly hard to get past his accent.
Such a kind teacher, really an enjoyable humanities course. Watched a movie called my life in pink which I really liked. If you need humanities, take this class!!

She's the best. Makes the class very interesting, lots of classroom interaction. Has different lecture formats instead of the same thing every time. Always willing to help or explain if you need it. Very fair about grading. Take her classes!

She is the best psychology teacher ever. only reason i have taken up three psychology classes already and im looking forward to taking one this semester too. I hope i get the same professor this time. Just take any class that she teaches. it will be worth it.HSS 175,176,330 and a couple others
She is a great teacher who picks interesting topics and is always willing to go out of her way to help. Highly recommended!
interesting and a good teacher. will go out of her way to help you, though you wont need it if you go to class and pay attention. picks cool books to read in gender class! highly recommended!

Pretty good professor. Know how to write essays well. She takes off points for the smallest things. Mid-term is very easy just read the book. She talks about very interesting topics in class...most of the time
Although the class is taught as more of a lecture, it can get interesting if you start a discussion going.  Very sweet woman who wants you to do well.
Very nice. Interesting topics.
Not a tough grader if you know your stuff.  Interesting classes.

He's really just your average white boomer professor. We had 3 group projects and a few papers, but that was it. Not a bad professor, but not a great one. He's a good professor to go to if you just want to get your humanities credits out of the way.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Group projects

comment: He is a very tough grader and participation matters A LOT in his class. If you skip, you will probably get a very low grade. He is not very helpful and is honestly quite judgemental. He does, however, grade the midterm and final lightly (yes you do have a final in this class during the finals period).
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Tough grader

comment: Professor Pennino makes for a very interesting and enjoyable class. He promotes in-class discussion in a very effective manner, and conveys the information well. You have to participate in class if you want a good grade, but that is not too hard to do. He grades the few required papers pretty easily, and he's a super nice and funny guy.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: His lectures are long and hard on the brain, yet the kernels of wisdom extracted from them are gems in the rough. He is encouraging of students who wish to do more, and acknowledges the fact that everyone is overworked. I never felt stupid asking a question when I got lost. The first half of each class was built on student feedback and questions.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Hes a great guy and teacher. He makes you feel very comfortable in class. His lectures are long and you do have to participate, but there are only 4 papers and a midterm and final essay which arent too bad.

Best professor I've had at Stevens so far.Extremely knowledgeable of his subject. Kept his 3 hour night class interesting and lively, which is especially difficult when it's in a room full of co-op students that have been at work all day. If you have the privilege to take one of his classes make it a priority.
Good but made us write a 15 pages essay.
Awesome.

She was a kind professor, but she also just expected too much of her students I feel. She makes it easy to get above a C but hard to get a full A, so its really a ton of effort just for a little reward so it was pretty draining. Also, no phones at all in class, and everything is on paper which was horrible, and this was unique to this professor.
EXTREMELY LIBERAL AND BIASED. Would not recommend taking her, can't use your phone ever and she lowkey is yapping too much.

You have to do a lot of on paper writing and homework. There is only a midterm portfolio and research paper that needed to be done, but messing those up can screw over your grade heavily. Somewhat harsh as a grader and do not even attempt to use AI, she has no issue handing out 0s.

She refuses to use technology in class, makes you write everything in a notebook.  Harsh grader for an intro course writing.  Most assignments are based off completion, making the midterm and final very heavy on your grades.  Most annoying laugh and voice ever tbh.

Nice to talk to and her classes were enjoyable, but way too harsh of a grader for an intro-level writing course. Even when submitting revised essays, her grading did not make any sense. I suggest taking someone else, the amount of work you will put in for an intro-level course with her is not worth it

Dr. Burke is not a bad option for CAL 103 although she does assign more than the normal amount of work than your average Cal class its not something that is hard,if you completed the assignment you got a 100. She has many opportunities for extra credit. The only con of the class was we had to create a podcast and present it.

Lots of reading in this class, took up tons of time. Hard grader and not a lot of grades so must do well on everything. Makes sure students are prepared for every graded assignment and is available outside of class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Accessible outside class

comment: The class was good, and the way the writing process is structured you will always be on track to finishing your essays. You really have to try to get below a B in this class because it is built in a way to support you through the readings and essays.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Burke is a solid lecturer. While many professors will tell you they want you to get a 100 (and then do absolutely nothing to help you achieve that), she actually gives you valuable feedback about your writing that will help you revise it to a 100. You can miss lectures for up to 4 days without any grade reduction. Highly recommend her.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: The worst course that I have ever taken! I won't never take his courses again. Heavy load of assignments, vague requirements. Rated by few tinny things, and also very unfair. If you want a happy semester, do no take his class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Prof. Oyeleke is an astute teacher. He is delivers his course material with real life examples and goes extra mile to make sure students get what he is teaching in class. He is also very understanding and passionate about his work. I will definitely take this course again. I really enjoyed this course.

Good Lord! This course made me hate programming and software engineering in general. Quizzes and exams do not align with what is being taught in class. Unclear grading in exams, points cut for arbitrary reasons in programming assignments, and a lengthy group project with clients so if you don't have much programming experience good luck.

The worst course that I've ever taken. I wish I never took this course, I wish I never met this professor. He even doesn't know how to code, but let you did lots of python assignments. Rate project score by nonsense points. Awful memories that I WISH I NEVER HAVE!
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: His delivery is boring, and lack of examples that are connected to the real world. A lot of mumbling. He doesn't fully understand his teaching material and PPT looks assembled through Google searches overnight. He doesn't design homework based on student's average available time. Attitude is somehow passive and doesn't seem to care.

This class is honestly a terrible way to introduce people to the Software Engineering Major at Stevens. Oyeleke reads off slides, can't answer basic questions about what is on the tests or what he is even teaching. Group project throughout the semester, but he provides no input or feedback whatsoever. Complete waste of time and terrible learning.

Extremely disappointing class. The teacher had very little actual domain knowledge about the class he was supposed to teach, and the TA had to carry the class. He spent more time figuring out what was going on than actually teaching. He just parrots the slides someone else made for him. Don't expect to learn anything new in this class.

If this was my introduction to coding, I would have switched majors. The professor gets defensive when you question something you don't understand and the course itself is the butt of everyone's jokes behind the scene. No, really. I can't think of a single person that thinks this course was good. Do better Stevens, this school is expensive.

The professor is not of understanding nature.
Use derogatory language in class
Does not keep his words
Lot of knowledge but does not know how to teach
He's a great guy. Pretty and chill too. Just be prepared to do a lot of work. His exams are way harder than you would expect.

One of the worst professors I have ever had. He was completely unhelpful and a terrible lecturer. He is knowledgeable in his field, but is often quite harsh and dismissive towards the students, which makes an already difficult course even more unbearable. Moreover, his attidude during most lectures wasn't great and he was often frustrated in class.

Very knowledgeable professor. I took FE621, however, his teaching style is not helpful. What he covers in class is 10%, and what leaves you to learn in homework is the remaining 90%. lt should be a computational class, not an algorithm class and leave you google and figure it on yourself. Upside is he do care about students, ask him any question
Very knowledgeable about probability but not financial engineering. He belongs in math department.

In the beginning of the semester gave us a choice of final project or final exam which was nice to have a choice. Let us have a take home final which was really long but graded pretty easily. If you followed the textbooks and lectures (which he posts on canvas) you will do well

Took his class in FE department. His teaching is good and with a good logic. He is professional in statistics and stochastic. And he treats student very well. (His attitude may be not that good, but he does care about students).

Worst teacher I have ever had since beginning my college career 5 years ago.  I realize this is a grad course so it should be difficult, but when the professor does nothing in class to help the students learn the material, it becomes that much harder. AVOID

Gives homework as busy work; essentially reads over the textbook in class; does not grade any of the homeworks we do in time so I have no idea how I am doing in the course; overestimates how efficient his students are doing the assignments (two paged proof hws and thinks we do them in 45 minutes); students are teaching themselves; and arrives late
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: He's alright. Not good not bad. Thick accent but it's not incomprehensible. He's pretty chill. As a student who doesn't like math, I found his classes challenging. Even if you are amazing at math, you have to study hard no matter what. A lot of HW in the math dept, and tests are definitely something. Just relax and stay positive. Get HW done early!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Helpful

What an embarrassment to Stevens. A completely incomprehensible teacher who scribbles nonsense on the board and mumbles in a Russian accent. I stopped going to his lectures halfway through and feel bad for the poor souls who were misguided by his teachings. I don't care how attractive girls may think he is, you will not learn anything from him.
He is so funny. Arguably my favorite teacher.
THIS MAN IS ABSOLUTELY BEAUTIFUL
No Comments

He's a really nice guy and all, but he is just so boring. He takes all his notes straight from the book, so no need to go to lectures. He does seem to genuinely care about his students. His handwriting is horrible, but luckily his accent is easy to understand.

First, this professor was extremely entertaining. Some of the reviews said that we only go over a small portion of what we read, although that's true I still learned alot. Also, the class wasn't difficult we had extra credit and even without doing any I still got an A, if I did do it, I would have had over 100%.
Abolutely NOT horrible, actually a great teacher.  Some who post here should, at least, check their grammar/spelling when attacking an English teacher

Absolutly Horrible.  He thinks more about what he is going to say than what he actually says.  He talks about one page of the books we read and has us read about 1-2 acts in one night and goes over none of it. He studers when he speaks and just goes off an random and useless tangents. Avoid if at all possible! Brutal coments on papers even its good
Great Professor
No Comments

He is a good teacher and explains things well.  He sometimes goes off on a tangent about sexuality, lol, but overall very good.  Atleast he is one of the few teachers at Stevens who isn't trying to ****in shaft you over.  Anyone who is complaining about him probably just got a bad grade, cuz if I did, i'd probably complain about him too.
No Comments
Absolutly HORRIBLE!

He likes to go of on tangents a little about his work experiences, but his experiences are very interesting.  If you need assistance or better guidance, he is not the best professor for you.  I just finished the assignments based on the book's content and I had no problem.

"Engineering Economics is the most important class you'll ever take here at Stevens. If Alexander C Humphreys was still alive today, he'd endorse E355." That's basically the gist of his lectures. You don't need to go to class - each class is just a powerpoint pres. that's put on webct anyway. Labs and hw can be a pain. Overall, its an easy class.

Dr. Merino wrote one of the most useful books on the subject and he makes the class interesting. He takes the time to make sure everyone in the room understands the classic calculations. He gives entire course slides on CD first day, so keeping abreast of the lectures and homework is simple, and one can work ahead each class, so lectures reinforce.
Easy class. Decent guy. Fun to joke around with. Tried to act tough but couldn't really control a classroom or push people to give maximum effort.
Good professor. He can be a little arrogant at times, but still a good teacher. Class was easy and very forward.
Read the book, he doesn't help a lick..although if you kiss his ass, that wil help, that is really all he cares about!
cool guy and funny, doesn't really teach alot and has alot of stories; however the class is really easy
This guy is great.  Easy class, good guy, but didnt learn that much cause i wasnt forced to.  He repeats his stories over and over.
Very tough grader

Thanks to her, Senior Design class was a great experience.  Always helpful, caring, making sure our projects are perfect, passionate about her job.  She is the best! This is a belated thank you for all the guidance and help she provided.
She really helped as a TA.  The professor sucked, but she helped us pass.
She is great! She went out of her way and helped me out with another class where I did not understand a theory.  ThanX!
:)  i wish we have more profs like her, she sure is very clear and helpful and a cute accent
No Comments
very helpful, down to earth, ready to help and makes sure you learn

She is the best ever! Very helpful, very nice, makes sure all students get the same attention.  Very fair in grading, responsive to all e mails, no office hours, it is pretty much she helps whenever you go.  I just would like to thank her one more time.

He is probably the best professor you can have for Engineering Graphics. Only teaches you what is necessary for his class and goes through the tutorials really well. Beware of going ahead of him though, he absolutely hates that. For the midterm, he goes over the test step by step so you are guaranteed to get a 100. The final is also super easy.

Really good professor that really cares about his students. He may seem very intense but he just wants all of his students to succeed. In his class you learn so much about SolidWorks in just a semester

Really accomplished guy who always finds a way to break the mold and push boundaries. Intense and demanding, but does it to better his students. Approach his personality with an open mind and swallow your pride, you will thank him later .

At first, he seemed really tough, but as the semester went on, he was an amazing professor. He actually taught in class instead of using the reverse classroom, and he knew the labs that other classes were doing were useless. I learned so much and he turned out to be a really funny guy. Even though I had him at 8, I was fine waking up.

He comes off as tough but he just has a sarcastic sense of humor. As the semester went on, he acted nicer and could laugh with the class while showing that he knew what he was doing and was willing to help as long as you were willing to ask for it. He is understanding and respects anyone who shows him respect back.
I don't know  what class the other two reviewers were in .. Amazing teacher and he really inspires you and lets you know what the real world will be like.

Everything you learn about Solidworks in this class, you teach yourself from the built-in tutorial modules.  Odds are you'll find his TA more helpful than he is if you have any questions.  Also, he's unnecessarily verbally abusive and mean to students who aren't as knowledgeable as he wants them to be.

This man was unkind, yelling at students for being late or unprepared for class. And he wouldn't let these seemingly small infractions go either- he would keep bringing them up. He did not teach topics, instead he would refer the class to tutorials using the software Solid Works to teach us computer graphics and 3D modeling.
A great guy.. with a rockin bod
reminds me of a grandpa. i kinda like him
He can't say O's are R's really well..But is a good teacher, tries to makes jokes... just laugh and learn.

This class is easy as long as you pay attention in class.  he gives quizzes but he doesn't weight them too heavily if the entire class doesn't do well.  overall very nice and helpful professor, he knows his stuff.
This class is pretty easy.  I like Prof. Skown.
Bernie is very knowledgable.
No Comments
vinsel is the dood
Vinsel is the greatest!

Vinsel is an excellent professor who is enthusiastic about the subject he teaches, and knows that you, as a student at a tech school, are most likely not as enthusiastic. That said, he does expect you to participate in his discussions, which he keeps lively and educational. It is overall a fun class and an easy-A as long as you participate.

Awesome guy, smart, very good professor.  He makes the class engaging, and overall a fun time (from 9am till noon; it's a long class).  All the readings and mandatory blog posts make for a nice pile of scutwork typical of a humanities course, but as far as humanities courses go, this is one where you won't even be mad about it.
Vinsel is the man

Vinsel is one of my favorite professors in the CAL department. His class is hilarious and he is very engaging in the classroom, he respects everyone's input and the topics discussed are very relevant.
Good class with good material. Lots of reading
I was so lucky to get this guy for my CAL 105 class. He's really laid back and personable, so he's very easy to talk to. I'll be on the lookout for any future classes to take with him.

One of favorite professor at Stevens. He's so kind and helping and always ready to help. He gives extension for assignments whenever needed. You'll learn alot from his course. Much much better than Patrick hill who teaches the on campus section.
He is extremely knowledgeable and experienced, but he should teach a little more in depth but its ok.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Barresi has been one of my favorite professors at Stevens and his web dev courses have been my favorite classes in my 4 years here. His lectures and codebase are very informative and the group project at the end is fun to work on. The content you learn in the class is very relevant to what you will do once you get a job or internship.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: One of the best courses here at Stevens! You will end up picking up solid skills that are extremely relevant in the industry. Prof is really engaging with the course content, and the assignments though open-ended at times were a lot of fun to work on. Makes himself available after and outside the class for questions and takes a real interest.
Awesome Professor!
Good Professor and have good knowledge. But very strict about timing in presentation and submission.
Awesome prof
What a swell guy.
Computer science class but using a computer is forbidden in the class. She does not have any sympathy for students.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: She never accepts responsibility and blame on us all the time. You cannot even move in the class, she directly asks "why are you moving in your chair". She skips the questions that she does not like.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She agrees my final paper proposal. In the final presentation, the first question is "Your topic is NOT RELATED to this course" this question for all yellow, brown, black students. I explain the idea ask her to understand or not but she intentionally said a simple word "NO" If I record evidence I will report her. Course grade C make GPA below 3.5
Unfair exams! And she is very arrogant!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Stay away of her! I don't understand why she is like this.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She looks so friendly but she is not. She only criticize everything and she is very arrogant. I wish I have never met her
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Course is easy but the professor is tough. In final paper presentation. If you are white, no question for you. If you are another color, five or six question for you until you have nothing to say and you will receive B or less grade.
Easy if you are good at speak and write. Do not choose this class if you are bad at write paper.

Great guy with a good personality whose good at explaining control system. Attendance is required though, but it's worth going to his lectures anyways. The quizzes are moderately difficult especially towards the end because we didn't cover enough practice problems to study off of. Overall I would recommend taking him for ME483.

Good dynamic professor. There is a lot of homework, but it is useful and is only graded as complete or not, motivating you to try and lean even if you make mistakes. He later provides answer keys to the homework. If you do the homework, you will do well on the test. You will have to work in this class but you will also learn a lot.

Very nice guy and ok teacher, but likes to give lots of homework, give large group projects which takes many hours, likes to pack lectures to the fullest of notes while skipping examples, and gives decently difficult exams.
Salman is great. Honestly one of the best lecturers ever and makes the material very clear. The homework is challenging but helps with the exams.

His lectures are mandatory but are a waste of time because to succeed all of the learning must be done at home. His teaching style is cringey and useless. Many tests are unfair compared to previous homework assignments and what we go over in class. Ineffective professor.

Fantastic instructor. I've taken Intro. to Robotics, Control Systems, and Senior D with him and he has been wonderful in all of them. He really cares about his students and is willing to spend a lot of time outside of class helping them. He's one of the best.
fantastic professor. communicates ideas well and keeps the classroom interesting with his good hearted nature. Will definitely look to schedule classes with Professor Salman in the future!
He's strict on details, especially in presentations, but he gives great feedback and really wants to make sure you learn the concepts.

Lectures start with an empty whiteboard and by the end of class they're completely full. The classroom is always packed and if you don't get a seat in the front the lectures are impossible to follow. The homeworks and exams are all 2 very difficult questions and if you struggle with the concepts they're impossible to even start.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Despite his name, haMID is absolutely not MID. He is a great professor. His lectures are interesting and useful. A great teacher. Tests are slightly difficult but fair.

The best professor in the ME department. Explains content very clearly, and in a manner easy to understand even if you did not understand thermodynamics. Funny and understanding professor. Peaked my interest in thermal engineering, and would take courses in order to have him as my professor. If you can have him, take him over any other professor.

Professor Hadim is the best professor I've had so far. He only does a few example problems per class, because he spends a lot of time on each one explaining the steps he takes to solve them. He's always available for office hours, and is always willing to help you. Exams aren't easy, but if you go to class every day and do the hws you'll do well.
Professor Hadim is very patient, understanding, and caring. He really helps you understand the material. Great person and professor.

Hadim gets straight to the point. He grinds out practice problems day after day with thorough explanations. Unfortunately, Hadim often gets too far ahead of the other lectures, but that's Prof. Bilah's fault for going too slow. He isn't as funny or as cool as Bilah but gets more work done. He also focuses on the most difficult material.

Hamid Hadim is hands down, one of the best professors I have ever had. He may seem a little monotone at times, but he makes sure you learn the material and how to solve examples. The tests are not bad, as long as you go to class and pay attention. He lets you use lecture notes on the tests. After a semester with him, I finally understand Thermo
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Hamid is the man, he usually goes through two problems a day. Although this does not sound good, he goes in great detail, going step by step until we get the answer. This method has helped me understand the material, and process much better than other classes.

Lawal is extremely tough, very insensitive, and tries to trick you on both his in-class questions and exams. He does not cold call as much anymore but you should still review your material. Read the textbook before and after every class!!! Good luck...

Will make everyone in the class participate if you do not want you. Class is tough and does challenge you but is easy to go to for help. Will the class for not being able to answer questions. If you are more sensitive you may not like him, but he will teach you a lot, whether that be by understanding or brute force in some cases.
He's kinda like a family friendly Gordon Ramsay but for chemistry

His lectures made me hit my head against the book it was so boring. I learned nothing new in this class, might not be his fault that the department hasnt done anything to fix the problem. His tests try to fool you. Averages on his test range from 30-50% on material that should be common sense.
great teacher

He is the best professor I have ever had. Even though I failed his class he taught me so much, and I would love to have him again. If any one has him next semester know that he is tough but will teach you alot.
He's awesome. Good teacher IMO.
Horrible professor. Cannot communicate properly. Should not be a teacher!

She gives out a lot of work compared to most lower-level electives, but the class itself is interesting.  The topics we talk about are current and she spews a ton of facts we never knew about.  The first half readings are a little clunky, but the second half flows better, lot of interesting assignments.  Overall, worth it.

Professor Macphail is the best!!! I loved her lectures and she always did her best to make sure everyone understood what was happening. She really prioritizes her classes and I loved attending lectures. I highly recommend her classes

One of my favorite professors. Her lectures are super fun and engaging and she always encourages participation to make it feel more like a conversation rather than a lecture. I wish I had taken a class of hers sooner because I did not know her classes existed until my final semester. 10/10 will always recommend Professor MacPhail

By far, one of the best professors. She's professional and light-hearted but still manages to take command of the classroom. Goes to show how much she really knows. The class is always insightful. Participate, do the assignments (they're fun anyway) and you'll enjoy the class. She's very human. She doesn't act like a pretentious professor

Quite possibly the best professor I have ever had. Confident & knows what she's talking about. She's enthusiastic about her lectures & that enthusiasm is truly contagious to students. She just loves what she does. Also, she's so cool! She's had such an interesting life, lowkey want to be her.

She is an absolutely amazing professor. I've had a class with her for three semesters now and I still am not bored. She is very engaging and paints anthropology in such a new light! The reading can get a little too much at times but she always discusses it in class and explains the reasoning behind everything.
Interesting topics in lecture. All you need to do is think about the topic and how it relates to other topics or a current event for your analysis.
I was in her Medical Anthropology class and she was able to change my mind about medicine and understand it in a better way. I am so glad to have taken her class.

A lightweight course that doesn't make you sweat. The grade is a coin-toss though, as admitted by the prof. There are no assignments, except for suggested reading. Lectures are interesting but provide only a very high-level overview. You will not end up gaining any practical applicable skills through this course. Make sure you make notes in class.

He teaches with a very fun and laid back style. He only does notes on the board. You must attend all classes and take very good notes in detail. His midterm is critical to do good and based on the notes. There is a final project presentation too. It is not a demanding class but his grading criteria is random and does not guarantee A.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: The BEST course ever. If you joined Stevens, attend his class
He is AMAZING. Lectures are interesting. No assignments. However, you need to take notes every lecture in order to pass the Final exam.
If you're good with presentation, and have good luck than go for it. Other than that,  the course doesn't reflect a graduate course level.

The professor is  nice but the grading is poor He has almost 75 student does not have a TA  and grades papers randomly He almost does not even check the papers I got a B although i knew everything in the class... The final exam questions are rubbish .I was asked what did you learn from class ? and i got a B. The subject is like a lucky draw

Great professor, care more about learning and inspiring, take the final projectpresentation as the most important thing, very practical, if listen and think carefully on his course,  one will learn much thing for the whole life.
Very good overview of cybersecurity,Has alot to offer,Cares more about learning than grades.Very good grader,Attend lectures and take lecture notes.
Great prof. Sort of funny and self-depreciating, but knows the material really well!
This guy is freakin' old
Is this guy still teaching?  This class is an important class but since this guy teach it becomes useless....

This guy should not be allowed to teach. He does not keep up with technology - still talks about his punched card days and K Maps. His tests are completely useless because he reuses older tests. His projects are unrelated to his material.
ZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZz
i love this guy
easy. fairly effective teacher. totally crazy.
No Comments

Professor McBryan is fantastic. This is a STEM school and that's the focus here, so many students aren't interested from the start. Professor McBryan acknowledges that is the case, and makes class interesting to engage these students. It's impressive and leaves students focused on STEM with a good albeit brief education in the humanities.

I felt discouraged going to class everyday. I felt like I was putting in my best effort but no matter what I was getting awful grades. maybe I am not as good of a writer as I thought. But I got top scores in high school for AP English and get only A's in my other classes essays. I don't think she liked me very much though I don't know what I did.

My favorite professor from my freshman year. Incredibly knowledgeable and kind, with a wit to boot. She gave me a lot more confidence in academic writing through her appreciative words. Can ask some tougher questions, and shares perspectives different than her own for rich discussion. Do not take deadline extensions for granted!

Professor McBryan is such a great teacher, and the class, while I don't usually enjoy English classes, was a genuine joy to go to! She always had interesting discussions, and was extremely clear and helpful on how to write a great essay. She grades easy if you put in the effort, but you won't mind as the content is actually interesting.
na
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: One of the best teachers I've ever had. I used to dread writing assignments, but she gave clear, constructive guidance that allowed me to enjoy putting my thoughts to paper. She's always reachable outside of class, I can always get a helpful response within 24 hours. Enriching lectures. A solid 10/10 professor.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor McBryan is a very caring professor. The theme for her CAL 105 was "Intelligence." Grades were based on low-stakes weekly writing exercises, midterm, and final as well as 2 analytical essays and a research paper with a presentation. You would want to put in work for the essays. She was very understanding of work that was late due to Covid.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Professor McBryan is a true educator who is passionate about teaching and roots for the success of her students. She gives good guidance and tips for your papers in class, and has a large amount of office hours where she offers even better one on one advice. Made a required freshman writing class an amazing experience.

He was a good professor, just very hard material. Once you fall behind once, you're stuck. Exams are extremely difficult but you do get cheat sheets. Pop quizzes but don't count for much in the grade. Problem sets are very difficult. Will help if you need but a little passive aggressive with his guidance.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: great teacher but very hard. pay attention and take notes and study. he cares about his students and idk why people say he's hilarious bc he isn't funny at all but he's a nice man and wants you to do well and will help you as long as you put in effort.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Great professor with a very fair grading policy. Gives students wiggle room when it comes to grading. Show your work and put in effort, and you will be compensated fairly. Grading scale is generous as well. Put in a good effort and you will be rewarded. Does pop quizzes, almost act like an attendance check, but small portion of grade.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Beware of pop quizzes--Accessible outside class

comment: Wants to help the students and is so nice. The work is definitely very hard but he grades easily and gives lots of partial credit if you show your work. He also lets you bring some notes to the exams
Great professor who really cares about his students. If you pay attention and do all hw you'll be fine. Make sure study previous exams and spend an hour or two on your cheat sheet.

Really young, early to mid 30s. Really personable. Great guy. Definitely wants you to succeed in his class. Tests are fine. As long as you study, you'll do fine. The HW involves problem sets that are challenging, but you can go through them in groups of like 4-5 people, so it's better than doing it on your own. He is definitely a living legend!
One of the best prof to teach corp fin and is really respected. He is very fair on his grading and if you somewhat listen in class and know what you are doing on the hw it is an easy A.

Show up for class because he'll put things in the exam that is only talked about in class. Gives many extra credit opportunities though. Exam one was very easy but exam two was pretty difficult (our class average was 76). Do the online homework, it's an easy 100 for 20% of your grade. Make friends in class, problem sets are difficult otherwise.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Plz no

Really, really nice guy. CS 590 is crap, DO NOT, I repeat, DO NOT take this course if it's not a requirement. Assignments are in C++, and must be compiled in the terminal. So no debugging, troubleshooting, or anything. DO NOT take this course if you don't have to. You'll regret it, I promise you.
