His lectures are mostly reading huge amounts of math equations off his slides and not explaining much. I found it very hard to learn the necessary concepts because he almost never used examples or showed how to utilize any of the concepts taught. It was an extremely stressful class and it didn't need to be.

The syllabus is good but the quizzes are mostly confusing(unclear questions and faulty answers) because of which you will lose marks. Assignments make you learn alot on algorithms so might be worth taking it but your doubt will never be cleared(can get more confused though). Score well in assignments, avg on tests, easy A.

Awful course and lecturer. He is good at making complex concept more complicated. Ambiguous assignment description. There are ALWAYS wrong descriptions or answers in weekly quiz. Quiz is just like a word game rather than reflecting what we really learn.
DON'T TAKE THIS COURSE.

The material itself isn't very difficult, but the professor makes it tough. He teaches one thing and then the assignment have you scrambling searching the internet for ways to solve them. The exam was not too hard, but the course isn't structured very well. Haphazard methodology of teaching, and irregular in his office hours. Confusing assignments.
Difficult class but good grader.

Most difficult class I've ever taken, not because of material, but because of how bad his teaching is. Skips his own office hours, writes confusing assignments, all lectures go into crazy depths of detail about the math irrelevant to homework, has no TAs or forums to post questions. You will be forced to learn from online forums and youtube videos.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: His 2024F TA gave generous grades with many bonus. Mid exam was difficult. To be honest it shouldn't be called Applied ML, too little about application.

Doesn't teach anything and expects you to know everything. He reads from the ppt like a robot and doesn't seem to care if you understand the concepts or not. He is knowledgeable but doesn't know how to articulate it. He reads the math problems out loud and doesn't solve anything. Allows 2 attempts for quiz so scoring is relatively easy.

Sucks at teaching. Reads from slides only. Never grades anything on time. Even after the semester ended, he did not grade half the stuff and did not submit grades to registrar. It's a new semester and everyone in the class doesnt know what their grade is from last semester. Avoid.

Class is not that hard but a lot of self teaching is required. He does not really articulate beyond whats written on the slides and class usually ends an hour early. Be prepared to read the textbook and watch Andrew Ng to understand the concepts. He allows you to retake the quizzes. Homeworks are easy if you have a coding background.

I would have given zero star but, no option for that. Classic bottom of the barrel professor. He doesn't care about students at all. He doesn't want to be bottered. Diffucult programming homework and final project. half of the class got B-. He is the only one for ee 695,sadly. Like others said learn phyton well before even thinking of EE/CPE 695.

Not approachable-hard to understand-tough grader-lots lots of programming homework. take other AI classes before 695, otherwise you will suffer. Also, you really need to be very good with phyton. Homeworks are heavy heavy programming involved. if you are not passionate about subjects, you will really struggle with his class. learn phyton!

Mr. Yu is intelligent research professional. That is being said; he should stay in lab, he does not know how to teach. He don't want any questions during class. So, its him and him only talking class. Grading is very tough. English is fair. You better be strong in probability and python, better be! Avoid if you can, he is no good
Tough on grades, no curve. Monoton robot style teaching. Take 626 and 627 before coming and also be strong in python
cant teach, no curve, monotone, avoid!
The finest professor. She cares for all her students, and will help them succeed.

Fantastic Professor, had her for fluid dynamics, water resources and senior design. I would take any class she teaches, even if its a subject I hated, she would find a way to teach it in a way that would make it interesting. Makes assignments/exams that are representative of the content she teaches and grades them fair.
Brunell is great. I've had her for four different classes and I really don't have anything bad to say. She can be hard at times with grading projects, but she'll go out of her way to help students.

Had her for senior design/surveying/water resources and she was a great professor/adviser. She knows the school and its system very well so her advice is informed. She will help you with almost anything, only downside is she's very busy, so she's late to things and sometimes not in the right head-space to teach/advise. Other than that, perfect.
very awesome teacher, knows what shes talking about and explains everything clearly. go to class and youll do great and shes very nice and a relatively easy grader.

Water was an interesting course and you could do really well if you went to class, listened to what Brunell said, did the homeworks. The tests were pretty easy, and no textbook needed to be bought. Final was long, but straightforward. Its pretty easy to do well in this class.

pretty good teacher.  The best thing about her is the effort she puts into helping the students.  She provides a lot of materials and puts a lot of work into planning things.  The class was upsettingly easy, though.
Had her for Fluids and Water. Best CE Teacher. Make sure you come to class n shell prob like you. Very personable. Grades n tests are good. Shes not that bad.
just a boring class, with powerpoint slop. just not worth taking his course.

Get ready to read.... cause he wont teach you anything. Seriously this class will teach you how to teach yourself. He says he takes attendance but always gives up like a month in. Takes forever to grade, very little feedback, and homework almost never prepare for exams. Class is mad easy cause he doesn't really look too hard at anything you submit.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Left our lab period to go to Walgreens
Man, this class is a snoozer boring PowerPoint lectures with no variety. He's better at teaching labs than teaching the lectures.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: He is the head of the Scholars Program at Stevens, and he should not be. He is terribly disorganized and demands attendance at mandatory events he announces at the last minute. It is really frustrating to know that you will have to hand something in, but you can't work on it because Whittaker has not given you any guidelines. I think he's all bark

Oh, where to start with Professor Whittaker? First off, I should mention that he is a Physics professor. PIN is an "honors" course in "leadership" or something. Whittaker treats both students and co-professors with amazing derision. Were this class not tied to my scholarship opportunity, I would drop it like it were hot. Avoid at all costs.

Whittaker...what to say. Well, I'm sure his career in physics peaked at one point in time. But he shows up to our 3-hour section, two hours in. His instructions for lab reports are unclear, not to mention incredibly broad. His TA does all the work. I know we're just lowly undergrads, but come on.
Changed the syllabus twice, once for including the final exam percentage (it used to be optional for those with a high enough average) and again AFTER the final exam has been calculated.

Knows his stuff, but the content is 15 years old and there are no direct announcements to students. Case study participation isn't high stakes brainstorming, so it's less stressful. Make sure u cite ur sources properly for the papers. Lots of room for extra credit in case studies and the 4 papers + presentation. Write more than u think to get extra

Based on the previous reviews mcnair has been a low effort professor for a few years. This class was nothing more than slides and audio recordings from his 2011 lectures that we had to sit and listen to for about 2 hours each. Essays (3) were supposed to be 6+ pages each, which wasn't too bad but he seems to make up reasons to deduct points.

He never gives an feedback on the assignments and project submitted (other than it has been submitted) until the end of the semester (literally a week before the semester ends). So you have no idea how you're doing in the course, how much more effort you need to put in etc. Online discussion and participation seems forced because its part of grade.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Thankfully this course is available only in the web lecture. His lectures were all about his experiences that happened while he used to work, but they weren't related to what we had to do in class. His slides were incoherent too. He didn't provide feedback on our work. He didn't even grade it until the last minute, so we don't know how we're doing.

Although highly touted and successful in the IEEE and professional realm, professor McNair is a horrid educator. He reads of power point slides and fails to make concepts taught in clear understandable.  He does not grade anything until the end of the semester and does not provide feedback so you are left in the dark. Smart but horrible educator.
I do not recommend this professor.  Though he says he values extra effort or provide extra credit, he is not fair in grading and does not work with student to be successful in the class.

Nice guy, and knowledgeable.  Communicates material somewhat clearly, and sometimes does examples outside of his slideshow.  No final exam, and all quizzes are take-home.  Most of my friends got A's. Not sure of how much I learned, though.  Also, all work (which entails math and showing your work) is collected electronically.

Professor Mcnair is a very nice person but not the greatest teacher. He doesn't explain much and just reads from  the power point slides he provides. If your goal is to learn as much as possible, without teaching yourself, try and take this class with someone else

He isn't a bad professor. He's very sweet and nice but he does grade harshly when it comes to essays and research papers so be aware of that since he doesn't do exams/midterms/final exam. Just turn in stuff on time for the sake of your grade since he does take his time with grading previous assignments.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: Awesome. Took him for both 103 and 105 and enjoyed every second of it.

He's a super nice guy but he does NOT want you to get an A. The highest I've seen anyone get from him on a paper is a 93. Attendance grade matters and you can fail the class if you don't show up. Takes ages to grade, with most assignments being graded after the end of the semester, so you don't even know how good you're doing until it's too late.
rating_tags: Tough grader--So many papers--Graded by few things

comment: The class was fairly easy, but Segura lost focus and control over his points fairly quickly, grades assignments INCREDIBLY LATE, and weighs only a few assignments so heavily that a good 70% of the class doesn't matter much for your final grade. He seems like a good guy and responds fairly quickly outside of class, but there are some problems here.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Graded by few things

comment: REALLY nice guy. Talks a lot but doesn't get much back from the class. Semi-fast grading, weak grading criteria. Very hard to get a good grade, especially for those who aren't adept writers. Readings are boring, along with CAL-103 as a whole, but Professor Segura did pretty well making it manageable. He's available a lot and offers to help.

He's very chill and I feel bad for him because no one participates and he asks questions to the class that no one answers. I have always been the most quiet person I know but I had to participate because literally no one else does. CAL-103 is boring, but honestly Segura is not a bad professor. Grades pretty fast and is available outside of class.

He's chill in class, but the way he teaches is pretty rigid. Takes a while to get your grade, and when you do, it's really hard to wrap yourself around why an A is 94+. He's not terrible, especially for a boring class like CAL 103, but if you get him, it will not be higher than expectations. He is willing to help though.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Accessible outside class

comment: Overall my experience with this professor was lame. He only graded our first essays and then used that same grade for the rest of our assignments. You don't need to participate in his class to do well, but you must show up. He makes the final paper for this course worth 45% of your final grade for this class.
Best teacher... I actually learned something in his class
This guy is the best!
7 billion smiles and his is my favorite
Smart, good looking, helpful, and adorable. Must take him
hmmm....
Good Stuff...
He is good...

Professor Mandel gives graph examples & motivational facts about topics like 3d variables. It needs an open mind to picture those examples. This year 85% of students printed previous exams in hope for repeated questions rather than studying or attending lectures, but the final and midterm were written from scratch which is why most are complaining.

Professor Mandel clearly wants to help students understand, but his lectures are kind of all over the place. I think they would be good if he made sure to talk while writing on the board, because I sometimes got lost watching him just write. When asked questions, he answers them well, so be sure to do that!!
lectures are pretty good, he clearly knows the subject but is prone to making a few mistakes in lectures every so often so just make sure your paying attention instead of mindlessly copying
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Had to rely on recitation for a lot of learning, but otherwise good class.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: Hard professor to follow for a course that is essential for most students. Without the time-consuming assignments he gives out as well as excellent TAs, I would not have been as successful in the course. Lectures were often disorganized and only the last few lectures of the semester were somewhat functional. Be aware.

Had Richie as a TA for MA 123/124 in Fall 2020. Most people were online as we were hybrid so he had to juggle Zoom and in-person students. He'd be somewhat available yet his explanations and help were eh. Workshops were meh. Hope he's a better lecturer. He does have that charming quirky uwu side to him which ig is a plus.

Tons of homework too. Lectures seem rushed but he makes do with the time he has to teach all 124 material and does it well. Explains not so well when lecturing but ask him questions and you'll understand a lot better. Also email the guy he explains the best there. Taught well, received material well. Very lenient with homework deadlines.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Patanakul is a great professor. It made me select MGT 600, however, I actually had him for MANGT 531. He has discussions, a group midterm paper, and a group final. He is a fairly easy grader. Like I said, just refer back to his lesson plans. He always responded to my emails in a timely manner!  I would take him again!
Good !
There are several sections of this course. Talk with people who took it before first, and then make your choice.
His accent is the first barrier. Always late for class. Plus the grading is very subjective.
Very fair, approachable, and knowledgable.  The only negative was his thick accent.  This professor is still awesome, definately recommend for MGT 600.
Great Teacher! Very smart! Class was very interesting and great conversations! Prof is very approachable  and extremely fair! Do good grad work and you'll get an A!
No Comments

This class was the bane of my existence. He just faces the board and writes down his notes from when he was in Maz's class. He's completely monotone and socially awkward. Additionally, class is mandatory so we're forced to sit there and rewrite All the notes. If he just gave us a packet of all the notes it would have saved us much more time.

Ok so he's a little socially challenged and awkward but he's a very good teacher who knows what he is talking about. He gives you great notes with lots of examples that are very helpful with homework and studying. Just go to class and pay attention and you'll do fine.
Very knowledgeable, GREAT notes, boring voice...but who cares.  You will learn the topic thoroughly and fairly.  Very solid.
KNows his stuff. TEst are much better than Maz! Have to actually work for his classes

Not the most exciting class, but it's calculus. He does his job really well, if you pay attention and follow the curriculum he walks you through. He's a walking talking textbook, which isn't always great, but when it comes to calculus he's the best math teacher I've ever had.

Prof Davidson is going to give you all of the theory as well as all of the examples that you would need to succeed in DiffEQ's.  He has the answers to any/all questions that come up in class, and I feel that he does his job well.  He's a bit impersonal, but that's usually expected from a Calc professor.  Overall: nice guy, clear notes, great class.

I'd say too smart for his own good but that would be pushing it. Just not a good teacher. Lectures were long and just took notes the whole time. He really didn't express the material that well and didn't show any interest in his students.

Dr. Wu was a great professor. She listens to your feedback and frankly just wants to make sure everyone learns at least something. Granted, there are no exams, and the majority of your grade depends on online homework, so it's a fairly easy A, but Dr. Wu clearly has a passion for what she teaches.
W

Professor Wu is one of the best professors ever. She truly cares about the students and always does everything to benefit the students. The class is truly great and stress free. I would definitely take a class with her again. I have taken three classes with this professor and highly recommend.
Great professor who makes the material and class fun
She is the sweetest prof. on campus. This class is very different from her usual macro/micro class. If you try it is an easy A.

Dr. Wu is an awesome professor. She cares about her students and really wants them to succeed. Even if you cannot make it to her office hours, emailing her definitely helps. Her lectures are engaging and at times funny. She offers extra credit opportunities but she makes you work for it and participate in class.
Hands down the nicest, most caring professor I've ever had. She genuinely cares about her students and will take the time to make sure everyone passes.

The material that he goes over can be boring, but his lecture style does not do anything to help it. 

The tests are very easy if you study the homework problems and essentially memorize how to do them and have a good notes sheet. 

Participation policy is too strict since you can ace the class without needing to go to most of the lectures tbh.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: all you'll learn about is hydroxyapatite and crystal structures. lectures are a snooze fest and the MC for exams can be a roulette wheel. if you can solve the homework and make a good note sheet you'll be fine for the exams. half of the lecture material is useless, especially for the hw and exams
Useless class taken too seriously
Terrible. Keeps talking about his good old days in the field- we want you to go back!
This teacher is also a surgeon and a sizable amount of the lectures and tests are esoteric references about his practice. An easy A, but a confusing and unnecessary class.
rating_tags: So many papers--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Actually the worst teacher ever. I've never had a worse professor in my life. Doesn't lecture anything worth knowing and then tests and homework are extremely difficult.
Worst ever.
Do not take her class.
Do everything you can to not take her class.

Most unsupportive professor I've ever had. Shows no empathy towards her students at all and her teaching is so bad she has to curve each test by 20 points. Refused to incorporate 5% of class participation into final grade (even though it was on the syllabus) and would yell at students who would ask each other questions about the material in class.

In spite of a case of COVID 19, recently diagnosed disability, and global pandemic, this professor made no attempt to be accommodating. Her chicken scratch was the only resource we were given for this complex class, and when she decided my progress wasnt to her liking she told me to drop her course. Horrified by the apathy and malice.
This class was discussion driven. Very unique and entertaining class as long as you put in the time and effort to prepare beforehand. 10/10 would recommend.

One of the best classes I've taken at Stevens. Very clear, descriptive and understanding professors. Dr. Perlman offers one of the only classes I've taken at Stevens that incorporates mathematics into real world problems. This class will be hard if you had trouble with calculus, but making a good effort in this class will only help you in life.

Dr. Pearlman is robotic and emotionless. Her communication skills are horrible, second only to her empathy (or lack thereof). She uses her notes from her undergraduate, and scoffs if you ask her a question she thinks is stupid. I passed her class, but only because I was able to separate the material from the terminator at the front of the  room.
Dr.Mannoor know his stuff just pay attention in class and turn in your work. Great professor
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Mannoor is very respectful. He is an inspiration. If you attend class regularly and participate in the discussions you will do well in his class.

A very intelligent man who is incredibly helpful. He prioritizes students and will make sure you understand course material prior to exams. You could go to him at anytime and if you make an effort he'll see that and it'll reflect in the grade. Not to mention he's super funny and his lectures are entertaining

Professor Mannoor is the kindest professor I will probably ever have. He prioritizes his students' well being over anything else, he learned our names and faces by the second week of class and will personally regrade homework or quizzes if you think the TA was unfair. Homework deadlines are soft, it just needs to be done by the end of the semester.

Professor Mannoor personally looks over your final and any quiz you give him and will give back any points he believes the graders missed. He takes the time to learn all his students names and comes off as one of the most caring and understanding professors here.

Dr. Mannoor is among the absolute best professors here. His story is an inspiration and he treats his students with incredible respect. The material he is given for this class doesn't give him much breathing room, so lectures were slightly dull, but I strive to one day achieve a fraction of the kindness and passion he demonstrates on a daily basis.
God is real and he goes by the name Manu Mannoor

Michael Frank is an Amazing Professor. He cares a lot about his students. His classes are thought provoking. He brings pizza and snacks to class sometimes. He really puts in that extra effort as a professor to keep the class Interesting and professors like those will only come across once/twice in our lifetime. I took him two times.
The class is a waste of time and completely irrelevant. I want my time back. Absolutely useless
Weekly assignments that aren't too hard. Biggest project of class is your final, but its an interesting class overall. Attend and learn something hes a great professor

I took MGT 699 in Fall under him and MIS730 in Spring. Sem 2, he was good, the classes were light and enjoyable. Nevertheless, the pizza review below, that's mine. Second time, he was same, caring, good lectures but by same I also mean similar lectures as MGT 699. It was fun to attend though. Learnt a lot in Fall Sem, not that much in Spring Sem.

Without a doubt one of the best professors I have studied under. Very caring & it's a treat to attend his class (food in class guaranteed: donuts, pizza....). His classes are fun to attend, has a different style of teaching, you're sure to learn a lot. 1 mid-term(easy), 2 projects(easy to moderate).  Easy to get an 'A', just follow his guidelines.

Best Professor I have ever had in my life. Doesn't go much technical into the subject matter but conveys all the concepts through some real life scenarios and videos. Totally a fun class with lot of learning. Close your eyes and choose the class, remember that the seats get filled up in 5 minutes.
register the class as early as possible.

One of the best professors I've had. Definitely worth putting in the effort to study since your exam grades make up most of the class grade. Show up to the lecture which is only once a week, take notes, study for the exams, and should have no issues in the class. Super funny and chill and passionate about what he teaches.
rating_tags: Group projects--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: Nano-200, lots of calculation, easy homework and easy test if you did well on copying what he wrote on ppt and good with number, TA was chill on grading, leads to an easy A. Mandatory on lecture attendance

This professor was awful. He claims that his criticism and questions come from a place of constructiveness, but absolutely not. He criticizes without any constructive feedback and will interrupt you every other second during presentations. Not a single grade in before the end of the semester. Extremely smart but treats you like you're dumb.

Easy course. The professor knows the material but is very blunt with the long lectures. Exams are easy with the 2-page note sheet. He grades hard on the presentations. The class and the material emphasize esoteric scientific concepts such as modern physics and research (some of which are his tis a chance to work with him). Take if ur interested
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Learn a lot especially presentation skill and thinking logic, but it's touch.
No Comments
He is a knowledgeable and nice person. You will learn a lot

I'm not sure why this AM course is not offered every year. I would recommend this course to anyone here. Professor Robert Chang is a national treasure. He seems to know everything about everything, yet somehow isn't cocky about it. His teaching style helps students learn the material, but also how to think, ask questions, and be resourceful.

Actually looked forward to going to class every week. Prof Chang introduced tensors and linear algebra in the context of real-world problems. His enthusiasm helped me to figure out some of the more complex, math-intensive course material over the semester.

Dr. Chang covers a lot of ground in his lectures. Go to his office hours and he will make the material clear as day. Smart guy who actually cares. Don't expect to fly under radar cause he knows everyone's full names.

Exams are pretty tough but Prof Chang takes time and patience to make difficult concepts clear. Take him if you are committed to learn. Obvious that he enjoys teaching and working with students. Sometimes takes a while to receive graded homeworks.
Professor tailor the course according to the need of the students Professor is inspirational, fun loving and knows his subject well
An engineering professor that's very knowledgeable about bio. He had a great sense of humor and was always available to clarify any questions I had. Made me interested in working in this area.
Great professor for EE Math.  Teaches material rather clearly.  Homework problems can be tricky sometimes, but overall not too bad.  You'll always be prepared for his exams.
Clear fair and an excellent professor

I had professor Heffes for Probability.  He often arrived late and left early.  Sometimes he intimidated students and I felt he glossed over many important aspects of the material.  There is no doubt that he is a brilliant mathematician and a very intelligent person, I just don't think he is a very good professor.
Difficult class (IMO) but if you go to class and try to do the work, he will not let you down!
Difficult, but fair. Do your work and show up to class and he will not let you down.

Heffess is the best professor that I have had at this school.  He is clear and consciece.  Because of system's theory, I now know what I would like to do with my degree.  He is hard, but very fair, and will schedule time to help you

One of the best professors, any student can come across. Extremely talented in his area of study and a very efficient teacher. He consummates both the roles that of a teacher and of a senior member of the EE/CPE department with the best of his ability.

Very good lectures that were really helpful. He also made it very clear what was going to be on the quizzes and exams which and having no numbers on exams, just variables, made for a relatively easy class. Sometimes he would ramble about something that we don't need to know for the physics majors but that wasn't really a problem

For me, this class was fairly easy and his teaching really helped! Not only does Zeng pace his course very well, but they also make the information on upcoming quizzes and exams very clear. There are moments when he overcomplicates very simple subjects, but apart from that, he's pretty much everything you want from a good college professor.
he's a really good professor!

Zeng's lectures are really good and explains examples very well. A lot of people don't go to lectures but I highly suggest going because when the exams are close he drops hints on what type of problems to expect which shows he really wants us to do well in the class. He also stays after lecture if you need him to explain something. Great professor.

Zeng is great, his lectures are clear and easy to follow if you pay attention. Most importantly, he truly cares about the success of his students. Will often take time after class to stay with students and explain any concept they have trouble with. He is also straightforward with exam material which is nice. Amazing professor and even better guy.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Such a great guy and really explains concepts well. He is so nice, and energetic. He really makes concepts simple. Makes test very fair. Just wish he was more in contact wit the TA they were never on the same page. Not a lot of hw and grades them fair.

Very smart professor. He does a lot of example problems and his mathematical explanations are logical but he sometimes moves too quickly. Asking questions is important because he will clarify something he probably didn't spend enough time explaining.

Professor Gilman was a great professor. He understood most people were not really interested in the material the class covers, and related topics to situations that were in engineering fields. He has a very dry sense of humor that is not for everyone, however I enjoyed it. A bit forgetful at times, but is extremely caring.
chill and friendly prof, regularly ends class a little early if he finishes going over material, good lectures, knows his stuff

This guy is a good professor. He genuinely does care if people do or don't understand and will try his best to explain. Formality and semantics matter in your proofs so make sure they are near perfect or expect to get points off.

This formal logic class was fairly introductory. It took him a while to get a feel for what the class's pace should be, and lectures sometimes jumped from incredibly simple to profoundly complex immediately, but it was overall a smooth course. Very particular about process during grading, but that may just be (*cringe*) 'par for the course.'
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Really great guy. Makes mistakes sometimes and can be a little esoteric sometimes, but if you are interested in maths he will definitely get you to where you need to be.
Doesn't explain things well, tries to help but you end up teaching yourself

He is an ok teacher.  He is unclear with a lot of his explanations and makes mistakes within the problems (not on purpose).  If you ask questions he will show you how its done.  But in a freshman class at 8am lecture no one is asking a thing.  Good Luck if you have him.  You will send 45 mins on one problem and still not understand a thing.

Assigns homework last minute, with problems taken from online sources. Does not grade on time. All assignments/papers are pushed towards the end of the course. Condescending when answering questions, but still tells us to ask more questions. Take any other elective course possible, as you learn nothing despite putting in excess effort.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Very strict and stern professor. His class is hard but if you actually study, you learn a lot. Anyone who complains about him are usually people looking for an easy A in the wrong place.

He thinks he knows everything there is to know about thermodynamics and looks down on students. About 95% of the time his lectures makes no sense. He is better off as a dean than a professor (even though he is terrible at both).

This is by far the worst professor I had at Stevens. I didn't learn anything in his class. Average for his tests were around 30 out of 100, this should tell him he is not meant to teach. I took ME 335 with Prof. Boyala****la, and surprisingly he taught me and understood all the material of ME 234 in just 2 weeks. Try to stay away from this guy. He

I had him for a dynamics professor, I put my best effort forward, and still failed.  It wasn't good enough to pass...No excuses, but he's hard as hell.  He'll help you out outside of class, if you're struggling.

You can only learn thermodydnamics from him if you already know the subject; he is terrible at teaching. He will never change a grase and he has the "I am never wrong" attitude. This was my worst class so farFor the Final use old review sheets. Good luck and God's speed; because you will brobably have no choice but to have him.
Very good professor; very knowledgeable/interested in subject matter, however, exams can be brutal if you are not extremely well prepared.
No Comments

The man is an absolute saint. Patient, caring, passionate about the topic, and available for questions both in and out of class. He is everything that a professor should be and more. The material is very hard but the class is taught so well that it never seems to be impossible, just challenging.
Excellent class.

One of the best professors I've had in my 5 years at the school (Masters and Bachelors). Has great lectures and goes out of his way to help students understand difficult course material. Accessible outside of class and very nice person. A great educator and knowledgeable. The school needs more professors like professor Ackland.

Very clear and concise lectures. Open to questions in and after classes. All of his course material is available online which is a plus. Book was not necessary as the lecture notes were sufficient to understand the material. Quick to respond to emails as well.

His classes can be challenging, but he does an excellent job in teaching the material as well as taking the time in and out of class to make sure you understand it. Extremely approachable, knowledgable, effective at teaching.  HINTS: The books for the class are not necessary. Understanding the homework is key to doing well in the class.

Lecture can be a bit dry, though it was his first time teaching the class so it's difficult to fault him at that. Aside from this, he is very personable and is willing to take the time to help out students that need help. Very good professor.
Professor Ackland is great!  Takes the time to go through examples and will stay after if you don't understand.  If more professors were like him, engineering would be less of a pain in the butt.
Shes super sweet and honestly shes so nice when i took her as a PRV experience not ENG 234. Shes very understanding and I hope I can take her for one of my future ENG courses.

One of the best engineering professors I've ever had, made herself available outside of class for questions. It's worth going to her to go over any lost points on exam, because she'll tell you exactly what you need to study for the next one. She communicates exactly what she expects you to know with no surprises or twists. Learned a lot from her.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Z was great. Her lectures were very clear and if you did not understand something, she takes the time to thoroughly explain it. She very much wants her students to succeed especially during exams she is especially helpful whenever you ask a question. She also changes the weight of your exams if she sees progress to give you a better grade
Great professor, lectures are helpful. She's serious when she says that there's no tricks on the exams. Definitely gives off queen energy

Dr. Z really grew on me throughout the semester. Many people in my section weren't happy with the lectures in the first half of the semester, but she listened to our comments and the class became more enjoyable with each passing week. Dr. Z is also extremely easy to reach outside of class.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Definitely one of the best professors! The grading is evenly split. Make sure to study for the midterms and do well in the group exams. Overall not too difficult to do well as long as you put some effort in.
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class
Group projects--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Easy A, but you don't really learn anything. If you care about easy classes and good grades, then this is for you. But if you really do want to learn HCI, I recommend the in person classes with the other professor. Group project can be done in 2 days and be all front end local based.

I took this class online. Each week you were given a pdf of lecture slides and had to complete a 10 question mcq quiz that was verbatim from the lecture notes. The midterm and final were expanded version of the quiz. The final group project is graded leniently and is based more on your effort than your ability to create a perfect website.
Prof. Vesonder is a great professor. He teaches the course really well, the lectures are interesting with a lot of knowledge.
Amazing individual.

He is a nice professor and knows his stuff clearly. Professor post lectures every week and you have to finish a quiz weekly. You have midterm, final and group project as well. Please prepare midterm and final as it will be indirect. Group projects have to be done carefully and please be ready to do surveys.

The lectures are great albeit a little bit of information overload. Take notes as midterm and endterm would be straight out of the material. A lot depends on the project. Pay attention to the grading criteria. Course is not really technical but is crucial if you are interested in building clean UI and want to learn about usability.
Awesome Professor. Very cool about doubts of students. Respected.

A really nice man who seems to genuinely be interested in what his students think. He loves to assign semester-long group projects, so pick your teams wisely! Also he'll give you a few textbooks you need, but I never used either of them and I got an A no problem. Just participate and take the group project seriously.

Excellent professor. Funny and helpful. Knows his stuff, explains clearly and has no problems going over the same thing again. Well prepared slides are backed up with good explanation. You are tested only on the material that's been covered during class. You do have to study and weekly quizzes are a must. He will make you work. You'll get your $$

Tumkor is a really nice guy and always has a smile on his face. He isn't the best at explaining things, but I had him for ENGR Lab so considering the course is fairly simple it was fine. He is a really easy grader. He will grade an assignment, give you feedback and let you go back and fix for a new grade. Overall he just wants his students to care.
The professor was great and presented everything clearly. He was very helpful with questions and comments on our work.
Professor was very helpful in teaching the confusing material. Helpful when questions are asked. Cares about student performance and group participation.
Taught us a lot about product design process. gave us almost work-like experience. Professor was helpful.

Terrible professor. Constantly became frustrated with his students. Extremely unclear when explaining assignment. If the class wasn't such a joke I would say don't take it but at the end of the day its pretty easy
Nice guy. Goes too fast when teaching for power points but he'll stop at points and go around the room to people who need help so they can catch up.
He is very hard to follow in class. He uses powerpoint presentations but goes through them faster than people can follow. The T.A. ended up basically teaching the class.
Pleasant professor, who understand the material from a real world perspective, and understands the challenges of working while taking classes.
Awesome professor. Very easy A and gives extensions if you need them on the homework. No exams, just homeworks and projects. Very easy grader.
Great prof.  Real world experience mixed with humor and wisdom.  I found her class to be well worth my time.

A beautiful lady, in person as well as intellectually...never stops smiling...Even if you dont take her course, it certainly makes sense to atleast know her and meet her...believe me its worth...never knew that a person of such an intellectual level could be so casual and easy going and just like one more student in the class...
Great professor you will learn and enjoy - A must take
She is an awesome professor, on the mark, knows her stuff, realizes that there needs to be a balance between grad school, work, and life.
She is a bad grader and when asked about why has she given this grade, she will be like my wish.
Professor Hayeri is one of the best and most caring professors I have experienced. She really cares for her students and spends a lot of time with them.

I don't know what I can say about her. 
her class is totally wasting time with a person that doesn't care about students at all.
Never select!

Teaches class centered around herself and her interests rather than what benefits the students. If you ask questions, she is likely to tell you that you should already know the answer and that she shouldn't have to repeat herself before answering the question. Not friendly. (did not have her for ISE 350, but PIN 184)

She lacks empathy for students and assumes that the reason you have questions can only be one of two things: in her own words "you either copied the material wrong or you have no idea what you are doing". typos are a sin, and her class setup is very centered around herself, rather than how to reach her students effectively.
Is super tough, gives a lot of homework and very little time to do the homework, is a hard grader, doesn't give good feedback. But the course is required so good luck!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I could already speak Spanish before the class so keep that in mind. Balog is great, nothing on the quizzes or exams should be a surprise if you're just paying attention in class. He'll tell you how it'll be formatted and what exactly you need to study. He does give a lot of homework assignments but they can be done really quickly.

He is an amazing professor. He is always available, and his classes open interesting discussions. As long as you do the work, which is not a lot, you will be perfectly fine. I am an international student and I took his class in my first semester and it definitely made me feel welcome.

I had an interesting class where it was just me and one other student and neither of us showed up all the time so there were a lot of 1 on 1 lessons. Professor Balog really helped me improve my Spanish ability and was super supportive the whole time. I struggled and I was making consistent mistakes but he never made me feel bad about it.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Balog is a good professor. He is accessible to students and answers emails pretty fast. A few group projects, but there isn't much pressure. He's really sweet and understanding. Only bad part is the grading policy, no more than three absences. He gives a few freebies but you need a doctors note every time. Sucks if you don't have insurance.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: He is the best! Do the work and you will pass! Will take him again!
This teacher was awful. Not helpful and extremely unforgiving. Do not take this prof.
Profe is awesome; he's really good at integrating the whole class in practicing our Spanish, even though we're engineering & science students. Tests have the exact material in the class.
dont recommend this class

Professor violet is a nice person, but she teaches bt 223 way too fast and gives little to no context in her lectures. The homework takes hours to do and if you don't know how to do them, good luck finding any help on her posted slideshows because they are no help whatsoever. The exams are so unfair compared to the curriculum and you never finish.

DO NOT recommend her for this course. Lectures are extremely unengaging and are gibberish to almost everyone in my section as everybody was lost after every lecture. Exams are long and very challenging as most of my class didn't even have time to finish. HW is also long, tough, and graded strictly. Do not recommend if you aren't good with Excel.
Great Professor, smooth going, always available .

She always tries to be helpful and understanding, and her lectures are amazing in terms of the knowledge you can gain in class. She grades strictly though, similar to many other professors from Asian backgrounds.

My favorite class yet! The professor is very knowledgeable and explains concepts very clearly. She's always available during office hours and tries her best to help you through your problems or doubts. Just attend class and it's an easy A!
Jafar is the GOAT for D4 labs. Take him!!!
Most easiet grading lab professor ever!!! If you get below a 90 in D4 Lab with him you should drop out of stevens. Cause thats how easy, nice, and easy going he is.

Probably the most interactive professor I have had to date. He may not be the best lecturer, but once the lab starts he truly shines. Always willing to help out students and give personal attention (something lacking from college professors).   He is a very jovial and fun teacher! A definite pick for D4.
Awesome Professor. A little unclear at times but hes an awesome person.
Very sweet guy. His lectures are boring and not very helpful, but if you ask questions he is more than happy to help. He is very good one-on-one so don't worry about not learning anything.
So quiet! he whispers when he talks. hes a sweetie though and loves to help. but his lectures lull me to sleep -_-

I loved Prof. Abeywickrama's teaching style. Organic chemistry  is a very difficult subject. she explained very well in the simplest way for us to understand better. she reminded the material frequently that helped us to review the previous chapters. she made us feel very comfortable in class and that helped to interact in class and ask questions.

I like Prof. Chandima. Kind and help with any question you have. very smart and very clearly taught. not like other professors, she explains very well and we focus well. I never missed class. Her expectations are high because she teaches well. I heard from other students in my class that they understood organic chemistry because of her lectures.

Dr. Abeywickrama is a very interesting lady. She teaches directly from the textbook section by section. Attendance is required every lecture, but she doesn't take attendance. Voice is annoying and she rushes a lot, but copy all examples. Every week you get a quiz, but as long as you take the quiz you get a 100%. The exams is where she screws you.

Terrible professor.  Come to class late everyday and covered only half of the material at the end of semester.  Only good thing is she goes over exam questions in the class.  So if you follow ecture and recitations it is easy A but won't learn anything.

Professor is very easy in terms of the course material. Everything that is tested is thoroughly gone over in class and in recitation but to the point the class is treated like they're stupid and are babied which is why she may fall behind schedule on the syllabus. However if you ensure you follow her examples in class and recitation you'll do well.

She's a terrible prof. Very unorganized and is short sighted when it comes to her own research. She wants the world from you and gives you little to work with. She showed up 15 mins late to every class

If you do the homework and follow the lab instructions, it's an easy class even for someone with no experience with solidworks. He's willing to stay after class ends and will help you out if you need it.
He is pretty chill and laid back. The course was not that bad but he was always available to help during group breakout sessions.

Professor Chaplin was one of my favorite professors during the fall semester. He is the perfect combination of knowledgeable, caring, and humorous, which was very welcoming for an introductory graphics class. A lot of this course at the end focused on the group project, but he was always willing to help wherever. A pleasure to have, for sure :)

A lot of the course is based around consistent homework and groupwork, but Chaplin does a great job at making it all enjoyable. He has a very good sense of humor and is willing to help in any sense of that word. He is the type of Professor to offer to stay long after class to help explain topics to you. One of the good ones here at Stevens!
Laid back guy with a good sense of humor. Was really understanding with my group when we needed an extension.
He's pretty chill and kind of hot
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Good professor ! No exams !  Final project is individual and topic is same for whole class.

He is a good professor and you would understand whatever he teaches if you in full concentration. However, in-class it gets boring a bit, but revise his lectures and you'll get to learn a lot. His assignments are good. It is fairly easy to get an A, if the assignments are done correctly. Overall he is a good Prof.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: He is awful at teaching and grading. Never take any course with him.
No final exam, only group project (you can do individual if you want). Prof. Mai is a nice guy. He answers every question clearly. Assignments and labs were not hard if you pay attention.

Prof. Mai is very organized. Homework and lab assignments are due two weeks after the lecture. Workload is not heavy. If you follow his lectures and slides, you'll do well on hw. No final exam. Final project can be either individual or group. He's a nice guy. I'll definitely recommend his class.
Teaches R in depth and provided plenty of help for the project
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: Please PLEASE avoid this professor if you can. For context I ended up with an A in this class and am not just salty or trying to rant or badmouth a professor. He is constantly randomly changing grades with no feedback, does not respond to email when asked for feedback, and is blatantly unaware of what homework his students are doing on a given week
The professor has no technical knowledge, deadlines continually change, and he missed class without warning 4 times in a row.
Worst professor I've ever had. Confusing instructions and refuses to teach. Doesn't put in grades. Doesn't answer questions.
Makes no sense at all so confusing  his slides make no sense like the deadlines are from 3 years ago
Worst teacher ever.
I've never been more confused in a class before. No clear instructions, no clear deadlines.

The class was easy with few assignments and mostly group work. It was supposed to be asychronous, but then he chose to meet online every week and count points for class participation. I took the class because it was asynchronous, but I couldn't go to the meetings so I lost participation points. Get a good group for the project and you're set.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: Joke class, super easy and you don't have to show up. He doesn't know how to use canvas so get a good group that you can work out what he wants you to submit every week. The assignments are some of the easiest I've ever done. He hijacked our presentation to talk for 8 minutes straight so we didn't have to answer any questions about our work...

Professor Mikruk is chill. Just do the assignments and put in the (bare) minimal amount of work. The course was easy with the main workload being from the group projects. Be sure to grab a beer with him after class; Mikruk has great stories about his time overseas in industry and how they were applicable to the course material. Definitely take him!

The class I took with him was incredibly easy, which is a double-edged sword. On the one hand, I didn't have to stress about it at all; on the other, I don't feel like I gained much of anything from it. He has interesting stories, but doesn't provide much beyond that--I wish I'd gotten more out of his class, but at least it was easy.
There is a plenty of details in EM 600 but overall, it was a really pleasant experience with this professor. He doesn't make things harder for you at all. Very refreshing!
he is a wonderful teacher and I would take another one of his classes again

Had him for 221 which I don't think he actually teaches, since there was a different instructor for the lab. The TAs are always there to help and make sure your work is done by the end of the day. It's a lab class so it's not hard to get an A.

This class is so troll, the labs are all recycled so it exists with upperclassmen, and the TA's just give 90+s as long as your labs aren't noticeably terrible. it's a 3 hour block every week but my group has always been out by usually 75 minutes so don't be too intimated by the scheduling block. I've also never seen Stephen himself cause I had 8 am

I took PEP 209 as an elective (I not in physics at all) and that was a mistake. Strauf is an amazing professor and was super helpful with extra student hours and answering questions in class. BUT I don't recommend this class for kids outside the major unless you have a light load and are seriously interested in optics.
Great professor, but a pretty tough class. Strauf is extremely knowledgeable and is quite passionate about the topics. I highly recommend this class (just be ready to do a little extra work).
Strauf is a smart guy, and is definitely well-researched in optics. His class was difficult, but I think he taught it very well.

I really enjoyed the material in this class, and the professor teaches it well. Enjoyable class, difficult subject, but it's physics. I love physics so even though this class was unnecessary for me I took it out of interest for the material, and it was a surprisingly nice yet challenging class. Take this class if you like physics.
He is an excellent  professor in teaching giving grades explaining the topics very clearly,giving meaning full assignments.
Classes are super fun and interactive. Professor teaches concepts in a way it is easy to understand.. lot of group activities.
He makes sure his class understands the topic well and he delivers at his best. It is always fun attending his lectures.
Professor Lechler is the sweetest man. He cares about his students and wants you to succeed. Literally love him with all my heart.

The students were disengage from the class, since the Professor did not know the topics and materials of the course. The hours of solving questions were a waste of time he because he did not know how to answer and evaded or answered the questions, many times he even answered incorrectly. He was rude with the teacher assistant and the students on

He's one of the best I have studied under. At times his classes are drowsy BUT, do his assignments on time and even if you do some small mistakes he gives you a second chance. Beware of 3 things, a small quiz and a closed book mid term & final(Possible questions are given(objective and Subjective), Prepare those possible questions alone. Easy A
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: He is easily my favorite teacher in the entire school. He obviously realizes that as students we have a ton of work in other classes, so he makes the workload light which I appreciate. He's funny, kind, and you can tell he truly cares about his students. He makes a lot of good jokes. If I could have this teacher for every single course, I would.

Amazing professor. Super passionate about accounting and very personable. He did all he could to make accounting interesting and you can tell he really cares about his students. Don't take any homeworks for granted because there aren't too many things this class is graded by. Would definitely recommend.
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Graded by few things

comment: Hes super qualified to teach accounting. He has a CPA and is Tax Attorney. Hes a good straightforward teacher. He goes over similar homework problems before assignment is due. Homework is online and could take awhile, however, you have few attempts to get the grade you want on assignment. Class is manageable and nothing crazy.

He's really chill. It's accounting so its obviously boring, but he makes dad jokes here and there that are pretty decent I must say. HW takes a decent amount of time, so just get it done early. Overall, easy going guy, easy going class. As long as you pay attention, you should be fine.
Keeps the class light and fun for boring subject like accounting
Keeps the class very light and fun for boring subject like accounting

She is an incredibly engaging and invested professor who very much rewards active participation in the class. Her class was the highlight of my week; there wasn't a ton of work outside of class, and I felt like I actually learned through the class discussions. She's also very approachable. If you can, you should absolutely take her course!

amazing prof; definitely one of my favorites at stevens. incredibly knowledgeable but also funny. I've found that even students who have minimal interest in politics come to really enjoy her classes. don't take it expecting an easy A, but as long as you make a good effort & take the class seriously, you'll do well.

She is a gem of a professor. She carries herself professionally all the while maintaining a sense of personality. She brings an energy to class. She's able to distill her knowledge in an accessible manner. Our class was 9am but she always brought her pep. But don't be fooled--she is understanding but respect her as well...read and do the assignment

By far the most engaging and interesting professor I've had here. She clearly cares about her students and takes the time to get interested in them, but is also extremely knowledgable on the course material and manages to get everyone else interested in the class.

One of the best professors I've had at Stevens. She cares about her students outside of the classroom and makes learning easy. Has a weird attendance policy, but all of her classes are super easy to finish
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Great professor

Plagarism is a big NO! Prof's HW's are hard(if you dont attend classes properly), you have to start the day they are released. Prof is very smart, gives very good feedback, her lectures are not boring slides but actual code! I lost scores cuz of project in the end and attendance!!
Great Professor !!!!!

Class is less about web mining and more about performing machine learning using web scrapped data. Her project requirements are unclear and confusing but she is accessible to address any questions. The homework are relatively easy if you have a coding background; most of the questions are very similar to lecture code.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Group projects

comment: Professor Liu very nice. I learned a lot of thing from her class. She lectures very professionally and students can understand easily. Although the class homework is difficult, you will definitely learn a lot from this course. Note! You must not copy other people's code work.

Really great prof,One of my favorite prof at Stevens! Most of the people don't like him just because he gives tough HW but trust me you would learn the most from it. They would be time taking but you'll learn a lot. Never ever try to copy assignments or else ready to suffer. Lectures are quite long and boring but if you pay attention they're best

Take this course only if you have a solid background in Data Science and Stats. The lectures are incredibly difficult to follow because of the communication and the material. Lectures are typically about which Python module to use to implement what technique with very little real life use case explanations. Lot of points for the group project.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: This professor assigned a midterm the day after spring break. Also assigned homework during spring break.

I mean I took IT214. At first it was hard to understand him but usually you get used to the way he teaches. Trust me he is very passionate to give students extra credits points at the end of every class. And he gives a lot of opportunity for student to get better grade in the class. I would recommend him idk maybe I did well in the class.

Not as bad as people say. Had him for a QF algorithms section and you'll really understand his lectures if you simply pay attention; he goes through examples of each algorithm every class. We only had 5 c++ HWss, which I wish we had more of to cover more bases (there are weekly recitations, but hws are more elaborate). Overall, average at worst.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: The professor is very monotone, making it easy to lose focus during lectures. He also did not follow one part of his syllabus and when confronted about this, he did not claim responsibility. Doesn't seem like there is a healthy learning environment happening within the course. The TAs will help you immensely more than this professor will.

Has a bad stutter, consistently says "right" at the end of his sentences and does not know how to teach. Really rude to students and does not care about anyone's grades. I would definitely avoid as he won't help you if you ask for help

He has a rough stutter, is rude to students, and constantly asks 'right? RIGHT?' when students are quiet in response to statements (statements, not questions, he does not give students opportunity to ask questions)

Would avoid if possible

Professor was out injured for 2 weeks and came back not ready to finish the course. Final was based off lessons not taught by the professor. Takes attendance for every class and the homework is hard and does not prepare you for the exams. Practice exams were helpfulbut the exams were challenging and curved very heavy. Overall would not recommend.

Idk y there r so many bad reviews for Prof Ryan. Maybe he was worse in the past idk, but he's a solid prof. I'm not even a sweat but his class is easy if u do the bare minimum, as in take just a bit to study for the exams. His practice exams are pretty much exactly like the real exams. Lecture's are a bit boring, but he's fair w grading and curves.

Professor Ryan is great! His lectures can be long and a little boring, but he is very helpful. He really cares about his students because he came back 1.5 weeks after he got injured. Respect to him!! His exams are almost exactly like practice exams. He also gives curves.

Honestly, I finished the course not having learned much about accounting. His lectures are not engaging and he doesn't break the content down enough for you to understand. He assigned TOO MUCH homework and his exams were nothing like what you did in the homework. I learned more from teaching myself.
he does not teach at all and does not make class engaging and makes u spend money to do his homework

This Professor's lectures were so unengaging and long. He spoke with such a monotone voice and would just read off the slides and expect the students to get it. The homework was tedious but easy at most times. The tests themselves were extremely hard and the professor had a weird philosophy where he wanted students to perform poorly and curve high.

Damopoulos is a chill dude. Easy going class tbh. As long as you show up you should be fine. There is a lab and it's really not that bad. Other than that, he's a good guy. I'm bad at CS but the class is straight-forward trust me.
Great software engineering course! Allowed me to get an internship!

This entire course can be summed up to "show up & you pass". He puts almost no effort into teaching the material and just gives extremely easy assignments to make sure everyone gets an A. If you want a free A, take this course. If you want to learn, try your luck elsewhere. The only semblance of a redeeming quality is his friendly personality.
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Doesn't have solid grasp of subject matter

The lectures are kind of boring, but Dimitrios is a very cheerful and funny guy. The midterm and final are shockingly hard, but he grades them pretty easily. Almost everyone gets an A. He gives large amounts of extra credit if you attempt to write codes on the board during class.   "Helloooooo. How was your weekend? Did you party?"

Hands-down the best CS professor at Stevens. He always has a happy and cheerful vibe about him and he understands his students better than any other professor I've met. Really down to earth and very easy on grades.

Genuinely caring, understanding, and intelligent professor who wants you to succeed. He's a real expert but doesn't show even a hint of arrogance. He has high expectations of his students but his support really evens that out.

Charming professor with incredible talent in radiative transfer modeling, atmospheric radiation. Excellent class using his well known book. World known, one of the top in the campus and in his field, and easily in the same category with other legends K.N. Liou, S. Chandrasekhar, G.W. Petty, C. Bohren. A challenging course in a respectable way. A++

He's one of the best in his specific field: radiative transfer modeling, and he uses his legendary book in his course.  Respectable, intelligent and challenging in a positive manner.  The Norwegian professor is a little too witty and is easily one of the top professors at this campus.  Only a few professors like him there.
Good professor. Couldve been more helpful though, didn't understand many things in his class.
Great professor, nice to students and gives hints to problem solving.
I found him very helpful.
Professor is excellent! Very knowledgeable, caring and interesting.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Amazing lectures--Would take again

comment: Best professor I ever took at Touro in three years. Caring, knowledgeable, very fair and helpful.

Dr. Kidron is strong professor and her course (Biological Psychology) is very interesting. I have used information from this class many times in my undergraduate and graduate work. I also throughly enjoyed working with her as a research assistant. Dr. Kidron is a delight to learn from and I would highly recommend taking her classes.
Great teacher! show up to class, listen and study and you can do well.

Does not give much feedback, lecture slides are boring and long(too much text). Class is not very engaging. Exams were not too difficult, but that's probably because I took AP Psych. I would recommend to attend class for the extra points at the end.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: She literally doesn't  give any usual feedback and she always tries to squeeze too much information into a single lecture. She literally has like 100 slides per lecture. It ridiculous. There are three exams and she doesn't curve any of them. She gives you 5 extra cred point to final grade for attending all lectures. Attend all of the lectures
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Sklinos started our class by welcoming us to "HLI 421," waited for some poor sap to ask, "Isn't this Differential Equations?" and then said, "Yes, this is unfortunately a much more boring class: math!" Contrary to this, this class was a blast. His lectures made the material easy, and I would take him again in a heartbeat. A great guy!

Professor Sklinos is extremely helpful and easily available outside of class. Linear algebra felt like a breeze compared to high school. I loved his lectures and he always took the time to make sure everyone understood everything. The exams were straightforward if you attended class and took notes. He's the main reason I found a passion for math.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Had him before Covid. He always came to class with his little espresso cup. He is enthusiastic about his subject, made sure students were having a good time. He was always prepared, always knew the answers to student questions, rarely made any mistakes in his problems (which he solved at a good pace and very in depth). Amazing teacher.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Prof. Sklinos was a delight to have for MA121/122. He was always cracking jokes and was super energetic.

Professor Sklinos is very passionate in the material and content he teaches. At times it may be difficult to understand the concepts that he teaches in lectures, but he is very welcoming during office hours and answers any questions you have in order to clarify your understanding of the topic. His lectures do not feel long and are instructive.
Solid choice of a calc professor. Can seem dry and boring at times but he has funny moments and solid lectures that make up for it.

Bayrak is genuinely the best professor I've had at Stevens. So sad that he is leaving to teach at Lehigh. He really cares. He is very knowledgeable and great at lecturing. He explains things very clearly and I learned so much from him. The assignments are all doable if you pay attention in class. Very clear grading and always open to questions.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Only person I've ever given a review for. Probably one of the best professors I've had at Stevens. Class wasn't exactly relevant to my major but he managed to make it interesting, and explained things very well.

He teaches very well.
he was always available for any questions we had.

Bayrak is the best! Made the course bearable. Never made labs, homework, or exams difficult. Professor is also accessible after class if you ever need help. I learned a lot from his lectures and I appreciate how he ran the class. Definitely recommend!

An absolute gem. He goes out of his way to make exams easy and as clear as possible, and if you're confused about anything on any assignment he's super easy to contact and he walks you through the whole thing. He actually cares about his students and the subject and wants to make the class as good as possible. Would absolutely recommend.
Only teacher that makes sense and cares if the students understand the information.
Up until the final project, he was a great teacher. But he was extremely strict when grading the final project, and wouldn't let us use materials that were available to other classes.
Very kind, definitely cares about his students. He outlines the course content well and thoroughly understands what he's teaching.
He's a caring and smart Professor. Im glad i had him, would def take him again if i could!
Overall great professor who cares about how you feel and if you're struggling. Always attempts to joke around and make the mood of the room better.
Lenient until it comes to final presentation and final report. Will scrutinize every single line and every single sentence you say.
Very boring to listen to, but very knowledgeable. Would take again.
I do not like this man.
Such an attractive fellow.
Really smart man but participation killed me

This guy knows his stuff. As a QF major you'll have him for recitation for QF 106 and QF 112. If you pay attention, you will gain valuable insights into the class. He is also very helpful and can answer basically any question you have about the course.

Professor Long is easily one of the best recitation professors I have had. He goes in depth with every topic discussed and is not a harsh grader. He makes sure that you get every topic and tries to not leave anyone behind. I would easily take him if I could every semester but unfortunately he only teaches a selected amount of classes.
Great recitation class.

Nothing short of an awful TA. 3/4 of the class is "independent working time" where we try to solve questions on the board. Everyone is clearly on their phone. In the least offensive way possible, the way he speaks is unbearable. Does not teach anything, just puts practice problems on the board. Does them quickly and doesn't explain anything.
Lectures were interesting and easy to understand, he made sure that the whole class knew what was going on.
Boring lectures and practically whispers while he's speaking. Doesn't give any study guides or a list of topics for an exam. What you get on a test is just what you get.

Great lecturer, great professor, very personable, and very open-minded. He understands that sometimes software such as Gradarius is wrong, and he will manually adjust grades that are reported to be made in error. However, he doesn't make his lectures stand out, and his voice is super easy to fall asleep to. Otherwise, he is fantastic!

Diff Eq was a rough class, but Professor Romney made it just that little bit easier to understand. Lectures were amazing and always easy to follow, and the homework (even though it was a lot) was super helpful for preparing for exams. 10/10 would recommend Romney.

Professor Romney had amazing lectures and explained things by doing examples and then going into the proofs, which made it very easy to see how things connected. Best mast professor I have had at Stevens.
As a lecture professor, he gives great exam reviews, and his lectures are incredibly coherent. For MA221, you should take Romney, he's great.

He is a good person, willing to help. His lectures can be a bit confusing sometimes but he answers questions well. Diff eq is also just a hard course so I would like to have him for a different course and see how it goes.

I had him for E-126. He is good in the aspect of he knows what hes talking about and can reach. If you ask too many questions he will get annoyed. And if you miss a day, you will be called out next class. He is still better than most Professor when it comes to teaching, but never made it comfortable to just ask a question if you didnt understand

Going to his class was stressful. He was constantly irritable and never appreciated questions being asked in class. If you ever missed a class, he'd make some comment in front of the class about it, and he *hated* people being late. He didn't present the material very well, and his pop quizzes sucked. He was intimidating and unhelpful.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: He is a good professor. The lecture establishes basic knowledges but it needs some more reading and some google research in order to get better understanding and to complete the exams/quizes. Also, he has very strong background what he teach.

He is a good professor and he is willing to help but because class was a bit hard his explanations might not be clear. Just ask, he likes when people ask questions. At the same time, he is funny. Just DON'T BE LATE - he hates that.

I took ME 524 Fundamentals of Remote Sensing with Dimitri online.  There was no textbook, the only material he gave us were his PowerPoints from class.  He gave these to us without any notes, audio or video to accompany them, they were useless.  I spoke to my department head about this, I don't think this class will be offered for credit anymore.
Awesome guy.  Good stories.  Good examples.

Weekly questions to answer, which are short papers; midterm; final. Midterm and final have options for format, which is nice. Dr. Lombardi is fair, respected, and always can be emailed for clarity. No group work in the course or live lectures; it's all clearly reused material but still feel like I learned more compared to other classes.

Doc motivates and inspires you to achieve your potential. Truly cares about you as a person, and as long as you reciprocate his respect by coming to class, participating, and talking to him before/after class, you should be able to get a good grade. Mostly group projects. Lots of class discussion. Doesn't call you out if you don't know the answer.

Dr. L is an amazing professor and great motivator. He is honest about his expectations in class, and he really takes the time to learn about each student. He treats all of his students as colleagues, and I would definitely take any class he teaches.
Best prof I've ever had! He's incredibly helpful.
Great professor! I would highly recommend him, he has both the industry experience and the passion for teaching - making his classes exciting and productive.
Aweseome professor.  Learned a great deal and it was a fun class.  There was work involved, but it was manageable.  Would love to take more classes with him.
he is a very interactive person
THE PROFESSOR TEACHING METHOD IS SO GREAT AND EASY TO UNDERSTAND . THE CLASS IS SO INTERACTIVE AND HELPFUL

This professor is amazing and creative. He give very good feedbacks on our assignments and work in class. His grading and teaching methods are very good. He gives lot of real time examples, videos during lectures for better understanding and always responds to emails and doubts. I will recommend students to take this prof.
