This prof is very good, love to listen to his classes. The method of teaching is very unique and engaging. The way he teaches each topic with examples, showing videos in lectures, giving real time examples makes more engaging and interesting class. His in class activity sessions are very creative.

This professor is really good i would love to listen to his classes he is great and friendly .The way he teaches each topic with examples is crazy i mean i didnot have this lecturer so far he is just good.The course was taught very weel with following the canvas timelines he was on point  .The main point i likedis teaching skills are good.
He's really good and helps you out a lot
Good, if you want to learn new things in AI and how to make useful of it rather than completely rely on it.
A large portion of your grade is based on weekly takehome quizes and he drops the two worst ones. He's easily the best professor in terms of actually learning in class that I've had at Cooper.

Extremely flexible with students particularly with weekly quizzes (most of which are take home and the lowest two get dropped). Midterms were fairly similar to hw/in class work, but the final was fairly difficult. Fairly easy to get a B or higher with some (but not an unreasonable) amount of effort.

Professor Wright is overall disorganized. He reads from the textbook, so it's not worth going to the lectures, despite them being mandatory. His syllabus listed a special assignment citing 15% of the grade, which he did not assign until the week of finals week. After first denying my idea for an assignment, he plagiarized the idea a week later.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Terribly vague and hardly ever answers questions upfront. Reads straight off slides then practically speaks in riddles when asked to clarify. On top of this he hand calculated my grade towards the end of the semester, telling me it was fine and that I shouldn't drop, when according to the final grade that was obviously not the case.

He is the worst teacher I have ever encountered. Multiple classes at the end of the year were entirely spent (50 full minutes) doing parts A and B of an example, which is material we should've known week 2.

Professor Wright said on the 1st day "If you don't come to class, you will burn on the tests." However, the homework is crucial as it is the exact material to study for the weekly quiz (every Friday) and the 4 exams. The class, by nature of the material, is not easy, but as long as you do the examples you will pass. GO TO CLASS! but not mandatory

Great great professor. i have no interest in math whatsoever. he really knows his stuff and will take someone like me, who hates math and doesn't understand anything! and who also thought i was unteachable-to see that i can do it! he's corny but really amazing! willing to help with everything and doesn't take ****. show up and take notes.
He is a great TA.  If you don't understand something he will explain it to you
Your pen is your weapon of mass destruction.
COREY IS THE MAN. He is the best math teacher I've ever had. He should be a professor for all math classes. He helped so much and he is the reason I did well in Calc 2.
Cool Dude!! He should teach all my math classes!!

Really great professor. He might write a little small, but he explains things really well and will make sure he fully answers any questions anybody has. Contrary to other reviews, I think he's a very good lecturer if you pay attention. He does explain a lot and writes EVERYTHING on the board, which really helps as it helps you not miss anything.
He writes very small on the board, is often hard to understand, and is not a good lecturer. Switch to another professor ASAP or you're going to have to each yourself
His lectures suck. Go to a different professor's lectures if you can.

Clarity is lacking at times, but that's because my background in mathematics wasn't as good as it should have been. He puts a lot of work into the problems and things that he assigns and is genuinely excited about the topic (Especially graph theory). One of the best classes I've ever taken. Might not count towards my degree but still worth it.
Excellent at the computational, a little less so at the theoretical.

An awesome professor in Stevens. He has depth knowledge in E-Commerce domain and he is friendly. Attendance and participation are mandatory and he will count those factors for the final grade. Individual Project is to make an E-commerce site so be ready to spend 40-100$ for domain purchase but you will learn a lot about E-commerce after the cours

he is very nice, helpful, explains everything very clear but he always make me sleepy. the course is very helpful and practical you will do everything yourself, so you gonna understand it . take this course if you wanna have a nice time and learn a lot in the same time. finish final in 1st hr & take 10 extra credit, or in 90 min for 5 extra credit
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: PROs: # The course is straightforward and quite intuitive. # Lecturer encourages discussions in class. # Assignments are easy. # Friendly prof! CONs: # Not a technical course. Techno-functional at best. # Need to spend approx USD 50 for the final project. NOTE: Take this if you are loaded with other courses and looking for an easy one.

A very nice and friendly professor that is very knowledgeable in his field. You learn a lot about e-commerce. Lectures are very standard and can be boring sometimes. Grading is straightforward and follow directions to get a good grade. There is a group project in the first part course then you do a individual project second half of the course.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: This class (cs 519)gave a great overview of Ecommerce and was not difficult.  His lectures were interesting and easy to follow.  The homeworks and final were also somewhat of a breeze.  Good teacher very friendly and not mean.

course is very intensive with assignments and exams, with a total of 16 graded assignments or projects in a semester.The professor has a lot of ddl, but please don't despair, he is just scaring you, as long as you complete every assignment carefully, even if a week beyond the ddl ,you will be fine.
The software he uses is old.try something new.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Caring

comment: He refuses to teach on any software less than 20 years old, even though the university buys licenses to better software, because he doesnt want to redo his teaching materials. Forces you to buy a $90 online textbook (that even the publisher admits is legacy software). Huge headache, waste of time, avoid him and his class like the plague.

I did not have the best experience with this Professor. He frequently showed up to class late, took months to grade assignments, and even judged me sometimes for asking for help in class when I had a question. He was not very patient with us and took forever to respond to emails, too. My only solace was being in touch with an amazing TA.

The coursework was trivial and kind of disappointing. It could have been a really interesting class if it was taught by someone competent. However, Manna's boring and condescending lectures made class painful to sit through. You'll learn nothing, but at least you don't need to know much. I graduate in a day and I still haven't received my grades.

Professor Manna would show up to class, tell you which lab is due and when, and then sit back on his laptop and not move for the remaining two hours. Thankfully my section had an amazing TA that was practically the professor and taught everyone solidworks. It's an easy class, I have never used solidworks before and easily managed an A.
Really enjoyed his class, very interesting critter

Mario is awesome, the class was easy and I learned a lot of cool stuff! He is super enthusiastic and cares about his students' progress as well as what he does. He always has a smile and is super welcoming, perfect morning class! He gives thorough and valuable feedback and is always upbeat and fun! The class is very hands on, the work is valuable!

Mario has been the highlight of my semester. He brings a lot of positivity to the music industry when most people would be negative. I learned so much about electronic music and it's all due to Mario. I looked forward to this class every single day. All the feedback he gave to me was very accurate. It is tragic that I don't have him next semester.

Mario is my favorite professor at Stevens. He is extremely knowledgable in the topic of electronic music, and you will learn a lot in his class. He always makes class enjoyable and gives excellent feedback to students.

mario is the coolest guy at stevens. his class was probably the most structured and organized class i have ever had the pleasure of participating in. he is collected and understanding and has a vast knowledge on pretty much everything that is discussed in class. this was one of the coolest classes i have ever gotten to experience.
Mario is a solid dude and a really good professor. He is really patient with his students and making sure they fully understand the material.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: This has been the most LABARIOUS course I have ever taken in my academic career. Never have I had such a demanding course! My complaint with this course is the fact that when it's so assignment and deliverables heavy, it takes away from the actual learning from the course and focuses more on HW. He's knowledge and uses the budget generously. Avoid!

I found Dr. Koen's class very engaging. His teachings are current, & are being adopted by large firms. I have been able to apply the learnings to my job function @ a fortune 500, which to me is a bigger accomplishment! Folks like Dr. Koen are highly appreciated, recognized, respected for their work at both academia and industry.

Dr. Koen is a well liked professor who strives to perfect the art of teaching, with students' learning in mind. The material is cutting-edge practical. You will apply lessons from class in your career. The professor is very reasonable and accommodating. He treats each student fairly and with respect. Coursework is intense, valuable, and achievable.
Professor Koen is not respected by us and the course itself feels like a waste of time. I heard about his reputation and should have considered it more before choosing him.
Tenured professor that goes through the motions. Avoid if you can as the class is painful and he doesn't explain things very well.

Professor Fisher is super nice and tries really hard to make a hard subject that doesn't apply to every major interesting for everyone. He's always willing to help and make your experience better. The class is difficult though, you have to show up and try hard to do well.

Listen to the other reviews lightly. Fisher is a good profand really knows what he's talking about. Statics is naturally a challenging course, but he does convey the material well through plenty of practice problems. If you have a question, he's more than happy to answer it. Only downside is he sometimes goes through stuff quickly.

Possibly the worst professor in the Stevens Mechanical Engineering department. Runs his class like a "company" where he is the CEO and the students are the employees, but in actuality he doesn't teach and gives confusingly graded case studies that are pointlessly long. He posts a "good" example of a case study and which if you follow would be a C.

Tries to be edgy by treating his class "like a company", but in reality he just assigns overly complicated and convoluted case studies that don't really help anyone learn. It seems he has a skewed idea of what a "job" actually is, especially since STUDENTS are only going to be working @ internships and are supposed to learn from mentors/experience.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: 51% of this class is group based - and you cannot work with the same person more than once, which makes it basically random. This guy gives NO grading outline and honestly teaches absolute nonsense. Not sure why this is even a class. Hes also not a nice teacher, not fun to listen to for hours. Less than 5% of the class gets As.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Professor Alkis is very kind and considerate. While the WN courses are mandatory Professor A makes it a priority to respect the individual and that life happens. He is understanding and works with you to succeed in class. He is very respected and is passionate in his teaching in a positive way. You will not be disappointed in his class.

Professor Vazacopoulos is great: extremely intelligent and knowledgeable but also teaches in a way that makes concepts easy to understand. He has a lot of passion for the subject matter, so his lectures are always interesting and engaging. One of the smartest and nicest professors you'll ever meet.

awesome. I was thinking of sitting in last rows on Day 1 class. I automatically started to sit in the first row. If u attend class regularly, assignments r simple. doubts will be clarified if you are proactively asking the Professor. The way you understand and listen in class matters. I would definitely recommend students. He is the best person.
Professor Vazacopoulos is one of the most knowledgable professors at Stevens; the course material is extremely applicable and relevant and he does a great job teaching the material.
Great Professor. Likes to engage with the class.
He is an excellent professor who clearly understands the course material and is able to communicate it to his students. He's also approachable and willing to answer questions.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: if you come in with a good understanding of single-variable calculus, you can get a good grade with good effort. It's the most difficult conceptually in the beginning but he is great at teaching

He's really young, but he knows what he's doing. He very much cares about the subject making his lectures pretty interesting if you don't hate math. The exams are pretty hard, but the SSPs and homework aren't bad, and if you have issues he tries to help.
He's a good guy and he knows the content well, but that's about it. He's a little boring, but I'm not sure if this was due to the online setting or not.

He's young and knows what hes doing. Definitely qualified to teach discrete math. I took the class over the summer so he was going very quick. Also his homework would sometimes be a lot harder than what he discussed. Overall if you try in the class, you can do well.

He seems to be a nice person outside of the class, but he does too much. He is a very tough grader and most times not fair at all. He will not let you make up work or fix any mistakes. He never has anything nice to say about your papers, even if they recieve 100's. But he is the quickest to give you negative feedback.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: found him too authoritative; doesn't seem to care about students wanting to do extra work; does not tent to give feedback to student's work
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: A great professor who provides excellent real world examples and quality feedback for all assignments.  As long as you follow his assignment instructions and listen during class it is hard to not learn a ton while also getting an A.  Definitely take him!!

Great Professor who uses real world examples when teaching.He provides great feedback when you seek his assistance.  Furthermore, as long as you follow his instruction and interact in class discussions, you can easily earn an A.
Great professor who utilizes real world examples.  He is very understanding and helpful when it comes to the assignments due.

Professor Alessandrini is definitely a caring professor who tries his best in lectures. He's open to answering questions. The only problem I have is that the terrible handwriting along with the Italian accent can definitely impact your learning, at least it did for me.
His lectures were difficult to follow because of his handwriting, ruined the rest of the semester for me. Had to do a lot of self-studying.
Very heavy Italian accent and his handwriting is morse code, he's a good guy though.

Heavy Italian accent and handwriting that is kind of hard to read, but you get used to it pretty quick. He's a great guy and a very good lecturer, also it's kind of funny when he pronounces greek letters the italian way.

Accent and cursive handwriting make it difficult to follow along sometimes, other than that, he is just OK. Not rude, is open to questions, and is loud enough during lectures. Strangely, if you fail the first half in the Fall, there's no MA125 during the second half to retake, so plan accordingly.

These two classes are actually pretty difficult and require a heavy amount of effort. Great professor, his lectures give great notes, and you can tell he's trying. I heard he's better in the 9-9:50 AM section, but he's a new professor (at this point) so cut him some slack. Otherwise, for a lecture professor he did his job fine, just a hard class.

Professor Alessandrini is a very nice teacher who is very approachable. He answers any questions, even if he just explained it 3 seconds ago. He has an Italian accent and his handwriting is hard to decipher from the back of the lecture hall, so sit up close. He humors class clowns and just has an overall good personality.
I love this teacher. He is a great professor.

The courses he teaches tend to be difficult. For this reason, his lectures will likely not make sense if you aren't willing to spend 1-2 hours per week trying to understand the material. He's a genius and certainly qualified in what he teaches. Note that he can be a bit harsh, though.

He is one of the worst professors I have ever had the unfortunate luck of working with. So far, his lectures are dry and way too fast for our level, the language he chose, Scheme, is the most annoying and outdated programming language I have ever seen. Even when the majority of the class failed the tests with 20s and 30s, he never changed his teach

This applies to all of the courses he teaches.  The subject matter is difficult in itself, and Bloom is the best candidate to teach it.  He knows what he's talking about, but is unable to explain clearly enough that *everyone* can understand.  If you listen and pay attention, you'll be able to get it.  Funny (sorta) and a genius, he's a cool prof.
This guy is way too smart for his own good. He doesn't know how to "dumb things down" so that sophomore undergrads can understand them. His homeworks are impossible unless you Google the problems.

Funda is great. Her lectures are clear and she really makes sure you understand the material during office hours if you need extra help. I loved that she goes over every problem you get wrong on exams when you pick them up at her office.
Shes awesome! Very funny and caring. I highly recommend

Funda is always a step ahead of the other Calculus professors and conveys the material really well. She always says she's not a lecturer but a coach to help you pass. Homework and exams are easy if you take notes.
She is the perfect turkish women and a great teacher. Wish she was 18 so i could marry her and have many kids with her perfect genetic material.
Too perfect for this world

His way of teaching and explaining concepts lacks clarity. Additionally, the content is not presented in a structured manner. The grading criteria for projects are unclear, which makes it challenging to understand how grades are assigned and how to meet expectations.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: I always liked stats, but Professor Grogan made me love it. He is an incredible teacher who really knows how to communicate the material; participating in his class is never frightening and he goes out of his way to address any confusion or questions. I always felt thoroughly prepared for the exams, and his class was the highlight of my week.

My sleeper pick for best prof on campus. Super caring and understanding, doesn't grade too harshly and is incredibly knowledgeable. I wasn't thrilled about the material of this course but his attitude helped make it bearable. Would be fine taking him again down the road just from his personality.

He is one of the best professors in the school. He is respected and concern each student. He is responsible for each Office hour and always very patient. He replies questions online and through email quickly. Absolutely learn a lot from his lectures.
A very good professor with a solid knowledge about statistics and working on Python. Definitely a thumbs up!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Very laid-back professor if you want CAL103 to be stress-free. Assignments are very standard and compared to most professors of the same course, he most likely is one of the more easier graders. Missing a few assignments or lectures shouldn't be much of a problem. Genuinely entertaining lectures and overall nice professor.

Schoch is super understanding and down to earth. If you put effort into the class he will be very flexible and he's a good grader. He also likes to engage in a lot of class discussion and class is not lecture-heavy.

Great Guy! would take his class again. He is young and relatable and sometimes tells funny stories from his college years. He is not strict with deadlines and is very . understanding. Overall, great teacher

Prof. Schoch was fantastic. His class was always interesting. He provided great feedback for work and it was always very clear what he wanted. If I had the opportunity to take him again for CAL 105 I would have picked him without a second thought.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Mike is new to Stevens but his class was a great experience. Friendly, casual, and laid back while still having command over the subject and lots of knowledge to share. Works with you to help you succeed and conscious of the rest of your workload. Sad that he isn't an option for CAL105, will be missed!
The course covers a lot of material and has high work load. But, professor was helpful with assignments and flexible. Overall it was a great class and interesting to learn about.

I learned a lot from this course and found the workload quite acceptable. It covered multiple software to build databases using SQL, cloud and Apache Hadoop ecosystem. Weekly assignments required us to use different data infrastructures and were sometimes challenging. But the professor was available to troubleshoot.

The professor is very nice and professional. He was very knowledgeable about data mining and covered various approaches to process data. He seemed to genuinely enjoy the content and want us to learn. Highly recommend.
The professor is very nice and professional. He was very knowledgeable about data mining and covered various approaches to process data. He seemed to genuinely enjoy the content and want us to learn.

I took this during a COVID-affected semester. This otherwise on-campus class was moved online. He executed the class very well in terms of logistics. Makes himself available for regular office hours. Was flexible given COVID and all the life and work changes that came with it. Would recommend.

I highly recommend this professor to anyone in CS or Software Engineering. She's funny, engaging, and makes tough topics worth the effort. The class is challenging but rewarding. Quizzes are designed to ensure you pay attention, featuring specific examples from lectures. If you want to become a software engineer, definitely take this class.

She is a wonderful professor. She really cares about her students and makes the class easy. Very approachable and fun to talk to. Lenient grader, but also very transparent. Just do your work on a timely basis (there isn't much of it) and this course is a very easy A.

Very informative course. Professor Annie does a lot to help students gain practical experience of Agile Methodologies. Do your work regularly as you're asked and you'll take a lot out of this class. The knowledge and experience you gain here will help you in the industry.

Love this teacher.  Truly cares about students.  Even after she went on maternity leave she still made sure to check in on us and even gave us bonus points on the final we had with the other teacher.  Overall, super nice grader and great professor. Lectures can be a little long, but she didn't forget to crack a joke or 2.
Prof. Yu is a gem. She is the best professor so far, she makes the lecture very interesting and easy to learn.
Very Helpful
does not respond to emails if he made a mistake in his grading

Extremely smart, but lazy. Okay at lecturing. Not responsive outside of class and there's an overall sense of lethargy to everything he does. Some disconnects between him, the curriculum, and the homework. The class is fascinating - but be prepared to spend tens of hours a week on the homeworks. Only take this class if you are extremely interested.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: He could have been asleep for half the lecture and I wouldn't have noticed. The class is incredibly interesting but has absurd expectations for students' time commitment to the class, with homeworks that take ~10-20 hours a week with a partner to accomplish. If you have a passion for computer science and don't value your time, this class is for you
Because the class is mostly group presentations, he was there to supervise and guide the conversation. It was a great course and an easy A.

The coursework is very interesting and makes sure to cover both theory and practical applications. Professor Koskinen is good at teaching the material but gets some points off for there being a general disconnect between homeworks and lecture material.

If you took chemistry in high school, you'll probably be fine. Raab's lectures were thorough, but I didn't pay attention most of the time since I already knew the material. He did take attendance in every class and did Poll Everywhere in the middle of most of the lectures, so make sure to pay enough attention to do those.
He is a great lecturer. He is young so he understands how we feel as college students. I hate chemistry though. He does not make chemistry any easier but he does make it barrable.
Take him

Raab was a decent professor and a nice guy, although the class did not help his case. If you are picking a science elective AVOID THIS CLASS. The amount of homework is as much as all your other classes combined. With Raab, he finished most classes with 10-15 minutes to spare which made his lectures more bearable, since attendance was graded.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Raab was awful. Did not know a single thing in class and was often corrected by other students, which led to a lot of time being wasted in lectures. There was no clear way to prepare for exams and he consistently made exams difficult, despite not adequately communicating/explaining the material. This class is a self-study class by all means.
generous, easy to pass, a little homework.
Was chill; realized that seminar classes shouldn't have too much work. Not too critical of presentations either and gives fairly good advice. Subject was interesting, we did AI.

New curriculum has more things applicable to wireless networks; just weekly one-pagers and a final presentation for assignments. The grading scheme was non-existent and feedback is very rarely given. Easy class but I could've learned more. Notes are just bullet points not actual slides with images and figures.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Well-intentioned and very passionate about the subject, but does little to actually teach it and consistently rambles on with no clear focus. The course itself is very easy though with hardly any work.

ignore the 2 star guy this man is a blessing to humanity and a demigod. attending class was like jesus christ himself descended into mclean hall and absolutely enlightened and dazzled the classroom. his warm, tender voice paired with his fantastic physique which would rival a sculpture of a greek god makes for a course to never forget.

Professor Yao know is knowledge but has a heavy Chinese accent and speaks poor English. Often, he goes on random tangents that no one follows about why he likes Fridays or something random. Additionally, he over shares and makes awkward conversation.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Murad is the best teacher I've ever had. He's always 10 steps ahead of everyone. It feels like you're playing chess with him. You'll lose every time but you'll learn a ton from it. I frequently go back and reference ideas and concepts he taught. Really great guy. Approachable. Thoughtful. Challenging, but in a good way. Highly recommend.

He is an inspirational professor who teaches through his field experience combined with theoretical understanding and not only through the text books. His classes are greatly interactive and involve a lot of team projects. His practical experience and interesting questions keep the class engaged and energetic. Intense classes but you learn a lot.
Good energy level, useful knowledge and teamwork. But need better on timing and clearer homework instructions.

You do not need to read the textbook for this class (MGT 699) just pay attension to his slides. Grade is heavily based on presenting and participating. He uses interesting techniques to help you learn but his classes are consistingly 20 minutes OVER TIME. I didn't do well on the exam bc it was impossible (13/25) but still got an A from extra credit

1.Frequently keeps students late after class is supposed to be over.  2.Gives "trick questions" (his words) on the test.  3.Multiple assignments due each week. 4.Grading is partially done by other students.

First time teaching D3. says WAY too many sussy things. we took a pop quiz as a class since he forgot there was a pop quiz. Very lecture-heavy. First-class was the whole three hours. sometimes misunderstands material. at least this class is gone. Easy A, not much work, but be prepared for a whole lotta sus and time wasted. What a mischievous child
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: Design 2 was draining until we switched online. He became the most interactive and helpful professor I had. Yes, he can be a little nerdy and odd, but deep down he cares and wants you to understand what's happening and actually answers the question "how do you do this" unlike other design profs. who leave you in the dark. Would def recommend

The professor made a terrible habit early on if not telling us what he was actually looking for in our work before grading, and when asked why work was inadequite would straight up add criteria that wasnt mentioned. He even went so far as to try to fail my group based on final report criteria completely absent from the syllabus. Switch out ASAP.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: He talks way too much about things that are completely irrelevant to the topic. Be ready to sit through 2 hour lectures about screw sizes. He also is very unclear about instructions and his time spent in class talking will significantly take time out of the limited time you have to complete your design project.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: He really does try, however he is an extremely tough grader and has quite a monotonous tone that made class long and hard to sit through. He is super unclear about what he wants you to do or put in the reports so hope you have a good TA. Don't be afraid to ask to redo parts of your reports either, he let our group redo a small portion on one.

Professor Connington is a great professor and I would recommend him to anyone. He makes a very hard subject enjoyable and as straightforward as possible. He also puts a lot of effort into his lectures, which you can tell by his slides and handouts. He's also always willing to help you and answer any questions during office hours.

He's a very smart professor and knows what he's talking about. Took him for the summer sem and he turned a very challenging subject into something enjoyable. He works out the examples kind of quickly so make sure to interact and study or you might do poorly on the exams. Overall would take the class again, he is a nice guy. Would recommend.

He goes super fast through easy textbook problems making them look complicated. I wish he took extra time to focus more on important things that are gonna be on the test. Its hard to keep up with him most of the time. His lectures are like reading the textbook. At least he prints out the notes what is nice.
Very Hard Course, but the Prof. Is really good. He's willing to meet for extra help and provides students with great resources.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: He loves fluids and it shines through his flaws. He is not the best at communicating ideas clearly and concisely, instead he leans on derivations which apparently some students find helpful. Had him for themo and fluids, defiantly better at fluids, in thermo I knew almost nothing. Nice guy, but not the best teacher, though not the worst
Super chill TA that will work through all types of problems during class that you will see on exams. The class itself is pretty light and the grading scheme is lenient. Not a lot of homework.
This TA is exactly what you want in a teacher. He is very engaging and entertaining. He knows what he's doing and will make sure you do, too.
One of the best and most caring TAs. He did an excellent job of explaining every topic in a way that could be easily understood. He also has a great sense of humor. I highly recommend.
Easily one of the best TA Ive had all semester. Hes a real down to earth guy and always tried to make class fun. He breaks down the material and explains things clearly.

Best TA I have ever had in my life. He will make physics much easier and explains it really well, he cares about his students and he wants them to pass. You can always reach out to him after school. Take him if possible, you won't regret it!

Professor Brennan is super kind and will always treat every question with respect no matter how stupid it is. Her labs are zybooks hacking practices so if you enjoy the art of ethical hacking you'll have fun. The whole semester is lecture content for the exam, so coding basically is an irrelevant skill in this class. Know the concepts and explain
She is lovely

Prof. Brennan knows what she is doing with CS284. Personally enjoyed how the course was homework-based as they allowed the class to apply the topic learned in the lectures well. She reaches out to anyone who is struggling and also is very open to extra credit opportunities. Overall, the quality is superb and you will learn a lot from her class.

Professor Brennan is a natural teacher, which is rare at the college level. She explains topics clearly, even for those of us who were new to Java. The assignments are challenging but doable, and she even offered a large extra credit assignment to ensure that our grades wouldn't tank from one bad assignment grade. Very caring and great at teaching.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: She is one of the best professors for CS284. She always gives motivational facts of different data methods which makes the topics easier to understand. Her office hours are really helpful and welcoming. She takes student privacy seriously which most professors don't. She really appreciates if a student is prepared for class before lectures.

The professor ensures that the students understand the topic and always gives out examples. Most of her quizes are take home. Assignments are always interesting. She is also generous with giving out extra credit, as she only cares about the student being able to take advantage of the knowledge she provides. I would recommend her very much so.
This professor is one of the best teacher I had encountered.

Good course. Midterm was fair and not a huge chunk of the grade. End of semester project was fairly straightforward and definitely easy if you have a good group. Gives good feedback and direction on homework. I definitely recommend anyone take him for any class that he offers.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Very helpful and knowlegable guy
mod and sim. online course. do the homework. straightforward. go an extra mile with the projects. not good with email response or phone calls. very clear online lectures.

Excellent and knowledgable person with extra ordinary helpfulness.All professor must be like him. I think he should take one more class in which he can teach other prof that how they should tackle students. Really down to earth person.
Great Guy, Knows what he is teaching very well.  A very good mentor.  He never replies back on e-mail.  Overall on a scale of 10, I would give him 9.

One of the worst professors. You're expected to know a lot of stuff with regard to TCP/IP basics which the professor does not go over. There is a daily quiz in every class, a tough midterm and a final. Oh, there's a group project as well. The TAs for this course are awful too. They provide no help whatsoever and cut points for arbitrary reasons.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: Cannot understand his english

Awful speaking skills; Often late; Assignment content: 5-6 relatively easy problems from the book per HW;
Lecture content: slides that the authors of the book made; What he adds to the slides: ???; Coming to lecture would be a complete waste of time if not for the mandatory quizzes. Professors like him damage the integrity of a Stevens degree.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Test heavy

comment: Class isn't too hard and not too much work is given. What truly sucks about this course is the lack of quality. Its kind of hard to describe, but it you can easily see how little effort is put into it. Also I am pretty sure Rahman has been teaching this class for several years, yet he still doesn't know how to use canvas.
great professor. daily quick quiz
Dave was a good man who enjoyed seeing people learn and wanted to improve the world through science and communication. He was my first boss and mentor before he became a professor. I will miss him.
Took him for HVAC.  Nice guy.  Rest in peace man...
If you can teach your self Thermodynamics, and do the homework, you will do well in this class.  Otherwise, take it during the normal semester, you'll learn more

The teacher does definitely want the students to learn and pass the class.  He will stay after if you need extra help which you might need to do because his teaching is a bit poor at times.  Overall, very satisfied with his attitude and his tests were fair.  Study the examples in the book!
This guy is pretty boring. He's class took forever but the tests were pretty easy. He constantly uses the expression "Can you buy the arguement" or "150 years ago".
Likes to hear himself talk, cancelled a lot of classes, didn't learn a thing

Professor Downie is fantastic! He is a well-rounded individual who not only incites discussion but participates in them himself. Even though he's new to Stevens, he fits in excellently. And he's very helpful. If you can, get in his class!

Downie's a cultured dude and certainly a knowledgeable litterateur. He gets a lot of flak because being at a tech school, you're not going to find a lot of people interested in humanities (or of regular class discussion). But Prof. Downie is one of a kind. He's an excellent teacher.
He thinks he knows all. In class discussion he is not afraid to tell you your opinion is wrong to help support the agenda that he is trying to push. Essay are easy though.

He's very eloquent. However, he is a very tough grader and has high expectations from incoming freshmen when it comes to writing. Discussions usually take up the whole class. Moreover, ask him questions about what the assignment he's assigning means to get through this class, because if you don't ask him questions, you will be lost.
Chen is very professional and gives good scores! She is pretty and nice as well
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Inspirational--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Tough course. Lots of probability but was exactly what I needed.
Tough class but I learned a lot
She is a good professor, her course is clear and comprehensive. The course talked about basic technique of AI, such as SVM, decisive tree, etc., I learned a lot in her course.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: The worst professor I have ever had in my life
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Lenient grader and very understanding with deadlines. Prepare to read, listen, and participate. Make sure to attend class. The biggest downside is that the readings chosen heavily lean to one side of the spectrum therefore the lectures sometimes or more just feel like you are listening to someone talk about their own opinions rather than learning.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: Prof. Cihan-Artun was entertaining and she made her best efforts to make the course somewhat tolerable. Most of the class was spent on discussion which I enjoyed since she was very passionate about providing her opinions on the literary pieces we read. The class is very easy-going as long as you keep track of what assignments are due every week.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy

comment: Excellent professor. She runs discussion based classes so if you are engaged it will be more entertaining. Lenient grader and lenient with deadlines. Gives great feedback on papers.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Artun is my favorite professor at this school periodt. She is so savage but still really helpful and has made my writing way better without it feeling like a burden. Best decision ever. :)
She super kind !!! She will help you grow no matter what. Just do the work and show up and you will get a good score.
Worst professor ever. Course is also not understable in any way. Professor doesn't seem to care at all.
Once your Massoud's student, he'll always be there for you. He has helped me several times in the past two years, went out of his way every time. A very good teacher and a very good man.
Love him. Best professor I've ever had. Was always accessible and takes it upon himself to make sure you understand complex concepts.
Excellent, inspiring Professor. He will challenge you and he will bring the best out of you. I don't know how he finds the time to teach students given that he is a dean of a school.
Irresponsible teacher and useless courses

The homework and assignments are just busy work. They're made purposefully vague to simulate difficulty. Not much of what he goes over in class is actually relevant for real life scenarios as they are antiquated techniques. Good lecturer, but in my opinion the material is bad and he is a bit self absorbed.

Ens knows his stuff. The course should have been called Fundamentals of Software Systems Engineering as it was more geared towards software planning than actual programming. Stevens Software Engineering is very business-oriented so people who want to program feel that Software Engineering is bad here. Lectures are very clear and detail-oriented.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Extremely knowledgeable and helps students understand the concept.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Great professor with industry experience. gives great real scenario as examples for agile

Interesting class and he has all of the lectures on Youtube so if there's anything you miss, you can re-watch them there. But there's a lot of busywork that doesn't help with the material and is just useless. Take if you find the material interesting, but not if you have a busy semester already.

Honestly just an intro to Python class. Should probably only take it if you're a pathways student. If you have any experience coding for more than a few months this is just a waste of your time. Prof. Bass is a good man/teacher. The students in his class were rude/uninterested and would talk constantly however or try to cheat during tests

One of the worst professors at stevens. His repo has gone so low that hardly anyone is taking his class anymore. He doesn't teach well and he throws problem solving type assignments for pathway students.
One of the worse Professors I've seen ever. His behavior is too rude. He doesn't know how to respect a student and doesn't try to understand students' problems.

Professor Bass is a new teacher at Stevens. His class 515 is great. It is straightforward, grading is very fair, and in general the material isn't that difficult. He is very kind and can be funny at times. Only complaint is midterms and final tests. Would prefer project style grading.

Pretty fun professor. Tries to make things simpler so that everyone gets it and always makes an effort to engage the class. Attendance wasn't mandatory and I was familiar with the subject but I still attended because it was fun to be in his class.

Professor will lecture for a few hours at a time with no break. He does not set clear assignment expectations, and will consequently take many points off. Will grade your homework by marking your answer as right or wrong, but does not elaborate at all (not helpful). Exams are ridiculously long and difficult. Does not provide any feedback.
Nice
Cool
No Comments
No Comments
Explains difficult concepts with ease.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria

comment: Prof Aron tries to keep a personal touch with the class strength with name tags. I like the way he conducts his classes in person which are actually interactive and there's so much to seek in his class. I personally became a fan of his on my very first class this Fall 2021 class. Grading isn't bad & a total wholesome learning experience.

Not Good. Not Prepared for class. Does not teach in class. Lazy. Compared to all other  advanced seminar courses in Stevens, negative value add. Does not teach concepts or tools . Abs waste of money as alternative prof class is not available.

he's so mean. first of all, he never post ppt before class. during the class, he just give questions based on our readings, which you need to buy first. discussion for two rounds until the end minute of class, then the class is over. Second, no respect to students. During students' presentation, he text with others online and reply email to others.

This teacher is not helpful at all that he never give the digital copy of the article he asked to read(even for the homework). It like you need to buy the paper every weeks and every homework!  A two hours class with one hour self-disccussion and one hour blablabla.

One of the worst professors at Stevens. Her lectures are awful and not very helpful. For all the projects, she gives very unclear directions. Class has lots of group assignments where you cannot pick your groups and is very unsympathetic to groups who have bad groupmates.

Hands down one of the worst professors at Stevens. Avoid any class with Howard as professor if you can. Her lectures are horrific as her slides barely have any information on the topics and they are riddled with typos. She treats her class like it's a high scale marketing firm and grades harsh like you are presenting to major companies. Avoid!!!!

She is a decent professor who has expertise in the subject she is teaching. However, she seems to think her class is more important than others.  Asked/required students to go to class early for the last few weeks of class. Memorization heavy class, with a decent portion of the grade being exam based. Lots of potential to make projects worth more.

Professor Howard gave terrrific marketing lectures; she interested me in marketing and inspired me to choose marketing as my business concentration. She was extremely supportive in understanding concepts I was confused with. Her email responses are also detailed and helpful. I plan to take her other courses in the future.

This professor doesn't follow what she says most of the time. She changes her mind about what the content should be and gives tests and lectures ridden with typos. Expect confusing wording due to typos and lectures that should be simple but are too condensed to be understandable. Likes to complain about generational gaps with students and belittle
He was very approachable and answers doubts very promptly. Very active for online discussions and any mistake would be referenced very well. Took his course online , but was a very good experience
Dr. Leopold is such a great guy! Not only is he an excellent teacher, but also he is genuinely interested in his field. I hope to take another class with him another term.

if you actually read the chapters of the book before lecture then attend lecture and pay attention, you will get an a no problem. except nobody does that. i found it more helpful to go to the lecture but just take notes from the book while i was there. if you go to visit him, he is incredibly accommodating and helpful.
Great guy, great hair. Leopold is a great bio teacher and made lecture pretty interesting if you went.

Head of the chem/chembio/biomed-eng, an English professor who actually works in the field hes teaching in. Class wasn't hard if you studied.yet it was hard to get a high grade, even with the ridiculous curve at the end of the semester. If your having trouble go to him and hes always willing to help out his students, which is nice to see at Stevens.

Seems like a good guy but not great at lecturing (doesn't make eye contact, messy handwriting). He helps with potential quiz questions during lecture but the q's on the quiz are much harder than what's discussed in class. Quizzes are graded  harshly- with a minimal curve. I took 2 yrs of IB physics in high school and this class was confusing.
Lectures cover theory behind equations with several example problems from the book, making them useless for the quizzes. AP Mechanics kids have an unfair advantage, everyone else gets lost

Professor Grube is a really great professor. Lectures can drag a bit sometimes, but he always provides examples for problems after introducing the concepts. Quizzes did have a low average, but I felt that after the first two the quizzes were fair. He is very open, loves engaging with his students, and will always help you when you need it.
Professor Grube definitely knows what he's talking about. He's also willing to help you if you fall behind.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Physics is an extremely difficult class, and Grube's lectures make it even more difficult to understand. The lectures solely explain the concepts behind the equations used, so it's difficult to translate them over to the word problems. And two online homework assignments a week + weekly quizzes makes the class absolutely unbearable.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: If he talks while your trying to work on your project or experiment just ignore him and keep working, he'll waste your time a lot.
Very understanding and lenient. Lectures can be long winded
Best design teacher at Stevens!
Best design teacher at Stevens
This professor is the best design professor at stevens. Soooooo chill.
He is very serious about the project so when giving the project proposal for his approval find something new.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: he goes through all the algorithm for data mining but theory will be covered in class, rest depend on u
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: The lectures are simply the summary of the textbook and presentation of student's work. Hard working on your homework is useless. Attendance not required and Randomly grade even you scoring 95% above.  You pay full for on-campus course but only get half time teaching at most (an hour). Save your money and time by avoiding this prof
Random Grading! You can get A- even if you have 99% overall.

He brings slides that are a summary of the textbook, and he does spend time to explain a few things, but he doesn't engage the students in any way. He is condescending towards students who ask questions for clarification. He does not grade the homework he assigns: the research assistants grade it. Unless you are already good at statistics, avoid.

Prof. Georgiev was fine. Nothing inherently special: your usual professor with a somewhat thick accent. He knows what he's talking about, but other ratings mentioning his disjoint example coverage are right: he makes many algebra mistakes and moves on if he can't find them in due time. The exams in MA 227 were graded leinently. Do WebAssign early!
Honestly the most useless professor known to man. He honestly cannot teach. The textbook doesn't help either. Tests are crazy hard because he doesn't teach what's going to be on the test

Firstly, his accent is too thick to be understood. Second, there were multiple occasions were he seemed unprepared for his lectures, routinely skipping examples that he couldnt figure out the answer to. Also, he sometimes takes long periods of silence between sentences, making his lectures pretty dry. Eventually, some people will just skip them.

Dr. Georgiev can be difficult to understand if you do not read the lecture notes on canvas. However, if you do a small amount of review before class, his lectures are quite clear. Very smart guy and he is helpful in office hours.
He's a legend. Once you understand his accent it's an awesome course.

A lot of homework. its 3 credit but feels like 6. He explains so so, he is available to help. he has his own recorded classes from 2014 and he basically makes them available everyterm. every week 45 -60 min online live session for feedback, not class. if I am watching pre-recorded classes, why am I paying like 5k per course here? He is bit lazy.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Amazing prof, clearly explained all the content. Although the class is online he does weekly live sessions to help with the homework. Gives many resources to help you do well and gives you plenty of time to complete assignments and tests. If you don't understand something he is eager to help you. He definitely went above and beyond for this class.

He is a caring and to the point professor. His homework takes time and was useful on the midterm. His final was based on the problems from the book for the most part and he gave us a plenty of time to finish it. He might not be everyone's cup of tea but overall, it was a good experience.

Professor Wang cares that students actually understand the big picture behind the theories & formulas. He uses his Zoom lectures to work through the assigned homeworks & give guidance BEFORE they are due which is extremely helpful. He is very quick to respond to any email questions & is willing to schedule personal meetings to provide extra help.

The professor is very unorganized. He uses autograder and provides very vague instructions on the homeworks. He nitpicks your assignments and will grade you an F on homework's on technicalities such as spacing. No partial credit is given and when you try to challenge a grade he takes no responsibility for his own mistakes.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Horrible teaching style.  Messes up on the problems he is doing and complains when no one corrects him.  Calls people out during class and stated a kid got a 40% in front of everyone. prepare to get a tutor for this class and self study.

taught diff eq as his first-class as a professor. slept in due to how bad he teaches. lectured from pdf notes then put on overhead camera and tried to do problems. diff eq is already hard and it didn't help when he was a TA how he would lambaste students for doing math wrong. avoid at all costs and I'm sorry if u get him for ur 123s cs people
Knows the material but doesn't know how to teach. Also asked students to ask any questions, when a student did ask he simply stated that he couldn't answer the question.

Although Slepoi is a new professor is new to Stevens, this does not justify his terrible teaching methods or egotistical attitude. Not only is he bad at conveying information, but he also gets defensive and rants about how he used to work on Wall St. when he catches us not paying attention to his meaningless lectures. Be prepared to self-study.
He is a new professor so he is not the best at teaching. However, he is really accessible outside of class. If you actually care to reach him outside of class, you will do well.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Amazing professor who takes things slow and explains in a brilliant way. Really makes you think and helps you learn. He is also pragmatic and will tell you what is important i.e. he cuts to the chase. Would 100% recommend

Super cool guy and 110% knows his stuff. Good teacher too; you don't realize how good you have it until someone else tries to teach you the subject and they really suck. Don't be afraid to ask for help or extensions. He's definitely willing, you just need to ask (and granted he's a little scary, but just push through that).

Remarkably intelligent, easily the smartest man I've ever encountered. This can sometimes come off as arrogant and intimidating, just ride with it and try to enjoy the class. His stats class is great, significantly more in depth than others from what I've heard, and in all the right places. Nice guy to chat with for a few minutes after class.

Excellent communicator, makes topics easy to understand as he presents them from the POV of a head of quant and not a seasoned professor. Can be cutthroat, but the class teaches how to think when approaching problems. With effort, an A is definitely achievable.

Diaco does not have an approachable demeanor. He gives out immense homework, only half the time is it something we learned in class, and his students are too intimidated to ask him for help. He and his TA come off as judgemental and mean-spirited towards students.

Gave A to everyone, and that's why he has high reviews. 
Each time a student asks a question, it seems like his world collapses, and then mumbles an answer that is usually completely wrong.
Is there anyone from the university authorities that ever checks what the instructors are doing in the classroom?
Great at teaching and is enthusiastic about teaching the topics. Was very helpful in explaining doubts. I will definitely take his class again.

BY FAR the best professor I have taken here at Stevens. Assigns homework weekly (so you will be VERY busy) but it will help you understand the material better for exams... plus it gives you a lot of opportunities to help inflate your grade! He also cares very much for his students and keeps his lectures very interesting.

One of the best math professors at Stevens. Really cares about you as a person and wants you to succeed. Puts a lot of emphasis on how to the material learned in class applies to the real world. If you put in any sort of effort, you will do well in his class, and he is always willing to help you outside of class hours.

One of the best professors so far seen at Stevens. He is best at his course and also gives directions incase you go for any other courses. Tough grader but gives you feedback and explain solution in easy-to-understand way.

Lectures are very inconsistent. Pop quizzes aren't helpful because they're just based on the homework due the night before. Midterm exam was hard. Not much guidance was given for the final project.

He jokes about being a bad teacher and refuses to improve. He has literally seen his rate my professor page. He has SPOKEN about it.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Lectures were in general really good and taught me quite a bit (especially when compared to 222). Although my grade didn't feel the same way after the midterm. The midterm was absolutely brutal and was very unlike the homework. If you want to learn and don't care too much about your grade, then take his class. The lectures are genuinely good.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Amazing lectures --Beware of pop quizzes

comment: No grading criteria, confusing lectures, need to put in a lot of work for minimal results, homework doesn't relate to exams at all, is unhelpful when asking for help, bad lecture notes, TERRIBLE wording, absolutely came to ruin your day. He knows he's a bad prof but never does anything to improve. Nobody ever knows what is going on. GPA: cooked.

Worst course I have taken so far. The homework was annoying because often times, the content wasn't covered in the lecture slides. Most of the final grade was determined by the midterm and final, which were VERY unreasonable. Extremely difficult questions that were not related to the lectures. Time consuming project was only worth 10%. Stressful!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy

comment: He graduated a year ago and came to ruin your day. He don't know how to teach and test was completely different from the homework. All of the class was so confused and didn't finish. His email was aggressive as well. Dont TAKE.

Prof. Harari is an experienced, skilled, and thoughtful teacher, who puts great time and effort into helping his students. He provides extremely thorough responses on assignments, gives passionate lectures. He's head of the department, so all of his classes are part of a grand vision of an educational journey. He expects a lot out of his students.

Realized the hard way after taking the course that we learned next to zero actual practical information in Sound Design and what we did learn was completely incorrect. He never went over how to properly organize ProTools sessions, or how to categorize different types of sound effects, among other things.

I have not learned one relevant piece of information on sound recording. Learning how DACs work is completely useless for everyone except the maybe one student who is interested in developing equipment; I didn't come here for elec eng. Why not teach us how the SSL works, or how to use outboard gear, or how to have a better workflow in Pro Tools?

Lectures and Canvas page are an organized mess. For the head of the Music & Technology department, he sure spent a long time failing to operate a CD player in the first lecture. He wanted us to write an essay about a concert but didn't give us the prompt until nearly a month after it, and the prompt he did provide us was incredibly vague.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Basically no actual hands-on sound recording.
Prof Mason is very knowledgable and he was super helpful all throughout the class both with hws and group projects. He kept the course quite interesting by showing us the latest big data trends.

I really like Professor Mason's class. The course is very interesting and useful. He guide us through programming very well.  Also, we get to see interesting stuff related to social network in his class. I think it is a pretty fun class.

I really like Professor Mason's class. The course is very interesting and useful. I have zero knowledge in programming when I started in the class. He guide us through programming very well. Now I am able to search and write the code I need. Also, we get to see interesting stuff related to social network in his class.

Prof. Mason was always willing to get out of his way to improve our overall experience and consistently tried to help everyone get a better understanding of the topics discussed. In addition, he provided outstanding feedback to teams and individuals. His class was one of the most interesting and helpful classes I have ever taken.

Only had three classes with Scott so far but can already tell how different he is from my other professors. He's fun and not afraid to talk about how class and the real work don't always connect and what's really important for us to know. He uses great examples that always give you a few pieces of new trivia totally unrelated to the class

Completely dedicated to his students, offers a great perspective and is in tune with the real world. Knows how to keep his teachings relevant to the modern day workforce. Deserves to teach more courses. Super relatable, and takes into account everything you tell him. Overall incredible professor!
Great real world experience on the subject matter and is good at distilling his expertise into understandable objectives. Focusing on teaching instead of evaluating which is a breath of fresh air.

Has great real world experience that translates into a better understanding of what well do once out of school. Cares more about us learning something than any particular test or paper grade. Pretty understanding, pretty funny, wants us all to do well
She is one of the best professors for Software Engineering. The lectures were interesting.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: LECTURE HEAVY
Focuses on Lectures

Great Professor that cares about her students' success. Gives great feedback and is respected by students. Tough quizzes but totally fair! Clear expectations for work and grades. Totally accessible for extra assistance or questions and always answers emails. Expert knowledge in her subject matter and more.

She knows the material well but thinks there is always only one right answer instead of listening to the opinions of her students. Huge amount of groupwork. Every single week is a large group assignment that is tough to split up, and her grading is harsh. She lectures for the entire time each week with barely any break time.
Great professor , gives you great feedback but be ready to read and it will be worth it ... grading is clear and she makes sure all your doubts are cleared.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Tough grader

Taught us Organizational Behaviour and Design and is one of the best teachers I have studied under. She is a very tough grader, as in has her own way of grading and has a few things she considers.  It's not hard to get an A or A- if you do an in-depth analysis for all her homework assignments, present well in group presentations and participate.

Really good lectures. Teaches a lot of high-level details about deep learning/machine learning, as well as some low-level mathematical details which I found the most interesting. Assignments were not too difficult, but taught you some good techniques to process, and training deep learning models.

Great class focusing high-level and real world implementations of ML. Professor Shusen Wang does well to build on previous ML classes. Sounds harsh over email but is much nicer and understanding in person.

He's a very knowledgeable professor. His classes are lecture heavy, so be prepared for each class. He cares a lot for the students and is always available to clarify their doubts. He respects the feedback given by students, and changes his teaching style accordingly. Definitely one of the best Data Science courses offered in Stevens.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Prof Wang has a great deal of knowledge. His course is not easy, but you do learn a lot. I like that his grading criteria and expectations are laid out on the course website, crystal clear, no surprises.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Overall great class and great professor. Sometimes the class can be a little dry but you can tell that she loves teaching. She also super understanding about extensions and extra credit if you reach out to her and although attendance is not mandatory it is if you want to get a good test grade for this course.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Cool Glasses; Hope she doesnt get Lasix.
No Comments
Great Teacher
AAAaaaaaaaaaa

It sucks that he's retiring this year.  Without the new batch of professors, he is one of the only professors in the department that actually cares about his students.  Even though this was essentially a seminar class, he would give helpful feedback on our assignments and help with our labs.
PROTECT THIS MAN AT ALL COSTS
Best Professor
Prof David is amazing and very knowledgable. If you attend his classes, you'll pass with flying colors! Easy grader.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Professor David is amazing and very lenient. You attend classes, you will pass with flying colors for sure!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: He is amazing. His technical knowledge is one of the best. He knows what he is talking. He is clear and almost nothing he cannot answer. His professional experience, teaching method ... I have not such a word to describe him. I wish I took more classes from him. Be prepared for weekly assignments, group, and a team project.
He is good professor classes are lecture heavy and if u read the book after attending the class you will learn the algorithms quickly
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Professor Braida is incredibly condescending. He has no respect for his students time, sometimes going over class time by an hour. It is also “mandatory” to go to office hours if one wishes to be able to complete the homework as he provides no information on the homework problems during lecture. Overall worst class I’ve taken at Stevens.

Does not properly prepare students for assignments and blames students for "waiting until the last minute" when they don't schedule one-on-one meetings with him to learn how to do the homework properly instead of just teaching the material in class. Very condescending, thinks his class is his students' only priority and grades harshly.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Dr. Braida is a great prof, is realistic and doesn't try to make your life harder. Great management teacher, learned a lot about how to write reports properly and how to communicate with over assessors. His accent is at first hard to get used to (not unusual in engineering) but it's not an obstacle by any means. 100% would take again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Worst communication skills of any professor I have ever taken. This man is everything wrong with modern day engineering professors - terrible at talking to people and acts as if his class must be "survived"
Readings and participation are important to pass.

He gives a lot of assignments and doesn't always grade quickly, but it's not hard at all to get an A in his class. Also had to complain about a group member going AWOL and he took it into account and went even easier on us. Also midterm is take home, and no real final. Strongly recommend overwriting each assignment and adding details from class
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Group projects--So many papers

comment: You will learn nothing in the BIA-686

Easy A, however the workload is very intense. Either an individual or group assignment due every week. He doesn't release grades often, but gives everyone full credit  don't fret. You will have to create a lot of diagrams & charts for unnecessary things. He usually gives poor feedback and complains even when you follow his instructions. Easy A tho
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: kenneth was the best! provided lots of great practice problems and prepared us very well for every quiz and exam

This guy is great, cares a whole lot about physics, always makes time for office hours and does a great job at explaining material that hedemann often lacks clarity in. Honestly not to glaze but he definitely is the carrying me through the course.
Mr. Mui cared so deeply about physics and instilled that on the students.

Kenny was a G for Mechanics recitations! He was so energetic in reviewing the concepts we learned in the lecture. You can honestly skip lectures, attend his recitations, and be well off for the 3-4 quizzes throughout the semester. Weekly HW consisted of 1-3 easy problems. Quizzes were a good and fun challenge. I highly recommend having Kenny as TA.

Kenneth was my TA for PEP 111 this semester, and he's fantastic! Passionate about physics, humorous, and helpful, you can approach him with any questions or concerns. Recitations were always interesting and I looked forward to them. They always lined up with lecture material, which was also explained well overall. Awesome TA, a pleasure to have.
Just good for an easy A

Amber isn't a bad professor but like she is very bigoted and I see how she gets bothered by guys who even hint at disagreeing with her. The class is easy as long as you participate and don't argue with her but be ready to be taught some extreme ideologies. Also she canceled class because she got upset at us for not doing the reading, which isnt bad

Class is heavy on homework reading but the class itself really is not that hard as long as you pay attention. The topics covered in class are always engaging and focus more on class/group discussions. Took the class originally for needed credits but learned so much.

The class was light in work, heavy in participation.Unreasonable expectations for the participation, and it seemed to be graded on a curve.I spoke 2 to 3 times per class and was still not given full credit for participation, which is ridiculous considering if all 40 students spoke 3 times per class we wouldn't have gotten through the material.

Great professor. Lectures were always laid back but interesting. She did a great job of assigning us timely and intriguing articles to read for hw- you'll learn a lot. Took the time to get to know all students which was very sweet. Coursework mainly consists of reading articles & writing reactions to them on canvas, 2 presentations, & participation

Interesting lectures and lots of opportunities for small in class group discussions to keep you engaged. Homework was light with a few projects spread throughout the semester. Prof Benezra is really caring and made an effort to get to know everyone in the class which was really nice!
In my opinion, Prof Khashanah is not an honest person.
Very Good professor in terms of knowledge.
He advises me on research he has guided me well challenge me and is a fair person  only negative thing is he does take long time to respond email

I really wondered, how this guy became director of financial engineering. He teaches in a pathetic way. First of all no proper agenda, random topics without connection and he dont even reply to students mail

He is strict in class but his concepts are clear and he will try to resolve all your queries. Fair in grading. If you listen to his instructions in class, you can easily get a good score. Very strict about mistakes but at the same time will give you extra chance to learn and correct your mistakes in the form of extra assignments or presentations.

He's a great teacher and cares a lot about the material. This class is his baby. Because of that, he really expects everyone to participate and be invested--but his bark is worse than his bite. He may sound strict, but he's actually quite fair when grading, and under his stern veneer he's adorable. If you put in the work, you'll learn quite a bit!

A very strict and serious teacher, almost every class time is used up. It is also very fair to give points. It will draw a lot of time in the preparation class, but it is not easy to be accommodating, so this is not an easy class to take A
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: He's a great professor and definitely spends a lot of time making sure his lectures are worthwhile. Encourages class participation. The work is useful, not super difficult, and fairly graded.
he is industry level professor he is extremely talented , but many times i failed to understand what is he talking about , also , sometimes he is scary
He is a great Professor..!!:)
A very well-prepared and an A-class quality professor.
HE IS ONE OF THE BEST PROFESSOR I HAVE MET.
you are provided with good resources to study before and after class

I felt the methodology was a bit unorthodox, lot of work in the class, lot of questions, I am not used to being a hard time. Good thing though, I now feel very comfortable using R, so I guess it works
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Clear assignments, lots of resources. Learned a lot!!! Thank you!
Clear assignments, clear lectures. Goes in detail on a specific topic every week or two. Easy to follow. Tons of resources for individual study.
He doesn't care about grades and points. He only cares about whether you understand or not. Such an excellent and considerate teacher

He is one chilled out professor and has a very clear grading criteria. Participation in class matters a lot and be prepared for every class with the readings assigned for that session. If you aren't prepared you will be sent out. Attendance doesn't matter at all. Very easy to get an 'A' just do what he says. Refrain from Plagiarism at any cost.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Chilled out professor
he is very nice but  when go to class always read the material for that week or u will be asked to leave.
Super helpful.

I agree with the first comment. I wouldn't take her class unless u know a lot of music terms. I am trying to take a class in which I have no idea, but she teaches as if we are all knowledgeable about music.

I took a similar course by Prof. Reeves at another institution and wanted to say that she was extremely helpful. The previous comment seems nothing like her and she made the class enjoyable and informative. She is very easygoing and not nearly as tough as she should be.
She thinks that she's the most important thing in the world and turned a throwaway class that could have been fun into a nightmare.  Don't take Music App. if you can avoid it!!
Has no patience to students. Too much homework.

When I took his class, I realized that he is tough and strict like other students had told me but that in fact made me study hard myself and be more attentive in the class. I really like that the Prof. teaches very well and gives time if you have any queries or concerns re the subject and is very knowledgeable in his field.
really a tough class, too many homework
