He teaches you a little, but ask you to do a lot. Unfriendly to the students who didn't know R before.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: I took HSS371 with Prof. Kowal over summer session 2. His lectures are very engaging as he incorporates a discussion of current events into every class as well as sharing his own person experience in the field. He is a lenient grader - as long as you put in some effort you will do fine. The amount of homework for the class is also very reasonable.

Genuinely one of the best humanities professors I've had at Stevens. Fairly lenient grader - as long as you put some effort into your papers, you'll get an A. Lectures had a fair blend of him teaching us about the government and everyone talking about current events.

Kowal talks a lot about current events in this class which makes it pretty interesting and engaging. There's a few papers to do and a midterm + final but its all straightforward. Only bad thing is stuff takes forever to be graded.

I took HSS371 over the winter session with professor Kowal and his lectures were always engaging and interesting. There were many readings, 5 reaction papers, 1 research paper and 2 essays for the midterm and final, but they were all manageable and graded leniently.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--So many papers

comment: I've taken 2 courses with Prof. Detwiler and have had nothing but amazing experiences. Lectures are engaging and the workload is very reasonable/manageable. She is without a doubt one of my favorite professors at Stevens.
Just do the work/reading and participate once in a while, and you will be presented with an A.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: An amazing professor for the course! While there is a lot of the work for the course, it's never bad. It helps that the material is also fun to learn about. The lectures were never boring, and she always accommodated students that needed it. You will never hate her class! (Just don't use AI for your assignments lol)
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: Prof. Detwiler is awesome. She is very understanding of our workload and grades fairly with a lot of opportunity for extra credit. Her lectures are also very engaging as she incorporates discussion of current events and does a good job explaining the material. Homework is mostly just reading and you can probably get it done in ~20-30 mins.

Very charitable, and understanding of the student body (tons of ways to get extra credit, mental health days, etc). I always looked forward to her feedback in discussion posts and essays, and she was very quick on grading! The hardest part of the class is just reading, some work can be 10-25 pages, but you'll probably get used to it if you haven't.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback

comment: He's fine. The people complaining about his volume in class also apparently forgot that he has a medical condition that makes him hard to recognized the volume he's speaking at. He's happy to clarify about anything.

Assignment directions and grading criteria are unclear at best. Late work is immediately marked as a zero. You do not get solutions to sample exams until AFTER the actual exam, making them useless. For most of the class, what he "teaches" isn't in the textbook OR posted lecture notes. Sometimes he seems "forgiving" when he's really just being lazy.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: For some reason, he teaches as if you already know everything he's talking about. He mumbles his way through lectures and almost never even makes eye contact with his students during them. Course material is basically inaccessible outside class, and he refuses to give out solutions to the few practice problems he does provide, making them useless.

If I had to compare this class/professor to something I would compare it to kidney stones. Having kidney stones can be long and painful, but this class is long, painful, and a semester's length. He is incapable of speaking above 20 decibels and has no self-awareness of the lack of teaching that he's actually doing. Nice guy, but a bad professor.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Why is Kevin Ryan not teaching this class during the fall and spring semester?  He can't speak up and goes on mathematical proofs without even explaining the basic concepts to us in the first place.  The class just started and I can't expect him to get any better.  Also basically inaccessible outside class.  Homework every class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: One of the most scariest professors to ever meet as he knows his stuff very well and will call on you for questions. Very hard class as he expects many things from you but if you try to make an effort he will help you as much as he can. I can see why others had a hard time in his class or with the lab/class on general.
He knows his stuff very well and will give you feedback on a lot of things. Took him for SKIL and cares about you learning the material and explaining how signal processing works etc.
Wow, what a I know physics and you don't, so I am the only comment and answer. Too much ego and very bad for motivating physics
He's the head of the physics department, and it shows in his breadth and depth of knowledge. He's a bit tough on grading, but I think that's a merit more than a fault.
Assigns the worst homework out of every professor. Never thought I would be forced to do so much homework and learn nothing.
Genuinely enthusiastic and likes teaching. Tests were easy.
The professor is extremely intelligent and knows what he is teaching. The material and especially problem sets are very difficult, so going to office hour is very important to succeed in this class.
Great professor for a hard class, definitely always go to lecture and start early on the problem sets. He's always available during office hours for extra help!

Paramonov is an amazing professor, his lectures are funny and he makes them engaging and enjoyable. If you have experience in Python the class is relatively easy. The class doesn't let you use loops till beyond halfway through the semester so you better understand recursion

Fire professor, absolute banger of a first year professor. If you have NEVER done CS before it will be difficult but he explains EVERYTHING greatly. Also I liked his train robbery lecture. Oh also you can't use loops until week 12 (all CS115's)
Prof Paramonov is a great teacher. his classes are hard but he really does care and tries to make things understandable - the one thing that can ruin this course is your grader/ta.

I thought her lectures were really interesting. We had lots of discussions and she encourages participation. The class wasn't too hard as long as you pay attention and do the readings. There's a big group project throughout the semester which could be annoying if you have bad group members. She's a very cool lady.
Bad professor. Lectures are very vague and hard to understand. The canvas page is a mess and for some reason, she doesn't allow us to view our grades.

Glad to have her for my marketing concentration courses! Professor Oh motivated me to go even deeper into marketing. The lectures and slides were easy to understand; Professor Oh was always available for any questions during her office hours and gave me great encouragement and feedback. I look forward to taking her course in the Fall as well!

She's funny and seems nice, but that doesn't make up for the fact that you can have an A all year and end with a B. Everything seems clear until she changes your grade for no reason. This is not the teacher for any introvert. If you care about your grade but prefer individual work instead of massive group projects this isn't it for you.
She is a wonderful professor and human being. I look forward to more of her courses
She is the nicest most wonderful teacher you will ever have. If it were okay to hug a teacher, she would be the first and only teacher i would hug.

Dr. ****baraci is without a doubt the sweetest and one of the most knowledgeable professors teaching at Stevens. She has a teaching style that breaks down the most complicated subject matter into something very simplistic and logical. The person who wrote the other review must have been on something.
This woman is hopeless.  She is sweet, and caring, and wants to help you, except I think she forgot more than most of us will ever know.  I hope she is not still teaching.

This is absurd. Nothing else to say but good luck if you have her. Most students that walk out of this class say they do not remember a thing and it was just a hurdle to jump over. That is not what learning should be about. So far the class feels like that.

This professor is the worst I've ever had at Stevens. Period. She is unable to communicate effectively and she does not answer questions in the best manner. The test and quizzes were nothing like what she taught. Unfortunately, only professor for the class!

Tests are ridiculously hard. There is no way you could memorize all the information for then and the class average was in the 40s. However, I scored in the 70s and received an A so there is a big curve.
Her class rocked. I loved lecture, but hate lab because the lab instructor is a weirdo. Beware of the creepy Cattiabiani.

Students don't like him because the course is tough. He takes corporate finance very seriously, and packs a lot of information into a semester. You are expected to do a lot of work and studying on your own time, even when not prepping for an exam. After 2 years in the real world, I now have a ton of respect for his teaching methods.
He goes off on tangents and assumes we all understand anything he goes over. Isn't helpful when answering questions.
He is very smart and a jack of all trades (marketing, finance, etc) but I don't think he has mastered any one area in particular and it comes across in his teaching. He explains things very poorly.

doesn't know how to teach, but probably knows what he's doing. although really we will never know for sure cause it's impossible to understand him a good portion of the time and therefore hard to glean anything from him.

Before joining M&T program, I had guitar lessons, but he helped me fill in gaps in my knowledge. He helped me with arranging my songs and I learned a great deal from his transcriptions and charts. As someone else says, they only allow 4 semesters of lessons. I asked about extending, but was told no. So, I continued with him privately during breaks.
Best mustic teacher I've ever had. Learned a lot. I looked forward to each class, was a lot of fun.

Studied bass with Professor Birch for four semesters. Really enjoyed our lessons there were fun and I learned a lot. He answered any questions I had including things I was confused about from other music classes. Would have liked to have studied with him for more than four semester but they don't allow it.

Awesome Music Professor. It was great to study with Professor Birch, learned a lot and had fun doing it. He's so chill, responds to emails fast, very knowledgeable, lots of funny music industry stories, answers all your questions and cares for his students a lot. TAKE HIM!

She has trouble solving the problems she makes. Spends a lot of class time trying to explain one question then leaves very difficult problems for you to try to figure out. She also loves to take off lots of points for minor things. Generally unhelpful and difficult.

Hands down the rudest person I've ever met in my entire life. Not helpful when you ask for help during office hours. Repeatedly called me stupid because I do not understand something and am asking for help. She is only helpful and nice to PhD students and everyone else is a nobody to her and she couldn't care less.
Never grade our HW. Give us the final one day before the summer holiday. The assignment is more related to the design but she never gave us any  conditions.

Frequently disrespectful to students and others. Not much consideration given to solve homework problems and the project itself was poorly planned in terms of deliverables. I would not take this professor again.
Cool guy. Interesting human. Gives intuitive ideas. Heart reacts only <3
Cool guy, clear, precise and collected

Terrible, terrible teacher.  He regularly took off points from tests when my answers were clearly correct and then told me I was still wrong.  Almost didn't get the grade I deserved because he doesn't know anything about math.

Excellent professor, a lot of people think he wasn't that great, however if these people put more than a half hour into studying instead of partying all the time they would find that their work combined with Ayan's lectures would have guaranteed them an A in the class.

The course was taught by Jonathan Wharton and Ali Mostashari jointly, and both were good in different ways. Prof. Ali was very inspiring, but had too much confidence in his own views. He was also very tough in grading, but the course was worthwhile. Last course before graduation, so will nostalgic in a sense. Thanks Professors.

Prof. Mostashari put me through a lot of pain, but I am glad I took his course. He is very friendly, but very tough at the same time. Very high expectations. At the end of the course everyone got their papers accepted in reputable conferences. Highly recommend
I took the online course with Dr. Mostashari in Spring 2010. By the time the class was done I was able to submit my research proposal for the qual exams. Very helpful course and great instructor.
Extremely passionate professor. Probably one of the best in the school of systems and enterprises. His course is a MUST for all PhD candidates.
not consistent of what he said will teach and what actually has been delivered

Most of the learning came from TA and his labs. Final project details are very vague and unclear. Questions on Piazza and e-mail get half-answered. Syllabus is really unclear on grading, and syllabus schedule didn't align at all with assignments. TA is left in the dark regarding assignment and project details, so you have to ask the prof.

Exams: fairly straightforward, but difficult. Homework: not many assignments, but they might take a long time to finish, and will probably be frustrating until you understand whats going on. I feel like I was one of the few students to actually enjoy the class.

As long as he has technically delivered the information given on the slides he believes he has done his job. The curriculum is a direct copy paste from Carnegie Mellon and he is useless at teaching the information.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Really good explainer, super caring and attentive to if you're struggling, and a super nice and funny guy. He's awesome and universally loved.

Not a professor, but a teaching assistant; he is great at the first-year math subjects that he is a TA for and is super helpful. Pretty busy, which makes sense since he's a graduate+ at this point but is willing to help out for exams through formal review sessions and if you contact him. Also, he's super chill in the recitations with grading too.
Thoroughly enjoyed this class. Prof. Cole's passion is hard to ignore. Highly recommended!
Awesome teacher and an awesome person.

He doesn't make expectations clear, assigns weekly quizzes on top of projects and presentations, and has stated he doesn't have much incentive to teach well. He attempts to make class fun but the way he carries out the course is kinda twisted. Everyone just does bad and he curves. Wouldn't take again.

This professor is a literal troll and funny guy. There is no clear grading criteria and has weekly quizzes where everyone does bad but he curves them all like crazy. Everyone does bad but he curves everything like crazy. Just do better than the class average and you should get a A. For the quizzes focus on the bold and italic words from his slides.

Professor Kim is super chill, we had 7 quizzes and at the end, it was curved a lot. He usually provides examples for his lectures, making understanding concepts easy. His lectures aren't bland, but pretty interesting. For the quizzes, as long as you study the slides he asked you'll be good. I definitely recommend taking his class!

This professor is one of the worst professors I've had at Stevens. The class is relatively easy however the structure of the class is what makes the class challenging. Quiz every week, Homework, projects overlapping with one another. Every quiz is just memorization of very specific details on the slides so be ready. Stay away for your own good.

This professor kept the course interesting but he gives you quizzes for almost every lecture. Those quizzes are only 3 questions long and would require you to practically memorize the slides in order to get a 100%. His grading system for the group presentations aren't clearly outlined either. He could definitely structure the course better.

just a pointless class to take. I don't know anything about the professor since he only makes us to busy work online. A discussion and long homework every week, and i still don't know anything about accounting.
Great, great, great teacher.  A very smart man who makes economics interesting to learn about.  Extremely understandable and very willing to help.
No Comments
Class is relatively easy.  Workload is weekly and discussion postings are annoying, but watched like a hawk for volume only.  2 Quizzes, Midterm, Final, 2 Project Assignments.
Good teacher.

She's not bad but is too strict when handing out any grade above a B+. If you aren't a good writer stay away from her as you will not get anything above a B or a B+ if you are lucky. Also she is NEVER available outside of class. You will most likely end up with a B or a B+ if you do all your work. If you want an A find another professor
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Tough grader

comment: If you aren't good at writing I would not recommend taking an Everett class. While it's not a hard class to pass it is tough to get an A. This being said if you show up to class and pay attention you will most likely get a B as long as you turn in your work on time (the stuff she says in class is on her exams). *NOTE* CAL 105 is worse than 103.
She's really a good professor. Easy to understand and talk to. She does not expect too much out of you.
half of my time and points has gone.
Not helpful
Sad times. So much pain. Makes me want to see the sun blow up.

This professor has no idea how to be a professor, at times you might question if he knows he's supposed to teach a class. He has a powerpoint for each week which he posts for the class and expects that to be enough to teach us. He himself does not speak or have physical or online lectures to any extent. Horrible.
Avoid at all costs.
Tweakerrrrrr

Akcora is a nice person but this is the type of class I imagine engineering grads have nightmares about years later. Boring lectures with no practice, chaotic Canvas page and messy notes, every exam felt like a curveball even after studying for days beforehand. My best advice is to pray but I don't know if I believe in God after taking her class
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Akcora is unironically the worst professor I have ever had. Instead of going to lecture, you might as well have your drunk aunt read the posted lecture material to you, but that would have too much structure. One notable characteristic of the class is that you do the same exact thing for weeks, yet almost nobody understands what is going on.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: I took this as a 500 level elective and it was interesting. The professor is knowledgeable of the topic so that makes it more enjoyable. There are readings every week and short written takeaways to write. The final group project is easy. Ask for examples from previous years for guidance, he can be reluctant to share past examples sometimes.

this class is getting discontinued but it's the easiest A I ever got. nothing in the class took long not even the final project. prof probably reuses some material in other classes he teaches. lectures were boring and long (1.5-2 hours). if u have a class with professor asan, go for it. it can be boring but it'll def be an easy A
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: He's incredibly easy as a grader, but unengaging as a lecturer--he doesn't seem very enthusiastic about the material he's teaching, and he's hard to connect with on a personal level. If you're looking for an easy A he's a pretty reliable choice, just don't expect to get a very valuable class experience out of it.
Insightful class, easy assignments & grader, class sometimes long & boring.

Professor Muka assigns a lot of work, and they are hefty assignments, but unless they aren't the midterm or final you can submit them whenever you want and she will always grade them normally.She is very funny and definitely enjoys her work and is very approachable. I would blame the class curriculum for being the worst rather than Professor Muka.
Tough grader. I've cried crocodile tears over this woman's feedback.
Literally terrible.
Muka is a great professor, she made class really interesting and it was clear to see that she cared. She was understanding and a kind grader but she gave good feedback. She's also funny.

Professor Espinel was very caring and provided great feed back on our papers. Take advantage of rewrite as he sees this as the most important aspect of writing. Great discussions in class and helped us think outside of the box.

Profe is a great man with a chill class! I have never really liked English class in high school, but I always looked forward to coming to his class. It was never boring and the essays were enjoyable. He offered revisions for the first two. GO TO THE WRITING CENTER!
Great teacher, very caring.

Great professor. Never failed to give good feedback and makes sure that you know the areas that you need to improve in. Extremely nice and genuinely cares about student health. Most definitely recommend if you have the chance to take his class.

He is very knowledgeable person, had a strong academic experience. His lectures were easier to grasp and advanced with multiple topics covered in a one lecture. Used to provide assignments to make us understand the topic / course very well. All of my class fellows used to love taking his lectures and never missed a single one. a really caring prof.

This may be the  worst professor I have ever had, his lectures are disorganized, and delivered in a whisper. His writing is illegible, and about mid semester he just stopped trying all together. Seems nice, but the way he teaches made both of the classes I took with him a complete waste of time.

Easy, but informative class. Adds a lot to lectures by giving examples from his own personal experience. Book is needed as homework is straight from the book (#'s to complete) but reading isn't really needed if you know what's going on and pay attention. Attendance isn't really mandatory, but grades are partially based on class participation.
No Comments
If you make decent efforts, you will easily end up with an A.
He is a good lecturer, answers all questions to the best of his knowledge. Heavy heavy midterm and heavy final! Both open book and closed book.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Miller saved a class I would have otherwise detested. His lectures are interactive, and he is able to meld teaching styles in order to make sure every individual understands what's happening. He relies heavily upon real-world examples. He encourages coming to class and, while not docking you points, will rag on you a bit if you're not there.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: If you can't fit Billah into your schedule for Mech Solids, definitely take this guy. He is very laid back and very good at explaining concepts. He constantly stresses the importance of going to class, and if you do go to class and pay attention, you will do excellent. He made me really interested in a class I thought I would hate.

Overall fairly easy material to comprehend. The papers are graded easily and if you show up to class for the most part everything will be a breeze. Very light grader, however make sure you study for the midterm and final or you will fail both. Looking over notes the night before the exam is good for the most part.
Cares about students understanding of material and enjoys seeing students become enthusiastic about their opinions.
Take her course for humanties.. She grades very easily and her tests are pretty much her powerpoints.  Plus the readings are interesting

A new professor, I had the joy of attending both her first course, and an interview lecture she gave before she got the job. Sadly she prefers to read her lectures off of slides, and avoids open discussion. In a debate she falls apart and is generally unable to support her own arguments. Prone to making wild statements to support her positions.

She's very tough and demanding, and you really need to know your stuff to get a decent grade. I work in information security, and the tests were very difficult for me. She's also fairly unclear about requirements, and exactly what will be on exams.
Very unfair and disorganized professor.

One of the most unclear and unfair professors I had thus far. She assigned 2 books, one written by her (hard to find) and one standard, and required both to be bought even though hers' was used. Since I was the ONLY ONE in her class there was no curve, and what made it worse was that no partial credit was given for written assignments. Don't take.
Noone understood Cui and viceversa. Pointless class. I knew nothing and still managed a B-.

Practically never here(on 20 day business trip right now).  Sends TA to teach(she is not good).  Homework is 1 week ahead of lecture so you have to learn everything on your own.  Quizzes are 1 week behind schedule and are pretty annoying.
It's a lecture hall with room for 300 and I understand that I will learn more at the recitation but the lack of clarity was just astounding
Not a fair grader at all. Complex grading system. Not student friendly. You cannot get good scores even if you work hard.
complete the homework is given in class. the paper will be from the hands out only . he speaks fast so sit in the front. don't keep this subject for the last . the early the better
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: nice prof, work hard on hands out
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY

comment: Professor Lappas is super helpful and makes the class straightforward. He focuses on group projects and gives clear instructions based on what he wants. If you dont understand anything, he will take the time to explain it and make sure you get the assignment right. Definitely recommend taking his class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Group projects

comment: he is good but most of the time busy. In this class, u just get the basic of NLP and over that u can build by reading at home.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Nice professor. knows his stuff. challenging project. cool in grading.  and helps a lot in project.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Doesnt teach. He reads from the slides and doesnt explain the material. The lecture slides and textbook have little to do with the actual assessments. If you look at the lecture slides examples to review for the exam, it doesn't show how he applied formulas and it ends up being more confusing. If you take this course, you are your teacher.
Avoid if possible.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Don't take this guy if you care about your GPA. Classes generally consist of two exams, two homework's and a project. Majority of the grade is skewed towards the exams which are notoriously tough and harshly graded . Provides plethora of lecture slides which I have found to be very confusing (if you want to understand material read the text).
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment: This course was a blowoff course, it has no work load. There are 3 things which will determine your grade. She is a pragmatic person, and teaches well too.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Easiest class, if you had some basic knowledge of programming coming in. Firstly, there are no tests, exams, or mid-terms. All you have is homework and quizzes after every lecture. It's difficult to understand her, because she tends to repeat herself a lot. Her lectures are accessible on moodle, so you can teach yourself, if lectures don't work.
Awesome!

She is a relatively easy teacher and explains concepts very clearly. The course material is easy if you are interested in finance but BT students found it difficult which made the class pace feel way too slow.
I can tell she has good financial knowledge. Her classes are practical. I think she made financial cases interesting which was supposed to be boring. I like her class.
Awesome Professor, you should always go for him.
He is an Awesome professor.
Good Professor
Knowledgeable but a very bad teacher.

By far, one of the most rigorous courses I have ever had. Having said that, If you put in time and effort, learning opportunity is limitless in the course and professor creamer makes sure that none of your doubts go unexplained. The material/textbooks provided are extremely helpful as well. Good course if you want to actually learn about the topics

Dr. Creamer makes this course primarily theoretical, but doesn't focus on the applications nearly as much as he should. For this reason, assignments were much harder than necessary and rather useless. Also, he does not explain things well at all. Whenever he answered my questions, I ended up more confused than I was before I asked. Avoid!

Where to begin? You will not receive grades back with ample time to study for exams. We received ours three hours before midterms. She won't respond to your emails/messages. Even when she does, she will not be helpful in the slightest. If you're in the market for a class that is a complete waste of your time, then this is the course for you.

Talks to herself for the entire class time. NEVER responds to emails and is never helpful if you have questions. You will learn absolutely nothing in this class, simply because she is an awful instructor. The course material is actually important and interesting, it is just a shame that she has such poor performance and no regard for her students.

Her lectures do not follow the textbook at all. If you are in the online environment, just listen to the last 10 minutes of the recorded lectures and you should have all the info you need on any assignments. Also, her mid-term quiz, is actually a week long exam (just a heads up to future students) to not wait until the last minute to take it.

Quite possibly the hardest class I've had at Stevens. Takes what should be an intro class and cranks it up to 11. Expect to get less than a 50% on the midterm. Clearly cares about his students, but the dude should not be teaching.
VERY DIFFICULT COURSE!! Is fair in grading but the course is tough student still don't do well. Average exam score are 40-50s.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: VERY DIFFICULT COURSE!! Is fair in grading but the course is tough student still don't do well. Average exam score are 40-50s.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Nice guy. Responsive to emails. Workload is fair and very manageable.
rating_tags: Group projects--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Lectures are bland, but they're ok; homework, basically recreating lecture slides, but the grading standards are not present; interactions, you'll get called on if you don't turn on your camera, and don't expect to have your questions answered clearly. This is strictly for online courses, I haven't had him offline so I won'tcomment on it.

Explanations are hard to understand because the professor keeps going around in circles. Not the greatest prof. but not the worst. Wouldn't take him again if I had the choice because the way he grades is unclear.
He makes this class so much harder than it should.  Went over MOS transistors and we never even knew the formulas required for the test.  He's also super quiet.

Update: Turns out the professor curved the class so my grade went up a full letter grade, but he also threatened to remove the curve when we questioned his grading system and contacted the administration to get him to cooperate with us. The professor told the TA to purposely give us poor grades, and this guy responds harshly to emails.

This guy is ruthless. If you send an email he will reply back in the most monotonous, cold-hearted way possible. Once I had gotten sick and emailed him asking to take the midterm at a later date. Word for word, his response was "read the syllabus." He whispers while teaching so you can't hear him but when you can hear he doesn't explain stuff well.

Prof Frank was a solid CAL (now HASS) teacher, I had him for 103 and 105 so I got to build up some rapport, but he cared for all of his students. Very fair grader so he will not round up grades ever no matter how close, but I feel like I genuinely became a better writer because of his feedback.

Nice guy, but can be pretty hypocritical. Chastises students for showing up 3 minutes late but will cancel class altogether on a 5 minute notice. Incredibly strict and unmoving on his grading policies but also never provides a rubric to gauge what went wrong in an essay.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Gillian Frank is great! You read alot for his class, but they are quite interesting! His class is discussion based so be sure you've read whatever he asked you to read.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: The sweetest man in the world. Class has a lot of discussions where he shares a lot of useful information. Honestly just so sweet made my heart explode every class. My top all time favorite professor everyone should experience him.

Professor Dominick's classes are incredibly valuable to anyone working in the outside world. You will appreciate the amount of useful knowledge you will gain from his course. The classes consist of interesting lectures, case studies to read and some minor assignments. The class is not hard at all and Prof Dominick is a class act.

He teaches a management course in a very "touchy feely" way that doesn't really teach much. He assigns dozens of readings every week and expects a weekly paper on "what you learned and how you will change your work ethics/mannerisms"  Utter garbage of a course.

Rod is great; he's very knowledgable in the subject. He's very caring as well. However, the curriculum is terrible. He was given the syllabus right before the semester and the content was not great. If he could have created his own curriculum, the course would have been even better.

Learned little to nothing in his lectures. He would go on tangents and not start "teaching" until 40 mins into class when he would read off a slideshow he didn't make and complain about the content. He would give assignments and assessments based on things he had never taught and expect us to figure them out.

To put it simply: this professor has no idea how to actually run a class.  Many lectures will be filled with irrelevant tangents, usually about the high school he taught at, and his Canvas page is filled with due date and assignment detail errors.
The 350 character limit is nowhere near enough to explain how much I, and many others, despise him.

This is a math methods course for physics and engineering students. You shouldn't expect it to be an easy class; however, if you study the handouts well, and use other reference books, you can easily get a grade above B.

Fantastic teacher, excellent man, very very smart. He really cares about the well being of his students and looks after them. He knows what he is talking about, I have never had any class where the teacher was so much in command of the subject. I owe to him my deeper understanding of Quantum Statistical Mechanics. Lovely man indeed,

Grade should be below 1.  Hands out a packets at beginning of semester that contain illegible material that is crossed out, written over, and photocopied 1000's of times.  Wrote the course notes 40 years ago and goes over them the same way with unwillingness to explain material.  Horrible Teacher! I hope he retires soon.

Glavy is an excellent professor. He clearly defines what is covered in class, and goes over what will be covered on the tests before the exams. He is a wonderful and passionate professor, and will do whatever it takes to get through to his students about cell biology. Overall, worst professor and I would not take any class with him again.

Professor Glavy is very passionate about his research, but he does not teach well. Typical of biology teachers, he floods lectures with details, instead of focusing on the key concepts.  In 50 minutes, he would try to deliver 80 to 100 slides. The saving grace is that the tests are straight out of the book and heavily curved. READ THE BOOK!

Cannot speak for his undergrad classes where I hear he is not helpful. As a grad professor he is awesome. Very clear English and quite practical in his lectures. He is very easy going and understanding. Tests are also very fair and generally easy. Associated molecular bio lab is easy too.

Professor Suffel is very knowledgeable, respective, kind, and helpful. He explains everything with an easy way. Gives outlines for the Midterm and Final that are very helpful. a weekly assignments and easy quiz. Attend class, do the assignments, prepare for the exam, and you will get A. Whenever you want to ask him, he is available and helpful.

Prof. Suffel is one of the very best professors I've had at Stevens. The course material itself is not easy but he is very clear on what is expected of you on exams. He is very knowledgeable and explains things well, and he is always willing to clarify if you speak up. Very friendly and genuinely wants his students to understand the material.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Caring

comment: Dr. Suffel genuinely cares about each and every student in his class. Although he moves too fast with the material at times, he always outlines exactly what he expects of his students. Our midterm was very fair, and I expect his final to be the same way. In terms of math professors, he's definitely one of the better choices you could make!

She is definitely a good musician who is very knowledgable. However, she tends to be a tough grader and tests you a lot, graded and not graded. My class got the objectives for the final only one week before. The day before one of the breaks, she assigned an OPTIONAL quiz and made it mandatory AFTER and took off points after no one showed up.

She grades papers too harsh for a 100 level course, also only shows up for online section. would not recommend, coming from an engineering major who wanted to take a 100 level course for an easier humanities credit.

I took her class for humanities credit since I had some music knowledge under my belt. She is a good professor who knows her material but be ready for her to call on you in the middle of class to either read or answer a question. Not a great professor, but not a bad one either. For a music professor, she does grade papers harshly though.

Professor Wang is fantastic. She does everything she can to ensure you have a grasp of the materiel, and is generally just a really great person. Even in a lecture of 40-50 students she makes an effort to learn everyones names and addresses people individually throughout the lecture to engage with them. It's commendable and appreciated.

Professor Wang is hands down the best prof at Stevens for business. Her lesson plan is organized and she is able to articulate topics very well. Super friendly, engaging, and understanding. Go out of your way to take her BT 321 or BT 440 class!!

Prof Wang was the best!!! I loved her class so much. Definitely one of my fav profs ever. Just study everything she gives you. She really wants everyone to do well and pass. Easily one of the best profs at this school. TAKE HER CLASS!!!

Very short quizzes that you won't have time to finish most of them. Prepare for 0s on some. Literally like 5 minutes given to do the quiz and the main professor continuously says that these problems take a LONG time to complete (15 mins or more per problem).
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: Professor Volchenko is a solid choice. He's very understanding of his students and tries to make sure no one is left behind. Sometimes I disagree with his teaching style or examples to clarify questions asked in class, but that's trivial compared to the rest of the material he covers. Personally goes over tests with you the same day. Plenty of EC.

I like Prof Volchenko but sometimes it is hard to understand him. It's not his accent that causes this, just his way of phrasing things. Also he can get irritated if you don't understand. But if he knows you're trying he'll have some respect for you.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: He is good at teaching and knows what he is talking about. Enthusiastic in his lectures. He gives homework but it's graded on completion anyway. 3 exams and no final, but make sure you study for them. Tests are easy to study for from notes. He seems to enjoy teaching students and answers questions effectively.

Macroeconomics class was super light regarding work load. Only a few hws, and they're graded to completion. Rest of grade is 3 tests, and no final. You'll have to study a bit for tests since its a lot of memorization but thats only if you're trying for an A. Professor is super nice and was an enjoyable class

I'm just taking this class as an elective, and he makes Microeconomics pretty easy to learn. He has good analogies and takes more time to explain things through. No final exam, only three exams that are fairly easy.

Uses curve. Goes really fast. 7-9 quizzes total & two exams (tricky problems not covered in class). Passionate but ok teacher and explainer. Go to office hours, show up, & negotiate for points back. Reading textbooks and doing homework helps even if not required. Topics after forces get really tough. Do extra credit to boost quiz grades.
Great!
Provided guidance when pointed questions were asked and had a genuinely enthusiastic attitude toward the course.

His lectures are fun to attend and listen to if you are at all interested in the design process from a business perspective. My advice is to listen as much as you can to the core concepts he covers and to contribute to your group work as best you can. He is a real pleasure to work with and gives great advice and feedback. Work hard and enjoy.
Terrible experience, this class was a waste of time considering many students don't really care about business. The professor also lacked communication and the way he graded made no sense.

Professor Puglia is my spirit animal. He is perky and excited and knowledgeable. He came from the business management world, and thus knows exactly what he's talking about. He's entertaining to watch, and educational to listen to. I found myself not dreading Friday morning classes, solely because he was the professor.

What he teaches in class doesnt really help that much for completeing your homeworks literally. He teaches great concepts and how things work in class and his homework is like a slap to the face when its 1/3 of your grade and you have to write pseudocode to get through it. Not a big fan of his teaching style but as a person he is cool.

This guy is a great teacher, he knows his stuff. He encourages the class to participate and will go over stuff till they learn it. He also makes sure to look around for facial gestures of confusion. The only thing I do not like about this teacher so far are the tests and homework. It really goes from easy to extremely hard.

While some don't like this teacher I think he's pretty funny. Uses too many slides to explain code I wish he would develop it with students much easier to remember. But if a student had a problem he would continue to go over it on the board until they understood. Must go to class to keep up with everything. Hw get exponentially harder
Much more work then other CAL 105 teachers. Not a bad class but I would avoid. Quizzes once a week on the readings and his midterm and final are nearly impossible.

Good professor and interesting material. Tests are a combination of his lectures and textbook reading (so you'll actually have to read). No mandatory attendance, but you'll be at a disadvantage if you miss a couple.
He's a really nice guy.  Lectures can sometimes drag on but the tests are straightforward!  I recommend.
Worst professor ever. Mumbles at the bored all class. I write this sitting in the room as hr is teaching. I give it 1/10
He is very boring and unenthusiastic when teaching. He's a nice guy and all, but not a very good teacher.
Good class, but trouble understanding him during lecture
Very sweet if you are a good student and are respectful. And she's not bad eye candy either
This girl was very demeaning and is the reason I got a B+ in an easy lab class. Avoid her at all cost!
Very sweet and awesome. Unlike other lab professors and TAs, she's very helpful and down-to-earth.
She was a new teacher and very timid but become more confident. Clearly knows her stuff but has trouble conveying it to students. Huge curve at end of class

Is clearly a smart professor, but has trouble teaching.  I am fairly certain this is her first semester teaching.  Over the course of the semester she has gotten better, but still I learn more on my own.

She is the worst teacher I have ever had! Does not know how to teach or explain the concepts of the class material at all. When she teaches, it almost seems like she barely knows the material herself, and she makes mistakes pretty often.

Professor Morgan's lectures were very entertaining and all in a seminar fashion. He had weekly readings but was understanding if you could not get to it. Overall very fair professor and understanding of all types of students.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria

comment: Prof. Morgan understands what his class is all about. While reading is a big part of the class, the discussions he leads make it very easy to participate and learn, even if you aren't 100% prepared for class. He keeps things lighthearted and stress-free, and time really flies in his lectures.
Professor Morgan is a great professor; HPL 111 was a very laid back class but I learned a lot from it. It was really nice to do short readings and just discuss during class. Kept us engaged.

Professor Magee was not a fair professor. The class caters to full time students, meanwhile myself who works full time was not able to attend live sessions. She graded as if it were a full time course, looking for many details that was harder than a 3 credit course. Not helpful to those who work full time and attend a master's program part time.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Professor Magee is great, Sys632 was made easy with her help and availability. She was always available to take time out of her day to answer your questions and her Q&A sessions are very helpful to figure out that weeks homework. Cannot recommend her enough

This professor does not know what she is talking about therefore you can not effectively communicate with her. She hides behind this statement "this is a graduate level course". If you want to be penalized for asking questions take a class with this one, she is something else.

Provides no grading rubric. Provides lengthy feedback but does not explain what you did wrong and does not provide the point deductions. You literally have to guess what this rude woman is thinking. Deducts points for things you should learn in the future. Deducts points for using the lecture method. You can not communicate with this Professor.

Used to be BIO281. He always encourages students to participate in class and cracks jokes during class. He makes sure to fully explain the information as best as possible. There's some text reading but not a lot. There is an attendance sheet and poll everywhere for participation. He also offers lots of extra credit and is the prof to take for Bio!

Professor Wong is a bit intimidating. It is clear he is knowledgeable about all subject matter and he is nice to take time to explain things to you. Standards are high though, you cannot slack off in his class. You will learn a lot if you try hard.

Professor Wong is one of the most supportive staff at Stevens. His BIO class is extremely information dense, demanding a few hours of textbook reading every week.The class isn't a gimmie but when it comes down to it, Kenny is THE professor to have for BIO. He is THE guy to have for BIO.
this class in general is really annoying but this professor doesn't really help it be better. there are better professors and class is wayyy to long and the group activities are useless

He constantly interrupts people in the class when they talk to him. Assigns a lot of homework for a two credit course. He seems to be more harsh towards the work of female students. The class itself is very long and takes up a lot of time.
He does a good job keeping the class engaged even if it is a boring topic.

Professor Ozgen is very nice - she's helpful with all your questions during office hours. She'll ask you "what is strategy" every class - if you can answer that question confidently and in detail, you're good in that class! Just do well in the group projects, midterm, and final, and you're all set.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: Mad chill. No explanations needed.
Overall, a great professor! Make sure you participate in lectures and come prepared to class. I would definitely take a class with her again.

CS 545* not 541. He is kind, knowledgeable, and a very lenient grader. The class is largely about the field of HCI as a whole and the process of drafting and forming an original contribution to it, culminating in a semester-long group project. Having a good group for the project is critical.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: This professor gives horrible assignments for CS 545 Human Computer Interaction. The Webfitt assignment took an hour of my life that I want back, an hour of useless, pointless, and seemingly endless agony of refilling settings and clicking away. It drains the life and soul out of the most joyous and pleasant individuals. 1 is too much.

His lectures are pretty decent, he covers the course material quite well. However, his slides aren't quite self-explanatory. His homework makes you think quite a bit, but it isn't difficult per se. If you want to learn concepts, this course is perfect for you.
HSS 371 with Sansevere is an awesome class!
Dr. Sansevere is awesome! HSS 371 is a great class.

Incredibly chill professor who has group projects for midterms and finals options if you don't want to do the essay. Essays still can be done, but its such a nice alternative because of She doesn't restrict you much at all with your group projects as long as she can tell you put a reasonable amount of effort for them. No Homework ever besides that
Hes an okay professor, he seems unprepared for his lectures a lot of the time, but is good at answering questions.

AMAZING PROFESSOR!! I came into this class hardly knowing anything past reading sheet music and I've learned so much since then. He's very clear and efficient and his explanations make so much sense! He also answers questions very thoroughly to ensure that you really understand the material. He's one of my favorite professors here and is so nice :)

Mike is a wonderful professor. While I already knew music theory before taking his class, he still taught the material clearly. All of his lectures were easy to understand, and he cares a lot about his students. Homework and quizzes were easy too.
Makes music theory easy to understand and the projects are fun. One of only like 3 good professors in the music department here.
Cant understand him. Could not imagine trying to learn physics for the first time with him.... the board is always a mess and extremely hard to follow
his class is very helpful. he is very patient and kind.

Hated his lecture style - all he did was draw figures on the board, which I found hard to follow and unhelpful. Homework is ridiculously hard and worth a lot. Has a very thick accent and is sometimes hard to understand.
After hearing many good things, I was disappointed with this Professor. He seemed unprepared and unfocused during lectures. A very underwhelming class where I truthfully learned little.

The most demanding CS course I've taken at Stevens. With the help of Grapsas, I not only feel that I learned a lot, but that I grew as a software engineer. He is REALLY tough at the start of the semester, but eases up a bit later on.
Extremely difficult but very knowledgeable and dedicated to teaching
Prof. Russell is the boss, always looking to help you learn, will listen to you if you ask for an extension, gives you terms for midterm and final.  Straight up best professor just don't skip class

TERRIBLE. We probably wrote 100+ pages worth of papers in 1 semester. Learned NOTHING. Just discussed OBVIOUS current issues. Mandatory attendance/15% participation grade for a 300 level class? This isnt High School. Worst Class/Professor Ive taken at stevens.
Prof Russell was so easy and amazing. I think we had one quiz (which was a joke) and a couple 2 page papers. The midterm and finals were even easier because he gave us the questions before hand.
He's a great lecturer and is very clear on the grading criteria. You must complete your midterm and final as your only grades in the class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: one of the best
learned a lot from the professor.
Really careful and responsible teacher.

rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: He is an industry professor so he is up to date on his computer science knowledge and knows a lot about making code as efficient as possible. He is pretty good at explaining difficult coding concepts.
A good course to gain a big picture of machine learning. The workload of homework and quiz is moderate. Easy to get an A if you pay some time on it.

A very well-organized class that covers several popular topics about ML. Need some knowledge of programming language and mathematics before enrolling in this course. The professor is nice and would always consider the student's needs.

Extremely unhelpful. Not a good speaker, difficult to understand the lectures. When asked questions about material, very reluctant to explain. Resorts to "read lecture slides" or "I have mentioned this in class", "I assume this is understandable." No feedback on assignments/exams. Unfair grading. Avoid if you want to learn and not be miserable.

She is very knowledgeable. Most of the class is group assignments, I recommend going to class to work in person. She answers your questions and will basically help you through the entire assignment, but can be a bit condescending. Lectures are long and kinda empty content sometimes. Tests aren't bad you can review slides and study the night before.

Professor Abel knows her stuff, and she expects you to know it too. Most of the grade in her class comes from group work, which is usually pretty easy, but her lectures are long and hard to parse for important info. She takes attendance, though, so you can't skip. Tests can be tough but you'll be good if you study. She's fine, just not exceptional.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: Amazing professor

Lecture quickly became the highlight of the course, as he thrives on class contributions to deliver the lecture. He is clearly very passionate about the subject and often makes larger arguments derived from case-studies. Participate and the long lectures will fly. Defer this to others and he probably won't care for you much. Highly recommend him.

The course was easy. The TA assigns and grades most of the work so the professor can be unresponsive to emails. Mansouri basically lectures and makes us engage with the content. He's very nice and the course has no exams. Definitely participate as it will make his day! Overall great professor

He cares so much about participation and putting your camera on that he took a notable portion of our class time reminding us every week. Super nice guy, he loves the material with a passion and does not grade traditionally (Easy A). His excitement and commitment to conversation made me wish I had him in person or cared more about the material.

Took this professor for an online class, in very unresponsive to emails, does not give back grades in a timely fashion, does not provide feedback, and prerecorded lessons and slides are useless for the homework assignments.

This professor refuses to accommodate students and is unreasonable in every aspect of his job. Theres not much to help this since he runs a required class and there are no other sections. You will get an A, but you will hate every second of it.

He is truly kind and caring. And it really shows. He cares about students succeeding. You have to be a total imbecile to fail his class. If you get him a lab instructor your definitely guareteed at least a 90 for the Lab course grade.

G. Song is the best lab supervisor at Stevens BY FAR. While other lab supervisors don't care whether or not you put box on floor, G. Song will always remember to remind you. He is also hilarious, as evidenced by his continuous laughter at everything he says and the constant smile beaming across his face while we are doing "physics". He's the best!
Excellent teaching skills

A wonderful professor. His class was super interesting, easy and always engaging. He did an entire lecture where he performed a short play about brain-swapping, fully in character the entire time. He also did an anonymous Q&A at the end of the semester--someone asked if he was straight and he actually answered. A real character who knows his stuff.

An awesome professor in Stevens. He is super friendly and accessible outside the class. Attendance is mandatory but you definitely love his teaching skills. He is very liberal in grading criteria but that doesn't mean you can skip assignments. The final project was to make a search engine and I proudly say everyone in our class did it easily.

Garg is one of few adjunct teachers who really understands the subject and cares about teaching. His MGT699 class requires preparation and participation during lecture and is a difficult course, but it is the class I learned the most in during my MBA at Stevens. Put in the effort, and you will do well and learn a ton!

The class is definitely loaded, as there are many homework assignments and quizzes, and you will most likely need to read the textbook in order to do well on those. However, he is very prepared and follows the syllabus very closely. So as long as you stay on top of the syllabus, you should be able to get a good grade. He is also very responsive.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: He is one of the least understanding prof. that I have ever met. He is the only prof. that teaches BT 301/BT401 and they are both required to graduate. Is very grade heavy, must participate and not just raise your hand once every class type. Lots of quizzes and hw. Easy class to pass but hard to get an A. Wouldn't take him if it was optional EVER!

He is an excellent professor who cares about his students. He makes difficult concepts easier to understand and explains how the course material is relevant in industry by providing examples of how it can be applied.
Prof. Pirjol is very knowledgeable was able to effectively communicate complex topics in a way that was easy to understand. Overall, highly recommend
Nice lectures.
Great lecture and usful contents

Overall a good course to get your Mathematical concepts cleared. Remember its a math heavy course, so if you think you can learn to code here , not at all, very few coding assignments. Midterm and Final exam is a 100 point exam with all the sums asked. If you focus on concepts taught in class, getting a good grade won't be that difficult.
Great Professor with more knowledge. Also he never hesitate to clarify the doubts.

Professor is very approachable. He explains topics well and is always ready to answer doubts.
The subject was quite math heavy but fun and easy if you pay attention is class. He explains fundamental concepts nicely. Homework were easy and had more weight than exams which made good grades easier to get.

I took Professor Carlucci's ME610-Thermodynamics course for the Fall 2021 semester. Final grade is determined solely by the exams which are tough but fair. Doing all the homework and extra textbook questions proved to be a winning combination in this course.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Great guy. Tough stuff though.
Dr. Carlucci is a great professor whose notes are extremely informative and whose homework assignments are designed in such a way to really determine whether you know the material or not.

He is a very honest person, very helpful-minded and is approachable at any time. His lab is very disoriented though, most of the students speak native languages while at work and you don't understand a thing, also is very reluctant to clean lab spaces. His presentations are very detailed and he cites lot of examples which is helpful.  really good.

Professor is honestly very helpful and tries to improve his lectures/class. If you manage to find him with time, he will provide help as much as he can. Honestly though, his lectures are rather dry and it does not help there is much overlap with materials course so you may be bored with the class. Tests are fair  and shouldn't be too difficult.

Prof Clavijo was great. She really cares about her students and wants us to do well. While a lot of people really won't participate, if you do you can get a lot out of a really simple class. She also really knowledgable about Stevens so if you need help with dealing with admins she is a good person to talk with.

For a lot of people, technogenesis isn't the most exciting course. I know a lot of people who resented showing up to their sections. But that was not the case for those of us with Sandra. She was so much fun. She taught us a lot of important skills that I am sure I will use in the future. She also gives really good feedback on presentations.

He was the TA/instructor for two lab sections I had... I am fairly certain he was learning the material via Google during the lab sections before telling us how to do whatever it was he just googled. Seems like a nice guy, but I was disappointed when I got him as a TA again, because I knew it was just going to be a waste of my time.
Just go to him after class for all of the homeworks and he'll practically do it for you. Also a good guy and really knows his stuff.

I have taken 3 of her classes now and they are pretty much all the same. Tests are easy but if your group doesn't get your presentations together she will grade kind of harsh. MAKE SURE YOUR SLIDES LOOK PRETTY! The less words the better. I usually get one or two good pieces of advice a class that are applicable to marketing/outside of class.

Adriana was a pleasure to have as a professor. Her exams are very easy if you go to class and pay attention. There are a lot of group presentations and she gives great feedback, but may grade them harshly. Adriana's lectures are sometimes dry, but she does a good job of using real-world examples to help us understand. She is very knowledgable.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Pretty easy to get an A, but the course material was not taught effectively. He would just run hundreds of lines of code and not explain anything. It was pretty easy to do well in the class but the learning had to be done on your own.
He's a great professor and if you apply yourself throughout the class, you should do very well. Don't fall behind!

She's great. I felt that she graded fairly and that she was eager to help students improve. Her assignments are substantial but not outrageous, and the essays are a reasonable amount of work as well. Lectures were succinct but had good information, and she's a very nice person as well. Not a super easy teacher, but a good and fair teacher.

Good professor overall—grades on time, helpful, and nice. Lectures can be boring, with frequent awkward attempts at class participation (more of just a general HASS thing, however). My only negatives were unclear wants/feedback at times and she disabled our total grade calculation, meaning that we could not see our grades the entire semester.

Professor Kellett is a wonderful humanities professor. The class lacks in engagement during lectures but the work assigned is rather straightforward and easy. If you have ay questions or concerns, she is more than willing to assist you and will reach back to you promptly. I encourage students to participate to enjoy class more too!

Overall, this professor was somewhat enjoyable, she was a nice person, but extremely biased. All of my peers received grades higher than me even though my work was greater. I had my essays checked by multiple advisors before submitting and yet my efforts, still received c's on all of my essays.
bro really assigned homework due during thanksgiving. not sure why but do your best to avoid taking classes with him.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lots of homework

comment: His lectures are dry and boring. The weekly homeworks and group assignments in an online environment seemed excessive in comparison to other online classes at Stevens. Brantle is hostile and combative even when asking questions about due date.

no office hours
all examination was streight from chegg. But, final was unique. 
(all my friends cheated with chegg or group study. 
he is a tough grader. non existent teacher.
Overall, if you value your time and $ dont take this guy
I studied my own and got an A. But many got lower grades and he doesnt curve. 96+ is A 95 is A- so you do the Math!

If you haven't taken probability before, this class will be challenging. His hw problems helped a bit on the midterm but not much on the final and these questions were hard. There was maybe one or two lectures with actual examples. Btw, going over the previous finals that he posted didn't help either.

I took the class under the assumption that it could be a good introduction to AI, and heard from others it was easy. It is easy, if you already know AI programming (since you won't learn it here), but pray to god you never have to email or interact with this man. I spent more time trying to figure out his words than I did actually programming.

If you have a solid group, this will be the easiest class you ever take at Stevens. He allows resubmissions to fix mistakes. If you cannot solve a problem, he allows you to simply explain why it didn't work and what it was supposed to do. The final project is just another homework assignment if you choose the right topic.

She is a great Professor who cares a lot about her students and her class. Although the topic of the class, which was education for my class, could sometimes get a bit boring, Professor Cihan Artun would always keep the lectures interesting. She is a very lenient grader and gives fantastic feedback on essays. Would definitely take her again.

I struggled to turn in assignments on time and she kept following up with me and helping me pass her class. She would email me on weekends and over breaks (in a good way) if I was missing an assignment. She also had interesting lectures. 100% reccomend!

Prof Jones was amazing! His homework assignments were engaging for the most part, and tests were short and sweet. The class is pretty fluid in terms of tests, for the last one he decided to make extra credit to help anyone who had struggled with the other tests. Could be knit-picky about formatting on HW. Overall, was a great and nice professor.
Great
Price/Performance or Effort/Letter is not satisfactory. Time consuming.

She makes the class interactive and the class is really easy overall.  Nobody really goes to the lectures, but she does her best to give people a good learning experience.  She gives extra credit as well.

Lectures were painfully dull; so many topics were covered in just one subsection in these 100+ Pearson slides that may or may not be on tests. I doubt he kept the retainment of more than 10% of the class. Your best bet is the study guide, which is a week before a quiz/exam. Extra credit and no-penalty grace period were nice, though.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: He seems to really enjoy lecturing and is happy to be here. Takes a lot of questions. Makes the lectures informative but also entertaining. Great personality. The class is easy. There are a quite a few homeworks but none are challenging. If you study for the exams you'll be fine.

Professor Man is decent at explaining. Attendance is not required so you can join virtually or watch the Zoom recordings. In-person midterm and final are open notes and open technology. The problems are just simpler homework. The professor grades projects and exams fairly. He has based takes on learning. One of the better ECE professors.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Graded by few things--Online Savvy

comment: Great guy! I wish he took more courses!

Decent Professor.  Has a lot of real-life experience that he adds.  Assignments are pretty easy, you just need to use common sense and pay attention when he explains how to use a particular excel trick or new program.

Had him as part of a evening graduate program thru Stevens.  He was awful.  Very dIsorganized.  No structure to the class.  Didn't respond to email. Grading system nonexistent.   Gave little to no guidance for projects and no valuable feedback on assignments.   Very disappointing - never had a bad prof in this program.
Fair, but not the greatest teacher. Better to go with another class.
No Comments
Brings 18 years of industry experience with him Expert in his field Detailed and made the subject breeze by the entire semester
What a professor ! He brings his immense experience with him !!
Great professor! Lots of homework and projects but it's easy "follow the steps in the textbook" kinda stuff. A lot of programming as well so be prepared
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Extensive industry experience, very good didactic.

He is very friendly, knowledgeable, fun and always available for extra help, even reachable outside of the class. He also helped me with other classes. It doesnt surprise me to see him working late at night, you may see him walking around the campus with a cup of iced coffee even around 1am. I wish I could take every class with him! Clone him !!!

Professor Morkan is amazing. He is an exceptional instructor and he deserves a teaching award. I really enjoyed his class he made it fun for all. His dedication to his students is simply exemplary. Do not miss the opportunity to take his class!
his TA sucks, grading is unreasonable. For example: -10pts for neatness.

Terrible! This teacher doesn't even know the material that he is covering. When I ask "could you explain why we use this formula?", he answers me straight in the eyes with cold blood "because we already tested it and it works!". Shameful for a high education level
I went to see him and I had an internship lined up by the time I left his office! He know's everyone
There's a secret about E101: Professor Sheppard takes all the students who went to two or more extra events on a yacht ride up the hudson. Knock on his door in BC409 if you're interested

Prof. Stevens provides unclear and conflicting feedback on assignments. The requirements for the assignments are not correct in many cases and she grades assignments with unprofessional language and condescending tone.

I felt like I learned a lot and could depend on Prof to provide clear guidance and requirements on assignments. She really has things down. We had some individual HW by way of discussion Q's and also a semester long group project. Highly recommend her for this class.

I love her lecture so much. It is so interactive and she also combine real life examples into her lectures. We have two exams (all multiple choices) and she will give study guide. Group projects are about writing research papers and presentation. She did not take attendance but she has in-class participation which is technically attendance grade.
Turned in an assignment 2 days late and she dropped my grade from a B to a D+

Dami is a legend. You have to get used to him though. He makes jokes that are definitely a bit questionable, but once you get his sense of humor you'll go with the flow. Just do your work and he'll be chill. He's very personable and pretty young, so he understands. Again, just do your work and the class is fine.

Does not know how to use the online technology and there is a computer issue every class.  Tries to be funny but his comments are more off-putting then anything.  Lectures are horrible and very hard to follow.
Basically you learn everything by yourself.

He is an excellent professor, knows his photography and is a great person to talk to.  If you are ever having problems in one of his courses, he is usually always available to talk.  He expects the best out of his students and will encourage you to produce the best work you can.

Nancy Nowacek will spend a majority of a critique complimenting your work, then will give you a low grade. If you want any actual critique, contact her after class. Even then she'll be very vague until she grades on Canvas. She has a vendetta against center compositions so avoid as much as possible.

A word to describe Nancy would be unpredictable. Sometimes she's seems like she loves your work and then will give you a C and other times she will sh*t on your work but give you an A. Overall she seems very knowledgeable about design but she often seems two faced so its hard to know what she thinks. To get a good grade you have to participate!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: She claims this class is about expressing creativity through music composition, but for some reason every student is locked into writing a piece for cello and electronics as their final. She also basically does not teach anything at all and expects you to already know everything there is to know about writing music, despite the few prerequisites.

Great Professor. Took her class just to get my humanities credit and it was such a fun class. She so nice to all her students and actually makes class very enjoyable. Definitely worth taking if you need a humanities credit.

Du has long, dry lectures and he cold calls during lectures. The course is easy tho as the midterm, final, and presentation aren't that bad. But we didn't learn much as the course goes way more into how computer networks work and had little application to what we may do in the future.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I don't know if it was because he's new to the school, or if it's how he is, but Du is just not a good professor. He completely changed the class curriculum and we did not learn anything that was previously taught in this class (and not prepared for future classes), and during group presentations a student passed out and he did not care at all.
A great teacher would take him again. Very nice and lenient.
Amazing professor. Very fun and had interesting classes. There is a decent amount of writing but he grades very leniently.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Hilarious--Graded by few things

comment:
He is a good guy. he knows the subject, at least it looks like it. 
but,
 A lot of homework. His grading is very harsh if you cant crack his sadistic grading practice
 4 of my mates failed misarebly

Not: if you are not willing to put the work and time in dont take this class! treat it as 6 credit not 3

So much homework and harsh grader!
it felts like 2 grad classes. unless you are very familiar with java take him you can learn alot. He is kind of ackward but ok. I dont like his style. he only excepts code certain way. so good luck.  I think he failed about 4 people out of 22 people class so you are warned, no partial grade or curve either!

Tough professor. Knows a lot about the subject but is a bad teacher. Taking the other professors for QF-430 is the best choice as their tests are open-note while his test are extremely more difficult with the average in the 60% range

Professor Goel does have a lot of knowledge and passion for financial derivatives, but he is not a good teacher. He always takes extra time after class and gives the attendance code 5 minutes after class is supposed to end. He also finds it amusing that students are struggling in his class. Try to take the other professor if you can.

QF430 with Prof Goel is one of the worst classes I have taken at Stevens. He routinely exceeds the allotted time for the class and takes attendance afterward because he always forgets. His homework assignments take 5-8 hours to complete. After midterm evaluations, he said he saw what we said but would not change anything. Worst prof I've ever had.

The Professor has stated that the Problem Sets assigned in class take him about 3 hours to complete, when talking with other classmates the average completion time is around 8-10hours.
Exams are extremely hard and there is a lot of work. For some topics, you are better off watching a Video explaining the concept than attending lecture.

Mr. Goel doesn't seem to take students feedback which doesn't help your grade in such a difficult class like this one. Problem Sets (Homework) takes hours on end to finish, as well as his exams being really difficult. Class ends at 12:15, but he'll take attendance at 12:20 cuz he forgets His class compared to the other one is significantly harder.

Laughs at the thought of students struggling. Runs over time every day. Gives the attendance code out late as well, if you have other classes after, your grade suffers.
