Isn't a good teacher plain out. Take the other professor, his sections are UNFAIR compared to the other!! (open note vs. closed, multiple choice vs open-ended, etc.)impossible/10 :(

Genuinely one of the worst classes I've ever taken. The lectures were boring, but he took attendance. The first homework took around 8 hours, and he didn't even finish teaching the material until the class before it was due. The homeworks are brutal and long, and he's a tough grader too. He might be fine for other classes, but not this one.

asked her about the organization of the assignments and quizzes because they were not on the syllabus and she questioned my attendance in lecture with me being there every week. 

the midterm had nothing to do with what she described was going to be on it. Hard to talk to after lecture since she doesnt understand you.

Don't take deep learning.

She literally does not care about the class. It sucks because she's the only professor for Deep Learning and she can't teach it well. She said there would be a few quizzes and assignments & at the end of the semester, there was only 2 quizzes & 2 assignments. She says one thing about a certain assignment and says something else later. DO NOT TAKE!
Loved this class. Super knowledgeable professor and very encouraging

Nice teacher but the assignments he gives are way too long. Weekly orchestration assignments that can take up to eight hours to complete is really excessive. Then again, he did start the very first lecture by saying that this was the hardest class in the music department.
Don't take this professor for the sake of your gpa
rating_tags: Tough grader--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: The class is quite heavy. However, the professor is extremely experienced and knowledgeable in the topics covered. Do not be afraid to ask for his help in the class as it can get very confusing at points.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Lockett is a very very smart person, it is very evident in his lectures. However, there are TONS of readings, and it becomes hard to keep up. 3 assignments are based on submission, and the essay which is the majority of the grade is very hard for someone who doesn't write. He helps a lot but the essays are still not easy.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Prof. L was great at explaining the material, but he went too fast in the class. I didn't understand a lot of the chapters and had to review myself.

Extremely smart and helpful teacher.  He is very good at being able to understand and answer questions based on the knowledge level of the student.  The only downside is he requires you to write alot of notes during class and assigns a large amount of homework.

This class is entirely based off of a group project, but as long as you meet the deadlines and hand something in, it's not hard to get a good grade. Isherwood isn't one to go into detail, so most of the class is just time to get work done on your projects. He answers questions if asked, but doesn't usually explain anything if you don't ask.
Professor Isherwood mainly sits back and lets the class go as it flows. The TA (with whom he's always in the room) answers more questions more clearly than he does.
Amazing professor and always willing to help, and easy to approach. Always kind and smiling to students, will not regret to take his courses!

Professor Shnayder was great. He made everything very easy to understand, and all of the assignments were very easy to get through. They could be somewhat time consuming, but considering the level of the class, it was a breeze. I came out of this class with a good understanding of what was taught and how to apply it.
Fidler likes to talk a lot but the lectures are interesting. He's fair and usually lenient with grading papers. Be sure to participate once in a while for extra points.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: His lectures are VERY important to attend. He does very well at covering all the material in class. And lucky enough, he's hilarious, so listen to what he has to say.

This professor grades harder then any other professor and is an incredibly rude person. On multiple occasions he would have us present and then force the other students to tell us whats wrong with our presentation and would proceed to bash the group. It got to the point where he made people cry. He constantly brings people down. AVOID IF POSSIBLE!
He is one of the worst professors at Stevens, steer clear. He is demeaning and in general not a nice person
Very tough. Try not choose this course first. If it's necessary, then don't ever choose prof.
she is not clear on grading at all

Professor is very knowledgeable. Be sure to speak up as he is a bit hard of hearing. Doesn't really explain complex subjects well. Feedback is tough but ultimately worthwhile. Ample opportunities to revise assignments to get a good grade. Decent professor, learned a lot.

Nice guy. Very knowledgable in his field. Not the most effective at teaching complex concepts clearly. He's also a little hard of hearing which occasionally made communication in the classroom difficult.

Rodivilov does a good job of teaching the material for the class. Your grade is based of off participation (10%) and three exams that are worth 30% each. No need to really worry about them as if you pay attention in class you'll do fine (especially since he is a lenient grader). Make sure to look at HWs (non-mandatory) and practice exams though.

Professor Rodivilov is amazing. The material that he had to teach was difficult, however, he did an amazing job at giving fair exams and teaching properly. Most of the exams were curved and he taught the class extremely well. I would definitely recommend going to lectures and doing the practice he hands out, it will help a lot.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Prof. Yang teaches really well. She is available to resolve the doubts but the course has lots of homework

This is the second course I've taken with Prof Yang. She actively tries to improve her courses on every new iteration and genuinely cares about her students' growth. Her classes aren't easy (including this one), but if you actively try to learn and ask questions, you will gain a lot. Thank you Prof Yang for being a gem in the SSW department!

100% one of the best professors I have had at Stevens and would love to have him again. He is extremely sweet and a great professor overall. Genuinely loves what he is teaching about and loves teaching students. Would recommend him to any student to take any class he teaches because he really is amazing.

Chun is a very nice dude that teaches pretty heavily from the textbook but tries to use modern examples to make class interesting. The class itself isn't too much work. You'll have weekly hw where you summarize stuff from the textbook which can be a bit tedious. Midterm and final where take home essay questions. Good class with a great prof.

It's a reading class and the test is solely based on the textbook, but he tries to make us use real life concepts rather than the textbook.  He knows a lot about cities and it's a fairly easy, yet slightly boring class.  It's not his fault though.  He uses some stories and current events to bring his ideas and they work well.

For a comprehensive understanding of ML, Prof Chen is the ideal instructor. Her teaching approach simplifies complex ML concepts. The key to success in her class lies in maintaining focus during lectures and doing HW. By doing so, you can establish a strong foundation in ML. The downside of her classes is that you might sometimes feel bored.

Prof Chen is a good instructor and has nice material to let students be introduced to ML using Python. If the student pays attention in class, does all the work diligently, they will get what they're looking for. Teaches well and is responsive to doubts & re-explaining. Sometimes she will get confused but she manages to recover and get back to you.
Amazing lectures, never did I leave lectures confused, as he always made sure I understood everything that was going on. I am going to miss having him as a professor.

You know that rule that you never have a good teacher who's also a good/fun person. Prof. Vallabh is the only exception. Attendance isn't req but it is to your own benefit to go. He makes the topics very approachable and clears up confusion easily on top of getting to know and joke around with all of his students. Put into class what you expect out

Drones, drones, more drones! I don't want to see a drone again. William Miller doesn't teach, informs to read nonsense books, these meaning something about "rockets" or the "moon" or more likely nowadays "drones" and the whole semester is about drones (2022). Lectures are going over issues from last week in class & a heads up for next class.
This guy is overworked

Prof. Murphy has a mastery of the subject matter and conveys the information clearly throughout the course. She was always prepared for class and kept the Canvas page organized. She was able to facilitate a positive and highly interactive learning environment and she built a sense of community among the students even though the class was online.
classes are discussion based and she's very receptive to people coming from all different backgrounds not related to business. Interesting material and relevant articles.

Easiest A I've ever seen. Took the online course of FIN615. Each week is a quiz which is not at all thought-provoking. Midterm and final have same exact questions from weekly quizzes so it'd be extremely difficult to not do well. 2 chances on each quiz/midterm/final. Didn't learn a thing.

Great professor! Funny accent, but you'll get used to it. Cares about his students. Very approachable. Easy quizzes and mini cases and you get 3 attempts for each except quiz 12(1 attempt). Answers are shown after quiz, save em and give the quiz again(if wrong) (NOT Quiz 12). Solve Practice tests, mostly same questions for Mid term & Final (MCQs).
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Caring

comment: Xu is pretty hard as a professor. He sticks to the textbook a lot, but he fails to rise above it and explain hard concepts. Tests were fairly hard, and you had to really know what was going on to do well in this class. He is helpful in his office though, so def. try that out if you're getting stuck.

Tough class since it involves some fairly complicated mathematics and concepts that engineering students may not be comfortable with yet. But the Prof is easy to work with and will explain things as clearly as necessary. If you pay attention, really work on the homework and read some of the text in detail, it should not be a very difficult class.
Good Prof., very organized, clear in his requirements. I enjoyed the class and learned a lot.
WebCampus class is relatively easy (no tests), but heavy on weekly briefs, discussions, and 5 Team Projects.  Seems like content is less important than volume.

Orchestration class in a word was awesome. Andy taught all the aspects of the orchestra very clearly in a very entertaining way and including examples of how certain musical sound cues or effects are done. He is very helpful when you need help although he is quite the busy man and may be difficult to reach.
Great professor.  Gets everyone involved and makes sure you understand everything. Loved this class
He is somewhat difficult to understand at first, but if you listen closely you can understand what he is saying.  He moves fast at times, but is willing to pause and wait for everyone to catch up.

I had a hard time understanding what he was saying most of the time in the class. However, the class was hands-on and whatever he said he put it up in class as a projection, so it was fine. He's very helpful. The class is easy if you like making 3D objects. There's like 2 easy quizzes and a final project.

Very smart in his specific field, but he dedicates zero time in teaching graduate students back in 2009. He is only about his research, not teaching.  He favors his small working group, doesn't prepare for creating an established upper level grad course, and shows no energy in wanting to become a quality instructor.  He doesn't care.
Professor is easily substituted by the book, as he doesn't prepare his classes, just copy the book. Assignments are all from the book. Professor does not care for your comprehension.

I had experience in doing projects and I learnt a lot from her class. But might be a little confusing when doing the mid-term and final presentations if you don't have work experience. But she fairly divides the groups by balancing the work experience. Overall, I think she isn't strict about grading or passing the due date reasonably.

If you want marks, don't take this class. At your face she doesn't seem strict at all, but when the marks come in, you'll know the real her. She says she wants us to learn, but doesn't realize, some aren't experienced or aren't interested in this compulsory course. She destroyed my GPA. Two exams, two presentations, so much homework and a B.
Super cool dude.  Knew him as an undergrad at Texas A & M.
He is cool guy, with positive attitude. He knows what he is teaching. Students actually look forward to attend his class. 100% attendance throughout the semester can you believe that.... ;o)
Nice guy who really loves his quantum.
Mind opening
Good teacher.
Cattabiani runs a great BIO lab. He is very clear when he is demonstrating lab work and is always willing to answer questions.
Interesting course, and interesting look at how to apply it.  Uses statistical terms for project management applications.
No Comments
A fine professor.
No Comments
One of the best teachers I have ever had. Kept me engaged and laughing and interested in each book we went over the entire class. There is some work, but it's definitely worth it.
Awesome Professor. Definitely take his literature classes.

Professor Huang is a great professor. I had taken MIS 710 under him as it was a core course for me. Lecture materials are a bit heavy but the assignments are good. Group projects are also fairly manageable if you bring in good and original ideas. Absolutely no plagiarism is allowed so take care of that. 100% would take this professor again!

He's very thorough about the material and gives good examples from which you can understood why things happen the way they happen. He gives interesting assignments, grades fairly and gives good feedback. Team projects are also easy in this course. He pitches students to executives in his company and that's the best thing about him. Nice and Kind.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Prof. Xu's classes are sought after because they're among the easiest in the department, but don't expect to get anything out of them. Prof. Xu is a poor lecturer and his teaching is little more than writing out code examples without adequately explaining why they work.
Great guy to have as a substitute for Borowski. TAKE JX AS PRIORITY FOR CS 392
This professor set too many traps in the quiz and exams.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Robert is one of the toughest teachers I have ever had not due to the class vigor but merely due to his incompetence. He does not post instructions for assignments, expects too much from students, no one pays attention during class but you miss nothing. All class periods are mandatory but are just slide shows. 0/5 if it wasn't funny to watch
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: The professor is kind and a good professor. The exam questions are mostly related to the textbook. The project can be a little hard, as you will do everything by yourself.

2 exams, 6 homework and one solo project which is based on finding you own solution. Exams problems can be random, not just from the hw or the review problems. The project can take a lot of time since you are doing everything yourself, so you need to take that into consideration.
Rigorous and competent
Tough grader but has a great understanding of the subject and is well prepared.
Organized professor who masters the subject.
Great professor
Great professor who really care about students. He can be tough but if you put in the work you will be OK.
He is not a bad professor but I had a very hard time understanding him. I also found it very hard to stay focused in his class.

This is the most disorganized teacher I have ever had. Absolutely no communications skills, extremely hard grader given his teach skills are in the gutter. Assignments are not graded on time, very scattered and sparse, does not work well with technology, extremely ill-prepared for classes.

One of the worst professors I have had at Stevens. Expects far too much and is very unclear in grading. Most did receive a good grade, but the constant busy work and the environment he created made it painful. Also extremely passive aggressive to students and took 2 months to release key grades, so students were unaware of their grade.

Great professor who cares about his students. He is helpful and easy-going, and graded very fairly off of the rubric. Was easily accessible for extra guidance on our final paper. Would definitely recommend taking this class with him!

Professor Tyler Penny (Tappy) is incredibly fair and cares about his students. He is so approachable and truly wants to see all his students succeed. Apart from his altruism, Tappy is a gifted lecturer and an all around brilliant mind. Highly recommend taking and participating in his class!
took a month to grade one of the only 2 essays in the semester and only gave grade on day of her final, overall course grade unavailable during semester,
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: Prof. Golden was my favorite professor I've had so far. She was extremely caring and understanding. The class was a bit boring as all CAL classes are, but she made it bearable. She seemed to genuinely care about her student's success and overall was just a really good human. Take her for CAL 103/105 if you can!!

Professor Golden cares about her students and their success in the course. She is very helpful when it comes to essay writing and overall makes the class enjoyable. She is definitely one of the better CAL 103 professors.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Not very helpful and doesn't answer his emails, he waits the next day to message you back
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: He will upload the videos and won't explain the topics we have to learn ourselves, there are quizzes in each class, and he gives us a lot of homework, don't take this professor for your sake.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: DO NOT TAKE.  No lectures, he just emails a few pages of notes each week.  Only grades are midterm and final, which are timed, difficult, and graded harshly. Many ppl in my class failed the course.  Worse $3500 I have ever spent on anything.  I feel like I was robbed at gunpoint.  DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS! DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS! DO NOT TAKE THIS CLA

This was an online course. Emails were not replied to in a timely manner, if at all. The midterm exam, which was sent by email, did not reach a number of students; I didn't get it till 40 minutes after the start the exam - A trial run before the exam would have been a good way to prevent this from happening. I asked to go over the exam-no response.

Standard Literature Professor.  Dynamic Speaker.  The usual assortment of required reading and comparison papers.  As long as you keep up with the class and turn papers in on time, you'll do well.  Pretty easy grader, as well.

Did not like this Professor at all. Very harsh with grading papers, and ruined everyone's grade by factoring in a 0 for an unannounced reading quiz, the reading which she hadn't even listed on the syllabus. She is alright in class, the topics she covered were very basic (grammar etc). Presentations were made too long and unnecessary though.

An interesting, very academic guy.  He makes himself available to help.  Biggest problem is he answers questions with obtuse answers or worse, more questions. There is no doubt he knows the material and is passionate about it.  But teaching is not a strength.  He also pitches his consulting service which seems a bit unethical

This guy is an adjunct professor just teaching a pm class to keep up his certifications. He answers questions with questions so you have no idea if you are on the right track. Worst professor in this graduate academy. He does the least amount of work and accuses you of not managing your time if you ask for an extension. Very unreliable with returni

He is a younger professor in his mid twenties so it's nice that he can relate and connect with the students at that level. He likes to make sure all your questions are answered and encourages them as well. He is very reasonable and gave fair programming assignments. Also includes funny comments here or there. Overall really down to earth and fun.

It was a warm fall evening and the smell of burning furniture covered the room like a blanket that also smelled like burning furniture. Professor Katz rushed in, kicking down the door, and saved me and my family from the fire caused by a bizarre Eggo Waffle malfunction. I don't recommend that toaster, but I highly recommend Professor Katz. 4 stars.

Nam Chen will, as he likes to put it, "give you the quick and dirty". He teaches Physics very quickly and not very well, with a thick accent and not much detail. The homework is relatively easy, but the quizzes are brutally difficult and there are only a few to get credit on. If you can, avoid this class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Not very good at conveying any of the material. Quizzes decide a huge chunk of your grade and his lectures don't prepare you for them at all.
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Tests are tough

comment: This course was honestly one of the best online course experiences I have had to date in my masters program. Her class structure enabled much flexibility for those who are full-time workers taking graduate courses, & the level of effort per week was manageable. Fair warning: there are no live lectures, just notes - so communicate & you'll be fine!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: She has an enjoyable British accent.  Very helpful.  Class wasn't too difficult.  2 semi-long papers, 1 team project, and weekly homework and discussion.

Nice man. Absolutely the worst professor I have ever had. Teaching at C of C now. Run. Lectures have nothing to do with the test  quizzes. Workload is insane. Grading is so strict it borders on impossible. You will work hard, you will learn very little, you will not get an A. Take any thing else. The most frustrating experience of my life.

Students are treated like they are in High-School, if you get in late by a minute you will be put on the spot. He is inconsistent on how he treats students. He is knowledgeable but he his teaching method leaves a lot of room for improvement.
This was a 3D modeling class and while the topics introduced were very interesting, it always feels like you are walking on eggshells with Nick. Out of nowhere he can be very rude and inappropriate
Not only did I have to teach myself everything, but this man is way out of line and feral.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: waste of time, did not learn a thing, VERY unforgiving
Professor Soltysiak is a great person and an excellent teacher.
if you are seeking a good grade, she is fine. If you really want to learn something, I will suggest reading the book that she reads during the class.
This professor reads off the slides; with no explanation. Never prepared. Her classes are basically big waste of money and time. You will learn nothing.
Heavy course, heavy material, heavy exams: close book and close note that does not make any sense for this course that has lots of math.

He tries to cover the heavy theoretical basis of the topic and does not mention any examples or applications of that.
The classes are boring, full of mathematics, and without any interaction with students. He is the only speaker in class! He assigns heavy homework but allocates only 15% of the grade for that! Disappointing!
Very helpful and basically always available. Super generous grader.
SIMPLY DA BEST AND DA GOAT OF ALL TIMES

There are no guidelines to how this professor grades. He has no rubric. He doesn't even grade assignments on Canvas you just get an email with a nonsensical paragraph and a letter grade. He teaches poorly, and yet he is also harsh and inconsistent with his grading. By far, he is the worst professor I've had at this university.

Horrible lecturer. He doesn't know how to use zoom, only shares one window at a time, and has to go back and forth. He reads straight from the slides and flies through them and tells you to just go through again later in more depth. There are no clear guidelines or expectations. He just hands out grades based on how he's feeling that day.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Group projects

comment: Has a lot of knowledge and industry experience. Get it out of him !
Good , clear and interesting .
Murrae is an overly difficult grader! WARNING.

Tim was a very good professor. He obviously cares, and knows a lot about the class, which definitely makes the three hours of class time per week bearable. Super smart guy. His feedback is worth a lot, in my opinion.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Prof. Graham is obscenely smart and experienced. Learning from him has been one of the best experiences I've had at Stevens. He taught me a new way of thinking. He's generally honest and helpful.  He's available but busy so if you need office hours, make sure to ask him beforehand.

He likes to make a lot of movie references and he'll sometimes talk in different accents. He's not quick when it comes to grading homework but he grades quizzes fast. Even if you show up late, he'll still mark you present. I don't like the way he teaches because he overcomplicates the subject. Cheat sheets can be used on most quizzes and tests.

Saleh is probably one of, if not the worst professor I've had here. His lectures are boring at best because he just reads off the slides (which are mostly cut and paste from the textbook). I usually end up teaching myself the material. The homework is overly complicated for what should be a simple subject. Also, he gives 5 pop-quizzes so beware.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: One of the few professors for this class that actually makes you work for it, but it's worth it. He's invested in helping you find real-world application for this stuff and makes the assignments interesting and engaging. You'll mostly be fine if you care about the class--he certainly does--and best of all you'll actually learn something.

Class was effective. Prof Lipizzi is fair and not looking to scam anyone out of a good grade. Lecture doesn't always cover everything you need to know for assignments, so a little extra research is required for HWs, but you put in that little extra effort and you get an A.
rating_tags: Respected--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Very nice teacher, not too much work, overall I'd take this class ten times over if I had to. Bio in general isn't the easiest subject but he makes it really manageable.

I wish he focused more on actual problems in his lectures or even posted additional problems with solutions for more important topics. This material can be complex and having more tangible resources would help with studying and reviewing.

She's the most middle of the road teacher ever. Will answer your questions in or out of class, will take the time to go over your math questions in class, fair enough grader, but also very boring to listen too, not particularly entertaining in anyway either. I would say what ultimately matters is your own competency with calculus.

Sandeep is a very understanding professor, but for a discussion-based class, it was mostly him lecturing to the class. He is a first-year professor, so I expect some issues to get better, but the readings were very dense. The canvas was rarely updated with grades, and it was difficult to know your exact standing in the class.

Great professor and really cares about what he teaches. Super liberal so be prepared to have to play into that. Really cares about his students and assigns a decent amount of readings. Overall really awesome teacher.

She hosted 2 classes the entire semester as she was on a beach in Florida. She taught nothing at all and everyone got 100%. The entire class is group work, and she doesn't care if only 1 member is doing all the work. I learned nothing. Could have completed entire course in one week if I didn't have to teach my lazy teammates the subject matter.

At the beginning of the class she let us decide if we wanted to have exams and a final or only online MyLab homework. The MyLab was $60-$80 for access to the homework platform and textbook. Of course the class voted for the only homework option even with the cost. The assignments were very easy and very generous with three attempts per questions.

TA for MA221-RC, great guy and will go around the room and help everyone in the recitation. The notes he gives out are basically condensed versions of the topics you need to know. He will also do some of the Workshop problems to help give you a direction for the workshop.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment:
Absent all semester.  Lectures are youtube links with some lectures missing and or in the wrong order per week.

Material was not challenging but you will get no feedback. Takes >1 month to grade a exam. (30% of final grade). 

Canvas was set up with clearly default info provided to instructors that he was too lazy to change.

This professor's style is a lot like an absent father (not vary hands on and just 'kinda' there). His lectures are YouTube videos with only 3 graded assignments (two exams and a final project). When you reach out to him, expect to wait 5-7 business days for a response. I recommend him if you have a harder class and know the material decently well.

Jeff is an extremely respectful and caring professor. I've taken various courses taught by him, and no matter the subject, he goes out of his way to ensure all students can keep up with it. Though he is an easy-going professor, he does not overdo it and maintains integrity in class as well.

Cringe. 
Gave me a 70% because I didn't 100% follow his guild line, even if my code did the same thing and I was finished much more than others. Sorry for being creative in an art class!  Sorry for finishing the project ahead of time :)

In both Chemistry I and Biology, he was the most helpful teacher I have ever had. Knowledgeable, helpful, and very clear. The examples he uses in teaching and the extent of which he goes to help you understand is phenomenal.

Jan is a little quirky but really likable. He's funny and very passionate. He clearly has a lot of experience and cares about his students learning the material. The course is a wonderful balance of concepts and application. 
But he expects you to watch videos outside of class and doesn't use canvas.
The homeworks and CTF are hard but doable.

I took this course in the Summer, but Still it was a rediculous amount of homework. Was supposed to have the class twice a week 3 hours each, ended up needing to go four times a week. And homework was at least ten hours a week. Its a lot of work. And very in depth, not really an introductory course at all.
Very helpful, learned more from him than the professor.

Srini is a very good person, and his lectures are not difficult to understand at all. He's clear and makes a few jokes here and there. The problem is with his exams. They are nothing like his lectures, and are full of trick questions. We had problems with a 0% rate for the class, and it didn't bother him. Curve saves this class.
Do the reading.
No matter how hard you work, you can't get A in his class.
Awesome!
Great Teacher.. lectures were clear and precise. Knows his stuff.

He is the best professor i have ever had! He has so much patience and you can easily tell that he loves what he does. He is super welcoming and offers extra help, he wants his student to pass. His tests aren't easy but if you study his notes you'll be fine.
a lot of work
I hate writing but his class was my favorite that semester. He is such an amazing, friendly, high-quality human being.

He just reads off detailed presentation slides filled with equations and words, but he clearly is very weak in ocean physics and never demonstrates derived physical meaning of the subject.  He acts like a political and brings his arrogance to the classroom in a braggadocios way.  Better off reading books and learning from a well focused student
Very nice prof. Although the lecture was difficult, you definitely would get what you paid

He was one of few professors to not go by Canvas due dates, so you had to pick up when he said something was due in class. If you went by the Canvas due dates then it would be marked late. Instructions were incredibly unclear and he got frustrated if someone asked him to repeat himself.

Dr. Sidhoum is a very good professor, he cares a lot about his class and doesn't try to make everybody's life hard. I found his lectures to be more applicable to real-life situations than reliant on tests and bs work. His tests don't try to trick you, like usual engineering tests, but actually gage if you've been paying attention. Learned a lot.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: The class material is interesting and the prof does a pretty good job of getting it across. The second midterm and final project involves coding which is not taught in this class so beware of that.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Group projects

comment: Had prof. Acar for statics last semester and honestly had a great experience. She cares a lot about students understanding the material she's going over and is willing to slow down/reexplain if needed. Attendance isn't graded but she really appreciated everyone who did go… would recommend going to statics lecture anyway tho no matter who you get
Explained the course material very well. If I have an option to take her again, I would.

incredible prof. funny, nice, & knowledgeable; can answer virtually any question. great job connecting concepts & lectures to real world applications. passionate about econ & good at engaging students & getting them interested in the material. tests are challenging but doable if u study the txtbk & take notes in class. very accommodating & fair.

Well I don't have much to say but Prof Ming is definitely the GOAT

His sense of humor is unmatched and he deeply cares about his students success. His stories during classes are the icing on the cake, as he entertains you in whichever way possible. He would go to lengths to explain concepts and lastly: enjoy his essays while it last

She's a really sweet professor who broke down heat transfer into something so simple. The class problems and quiz reviews are actually relevant to both the homework and quizzes. She's a very lenient professor that I would highly recommend.
I had SUCH a bad time with this professor that I am considering transferring.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: One of the worst online class experiences ever. Canvas shell hasn't been updated since 2022, and lectures were outdated/missing as well. Vague/nonexistent grading criteria, often 10-20 points taken off assignments without specifying why. Offers no clarification on things and came off indifferent and rude in emails. Avoid!!!

The course relies on prerecorded lectures with content that is sourced from the internet. Homework is overly simple, resembling freshman-level material, and hasn't been graded all semester. For a graduate embedded systems course, it's surprising that only two assignments involved programming. The professor seems disengaged from teaching.

Herbert Protin is another one of those working professors that thinks they are giving back to their alma mater by teaching at the school. The opposite was observed.  Assignments were harshly graded without clarity to why deductions were made, classwork was never returned in a timely fashion, and the professor provided little to no help.

Even tho this was an online class we had a lot of heavy reading to do every week, plus participation on the forums were not mandatory but she graded your participation anyway at the end. Overall she's a good professor but there's a ton of material to cover in such little time
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: His lectures are slow, sometimes boring, but he makes sure that all students get all information in class. He respects students and answers questions completely. Easy multi-choice exams, but heavy reading assignments.
She's a good professor. This class is required for the capstones. Make sure you purchase the case pack and you'll do well.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Full disclosure: Professor Farvardin is actually President Farvardin. This man is a legend. The president off the university leads a lecture series on Leadership to a group of 20-or-so freshmen who have no clue in the world what it is that they want to do. He is one of the most dynamic, charismatic, and inspirational men I have ever met in my life
He is the man and his Calc recitations are extremely helpful and makes things more clear and easier to understand. Definitely worth going to class!
She is extremely boring and she makes you real alot.

Foster is a boring teacher in this subject. The material is interesting by itself but not when he teaches it. He loves the material but it was not intersting when he talked about it. I loved what we read since that was interesting. Hope that someone will participate. He continuously states that this freshman english class is the most important...
does not respond to emails, phone calls etc., not fair at grading, and changes sylabus and assignments due constantly. very unorganized.
Good lectures
Just a great person

Homework is on WebAssign - use Chegg for help (highly recommended). Quizzes and Final are all multiple choice questions. Lab Reports are graded easily- just show all formulas and have nice data tables. The bottom line is that Monika wants to give her students A's. Put in the time and effort and this should not be hard to achieve. Same for PEP124
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: She will lecture the entire time,but she covers all material needed for a MIS630 class. She covers all of the basics needed for future classes and she is always open to any help or questions that you may have. She encourages discussions within class
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: i don't like sports, but he made this class fun.

Prof. D is great! At first, I thought he was going too fast with the theory & no examples. After today's class, I can understand his method to teach us physics. A very nice guy, explains things a lot, homework is challenging, and simplifies lectures. I heard he also teaches at Essex County College. Hope I can take him in the Fall Semester!
Nice guy, He'll help when you ask. A bit too quiet though.

He is a very nice prof. will be happy to help or discuss anything even gonn give you so much details about other stories. He is so helpful in grades or rescheduling tests. Try to ask someone who had taken the course so it's much easier to pass any tests ;) The problem is that his boering class cuz he just reads from slides that has so much detai.

You can tell he loves teaching about statistics. Unfortunately, he's very lecture heavy. The board problems are the only thing you really need to know. This class moves insanely fast and it's nearly impossible to keep up with all the concepts, so study the old tests before your tests and you should be good. The ungraded HW's help as well.
This class is an easy A if you participate in class discussion. Dr. Gray is a very reasonable and genuine teacher. She is young which makes it easy for her to relate to students.

Professor Schmudde is a great professor as he cares a lot about the topic(computers and society). He gives out about 5 easy pop quizzes on the weekly readings, 34% of the grade. He only gives out about one actual assignment which is a midterm essay on any related topic of your choice, worth 33% of your grade. The final is the last 33%.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Beware of pop quizzes--Amazing lectures

comment: Decent guy, sort of mediocre professor. One of those research guys, keeps the lectures super dry and monotone despite knowing the material very well from industry work. Useful slides though. The course was not hard and we finished the material early. Takes feedback like an absolute champ even when students get whiny. Would take again.

He likes what he teaches, which makes him such a great teacher. An undergrad was in this class when the professor taught advanced continuum mechanics, and she was like, if I can understand these, it tells you how good a teacher he is.

This TA makes so many mistakes it's infuriating. It actually makes it hard to follow and even harder to learn. Also, his teaching style is very slow, unenthusiastic, and not engaging. Besides this he can be helpful when you do problems in groups and he is a fair grader, but his constant mistakes are overwhelming. Switch out while you can.

Professor Karl is excellent. Her class is always engaging and very discussion-based; the exams are structured around essays and content understanding/synthesis rather than repetition, which made the class a genuine learning experience. She's also very understanding and approachable. Would absolutely take again and thoroughly recommend!

Professor Wang made class interesting and enjoyable. Most information could be taken out of her lectures, but I found it helped to read the textbook beforehand. As long as you put in the effort, she is a fair grader.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Group projects

comment: As long as you pay attention and take the time to do the assignments, you'll do well. The labs are based off of the in-class lab lecture. A tip: annotate your in-class lab code with additional notes. This makes it a lot easier to do the labs. Overall, she's a great professor and I would 100% take a class with her again.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: ANYONE is better than him. Here are a few facts about him: he doesn't speak any English, his lecture notes aren't posted until after the HW is due, the HW has nothing to do with the lecture, and when you ask him a question, he answers a different question that you didn't ask. He makes this class so much harder than it is. Have fun :)
Great teacher. Minimal workload.

She was just amazing. She explained things extremely well and was an extremely comprehensive grader. I told her how amazing of a teacher she was once the class ended. I 100% recommend taking her classes

Foad has great command of Operations Management. I learned a lot in his class. He stresses class participation and seems like he will be a very tough grader, but the lowest grade on class assignments was a 95. Group projects are alot of work, but he grades very easily. Exams are very easy.
Seems like a cool person but this class is so weird. Takes it too seriously and is very inconsiderate and unclear.

Professor Han is amazing! The way she teaches is very easy to understand and she always has great energy. She is very motivating, kind, and understanding. Exams are just like HW/ study guides and she gives a ton of extra credit. She's awesome
He does a good job at conveying course material to his students. Lectures are clear and concise and the lecture slides contain useful material to reference for the homework assignments.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Knowledgable, personable and fair professor. There are a lot of reading assignments and quizzes. Ask and answer questions in class -- engagement portion of the grade is key. Many group projects and reports that are graded harshly but curved in the end. I am very fond of Alan. It's a lot of work, but you'll learn a lot. Kent Chemical  nightmares...

Very difficult class if you have no coding experience (R or Python). All homeworks and final group project require you to know how to code. The final test was very difficult with problems that were not presented or reviewed previously in class. Reading suggested textbook was a complete waste of time -- did not help for the final or homeworks
Two homeworks and two open textbook tests formed your entire grade. I ended up learning a ton with no busy work. Make sure you keep up by reading your textbook though, because the material is tough
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: He can be scary to those who don't pay attention, but overall he's a pretty nice guy and he gets his point across. HE'll give you points back if you cry to him

He teaches the class as if we already know the material. He routinely gives material that's going to be on the test the lecture before the test, making it extremely hard to prepare. Also doesn't do a review class before the test, because at least in my class he fell behind on his stuff. From what I hear, his office hours aren't very helpful.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: good
This guy's the goat

I took this course over the winter. She expects participation in the class, and will sometimes stall until she gets it. There is a lot of written work, but it is all easy and doesn't take much time. She grades quite leniently. Teaches well and at a good pace. If you study for the exams and participate even a little you'll be fine.

If you already know a little bit of programming, this class is quite easy. Roughly one assignment per week and the TAs give good feedback. The lecture notes are emailed out every week so the only reason to go to the lecture is if you have questions.

I love Bobby so much! He is LGBT+ friendly and respectful to all of his students. There is a decent amount of reading, like all CAL 103 classes, but he makes class discussions very interesting and does tend to get off topic often. He's a very easy grader and gives great feedback. He even offered me a job at the WCC!!

Super easy-going and nice as a professor and a person. He definitely knows what he's talking about and gets the point across well. Pretty lenient, he will work with you if you need help. There was a lot of work and projects, but the grading was not hard. Overall, one of the better professors that I have had here at Stevens.

A very interesting and straightforward class. Not much writing that needs to be done for a humanities class and there are reviews before each test. MaryBeth is def one of the nicest profs at Stevens too.

I took this course over the winter 2023. She expects participation in the class, and will sometimes stall until she gets it. There is a lot of written work, but it is all easy and doesn't take much time. She grades quite leniently. Teaches well and at a good pace. If you study for the exams and participate even a little you'll be fine.
Professor Sugino is an exemplary teacher. He teaches the content well and at a digestible pace. He is also very approachable and well-spoken. I would love to take another class with him!

Prof Muresan preps you for industry which I feel is very important to the software engineering field. He emphasizes the importance of team projects, documentation and project processes. Can not stress enough how great of a professor he is. Everyone should take his classes!

Super disappointed with this class, SIT doesn't provide enough lab equipment for the professor to teach the lab portion of the class.
The lectures have so much information crammed in that he doesn't go in depth at all, and all the midterm material wasn't effectively covered.
rating_tags: Group projects--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: One of the easiest prof. He grades everything in the end. Very knowledgeable and resourceful. Industry orientated

One can tell the professor is knowledgeable in the field; it doesn't translate well. >50% of grade is group presentation & final. Criteria for the project felt like it kept changing; groups only got more confused. Ex: we were given an outline; each group followed it but were all told to have been more creative/deviate in order to get a good grade.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: Prof Paliwal was often late to lectures and covered the material either super slow or super fast. Definitely knew his concepts but struggled to articulate them sometimes. Cared about student success and was available for help.
Professor Malantchouk is nice, grades fairly and I would definitely recommend her for Management

Professor Zielinski is a great professor who really cares about teaching students effectively. His lectures were easy to comprehend and his code examples helped in truly understanding data structures. He was also sympathetic to students' learning needs, so he would spend more time on more time on a topic if necessary. Highly recommend his classes.

Lefer is a good lecturer, the content is intersting and he teaches in a humorous way. However, that's only the lecture part of the class. The work you have to do in workshops are mostly in groups, and there are a lot of work.

Dr. Zhang is such a smart and caring professor :) Chem dynamics has a lot of difficult concepts, but he made sure that the grading structure allowed us to succeed (LOTS of extra credit). He is a bit difficult to understand during lectures, but always willing to answer questions. Overall a great professor who wants you to do well!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Back in 2008, Benilov showed perfection in instructing students.  Deepest knowledge base I've ever witnessed in a professor (a turbulence expert or physicist).  Allows you to experience an "old world Russian physicist track" to air-sea interaction.  14 carefully selected books for specific chapters from authors he knew well.  SIT will miss this gem
Good lectures; flexible time; always available.  Willing to go the extra mile demonstrating the tools and advising on how to best approach the problem.

If you want to learn how to use a Bloomberg Terminal, take a class with Parisa. She helped me prepare for an internship (as a freshman) that was meant for a junior or senior. She explains the material very well, is caring and accessible outside of class. My boss was very impressed with her teaching ability as was I.

Stresses the importance of teaching kids that it's okay to get Cs as an important life lesson. His rules to pass are attend every lecture, pay attention and read every chapter assigned (300+ pg per test). I never missed a class and read every chapter, ended with a C+. No one in the class got an A. 3 exams 25% ea and 2 discussions 12.5% ea
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Awesome professor, very knowledgeable. He's really cool and easy to talk to. He makes transportation engineering sound cool and you learn a lot in his class. Did i mention he's easy on the eyes. I highly recommend taking his class!
she can be mean, be advised.

He wanted to do some avant-garde experiments in his lecture but failed due to his lack of experience. Students need to preview his videos before and discuss during the class time. Jumped these important chapters like matrix.
2 mid exams 1 final exam and 1 final project including many items with unclear requirements.
Material isn't easy and labs are pretty tough but he's a good professor cares about you.
Chill professor, just show up to lectures. Labs are very tough but he is a lenient grader.
Very chill professor, just pay attention in class and you'll pass :).

He's not the worst since he's not actively hostile, but he's certainly not great. I'm the kind of person who attends *every* class--and I skipped his. His accent is rather thick, but the real kicker is his voice, which is incredibly monotone and makes the dull material even duller. Would definitely recommend someone (almost anyone) else over him.

Prof Sharma is extremely knowledgeable about organic chemistry, cares so much about the students and encourages participation to ensure everyone is understanding. I would definitely take Dr. Sharma's class again.

Good amount of content is covered, the exams are average but HW-s are heavy. You'll have to do a lot of self study. The class is a lot monotonous and is taught on slides, so the math isn't understood well. Easy grader.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Just a super nice dude, will work with you if needed. Mostly just attendance grades
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: This was my first philosophy class and I LOVED it. Adam makes group discussions really fun and the material engaging. He grades kinda tough, but its manageable.

She teaches the topic in an unclear way, does not speak understandable English, and expects students to know material we have yet to be taught. The notation she uses for lecture notes is not consistent and overcomplicates simple topics. Take the other section if you can!
rating_tags: Group projects--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: It's alright.

what a GOAT. you could tell he cared about his students and a lot of thought went into his lectures. honestly prv is kind of a nothing burger of a class that stevens decided to make all freshmen take for kicks ig I really don't know TnT but he turned it into a nice 50 minutes where he taught us genuinely meaningful life lessons
